Just as all things Originate due to multiple conditions, So also does seeing Buddha Necessarily depend on many good works.
Just as the wish-fulfilling jewel Can satisfy beings’ hearts, So can the teachings of the Buddhas Completely fulfill all aspirations.
In infinite lands The Guides appear in the world; In accord with the power of their vows They respond in every place.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad ba 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Banner of Purification, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

ye shes dkyil 'khor sangs rgyas te/ / 'jig rten chos rnams rnam par sbyong / / 'jig rten chos rnams rnam sbyangs nas/ / sangs rgyas chos rnams rab tu brjod/ /
de ste sems can mnyam sangs rgyas/ / sems can la las bsam byas na/ / rgyal ba de dag thams cad mthong / / sangs rgyas la ni gshegs pa med/ /
sangs rgyas la ni dmigs byas nas/ / sems kyis sangs rgyas dmigs pas na/ / sems bskyed pa dang rgyal mnyam par/ / de bzhin de dag rgyal ba mthong / /
dkar ba'i chos kyis nyer brtan cing / / gang gis grags pa rnams sbyangs pa/ / de dag thams cad sems bskyed la/ / shes rab ldan pa rab tu bzhugs/ /
dmigs pa dag dang byin gyi rlabs/ / mi yi gtso bo ston pa mdzad/ / de phyir dmigs pa kun tu yang / / sangs rgyas rgyal ba gshegs par brjod/ /
'jig rten khams rnams 'di dag ni/ / sangs rgyas sku rnams bdag gi med/ / sems la bdag gi med pa bstan/ / byang chub rtogs la bdag gi med/ /
mi yi seng+ge'i chos nyid dang / / dpa' ba'i stobs la rab tu gnas/ / lus dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ste/ / snang ba'i sems dang mnyam pa'i sku/ /
ji ltar 'jig rten de bzhin sku/ / ji bzhin skur yang rgyal ba ste/ / sku yi rang bzhin shes pa ni/ / sangs rgyas chags pa med ces bya/ /
sangs rgyas kun tu gzigs pa ste/ / chos rnams thams cad rab tu gzigs/ / sangs rgyas chos dang byang chub rnams/ / gang la'ang dmigs pa med pa yin/ /
sangs rgyas la ni gshegs pa med/ / sangs rgyas gang na'ang mi bzhugs te/ / yang dag sangs rgyas log pa med/ / de bzhin gshegs la len mi mnga'/ /

The light of great knowledge of the Enlightened Universally purifies all worlds; Once the worlds are purified, He reveals the enlightening teachings.
Even if people want to see Buddhas as numerous as sentient beings, The Buddha responds to their wishes— Yet really comes from nowhere.
With Buddha as the object, Concentrating continuously, One can see Buddhas As many as thoughts.
Carrying out pure ways, Fulfilling virtues, One can concentrate unremittingly On omniscience.
The Guides expound teachings To beings in accord with their needs; Wherever any can be taught He manifests the supreme incarnation.
The bodies of Buddha and the worlds’ beings Are all without self: Realizing this, he attains true awakening And also explains it to others.
All the Human Lions, With boundless powers of freedom, Manifest bodies equal to thoughts, Those bodies each being different.
As are the bodies of the beings of the worlds, So too are the bodies of Buddhas: When one really knows their inherent nature, That is called Buddhahood.
The Enlightened see and know all, Clearly comprehending all things: Buddhahood and enlightenment Are both ungraspable.
The Guide has no coming or going And also no place of abode: Departing from all delusions Is called true perfect enlightenment.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Constellation Banner, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

sangs rgyas thams cad kun tu khyab/ / zhing gcig la ni mi gnas te/ / thams cad du ni sangs rgyas gshegs/ / zhing rnams kun tu rab tu snang / /
sangs rgyas sku ni thams cad du/ / byin gyi rlabs dag rab tu 'byung / / 'tshang rgya chos kyi 'khor lo dang / / bsam pa bzhin du mya ngan 'da'; ;
sangs rgyas la ni su zhig sems/ / ci phyir sangs rgyas bsam mi khyab/ / yang dag sangs rgyas su yis mthong / / rgyal ba sus kyang mthong bar 'gyur/ /
ji ltar chos rnams chos nyid dang / / ji ltar sangs rgyas spyod yul du/ / gang dag chos rnams gcig tsam yang / / de bzhin nyid la mi 'jug go /
'di ni 'jig rten 'di rgyal zhes/ / 'jig rten dag na rnam rtog yod/ / gang gis ngo bo nyid shes na/ / 'jig rten med de rgyal ba'ang med/ /
'jig rten dad par bya ba'i phyir/ / mgon po dag ni mngon sum ston/ / de dag gi ni lta ba 'di/ / shin tu dmigs par mi rung ngo/ /
gang gis chags pa rnam bzlog cing / / chags pa med la dga' byed pa/ / chags pa thams cad rnam bzlog nas; ; chags med chos nyid rtogs par 'gyur/ /
sangs rgyas zhes brjod gang yin dang / / gang gi rnam 'phrul snang gyur pa'i/ / chos ni dus gsum thams cad du/ / rnam pa kun tu mi rnyed de/ /
gang gis chos nyid 'di shes shing / / gang gis 'di bzhin yid ches na/ / thams cad mkhyen cing kun gzigs pa'i/ / de bzhin gshegs par myur du 'gyur; ;
sangs rgyas thams cad rnam 'phrul ba/ / 'di dag thams cad tshig gis bstan/ / yang dag sangs rgyas tshig lam med/ / tshig gi lam gyis rab tu brjod/ /

The Realizer of Thusness, without dwelling anywhere, Abides in all lands, Going to all lands, Seen in all places.
Buddha manifests all bodies According to sentient beings’ minds, Attaining the Way, teaching the truth, And finally passing utterly away.
The Buddhas are inconceivable: Who can conceive of the Buddhas? Who can see the Truly Awake? Who can manifest the Supreme?
All things are thus, And so are the states of the Buddhas; There’s not a single thing in thusness That has birth or death.
Sentient beings erroneously discriminate: “This is Buddha,” “this is the world.” For one realizing the true nature of things There’s no Buddha and no world.
The Realizer of Thusness appears before all Causing sentient beings to believe and rejoice. But the essence of Buddha is ungraspable, And they are not seeing anything either.
If one can, in the world, Depart from all attachments, With unimpeded mind, joyful, One will awaken to the truth.
That manifested by spiritual power Is what is called Buddha: Though one search in all times, past, present, or future, It has no existence at all.
If one can know in this way The mind and all things, One will know and see all And soon become enlightened.
In words are expressed The powers of Buddhas; But true enlightenment transcends words, Though it be provisionally explained by words.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Banner of Truth, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

gang gis rnam par 'phrul snang ba'i/ / sangs rgyas mthong ba med pa bas/ / 'jig rten khams rnams thams cad kyi/ / sdug bsngal phung po blangs kyang bla; ;
'gro ba gang gis byang chub tu/ / sems can ni nam yang ma bskyed pa/ / de dag gnas 'di thos gyur na/ / sangs rgyas byang chub 'grub par 'gyur/ /
gang gis bsam ba gcig gis kyang / / 'di la mos byed mkhas pa ni/ / mi yi mchog tu mi 'gyur zhes/ / des ni the tshom mi bya'o/ /
de yi rnam par 'phrul ba ni/ / bskal pa bye ba'i bar du dkon/ / su zhig 'di la mos byed pa/ / de dag bla na med par 'gyur/ /
brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas rnams/ / skad cig skad cig bsnyen bkur kyang / / 'di yi tshul la mi gnas na/ / de dag bsnyen bkur byas ma yin/ /
gang la sangs rgyas brjod gyur pa'i/ / chos 'di gang gis thos gyur pa/ / des ni mi bde kun gyis kyang / / spyad pa rnams ni blang bar bya/ /
ji tsam chos kyi dbyings rnams dang / / dus gsum gyi ni mgon po yi/ / sangs rgyas rnams ni rten pa yi/ / ye shes chen po gcig thos nas/ /
phyi ma'i bskal pa bye ba rnams/ / zhing rnams re rer zad byas shing / / 'di yi tshul ni brtson byed na/ / de la byang chub dkon pa med/ /
sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha'i/ / 'khor bar mi rnams gnas gyur kyang / / des ni sangs rgyas rab phyung pa/ / chos nyid 'di ni shes ma gyur/ /
chos rnams zhig par byas pa med/ / chos ni 'jig par mi 'gyur te/ / kun tu snang las rnam 'phrul ba/ / 'jig rten de dag thams cad bstan/ /

It’s better to always experience All the pains of the world Than to be apart from the Buddha And not see Buddha’s mystic powers.
If there are any sentient beings Who have not yet set their minds on enlightenment, If they once hear the name of Buddha They’ll surely attain enlightenment.
People with knowledge and wisdom, Once they set their minds on enlightenment, Will surely become supreme Buddhas: Have no doubt of that.
The mystic power of the enlightened Is rarely encountered even in countless ages; If you engender a single thought of faith You’ll soon ascend to the highest path.
Even if in every instant You give offerings to countless Buddhas, If you don’t know the real truth This is not to be called offering.
If you hear such a teaching, The Buddhas are born from this; Though you experience countless pains You’ll not quit enlightening practices.
Once having heard of great knowledge, The state entered by the Buddhas, Everywhere in the universe You’ll become a guide of all times.
Though one pass the whole future Traveling to all buddha-lands, If one doesn’t seek this wondrous truth One will never become enlightened.
Sentient beings, from beginningless past, Have long revolved in birth and death; They do not know the real truth, So Buddhas come forth in the world.
Truths cannot be destroyed, And no one can destroy them: The great light of mystic power Is revealed throughout the world.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ / dga' ldan gyi gnas su byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa'i le'u ste/ nyi shu dgu pa'o// //
[30. rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyis yongs su bsngo ba'i le'u]
BOOK TWENTY-FIVE. Ten Dedications

de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus ting nge 'dzin ye shes snang ba zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs te/ byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin ye shes snang ba zhes bya ba de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de'i tshe na phyogs bcu'i phyogs re rer 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol nas de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya phra stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis zhal bstan pa mthong ste/ de dag kyang 'di lta ste/ mtshan rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba sha stag go /phyogs gcig nas ji lta ba ltar phyogs bcu nas kyang de bzhin te/ de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis 'di skad ces kyang bka' stsal to/ / rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan/ de ltar khyod byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin ye shes snang ba la snyoms par zhugs pa legs so/ / legs so/ / 'di ltar yang rigs kyi bu/ khyod la phyogs bcu nas de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thams cad kyang mtshan mthun pa sha stag gis 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'di'i sngon gyi smon lam dang / sngon gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / khyod kyi ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas brtan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste; byang chub sems dpa'i mi 'jigs pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / spobs pa chags pa med par bya ba dang / ye shes kyis bsgribs pa med pa'i sar 'jug par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems yangs pa la rab tu 'jug par bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa phun sum tshogs par bya ba dang / bsgribs pa med pa'i chos dkar po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings la sgo kun nas 'jug par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi cho 'phrul bstan par bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i ye shes dang dran par rgyun mi chod par rnam par dag par bya ba dang / dbang po sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlab par bya ba dang chos kyi sgo mtha' yas par bstan par bya ba dang / shes pa kun tu gzung bar bya ba dang / 'di lta ste/ yongs su bsngo ba bcu yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gzung bar bya ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshogs rnams rab tu bstan par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mi chod par bya ba dang / smon lam chen po'i skabs dbye bar bya ba dang / don shin tu bstan pa la 'jug par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su shes par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yid rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi srid pa gsum gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mthun pa la brten par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs yang dag par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir byin gyis brlabs pa mdzad kyi/

THEN THE ENLIGHTENING BEING Diamond Banner, empowered by the Buddha, entered absorption in the light of knowledge of enlightening beings. When he had entered this absorption, there appeared before him as many Buddhas as atoms in a hundred thousand buddha-lands from beyond as many worlds as atoms in a hundred thousand buddha-lands in each of the ten directions. Those Buddhas, who were all alike named Diamond Banner, praised him, saying, “Good! Good man, it’s very good that you can enter this absorption in the light of knowledge of enlightening beings. Good man, this is the spiritual power of Buddhas as numerous as atoms in a hundred thousand buddha-lands in each of the ten directions bolstering you, and also the spiritual power of the force of Vairocana Buddha’s past vows, and it is also due to the purity of your knowledge and wisdom, and to the growing supremacy of the bases of goodness of enlightening beings, enabling you to enter this absorption and expound the teaching, in order to enable enlightening beings to attain pure fearlessness, to have unimpeded powers of elucidation, to enter the state of unobstructed knowledge, to abide in the great mind of omniscience, to perfect innumerable virtues, to fulfill unhindered pure ways, to enter into the all-sided realm of reality, to manifest the spiritual freedom of all Buddhas, to maintain previous awareness and knowledge, to gain all Buddhas’ protection of all faculties, to extensively expound myriad principles by means of countless approaches, to understand and keep in memory the teachings heard, to embrace all the foundations of goodness of enlightening beings, to accomplish the aids to the path transcending the world, to prevent omniscient knowledge from dying out, to develop great vows, to interpret true meanings, to know the realm of reality, to cause all enlightening beings to rejoice, to cultivate the equal roots of goodness of all Buddhas, to protect and maintain the lineage of all enlightened ones; that is, you expound the ten dedications of enlightening beings.

kye rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams kyis brtan pa dang / gzungs kyi snang ba la zhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bsgribs pa med pa la zhugs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings snang ba'i chos nyid du bya ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos dkar po yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba dang / ye shes kyi spyod yul yangs pa la gnas pa dang / bsgribs pa med pa'i chos snang ba la gnas pas chos bstan pa 'di brjod pa dang / bstan pa'i phyir spobs par gyis shig /

“Child of Buddha, you should receive the spiritual power of the Buddha and expound this teaching, to gain the protection of the Buddhas, to dwell in the house of the Buddhas, to increase transcendental virtues, to attain the light of concentration, to enter the unobstructed state of the Buddha, to illumine the realm of reality with great light, to assemble faultless pure ways, to abide in the realm of great knowledge, to attain the unimpeded light of truth.”

de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan gyi ye shes tshad med pa nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do/ / spobs pa chags pa med pa dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do/ / bsgribs pa med pa'i chos kyi snang ba nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku dang gcig pa nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do/ / tshad med pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad nyams pa med par yongs su bsngo ba'i ye shes nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do/ / chos thams cad kyi lhag mthong mngon par bskyed pa la mkhas pa nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do/ / chos thams cad bstan pa'i gnas rgyun mi chod pa nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gzi brjid kyi phyir ro/ /

Then the Buddhas bestowed on Diamond Banner boundless knowledge and wisdom, unhalting, unimpeded eloquence, skill in distinguishing expressions and meanings, unhindered light of the teaching, the equal body of wisdom of the enlightened, a pure voice with infinite distinct tones, the inconceivable concentration of enlightening beings’ skillful observation, the knowledge of dedication of indestructible foundations of all goodness, consummate skill in analytic observation of all things, and uninterrupted power of elucidation to explain all things in all places. Why? Because of the power of the virtue of entry into this absorption.

de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi phyag g.yas pas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan gyi spyi bo la byug pa mdzad do/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan la reg ma thag tu ting nge 'dzin de las rnam par langs te/ langs nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' de dag la smras pa/
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam 'di lta ste/ 'gro ba thams cad khyab par byed pa/ sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa 'di ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba la slob bo/ /ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba la slob par 'gyur ro/ /da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba la slob bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba gang la bsam ste de skad du smras pa de dag ni; gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / yongs su bsngo ba'i grangs ni/ du zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /bsngo ba bcu po 'di dag ni/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs so/ /gsung ngo/ /gsung bar 'gyur ro/ /
bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sems can rnams kyi 'du shes 'gog cing 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba dang po dang / mi phyed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba gnyis pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la yang dag par bskyed pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba gsum pa dang / thams cad rjes su song ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba bzhi pa dang / bsod nams kyi mdzod mi zad pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba lnga pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba drug pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba bdun pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba brgyad pa dang / chags pa med cing bcings pa dang / dkrol ba med pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba dgu pa dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba bcu pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba bcu po de dag ni/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so/ /gsung ngo/ /gsung bar 'gyur ro/ /

Then the Buddhas each patted the enlightening being Diamond Banner on the head with their right hands, after which Diamond Banner rose from absorption and declared to the enlightening beings, “Children of Buddhas, great enlightening beings have inconceivable great vows, filling the cosmos, able to save all sentient beings. That is, to learn and practice the dedications of all Buddhas of past, present, and future. How many kinds of dedication have the great enlightening beings? Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of dedication, which are expounded by the Buddhas of past, present, and future. What are they? (1) Dedication to saving all sentient beings without any mental image of sentient beings. (2) Indestructible dedication. (3) Dedication equal to all Buddhas. (4) Dedication reaching all places. (5) Dedication of inexhaustible treasuries of virtue. (6) Dedication causing all roots of goodness to endure. (7) Dedication equally adapting to all sentient beings. (8) Dedication with the character of true thusness. (9) Unattached, unbound, liberated dedication. (10) Boundless dedication equal to the cosmos. These are the ten kinds of dedication of great enlightening beings, which the past, future, and present Buddhas have, will, and do expound.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba dang po sems can rnams kyi 'du shes 'gog cing 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu sbyor ba 'am/ tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par sbyong ba'am/ bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sems pa'am/ brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa'am/ bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par dpyod pa'am/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa'am/ byams pa sgom pa yang dag par bskyed pa'am/ snying rjes snying brtse bar byed pa'am/ dga' ba la rab tu dga' bar byed pa'am/ btang snyoms la shin tu gnas par byed kyang rung ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la shin tu bsam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dang / de dag la rab tu sbyor zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa rnam par phye nas 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis sems can rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba'i ngan song rgyun chad par 'gyur ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par ldog par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'gro ba thams cad la rnam par dag pa'i mthar phyin par phan 'dogs pa gang yin zhes sems bskyed do/ / de de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par bskyed pa na 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi gnas su gyur cig / nyon mongs pa thams cad las yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi dpung gnyen du gyur cig / 'jigs pa kun las bsrung ba'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur cig / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi lam du gyur cig / shin tu bde ba dang ldan pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi rten du gyur cig / rab rib med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi snang bar gyur cig / ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par bsal ba'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi sgron mar gyur cig / shin tu dag pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi mar mer gyur cig / chos kyi tshul la gzung ba'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi don gyi 'dren par gyur cig / bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po bstab pa'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi yongs su 'dren par gyur cig / ces de de ltar 'gro ba thams cad kyi don du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar shin tu thug par dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ste/

“What is the great enlightening beings’ dedication to saving all sentient beings? Here the enlightening beings practice transcendent giving, purify transcendent discipline, cultivate transcendent forbearance, arouse transcendent energy, enter transcendent meditation, abide in transcendent wisdom, great compassion, great kindness, great joy, and great equanimity. Cultivating boundless roots of goodness such as these, they form this thought: ‘May these roots of goodness universally benefit all sentient beings, causing them to be purified, to reach the ultimate, and to forever leave the innumerable pains and afflictions of the realms of hells, ghosts, and animals, and so on.’ When the great enlightening beings plant these roots of goodness, they dedicate their own roots of goodness thus: ‘I should be a hostel for all sentient beings, to let them escape from all painful things. I should be a protector for all sentient beings, to let them all be liberated from all afflictions. I should be a refuge for all sentient beings, to free them from all fears. I should be a goal for all sentient beings, to cause them to reach universal knowledge. I should make a resting place for all sentient beings, to enable them to find a place of peace and security. I should be a light for all sentient beings, to enable them to attain the light of knowledge to annihilate the darkness of ignorance. I should be a torch for all sentient beings, to destroy all darkness of nescience. I should be a lamp for all sentient beings, to cause them to abide in the realm of ultimate purity. I should be a guide for all sentient beings, to lead them into the truth. I should be a great leader for all sentient beings, to give them great knowledge.’ Enlightening beings dedicate all foundations of goodness in this way, to equally benefit all sentient beings and ultimately cause them all to attain universal knowledge.

ji ltar mdza' ba bsrung ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba de ltar mi mdza' ba bsrung ba'i phyir yang yongs su bsngo'o/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bdag tu bya ba'i bsam pas mi mdza' ba ni/ gang yang med de/ de yang 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni/ chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la yang dag par 'byung ba ste/ de 'di snyam du byang chub sems dpa' la mi mdza' ba'i don byed pa de dag thams cad ni/ bdag gi rgyud la dgod dgod pa yin no/ / zhes te/ de dag ni/ sems can thams cad kyi yul thams cad la zhe sdang ba med pa'i mig gis blta'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen te/ sems can thams cad la dge ba'i chos yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir 'jug go /'di lta ste/ dper na; rgya mtsho chen po ni/ dug thams cad kyis gdug par bya bar mi nus so/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang drin mi gzo ba dang / blo zhan pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / rnyog pa dang / mun par gyur pa dang / rang bzhin stor ba dang / rlom sems dang ldan pa dang / sgrub pa nyams pa dang / sems dmus long lta bur gyur pa'i sems can byis pa thams cad kyis skyon can du bya bar mi nus so/ /

“The enlightening beings’ protection of and dedication to those who are not their relatives or friends are equal to those for their relatives and friends. Why? Because enlightening beings enter the equal nature of all things, they do not conceive a single thought of not being relatives or friends. Even if there be sentient beings who have malicious or hostile intentions toward the enlightening beings, still the enlightening beings also regard them with the eye of compassion and are never angered. They are good friends to all sentient beings, explaining the right teaching for them, so that they may learn and practice it. Just as the ocean cannot be changed or destroyed by all poisons, so too are enlightening beings—the various oppressive afflictions of all the ignorant, the unwise, the ungrateful, the wrathful, those poisoned by covetousness, the arrogant and conceited, the mentally blind and deaf, those who do not know what is good, and other such evil sentient beings, cannot disturb the enlightening beings.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ lha'i bu nyi ma 'char ba de ni/ dmus long gi skyon gyis 'char pa las thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / dri za'i grong khyer gyi skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sa'i rdul gyi skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / lha ma yin gyi dbang po sgra gcan gyi skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / du ba 'khrigs pa'i skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / 'dzam bu'i gling gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / grib ma sna tshogs kyi skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / dug gi ri'i skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro; ; khams kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / dus yongs su 'gyur ba'i skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dran pa can/ yang dag par shes pa dang ldan pa/ sems kyi bdag nyid che ba nyid shin tu zab cing yangs pa/ yid la yang dag par rtog pa mi zhan pa/ yon tan spyad pas ye shes kyi mthar gyur pa/ chos la shin tu dad pa'i sems mngon par skyes pa/ chos kyi snang ba'i 'od kyis rab tu snang ba/ don thams cad mthong ba/ chos mngon par shes pa/ ye shes rig pa/ rtsod pa med pa lhur byed pa/ sems can thams cad dge ba'i chos spyod pa la rab tu sbyor ro/ / sems can thams cad kyis nyes par sems bskyed pa la 'khrul pa med pa de yang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba na gnod par byed pa thams cad kyi skyon gyis thogs par mi 'gyur ro/ / sems can mi srun ba'i tshul gyis ldog par mi 'gyur ro/ / sems can gyi lta ba'i rnyog pas dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro/ / sems can gyi sems 'khrug pas ldog par mi 'gyur ro/ / sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud stor bas byang chub sems dpa'i go cha chen po bgos pa las ring bar mi 'gyur ro/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i smon lam dkrug ma'i rnyog pa thams cad kyis bcil bar mi 'gyur ro/ / byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa chen po sems can drin du mi gzo ba mthong bas lhod par mi 'gyur ro/ / byang chub tu dmigs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can mi srun pa'i dbang pos zhum par mi 'gyur ro/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ba bzhin las byis pa'i skye bo dang 'grogs pa las 'phang bar mi 'gyur ro/ / sems can gyi skyon gyis skyo bar mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as the sun, appearing in the world, is not concealed because those who are born blind do not see it, and is not hidden by the obstruction of such things as mirages, eclipses, trees, high mountains, deep ravines, dust, mist, smoke, or clouds, and is not concealed by the change of seasons, so also are the enlightening beings—they have great virtues, their minds are deep and broad, they observe with true mindfulness, without boredom; because they want ultimate virtue and knowledge their minds aspire to the supreme truth; the light of truth illumines everywhere and they perceive the meanings of everything. Their knowledge freely commands all avenues of teaching, and in order to benefit all sentient beings they always practice virtuous ways, never mistakenly conceiving the idea of abandoning sentient beings. They do not reject sentient beings and fail to cultivate dedication because of the meanness of character of sentient beings, or because their erroneous views, ill will, and confusion are hard to quell. The enlightening beings just array themselves with the armor of great vows of enlightening beings, saving sentient beings without ever retreating; they do not withdraw from enlightening activity and abandon the path of enlightenment just because sentient beings are ungrateful, they do not get sick of sentient beings just because ignoramuses altogether give up all the foundations of goodness which accord with reality, or because they repeatedly commit excesses and evils which are hard to bear.
'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo/ bam po sum cu rtsa gnyis pa/

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ dkyil 'khor 'di ni/ bsgribs pa med par 'gro ba thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba ste/ sems can gcig la dmigs shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ma yin/ 'di lta ste/ zhing rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zhing gcig la dmigs te byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la mngon par spro ba ma yin/ 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas blta ba rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gcig la dmigs te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dad pa skye ba ma yin/ 'di lta ste/ ye shes gcig rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir ye shes gcig la dmigs nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam skye ba ma yin gyi/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su bsngo'o/ / zhing thams cad yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba la dmigs nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dad pa skye'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi ye shes kyis rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba rnams kyi smon lam skye'o/ /

Why? Just as the sun does not appear in the world for just one thing, so too the enlightening beings do not cultivate roots of goodness and dedicate them to complete perfect enlightenment just for the sake of one sentient being—it is in order to save and safeguard all sentient beings everywhere that they cultivate roots of goodness and dedicate them to unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment. In the same way, it is not to purify just one buddha-land, not because of belief in just one Buddha, not just to see one Buddha, not just to comprehend one doctrine, that they initiate the determination for great knowledge and dedicate it to unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment—it is to purify all buddha-lands, out of faith in all Buddhas, to serve all Buddhas, to understand all Buddha teachings, that they initiate great vows, cultivate the foundations of goodness, and dedicate them to unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

de yang 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi stobs la dmigs pa la sems yangs pa/ bsam pa ma 'khums pa/ bskal pa thams cad du shin tu dkon pa'i sems rin po che dang ldan pa rnams kyi sems ni/ 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu skyes te/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par mthong nas sems dad pa chen po rnam par dag pa dang / snying rje chen po brtan pas bsngo zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngos te/ de yang tshig tsam du ma yin gyi/ bsam pa thag pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / de yang dga' ba'i sems dang / rab tu dga' ba'i sems dang / dad pa'i sems dang / mos pa'i sems dang / 'byams pa'i sems dang / byams pa'i sems dang / nye ba'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / phan gdags pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Enlightening beings, focusing on all the Buddha teachings, develop a broad mind and great determination, a determination never to retreat, and through measureless eons cultivate and collect rare, hard to obtain mental jewels, all equal to those of all Buddhas. Thus observing the bases of goodness, enlightening beings’ mind of faith is pure, their great compassion is firm and enduring; they truly and genuinely dedicate them to sentient beings with a most profound intent, a joyful mind, a pure mind, a mind conquering all, a gentle mind, a kind, compassionate mind, a mind of pity and sympathy, with the intention to protect, to benefit, and to give peace and happiness to all sentient beings — they do this sincerely and in reality, not just in words.

de yang 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyi 'gro ba rnam par dag par gyur cig/ skye ba yongs su dag par gyur cig/ bsod nams kyi bdag nyid che ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig/ zil gyis mi non par gyur cig/ mi zad par gyur cig/ thub par dka' ba'i sems su gyur cig/ dran pa nyams pa med par gyur cig/ rtogs pa nges par gyur cig/ blo tshad med par gyur cig/ lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las kyi yon tan gyi rgyan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can de dag thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par byed par gyur cig/ mnyes par byas nas kyang thugs 'byung ba med par gyur cig/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mi phyed pa'i dad pa yang thob par gyur cig/ de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa thos par gyur cig/ thos nas kyang the tshom dang / yid gnyis med par gyur cig/ yang dag par 'dzin cing nan tan gyis sgrub par gyur cig/ sems kyi dga' ba nyid kyang thob par gyur cig/ kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lus kyi las kyang yang dag par grub par gyur cig/ dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po la bdag rab tu gzhog par gyur cig/ shin tu dbul ba dang rnam par bral bar gyur cig/ nor bdun thob pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rjes su yang slob par gyur cig/ dge ba'i dbang po 'thob par bya ba'ang thob par gyur cig/ mos pa chen po'i mnyam pa nyid kyang yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi go yang rnyed par gyur cig/ 'gro ba thams cad du nyams pa med pa'i mig kyang bskyed par gyur cig/ mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i lus yongs su rdzogs pa yang thob par gyur cig/ yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i tshig rnam par dag pa yang yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig/ dbang po bsdams shing stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i sems dge ba yang dag par grub par gyur cig/ gnas med par spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig/ sangs rgyas thams cad bde ba'i rim gro gang dang ldan pa'i bde ba'i rim gro de dag sems can thams cad kyis thob par gyur cig/ sangs rgyas kyi gnas rab tu thob pas tshad med pa'i gnas su gyur cig/

“When great enlightening beings dedicate roots of goodness, they think in these terms: ‘By my roots of goodness may all creatures, all sentient beings, be purified, may they be filled with virtues which cannot be ruined and are inexhaustible. May they always gain respect. May they have right mindfulness and unfailing recollection. May they attain sure discernment. May they be replete with immeasurable knowledge. May all virtues of physical, verbal, and mental action fully adorn them.’ They also think, ‘By these roots of goodness I’ll cause all sentient beings to serve all Buddhas, to their unfailing benefit. I’ll cause their pure faith to be indestructible; I’ll cause them to hear the true teaching, cut off all doubt and confusion, remember the teaching without forgetting it and practice in accord with the teaching. I will cause them to develop respect for the Enlightened, to act with purity, to rest securely on innumerable great foundations of goodness, to be forever free of poverty, to be fully equipped with the seven kinds of wealth—faith, self-control, shame, conscience, learning, generosity, and wisdom—to always learn from the Buddhas, to perfect innumerable supreme roots of goodness, to attain impartial understanding, to abide in omniscience, to look upon all sentient beings equally with unobstructed eyes, to adorn their bodies with all marks of greatness, without any flaws, to have pure, beautiful voices replete with all fine qualities, to have control over their senses, to accomplish the ten powers, to be filled with good will, to dwell or depend on nothing, to cause all sentient beings to attain the enjoyments of buddhahood, attain infinite spiritual stations, and abide in the abode of Buddhas.

sems can de dag thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po sgrib pa'i las sna tshogs las byung ba/ sgrib pa'i las de dag gis bsgribs pa/ sangs rgyas mi mthong ba dang / chos mi thos pa dang / dge 'dun mi shes pa'i sgrib pa'i las rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsags pa'i sdug bsngal gyi phung po de dag bdag gi lus 'dis sems can dmyal ba'i skye gnas dang / ngan song gi sa'i gnas de dang de dag nas blang bar bya'o; ; sems can de dag thams cad ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis de nas bton te/ bdag gis de dag gi sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa de dag blang bar bya'o/ / spro bar bya'o// mi ldog par bya'o/ / de las mi 'bros par bya'o/ / mi skrag par bya'o/ / mi 'jigs par bya'o/ / phyir mi ldog par bya'o/ / zhum pa med par bya'o/ / mi skyo bar bya'o/ /

“When enlightening beings see sentient beings doing all sorts of bad things and suffering all sorts of misery and pain, and being hindered by this from seeing the Buddha, hearing the teaching, and recognizing the community, the enlightening beings think, ‘I should, in those states of woe, take on the various miseries in place of the sentient beings, to liberate them.’ When enlightening beings suffer pain in this way, they become even more determined—they do not give up or run away, are not shocked or frightened, are not discouraged or intimidated, and are unwearied.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ bdag gis ni/ sems can thams cad bsgral bar smon lam btab pas na/ sems can thams cad kyi khur bkur dgos so/ / 'di ltar bdag gis sems can thams cad yongs su dgrol bar bya'o/ / 'di ltar bdag gis sems can thams cad bsgral bar bya'o/ / skye ba'i dgon pa dang / rga ba dang / na ba'i dgon pa dang / 'chi ba'i dgon pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba'i dgon pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dgon pa dang / mi khom pa thams cad kyi dgon pa dang / 'khor ba thams cad kyi dgon pa dang / lta ba thibs po thams cad kyi dgon pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad gtor ba'i dgon pa dang / mi shes pa las byung ba'i dgon pa dang / dgon pa de dag thams cad nas bdag gis

Why? Because according to their vows they are determined to carry all sentient beings to liberation. At such a time, enlightening beings think in these terms: ‘All sentient beings are in the realm of the pains and troubles of birth, old age, sickness, and death, revolving in repeated routines according to the force of their acts, ignorant, with erroneous views, bereft of qualities of goodness — I should save them and enable them to attain emancipation.’

sems can sred pa'i dra bas dkris pa dang / ma rig pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa dang ldan pa/ zhen pa'i mthar gyur pa/ sdug bsngal gyi shing thags kyis bskor ba/ bdud kyi las la brten pa/ mi mkhas pa/ bsod nams 'gags pa/ the tshom du gyur pa/ rtag tu yid gnyis dang ldan pa/ mi bde ba mthong ba/ 'byung ba la mi mkhas pa/ tshub mas bskor ba'i lo ma lta bur 'khor zhing 'phyan pa de dag thams cad yongs su thar par bya'o; ; zhes de la byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen pos yongs su rgyas pa'i sems dang ldan pas sems can gyi khams 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba mthong nas sems can de dag la snying brtse ba chen po skyes pa/ phan cher gdags pa'i sems rab tu bskyed pa/ sems can rnams kyi don chen po bya bar dga' ba/ sems can mang po rab tu dgrol par dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo'o/ / yongs su bsngo ba chen po la zhugs pa/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba la rab tu zhugs pa/ bsngo ba chen po'i mdos sems can thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba/ sems can thams cad shin tu rnam par dag par bya bar sems pa/ sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba kun thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug par yongs su bsngo ba de sems 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur te; sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyal srid la rab tu gzhag pa'i phyir bdag spyod de/ bdag ni/ bdag 'ba' zhig yongs su dgrol ba la mngon par zhugs pa ma yin gyi/ bdag gis sems can 'di dag kun thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems rab tu snang bas 'khor ba'i dgon pa rgal dka' ba nas gdon par bya'o/ / g.yang sa chen po nas blang bar bya'o/ / gnod pa thams cad yongs su dgrol bar bya'o/ / 'khor ba'i rgyud las rab tu bsgral bar bya'o/ /

“Also, sentient beings are wrapped up in the web of attachments, covered by the shroud of ignorance, clinging to all existents, pursuing them unceasingly, entering the cage of suffering, acting like maniacs, totally void of virtue or knowledge, always doubtful and confused; they do not perceive the place of peace, they do not know the path of emancipation, they revolve in birth and death without rest, always submerged in the mire of suffering. Enlightening beings, seeing this, conceive great compassion and desire to help them, wanting to enable sentient beings to all attain liberation; to this end they dedicate all their virtues, dedicating them with a great, magnanimous heart, in conformity with the dedication practiced by the enlightening beings of all times, in accord with dedication as explained in the scriptures, praying that all sentient beings be thoroughly purified and ultimately accomplish knowledge of all means of liberation. They also think, ‘What I practice is in order to enable sentient beings to all become supreme sovereigns of knowledge; I am not seeking liberation for myself, but only to serve all sentient beings, to cause them to all attain the omniscient mind, to cross over the flow of birth and death, and be freed from all suffering.’

bdag nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po blang par spro bar bya'o/ / bdag gis sems can de dag thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal chen po'i sa'i 'og nas drang par bya'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa thams cad kyi ngan song kun gyi sdug bsngal thams cad blangs te nyams su myong bar bya ba la bdag gi spro bar bya'o/ / bdag gis sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba las mi spang bar sems can thams cad yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir bdag ngan song gcig na phyi ma'i mthar thug pa'i bskal par gnas par spro bar bya'o/ / ngan song gcig tu ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i ngan song thams cad du gnas par spro bar bya'o/ /

“They also form this thought: ‘I should accept all sufferings for the sake of all sentient beings, and enable them to escape from the abyss of immeasurable woes of birth and death. I should accept all suffering for the sake of all sentient beings in all worlds, in all states of misery, forever and ever, and still always cultivate foundations of goodness for the sake of all beings.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kyi hud sems can 'di dag thams cad sdug bsngal gyi gnas su lhung ba bas ni/ bdag gcig pu sdug bsngal myong yang bla'i/ / bdag gis der bdag nyid gtar bcug ste sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi dgon pa nas 'gro ba thams cad blus te bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi don du sdug bsngal tshor ba'i phung po 'di dag thams cad bdag gi lus 'dis myong bar bya'o/ /

Why? I would rather take all this suffering on myself than to allow sentient beings to fall into hell. I should be a hostage in those perilous places—hells, animal realms, the nether world, etc. — as a ransom to rescue all sentient beings in states of woe and enable them to gain liberation.’
bdag gis ni/ sems can rnams kyi gnya' bden par smra ba dang / yid ches shing mi blu bar spro bar bya'i/ bdag la ni/ sems can thams cad kyis ma yin te/
“They also form this thought: ‘I vow to protect all sentient beings and never abandon them. What I say is sincerely true, without falsehood.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir bdag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems sems can thams cad la dmigs pa skyes te/ bdag nyid 'dod pa'i phyir ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma zhugs so/ / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la dga' zhing spyod pa'i phyir yang ma yin no/ / 'dod pa'i yul la bsnyen pa'i phyir yang ma yin no/ / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i dga' ba mang po gzhan blang pa'i phyir yang byang chub kyi spyod pa la mi spyod do/ /

Why? Because I have set my mind on enlightenment in order to liberate all sentient beings; I do not seek the unexcelled Way for my own sake. Also I do not cultivate enlightening practice in search of pleasure or enjoyment.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'jig rten gyi dga' ba 'di thams cad ni/ dgra yin no/ / 'dod pa la brten pa 'di ni/ bdud kyi yul lo/ / 'dod pa la brten pa de ni/ blo ngan pas bstan pa'i lam mo/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis smad pa'i yul lo/ / de dag la brten pa de las sdug bsngal thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / de las sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten 'di dag thams cad kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / de las sems can rnams 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / gnad la 'bebs pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / kun tu 'khrug pa rnams kyang rab tu 'byung ngo/ / sems can 'di dag ni/ 'dod pa la brten pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las ring du gyur pa ste/ 'dod pa de dag ni/ mtho ris su skye ba la yang bar du gcod na/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la lta smos kyang ci dgos te/ sems can thams cad kyi bde ba dang / dga' ba thams cad kyi yang bar chad du 'gyur ro/ / de ltar bdag gis 'dod pa ni/ ro chung zhing tshad med pa'i nyes pa can du mthong na/ ci de yang de dag spyod pa'i phyir 'jug gam/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ bdag ni/ don 'di dag gi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa ma yin no/ / 'dod pa la dga' ba'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mi spyod de/ de bas na/ sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde par zhugs pa'i sems bskyed de/ bdag ni/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir de dag nyid kyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / bsngo zhing bsgrub pa'i phyir don de la zhugs pa ste/ de bas na/ bdag gis sems can sdug bsngal gyi zhags pas bcings pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi zhags pa bcad de/ sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su dgrol bar bya'o/ / sdug bsngal gyi rgyud las rnam par bzlog par bya'o/ /

Why? Because mundane pleasures are all suffering, the realm of maniacs, craved by ignorant people but scorned by Buddhas; all misery arises from them. The anger, fighting, mutual defamation, and other such evils of the realms of hells, ghosts, animals, and the nether world are all caused by greedy attachment to objects of desire. By addiction to desire one becomes estranged from the Buddhas and hindered from birth in heaven, to say nothing of unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.’ Observing thus how worldlings, because of greed for a little taste of what they desire, experience immeasurable suffering, enlightening beings after all do not seek unexcelled enlightenment and cultivate enlightening practice for the sake of those pleasures of the senses; it is only to bring peace and comfort to all sentient beings that they set their minds on enlightenment and practice to fulfill their great vows to cut sentient beings’ halter of miseries and enable them to attain liberation.

bdag gis ji lta ji ltar sems can 'di dag thams cad shin tu bde ba dang / phan par 'gyur ba'i bde ba dang / tshor ba med pa'i bde ba dang / zhi ba'i bde ba dang / mi gnas pa'i bde ba dang / mi g.yo ba'i bde ba dang / tshad med pa'i bde ba dang / ma nyams pa'i bde ba dang / mi 'gag pa'i bde ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bde ba rab tu thob par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings also form this thought: ‘I should dedicate roots of goodness in this way to enable all sentient beings to attain ultimate bliss, beneficial bliss, the bliss of nonreception, the bliss of dispassionate tranquility, the bliss of nondependence, the bliss of imperturbability, immeasurable bliss, the bliss of not rejecting birth and death yet not regressing from nirvana, undying bliss, and the bliss of universal knowledge.’

bdag kha lo sgyur ba dang / bdag mgon po dang / bdag me sgron 'dzin pa dang / bdag lam bde ba ston pa dang / bdag khom pa rnyed pa dang / bdag thabs la mkhas pa dang / bdag don shes pa dang / bdag 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho la thams cad mkhyen pa'i gru bo che'i mnyan par gyur pa dang / bdag yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa dang / bdag pha rol ston pas

“They also think, ‘I should be for all sentient beings as a charioteer, as a leader, holding the torch of great knowledge and showing the way to safety and peace, freeing them from danger, using appropriate means to inform them of the truth; and also, in the ocean of birth and death, be as a skillful ship’s captain who knows all, to deliver sentient beings to the other shore.’

dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ji lta ji ltar sems can rnams kyi skyabs su 'gyur pa dang / 'khor bar gyur pa rnams yongs su rgal bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgribs pa med par 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyi yul rnams la mi gnas par 'gyur ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i grogs po thams cad yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad la brten par 'gyur ba dang / las rnam par dag pa la kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba dang / spyad pa chen po'i smon lam rnams yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad khong du chud par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“In this way do great enlightening beings dedicate all their basic virtues — that is, they save all sentient beings by employing means appropriate to the situation to cause them to emerge from birth and death, serve and provide for all the Buddhas, attain unhindered, omniscient knowledge, abandon all maniacs and bad associates, approach all enlightening beings and good associates, annihilate all error and wrongdoing, perfect pure behavior, and fulfill the great practical vows and innumerable virtues of enlightening beings.

de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba na sems 'di snyam du bskyed de/ kye ma gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar bya ba'i phyir gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed pa de snyed kyi nyi ma ni/ mi 'char gyi/ gling bzhi'i 'jig rten snang bar bya ba'i phyir nyi ma 'di nyid gcig pu 'char te/ sems can gling bzhir gtogs pa de dag rang rang gi lus las kyang snang ba gang gis de dag gi nyi ma'i grangs shes par 'gyur ba'am/ rang gi don sgrub par 'gyur ba'am/ lo tog yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'am/ nyin gcig nyin gcig cing bza' shing gi ra ba dang / grong khyer dag tu dga' ba dang / rtse ba'i longs spyod myong bar 'gyur ba'am/ phyogs snang bar 'gyur ba'am/ grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / pho brang 'khor dang / rgyal po'i gnas dag tu 'gro ba dang / 'ong bar bya ba'am/ spyod pa'i don sbyar bar bya ba'i snang ba mi 'byung ste/ sems can de dag rang rang gi lus la yang 'od gang gis de dag gi don sgrub pa'i 'od de lta bu mi gtong ste/ 'di ltar lha'i bu nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gcig pu gnyis su med pa de ni/ gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can rnams la snang bar bya ba'i phyir 'char zhing rab tu 'byung ngo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba na sems 'di ltar skyes te/ sems can 'di dag thams cad la gang gis de dag bdag nyid yongs su bskyab par bya ba de nyid kyang med na; gzhan bskyab pa lta ci smos kyi/ bdag nyid gcig pu gnyis su med pas sems can thams cad kyi phyir 'di ltar sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad snang bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad gsal bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad shes par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad gzung bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad bsdu bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad bskyed par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad dad par bya ba dang sems can thams cad sim par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rtsa ba rnams yang dag par bsdu'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings have properly dedicated their roots of goodness, they form this thought: ‘Many suns do not appear because of the multitude of sentient beings in the four continents—only one sun appears, yet it can shine on all sentient beings. Also, sentient beings do not know the day and night, or travel, or see, or carry out their work by the light of their own bodies—the accomplishment of these things all depends on the emergence of the sun; yet the sun is only one, not two.’ In the same way, great enlightening beings, cultivating and amassing roots of goodness, thinking as they dedicate them, ‘Sentient beings cannot save themselves—how can they save others? Only I alone have this unique determination,’ they cultivate and amass roots of goodness and dedicate them in this way—that is to liberate all sentient beings, to illumine all sentient beings, to guide all sentient beings, to enlighten all sentient beings, to watch over and attend to all sentient beings, to take care of all sentient beings, to perfect all sentient beings, to gladden all sentient beings, to bring happiness to all sentient beings, and to cause all sentient beings to become freed from doubt.

bdag gis ni/ nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de lta bur bya ste/ gzhan las phan pa'i lan re bar mi bya'o/ / gzhan gyis skabs mi rnyed par bya'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi phyir go cha mi 'dor bar bya'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi don du spro ba mi ldog par bya'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi bde ba sgrub pa'i yongs su bsngo ba las phyir ldog par mi bya'o; ; dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu yang bsdu bar bya ste/ yongs su bsngo ba chung ngus yongs su bsngo zhing dga' bar mi bya'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba phan par mi 'gyur ba rnams ni/ sems can rnams la bsngo bar mi bya ste/ ci nas kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la bde bar 'gyur ba de ltar bsngo'o/ / mngon par chags pa med pa'i chos nyid la brten te yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ / sems can rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ / zhes te/ de ni/ 'pho ba'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba la gnas pa ma yin/ srid pa la mngon par chags pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la mi gnas so/ / mtshan ma'i tshul gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su mi bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings also think, ‘I should be like the sun, shining universally on all without seeking thanks or reward, able to take care of all sentient beings even if they are bad, never giving up my vows on this account, not abandoning all sentient beings because one sentient being is evil, just diligently practicing the dedication of roots of goodness to cause all sentient beings to attain peace and ease. Even if my roots of goodness be few, I embrace all sentient beings and make a great dedication with a joyful heart. If one has roots of goodness but does not desire to benefit all sentient beings, that’s not called dedication. When every single root of goodness is directed toward all sentient beings, that is called dedication.’

dngos po la mngon par chags pa'i phyir las kyi rnam par smin pa la yongs su mi rtog go /phung po rnams kyi 'du shes la gnas shing yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / phung po 'jig pa la gnas shing yongs su mi bsngo'o/ las rnam par rtog pa la gnas shing yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / rnam par smin pa la re bas ma yin no/ / rten pas snyems shing ma yin no/ / 'brel par 'byung ba la kun tu rtog pas ma yin no/ / grags pa la gnas pas ma yin no/ / gnas kyi 'du shes la gnas pas ma yin no/ / gnas su rtog pa la gnas bas ma yin no/ / chos la rnam par rtog pa la gnas pas ma yin no/ / sems can gyi 'du shes la gnas pas ma yin te/ khams kyi tshul rnam pa tha dad pa'i rjes su song bas yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / sems kyi kun tu rtog pa la gnas te yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / sems kyi phyin ci log la gnas te yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / 'du shes kyi phyin ci log la gnas te yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / lta ba'i phyin ci log la gnas de yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / tshig gi lam la gnas te yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / de ni/ 'di ltar chos rnams la ji lta ba bzhin rnam par dpyod cing yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid la sems shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyas btab pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mnyam pa'i chos kyis yongs su brtags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos thams cad la sgro gdags pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag rjes su rtogs par byed do/ / gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la yang dag par lta zhing yongs su bsngo ba de dag la rab tu 'jug ste/ chos gang yang skye ba'am/ 'gag par byed pa med do/ /

“They cultivate dedication to place sentient beings in the true nature of things where there is no attachment, dedication seeing that the intrinsic nature of sentient beings doesn’t move or change, dedication without depending on or grasping dedication, dedication without attachment to the appearances of roots of goodness, dedication without false ideas about the essential nature of consequences of actions, dedication without attachment to the characteristics of the five clusters of material and mental existence, dedication without destroying the characteristics of the five clusters, dedication without grasping action, dedication without seeking reward, dedication without attachment to causality, dedication without imagining what is produced by causality, dedication without attachment to reputation, without attachment to location, dedication without attachment to unreal things, dedication without attachment to images of sentient beings, the world, or mind, dedication without creating delusions of mind, delusions of concepts, or delusions of views, dedication without attachment to verbal expression, dedication observing the real true nature of all things, dedication observing the aspects in which all sentient beings are equal, dedication stamping all roots of goodness with the seal of the realm of truth, dedication observing all things dispassionately; they understand that all things have no propagation and that roots of goodness are also thus; they observe that things are nondual, unborn, and unperishing, and that so is dedication.

de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ste/ gnyen pos yongs su dag pas bsngo ba de dag la yang dag par spyod do/ / 'jig rten las 'das pa 'byams klas pa'i rjes su song ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag mthong ste/ gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad khong du chud par mi byed do/ / las kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang dag par mi spyod do/ / las las gzhan du yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su mi bsngo'o; ; las gang yin pa de yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo/ / las kyi lam dang bral bas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi smon lam thob par mi 'gyur te/ las kyi gzugs brnyan gyis rnam par smin pa'i gzugs brnyan yongs su dag par 'gyur ro/ / rnam par smin pa'i gzugs brnyan yongs su dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro/ / yongs su bsngo ba de g.yo ba dang / rlom sems dang / rnam par spyod pa dang bral bar yang rab tu shes so/ / des kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / yongs su bsngo ba 'dis yongs su bsngos pas sems can rab tu dgrol ba rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Dedicating such roots of goodness, they cultivate and practice pure methods of curing spiritual ills. All of their roots of goodness are in accord with transcendental principles, but they do not conceive of them dualistically: it is not in their deeds that they cultivate omniscience, yet it is not apart from deeds that they are dedicated to omniscience; omniscience is not identical to action, but omniscience is not attained apart from action either. Because their action is pure as light, the consequences are also pure as light; because the consequences are pure as light, omniscience is also pure as light. Detached from all confusions and thoughts of self and possession, they know perfectly in this way and skillfully dedicate all roots of goodness.

dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba 'dis yongs su bsngo ba na chos kyi mtshan nyid la gnas pa'ang mi gtong ste/ las dang rnam par smin pa med pa'i chos thams cad la nyon mongs pa med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul gyis las dang rnam par smin ba sgrub pa la mngon par mkhas pa yin no/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rjes su spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba sems can rnams kyi 'du shes 'gog cing; 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa zhes bya ba ste/ dang po'o/ /

“When enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, liberating sentient beings ceaselessly, they do not dwell on appearances; but though they know that in all things there is no action and no consequence, yet they can skillfully produce all deeds and consequences, without opposition or contention. In this way they expediently practice dedication. When enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they are free from all faults and are praised by all Buddhas. This is called the great enlightening beings’ first dedication, saving all sentient beings without any image or concept of sentient beings.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyis 'khor thams cad la rnam par bltas te/ chos kyi dbyings la rnam par bltas nas don dang / tshig dang / yi ge la 'jug par bya ba dang / sems rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su sgom pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad snying rje chen pos khyab par bya ba dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi gdung la sems yang dag par 'brel bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dang yon tan thams cad la 'jug par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus yang dag par bskyed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rab tu dbye ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i dus la ji ltar 'bab pa yang dag par blta ba dang / chos kyi las dang mthun pa'i gzugs kyi lus yongs su dag pa yang dag par bstan par byed cing / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Then the enlightening being Diamond Banner looked over all the assemblies in the ten directions, throughout the cosmos; entering into the meanings and expressions of the profundities, cultivating supreme action with a boundless mind, covering all beings with great compassion, maintaining the lineage of the enlightened ones of past, present, and future, entering the treasury of virtuous qualities of all Buddhas, producing the verity body of all Buddhas, able to discern the mentalities of all sentient beings, knowing the roots of goodness he had planted were ripe, while abiding in the reality body he manifested pure physical embodiment for them and, empowered by the Buddha, said in verse,

gang zhig bsam yas bskal par spyod pa dag / sems can phan phyir rtag tu zhugs pa ste/ / de dag brtson brtan chags med yid ldan pa/ / sangs rgyas yon tan rtag tu sbyor zhing tshol/ /
gang zhig mtshungs med skyes bu 'dul drung du/ / bsam pa dri ma med par rnam sbyangs shing / / chos mkhas 'gro ba skyob pa'i sems ldan pa/ / de dag yongs bsngo mdzod du zhugs pa yin/ /
brtson 'grus stobs dang de dag nyer ldan zhing / / ye shes stobs kyis rnam dag yid gzhungs te/ / bzod pa'i stobs ldan sgul bar mi nus pa/ / de dag 'gro ba kun skyab mngon par brtson/ /
shin tu yid brtan mtshungs pa med pa dang / / bsam pa rnam dag dga' ba'i blo ldan pa/ / de dag sa dang / 'dra ba'i bzod stobs kyis/ / 'gro ba kun la phan phyir mngon par brtson/ /
bdag la bde ba tshol bar mi byed de/ / snying rje can gyi bsam pa de 'dra'o/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob sems can/ / chags med gyur par de dag zhugs pa yin/ /
phyogs bcu'i sems can ji snyed gang yang rung / / 'gro ba kun nas ma lus bsdu byas te; ; de dag don du brtan sems ldan pa rnams/ / de dag yongs su bsngo tshul bslab pa yin/ /
dga' ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa gtong bar byed/ / skyes bu dam pa tshul khrims rnam dag pa/ / brtson 'grus stobs la brtan par gnas pa'i sems/ / de dag ye shes dge bas yongs su bsngo/ /
de dag blo gros yangs shing mtha' yas pa/ / bzod pa'i stobs la rtag par rab tu zhugs/ / bsam gtan stobs la rjes su sems pas na/ / mkhas pa de dag shes rab bsam mi khyab/ /
phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten kun na gang yod pa'i/ / dge ba de dag yang dag sgrub pa na/ / 'gro ba kun la phan dang bde sems kyis/ / ye shes mkhas la de dag yongs su bsngo/ /
dge ba de dag gang la tshad med pa/ / brtan pa de dag yongs su sdud pa'i tshe/ / de la rtag brtson dam pa'i blo gros can/ / bsam yas ye shes la mi rab tu gzhog /

Cultivating the Way over inconceivable eons, Vigor firm, mind unobstructed, Always seeking the virtuous qualities of Buddhas To benefit living beings,
The peerless tamers of the world Thoroughly purify their minds; Determining to save all conscious creatures, They can enter well into the treasury of dedication.
Their courageous power of energy complete, Their knowledge clear, their minds pure, They rescue all beings everywhere, Their minds enduring, unperturbed.
Their hearts can rest peacefully, without compare; Their minds are ever pure and full of joy. Earnestly striving thus for the sake of the living, They are like earth, accepting all.
They do not seek pleasure for themselves: They only want to rescue sentient beings; Thus developing a heart of great compassion, They quickly gain entry to the unhindered state.
They are able to accept all beings In all worlds in the ten directions; They stabilize their minds to save those beings, This way cultivating the dedications.
They practice generosity most gladly And preserve pure conduct, without transgression; Their intrepid, vigorous mind unstirred, They dedicate this to enlightened omniscience.
Their mind is boundlessly broad, Their forbearance is stable, unshakable; Their meditation is most profound, always illumining, Their wisdom’s inconceivably subtle.
In all worlds in the ten directions They fully cultivate pure practices: All these virtues they dedicate To the peace and happiness of all conscious beings.
The great heroes diligently practice good works, Measureless, boundless, uncountable: All these they use to benefit sentient beings And cause them to abide in inconceivable supreme knowledge.

de dag 'gro ba'i don du ma nar med par/ / bskal ba bsam gyis mi khyab gnas pa spro; ; de dag yid ni zhum par mi 'gyur te/ / de dag bsngo rtogs bsam pa'i yid dang ldan/ /
gzugs tshol mi byed sgra dang dri ma yin/ / bro dang reg pa de bzhin mi tshol te/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su dgrol sems kyis/ / ye shes dam pa'i stobs ni rtag tu tshol/ /
mkhas pa de dag ye shes mkha' 'dra bas/ / mtha' dang dbus med spyad pa spyod pa byed/ / rgyal ba'i chos kyi chos nyid ci 'dra ba/ / mtha' yas grags ba'i spyod pa de 'dra'o/ /
de dag gang dang gang du 'dong byed pa/ / 'gro la bde ba rgya cher rab tu sgrub/ / rtag tu mchog brtson dga' ba byed pa ste/ / byang chub spyod pas dga' bar tshor ba med/ /
gdugs med sems la gnas shing zhugs pa rnams/ / ye shes dam pa mchog la rjes su sems/ / de dag bdag la bde bar mi/ 'dod de/ / 'gro ba kun la bde dang dga' phyir brtson/ /
de dag yongs su bsngo ba mthar phyin dang / / bsam pa gdug med rnam par dag yid kyis/ / dus gsum rgyal ba gang na bzhugs bzhugs pa'i/ / chos kyi grong rdal de na rab tu gnas/ /
gzugs dang tshor ba dag la mi gnas shing / / 'du shes 'du byed yid la'ang ma yin te/ / srid pa gsum las yongs su yid bskyod de/ / bsod nams gter la de dag yongs su bsngo/ /
sems can ji snyed rgyal bas sad byas pa/ / 'gro ba kun nas ma lus bsdu byas te/ / skyes bu dam pa de dag dgrol ba'i phyir/ / spyod pa'i mchog la gang zhig brtson byed pa/ /
de dag rnam pa kun tu sems brtan te/ / de dag blo gros yangs pa gzhal du med/ / de dag dran pa'i dbang po ma nyams pa/ / de dag mnyam bzhag bsam pa rnam par dag /
'jig rten 'di yi nang dang phyi rnams su/ / gang du'ang de dag gnas 'chang mi byed de/ / mkha' la rlung dang rlung mar ci 'dra ba/ / phyogs rnams kun tu sems ni de bzhin no/ /

To act for the benefit of all sentient beings They spend inconceivably many eons in hells; This they do without wearying or shrinking back, Always practicing dedication with courage and decision.
They do not seek form, sound, smell or taste, And they do not seek nice feelings: It is just to liberate all living beings That they always seek supreme knowledge.
Their knowledge and wisdom are pure as space, They pratice boundless enlightening acts; The practical methods the Buddhas carry out Those people always practice and learn.
The great heroes, traveling through all worlds, Are able to give peace and safety to all beings, Causing all to rejoice, Tirelessly cultivating enlightening practice.
Destroying all mental poisons, Contemplating and cultivating highest knowledge, They do not seek comfort for themselves: They only wish that sentient beings be freed from pain.
These people’s dedication is ultimate— Their hearts are always pure and free from poison: Entrusted by the Buddhas of all times, They dwell in the citadel of the loftiest teaching.
They’re never attached to forms Or to sensations, perceptions, habits, or consciousness; Their minds have forever transcended existence, While all their virtues they dedicate to others.
All the sentient beings seen by the Buddhas They take into their care, without exception, Vowing to enable them all to be liberated; For them do they strive, with great joy.
Their minds are constantly stable, Their knowledge and wisdom’s incomparably vast. Truly mindful, free from ignorance, they’re always calm, And all their deeds are totally pure.
Those enlightening beings, while in the world, Are not attached to any internal or external phenomena; Like the wind traveling unhindered through the sky Is the function of the great beings’ mind.

de dag lus kyi las rnams rtsom byed pa/ / des ni rgyal ba mngon par mnyes par byed/ / rgyal ba rnams la ngag kyang bsdams pa ste; ; yid kyis de dag zhugs pa gang yang med/ /
mi yi dbang po gang na bzhugs pa'i zhing / / mtha' yas zhing du de dag 'dong byed cing / / de dag kun tu thugs rje rgyal ba mthong / / rgyal ba rim gro byas shing de nas 'dong / /
de dag rtag tu kha na ma tho med/ / 'gro ba kun na de dag 'jigs pa med/ / de dag srid gsum 'di na mu stegs byed/ / de dag bde gshegs lam la gnas pa yin/ /
de dag rnam par sgom zhing mngon brtson pa/ / skye dang 'jig pa'i tshul la rjes su sems/ / chos kyi ngo bo nyid la rab tu zhugs/ / nyon mongs med pa'i tshul la rab tu zhugs pa yin/ /
gang gi spyod pa rab tu brtan gyur cing / / 'gro ba kun las shes pa mi ldog pa/ / de 'dra'i chos nyid de dag rjes su sems/ / des ni dus gsum chags pa med par 'gyur/ /
gang rnams 'gro ba rnam par dag byed pa/ / de dag yongs su bsngo ba'i pha rol phyin/ / de dag gnas rnams thams cad phyir bzlog pas/ / de phyir de dag spyod la mi gnas so/ /
'gro ba kun gyi tshig lam ji snyed dang / / skye rgu thams cad smra zhing mngon brjod pa/ / de dag smra yang rlom sems med pa yin/ / chags med yid ldan spyod pa 'di 'dra'o; ;
bsod nams tshul la blo gros mtha' yas pa/ / de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ba na/ / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten bzhugs pa ji snyed pa'i/ / mi yi dbang po de dag mnyes pa yin; ;

Their physical actions are all pure, All their speech is without error; Their minds always take refuge in the Buddha, And they can please all the Buddhas.
In the infinite worlds of the ten directions, Wherever there are Buddhas, they go; There, seeing the lords of great compassion, They all gaze with reverent respect.
Their minds are always pure and faultless, Entering all worlds without fear; Already in the Enlightened Ones’ unexcelled Path, They act as great reservoirs of truth for all beings.
Diligently observing and examining all phenomena, They contemplate existence and nonexistence accordingly: Thus they pursue the truth And gain entry to the most profound realm of noncontention.
With this they cultivate the steadfast Way Which no sentient beings can break down; Well able to comprehend the nature of all things, They have no attachments in any world.
Thus they are dedicated to reaching the other shore, Enabling all beings to be free from defilements; Forever rid of all dependency, They enter the realm of ultimate independence.
In the languages of all sentient beings In accord with the differences in their types, Enlightening beings can distinctly explain While their minds are unattached and unhindered.
Thus do enlightening beings practice dedication: Unspeakably many are their virtues and their methods; They earn the praise of all the Buddhas In all worlds of the ten directions.
'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa zhes bya ba ste/ yongs su bsngo ba dang po'o/ /

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba mi phyed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad la mi phyed par dad pa yin/ 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa gcig thob pa yan chad kun la yang mi phyed par dad pa yin/ 'di lta ste/ lhag pa'i bsam pas rab tu zhugs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mi phyed par dad pa yin/ 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa yang dag par gzung zhing bsrung ba'i phyir de dag dang de dag tu skyes pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa la mi phyed par dad pa yin/ 'di lta ste/ sdang ba med pa'i mig rab tu 'thob pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la mi phyed par dad pa yin/ 'di lta ste/ mtha' yas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya zhing yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir chos dkar po thams cad la mi phyed par dad pa yin/ 'di lta ste/ lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba la mi phyed par dad pa yin/ 'di lta ste/ ston pa'i 'du shes yongs su ma rgyas pa rgyas par bya ba'i phyir chos smra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mi phyed par dad pa yin/ 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la dad par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul la mi phyed par dad pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa'i spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyis yang dag par bzung ba/ dmigs pa kun tu rgyu ba gzhan dang gzhan can de dag thams cad la mi phyed par dad pa yin te/

“What is the indestructible dedication of great enlightening beings? These great enlightening beings attain indestructible faith in the Enlightened Ones of past, future, and present, because they serve all Buddhas. They attain indestructible faith in enlightening beings, even those who have just resolved on the search for omniscience for the first time, because they vow to tirelessly cultivate all foundations of goodness of enlightening beings. They attain indestructible faith in all the Buddha qualities, because they conceive profound aspiration. They attain indestructible faith in all Buddha teachings, because they abide by them and maintain them. They attain indestructible faith in all sentient beings, because they look upon them impartially with the eye of compassion and dedicate roots of goodness to their universal benefit. They attain indestructible faith in all pure ways, because everywhere they amass boundless roots of goodness. They attain indestructible faith in the path of dedication of enlightening beings, because they fulfill their noble aspirations. They attain indestructible faith in all teachers of the ways of enlightening beings, because they think of the enlightening beings as Buddhas. They attain indestructible faith in the spiritual powers of all Buddhas, because they deeply believe in the inconceivability of the Buddhas. They attain indestructible faith in the practice of skill in expedient means exercised by all enlightening beings, because they include countless various realms of activity.
