de ltar mi phyed pa'i gnas rab tu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba ci'ang rung ste; sangs rgyas sam/ byang chub sems dpa'am/ nyan thos sam/ rang sangs rgyas sam/ sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'am/ sems can rnams la dmigs pa gang dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs sam/ dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa tha dad pa'am/ byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'am/ byams pa sgom pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bskyed pas kyang rung ste/ snying rje chen po yangs pa tshad med pa yang dag par mthong bas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yangs par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rjes su bslab pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rjes su nan tan bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba dang / don shes pa la yang dag par 'jug par bya ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / sbyin pa'i tshogs rab tu brtsam pa dang / yon tan thams cad kyi tshogs la rab tu 'jug par bya ba dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rnam par dpyod par byed cing /

“When great enlightening beings abide in indestructible faith, they plant roots of goodness, innumerable and boundless, in various realms, such as those of Buddhas, enlightening beings, disciples of Buddhas, individual illuminates, of Buddhist doctrines, and of sentient beings, causing the determination for enlightenment to grow more and more. Their kindness and compassion broad and great, they observe impartially. They accord with and practice the deeds of the Buddhas, embracing all pure foundations of goodness. Entering the truth, they assemble virtuous practices, carry out great works of charity, and cultivate meritorious qualities, looking upon the past, present, and future as equal.

de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshogs bsags pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba dang mi 'bral ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang mi 'bral ba rab tu thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mi 'bral bar 'grogs ba dang thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yang dag par bzung zhing bsrung ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das par sems bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / chos smra ba thams cad la phu dud du bya ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / chos kyi snang ba thams cad thob pa dang mi 'bral ba dang / smon lam chen po la rab tu brtson par bya ba dang mi 'bral bar yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings dedicate such virtues to omniscience, aspiring to always see the Buddhas. They associate with good companions and live among enlightening beings. Constantly keeping their minds on omniscience, they accept and hold the Buddhist teachings, conscientiously protecting them, and educate and develop all sentient beings, their minds always dedicated to the path of emancipation from the world. They provide for and serve all teachers of truth. Understanding the principles of the teachings, they retain them in memory; they cultivate and practice great vows, causing them all to be fulfilled.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par sgrub cing yang dag par sdud pa dang / nye bar gsog pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / sems pa dang / dmigs par byed pa dang / rab tu rtog pa dang / yang dag par smon pa dang / kun tu spyod pa dang / nye bar ston pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/

“Thus do enlightening beings amass roots of goodness, accomplish roots of goodness, develop roots of goodness, contemplate roots of goodness, concentrate on roots of goodness, analyze roots of goodness, delight in roots of goodness, cultivate roots of goodness, and abide in roots of goodness.

dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag 'di ltar bsgrubs pa las dge pa'i rtsa ba dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gang byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu des bdag byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na/ sems kyi skad cig re re la brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong bar gyur cig / de dag kyang mnyes par byas par gyur cig / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la yang sangs rgyas kyi rim gro rgya chen po byas par gyur cig / rin po che grangs med pa dang / me tog grangs med pa dang / dri grangs med pa dang / phreng ba grangs med pa dang / na bza' grangs med pa dang / gdugs grangs med pa dang / rgyal mtshan grangs med pa dang / ba dan grangs med pa dang / rgyan grangs med pa dang / lhab lhub grangs med pa dang / rim gro grangs med pa dang / byug pa grangs med pa dang / rnam par byug pa grangs med pa dang / me tog thams cad kyi gdan grangs med pa dang / spos thams cad kyi gdan grangs med pa dang / phreng ba thams cad kyi gdan grangs med pa dang / tsan+dan bzang po thams cad kyi gdan grangs med pa dang / gos thams cad kyi gdan grangs med pa dang / rdo rje thams cad kyi gdan grangs med pa dang / nor bu rin po che thams cad kyi gdan grangs med pa dang / rin po che'i spang leb thams cad kyi gdan grangs med pa dang / rin po che'i kha dog gi gdan grangs med pa dang / rin po che thams cad kyi 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / me tog thams cad kyi 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / spos thams cad kyi 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / phreng ba'i rgyan thams cad kyi 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / gos thams cad kyi 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / rin po che thams cad kyis sna tshogs su spras pa'i 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / rin po che thams cad kyi spang leb bting ba'i 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / rin po che thams cad kyi shing ta la'i phreng ba bsgrengs pa'i 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / rin po che'i stegs bus bskor ba'i 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / rin po che thams cad kyi dril bu'i dra bas kun nas yog par byas pa'i 'chag sa grangs med pa dang / lha rdzas thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i rin po che'i gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang / lha rdzas thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i me tog thams cad kyi gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang / lha rdzas las shin tu 'das pa'i spos thams cad kyi gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang / lha rdzas las shin tu 'das pa'i phreng ba thams cad kyi gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang /
lha rdzas las shin tu 'das pa'i tsan+dan thams cad kyi gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang / lha rdzas las shin tu 'das pa'i spos dang bdug pa mchog dam pa thams cad kyi gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang / lha rdzas thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i rdo rje'i gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang / nor bu rin po che'i gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang / spos kyi shing dang / gos kyi shing dang / rol mo'i shing dang / rin po che'i shing dang / lhab lhub kyi shing dang / shing sna tshogs kyis kun nas bskor ba'i gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang / yid du 'ong ba'i sgra 'byung ba'i shing grangs med pa dang / snam bu rin po che dpyangs pa'i shing grangs med pa dang / rin po che mang po'i shing grangs med pa dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan thams cad grangs med pa dang / shing thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang / ba gam gyi rgyan grangs med pa dang / skar khung gi rgyan grangs med pa dang / rta babs kyi rgyan grangs med pa dang / pu shu'i rgyan dang / zla gam gyi rgyan dang / khang pa brtsegs ba'i rgyan dang / bla re'i rgyan grangs med pa dang / gsar gyi dra ba'i khab grangs med pa dang / spos dang / bdug pa'i dam pa thams cad kyi rgyan grangs med pa dang / gos thams cad gding par bting ba'i rgyan gyis thams cad rab tu brgyan pa'i gtsug lag khang grangs med pas bsnyen bkur byas par gyur cig /

“Once enlightening beings have amassed various roots of goodness in this way, they cultivate the practices of enlightening beings by means of the results of these roots of goodness. In every successive moment they see innumerable Buddhas, and serve and provide for them in accordance with their needs. They provide innumerable jewels, flowers, garlands, garments, parasols, banners, pennants, adornments, servants, beautified places, perfumes, powdered incenses, mixed scents, burning incenses, profound faith, aspiration, pure minds, respect, praise, honor, jeweled seats, flower seats, incense seats, seats of garlands, sandalwood seats, cloth seats, diamond seats, crystal seats, precious streamer seats, jewel-colored seats, bejeweled parks, flowered parks, perfumed parks, parks hung with garlands, parks spread with robes, jewel-studded parks, parks decorated with streamers of all jewels, parks with trees of all precious substances, parks with balustrades of all precious substances, parks covered with nets of chimes of all jewels, palaces with all precious substances, palaces with all kinds of flowers, palaces with all kinds of incenses, palaces with all kinds of garlands,
palaces of all kinds of sandalwood, palaces with stores of all kinds of aromatic resins, palaces of all kinds of diamonds, palaces of all kinds of crystals, all extraordinarily fine, surpassing those of the heavens; innumerable trees of mixed jewels, trees of various fragrances, trees of precious raiment, trees of music, trees of fascinating jewels, trees of gem-studded streamers, trees of precious rings, trees adorned with banners, pennants, and canopies with the fragrances of all flowers—such trees, with luxuriant foliage interreflecting, adorn the palaces; the palaces also are adorned with countless lattices, windows, doors, balconies, crescents, and drapes, countless nets of gold covering them, countless perfumes wafting throughout them scenting everything, and countless robes spread on the ground.

de ltar mchod pa rgya chen po sbyar te sangs rgyas thams cad la yid kyi dbang po shin tu dad pas mchod pa dang / rim gro rgyun mi chad pa dang / sangs rgyas phu dud du bya ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa las byung bas phyag 'tshal zhing mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur byas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad rim gror bya bas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa zad par gyur cig/ 'gro ba thams cad dad par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsdu ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par bzlog pa dang / sems rgya chen po bskyed pa la mos par bya ba dang / rgyan chen pos yang dag par brgyan pa dang / tshad med par rnam par bres pa'i rgyan dang / brtsams pa mthar phyin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba shin tu dkon pa brjod par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / mchod rten sna tshogs bsnyen bkur bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de la

“Enlightening beings reverently present these offerings with pure-minded respect to all Buddhas for countless, incalculable eons, never retreating, never ceasing; and after each Buddha dies they also respectfully make similar offerings to all their relics, in order to induce all sentient beings to develop pure faith, to embody all foundations of goodness, to be freed from all suffering, to have broad understanding, to be arrayed with great adornments, to be arrayed with infinite adornments, to consummate all their undertakings, to know how rare it is to meet a Buddha in the world, to fulfill the immeasurable power of the enlightened, to adorn and make offerings to the tombs and shrines of Buddhas, and to maintain the teachings of all Buddhas.

de lta bu'i rim gro byed pa dang / de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang sangs rgyas de dag thams cad kyi sku gdung mchod pa la rab tu brtson par bya bas bskal pa grangs med pa zad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i rgyan dang / brjod pa yon tan mtha' yas pa bsngags pas bsgrubs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsgrubs pa de dag mthar thug par ma gyur cig / de ltar rim gro byed pa las phyir ldog par ma gyur cig / rgyun gcod par ma gyur cig / sems yongs su skyo ba med pa yang thob par gyur cig / mngon par chags pa'i sems 'du shes rnam par spangs pa dang / mi gnas pa'i chos nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rlom sems thams cad bcom pas rlom sems med par gyur pa dang / chos 'gyur ba med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi rgyas btab pa'i chos kyi sgo dang / tshe dang skye ba thams cad du 'khor bar 'gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa dang / skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin la dbyod [*dpyod?] cing dmigs pa'i chos kyi rgyas btab pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i yongs su bsngo ba dang / chos kyi rang bzhin la rab tu brtson pa'i yongs su bsngo ba mnyam pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i tshul la zhugs pa'i mngon par 'du bya ba med par sgrub pa dang / dngos po thams cad kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i bsngo ba'i tshul dang / bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i rnam pa tshad med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bsngo ba srid pa kun las 'phags pa dang / sgom pa'i sgo mtshan ma la mkhas pas gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar len pa'i byin gyi rlabs can dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bsngo ba chen pos yongs su sbyangs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la gnas pa'i mos pa yongs su rgyas par gnas thams cad yang dag par bcom par gyur cig/

“Their offerings to living Buddhas and to their relics after death could never be fully told of even in an incalculable period of time. Such cultivation and accumulation of immeasurable virtue is all to develop and mature sentient beings, without retreating, without ceasing, without wearying, without clinging, free from all mental images, without stopping anywhere, forever beyond all dependence, detached from self and anything pertaining to a self. They seal all aspects of their activities with the stamp of truth, realize the birthlessness of things, abide in the abode of buddhahood, and observe the nature of birthlessness definitively marking all objects. In the care of the Buddhas, they set their minds on dedication—dedication in accord with the essential nature of things, dedication entering into the uncreated truth yet perfecting created expedient methods, dedication of techniques discarding attachments to concepts of phenomena, dedication abiding in countless enlightening skills, dedication forever departing from all realms of existence, dedication of expedient application of practices without sticking to forms, dedication embracing all foundations of goodness, great dedication purifying the acts of all enlightening beings, dedication rousing the will for enlightenment, dedication living with all bases of goodness, dedication fulfilling supreme faith.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar ci nas kyang 'khor ba'i rgyud du chud zos par mi 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa chud zos par mi 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang srid pa'i 'du 'dzis chud zos par mi 'gyur pa dang / ci nas kyang sems can gyi khams thams cad bsgral ba dang / ci nas kyang skye ba dang / 'chi 'phos skyon du mi 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sgo stor bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyu zad par mi 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis kun tu blangs par mi 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bar yongs su bsngo ste/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa mun pa med pa dang ldan pa ni/ chos dkar po snang bar gyur pas nye bar brtan cing yongs su bsngo ba'i mchog skyes bu dam pas spyad pa dang /

“When enlightening beings dedicate such roots of goodness, though they go along with birth and death they are not changed: they seek omniscience without ever retreating; while being in the various realms of existence, their minds are undisturbed; they are able to liberate all sentient beings; they are not stained by compounded things; they do not lose unimpeded knowledge; their fulfillment of causes and conditions of enlightening beings’ practices and stages is inexhaustible; worldly things cannot change or move them; they fulfill the pure ways of transcendence; they are able to accomplish all knowledge and power. Thus do enlightening beings get rid of the darkness of ignorance and folly, develop the will for enlightenment and reveal its light, increase pure ways, dedicated to the supreme Way, fulfilling all its practices.

yongs su dag pa'i yid kyis yang dag par rtog pa dang / sems dang 'dra ba'i chos thams cad la zhugs pa dang / sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i las yongs su shes pa dang / mig yor lta bu'i las kyi rnam par smin pa la mos pa dang / sprul pa lta bu'i mngon par 'du byed pa la gnas pa dang / sgra brnyan lta bu'i las la brten pa dang / grib ma lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rjes su song ba dang / chags pa med pa'i chos kyi mig rab tu skyes pa dang / bya ba med par 'byams klas pa'i rjes su song ba dang / zhi ba'i rigs rab tu thob pa dang / gnyis su med pa dang ldan pa'i 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad la rab tu zhugs pa dang / chos ma nor ba'i mtshan ma thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / mtshan ma thams cad la zhen pa med pa dang / thun mong gi las la mkhas pa'i rjes su song ba dang / chos dkar po thams cad rgyun ma chad pa dang / chags pa thams cad kyis mngon par ma zhen pa dang / chags pa med par 'gro ba la brten pa dang ldan pa yin te/

“With clear, pure intellect they are able to skillfully analyze and comprehend all things as appearing according to the mind; they know deeds are like illusions, results of deeds are like paintings, all activities are like magic tricks, things born of causes and conditions are all like echoes, and the practices of enlightening beings are all like reflections. They produce the clear, pure eye of reality, seeing the vast realm of the uncreated; realizing their null essence, they understand the nonduality of things and discover the true aspect of things. They fulfill the practices of enlightening beings without attachment to any forms. They are able to carry out all commonplace acts without ever abandoning pure principles and practices. Free from all attachments, they remain unattached in action.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu bsam pa'i blo dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba la rmongs pa med pa/ chos thams cad dang 'gal ba med pa'i chos can/ rgyu dang / las dang / bya ba dang 'gal ba med pa yang dag par mthong ba/ yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa/ ngo bo nyid kyi chos kyi tshul dang / las rnam par smin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad la rnam par lta zhing / rnam par dpyod pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa/ yongs su bsngo ba'i ye shes chen po mngon par shes pa las shin tu rig pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa/ mngon par 'du bya ba med par spyod pa'i sems dge ba dang ldan pa de

“Thus do enlightening beings think flexibly, without confusion or delusion, without contradicting facts, without destroying active causes, dedicating as is appropriate, with clear perception of real truth. They know the inherent nature of things, yet by the power of skill in means they accomplish results of action and reach the other shore. With knowledge and wisdom they examine all things and attain knowledge of spiritual faculties. The virtues of their deeds are carried out without striving, in accordance with their free will.

dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar ci nas kyang 'gro ba thams cad yongs su dgrol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs bdud kyi las dang bral ba/ las kyi rnam pa yongs su byang ba'i bdag nyid can thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mos shing rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan par 'gyur bar yongs su bsngo'o; ; bsngo ba de yang tshad med pa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par mthong bar byed de/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'jig rten gyi yul dang rnam par bral ba/ nyon mongs pa thams cad dang rnam par bral bar yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad shin tu rnam par byang ba'i phyir yang yongs su bsngo ste/ ye shes rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug par zab pa'i tshul gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang 'khor ba'i chos kyis mi bskyod cing / sangs rgyas kyi dge ba mngon par 'byung ba sems bskyed pa dang ldan par yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe'ang bdud kyi las thams cad las rnam par bzlog ste chos mnyam pa nyid kyi rgya yongs su bsngo ba'i ye shes kyi rjes su song ba las rgyas 'debs par byed do/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi longs spyod kyi phyir yang chos thams cad 'jig rten las 'das par khong du chud pa'i yongs su bsngo bas yongs su bsngo'o/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su grub pas 'gyod pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba mi phyed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste/ gnyis pa'o/ /

“Enlightening beings dedicate roots of goodness in this way because they want to liberate all sentient beings, keep the lineage of Buddhas unbroken, be forever rid of demonic activity, and see omniscience. Their boundless aspiration is never discarded; they detach from mundane objects and cut off all mixup and defilement. They also wish for sentient beings to attain pure knowledge, enter deeply into the techniques of liberation, depart from the state of birth and death, attain the bases of virtues of buddhahood, forever end all delusive activities, stamp all actions with the seal of equanimity, determine to enter knowledge of all ways of liberation, and accomplish all transmundane qualities. This, O Child of Buddha, is called enlightening beings’ second dedication, indestructible dedication.

yongs su bsngo ba de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su bsngo zhing / sangs rgyas grangs med pa mngon sum du bya ba thob par 'gyur ro/ / chos brjod du med pa yongs su dag pa yang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyang khong du chud par byed do/ / chos thams cad la 'jug pa rmongs pa med pa la yang rab tu 'jug go /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs bdud kyi las thams cad rab tu 'joms pa yang yongs su sgrub bo/ / mngon par skyes pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ / chags pa med pa la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'ang yang dag par 'grub bo/ / chos thams cad kyi don mthong ba yang rab tu thob bo/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i 'du shes kyi gnas kyang rab tu rtogs par byed do/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su snang bar bya ba'i yongs su dag pa yang yongs su sgrub bo/ /

“When enlightening beings abide in this dedication, they get to see all the countless Buddhas and master innumerable pure, sublime teachings. They attain impartiality toward all sentient beings, and have no doubt about anything. Strengthened by the spiritual power of all Buddhas, they overcome all demons and forever get rid of their influence. They achieve noble birth and fulfill the will for enlightenment. Attaining unhindered knowledge, they can expound the meanings of all doctrines without relying on another for understanding. They are able, following the power of imagination, to enter all lands; illumining sentient beings everywhere, they cause them all to become purified. Great enlightening beings, by the power of this indestructible dedication, embody all foundations of goodness and dedicate them in this way.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Diamond Banner, spiritually empowered by Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

de dag yid ni dbye ba med bsgyur cing / / ji snyed las rnams yang dag brtson byed kun/ / ci nas rgyal ba mngon par mnyes 'gyur ba/ / de ltar 'jig rten mkhas la yongs su bsngo ba byed/ /
sangs rgyas bsam du med pa bsnyen bkur cing / / sbyin 'dul sdom pa mchog gi tshul khrims rnams/ / ci nas 'gro kun rnam par dag 'gyur ba/ / de ltar 'jig rten phan phyir yongs su bsngo/ /
ji snyed 'di na spos kyi gzhal med khang / / me tog rnam pa na bza'i rnam pa dang / / lhab lhub rnam pa gdugs kyi rnam pa dag / des na ye shes mkhas la bsnyen bkur byed/ /
de ltar skyes bu'i seng+ge drang srong rnams/ / bskal pa bsam yas bsnyen cing bkur byas kyang / / rgyal ba skyes bu 'dul ba mchod byas pas/ / nam yang ngoms par tshor bar mi 'gyur ro/ /
de dag rgyal ba kun la mos byed cing / / phyogs rnams kun gyi 'jig rten sgron ma rnams/ / mi yi seng+ge mtshungs med ji snyed du/ / 'jig rten phyogs bcu dag na bzhugs pa mthong / /
bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab rnam mang du/ / mi ngoms yid kyis sbyin pa gtong byed cing / / dge ba de la rjes su sems byed pas/ / bskal pa brgyar yang ngoms par mi tshor ro/ /
'gro ba'i 'du shes rnam rtog rab shes kyang / / de la de ni mi rtog rnam mi rtog / de dag 'gro ba'i dbang po ma lus shes; ; de dag phan phyir rtag tu 'jug par byed/ /
de dag dga' zhing mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems/ / dad pa 'od gsal sri zhu ldan pa rnams/ / bsam yas bskal par 'jig rten 'gro phan phyir/ / yongs su dgrol ba'i sems kyis spro bar byed/ /
de dag bde gshegs mya ngan 'das pa la/ / sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad yid 'ong ba'i/ / mchod rten bsam gyis mi khyab rtsig byed cing / / mchod pa byed kyang nam yang tshim pa med/ /
mtshungs med de dag sku gzugs rnam dag pa/ / rab tu 'od 'bar gser gyi snying po can/ / rgyal ba'i sku gzugs ri rab mnyam pa dag / bye ba brgya phrag mtha' yas rab tu byed/ /
zil mnon dam pa rnyed pa de dag ni/ / bsod nams yangs pa'i stobs de sgrub pa na/ / de dag yongs bsngo'i shes par rab rtogs shing / / dngos dang dngos med thams cad rab tu sgom/ /
'di 'dra'i ye shes tshul la yongs bsngos pas; ; de phyir 'khor bar zad par mi 'gyur te/ / chos nyid ye shes mchog dang dam pa dang / / de la chos rnams skye ba gang yang med/ /

Enlightening beings, having attained indestructible will, Carry out all good works; Therefore they’re able to make the Buddhas rejoice: Those who are wise dedicate this.
Making offerings to infinite Buddhas, Giving charity, with self-control, they subdue their senses, Out of desire to benefit all sentient beings, To cause them all to be purified.
All sorts of beautiful, fragrant flowers, Innumerable different splendid robes, Jeweled canopies and adornments, They present to all the Buddhas.
Thus do they make offerings to Buddhas For countless, unthinkable eons; Reverent, respectful, always rejoicing, They never have a thought of weariness.
They concentrate their thought on the Buddhas, The Great Bright Lamps of all worlds: All the Enlightened Ones of the ten directions Appear before them, as though face to face.
For inconceivably infinite eons They give in all ways, their minds never weary: For hundreds of millions of eons They practice good principles in the same way.
After the Buddhas become extinct, They make offerings to their relics, tirelessly: With various fine adornments for each They set up inconceivably many shrines.
Built in incomparably excellent forms, Adorned with jewels and gold, The shrines are magnificent, big as mountains, Their number countless billions.
Having made offerings with pure minds, with respect, They also conceive the will to gladden and benefit others; For inconceivable eons they stay in the world, Rescuing sentient beings and liberating them.
They know that sentient beings are illusory And do not discriminate among them, Yet can differentiate the faculties of beings And act for the benefit of all the living.
Enlightening beings cultivate and build up virtues Vast, extensive, incomparably supreme; Understanding they’re essentially not existent, In this way they dedicate them all with certainty.
Observing all things with supreme knowledge, There’s not a single thing that’s born; Thus do they provisionally cultivate dedication, Virtue infinite, inexhaustible.

des ni 'jig rten mkhyen pa rnam dag ltar/ / sems kyang rab tu rnam par dag par 'gyur/ / des na mi zad mthar phyin tshul rtogs pa'i/ / 'dus byas bsod nams zad par 'gyur ba med/ /
gang rnams byang chub sems dang ldan gyur cing / / 'jig rten kun la gnas pa med pa dag / 'gro ba kun la chags pa med pa yin/ / phyogs rnams kun tu 'ang mtha' yas rab tu 'gro/ /
gang gis mi yi dbang po kun 'byung ba/ / de 'dra'i sems su yongs su bsngo ba byed/ / 'gro ba thams cad sems dang mnyam rtogs kyang / / 'gro ba kun tu sems ni dmigs pa med; /
de dag dngos po thams cad ma lus par/ / chos rnams dngos med ji bzhin 'jug par byed/ / ci nas 'jig rten lam du nyams med par/ / rnam dag mig can yongs su bsngo ba byed; ;
des ni srid rnams yongs su dag par bsngo/ / dngos su sred la rtog par mi byed de/ / dngos dang dngos med tshul ni shes byed cing / / 'od gsal dang bas sems kyang tshim par byed; ;
sangs rgyas zhing gcig gnas par mi byed de/ / zhing rnams ma lus kun tu 'ang gnas mi 'cha'/ / 'dus byas chos kyis snyems par mi byed de/ / de dag rang bzhin la yang mi gnas so; ;
ci nas rgyal ba kun gyi kun mkhyen dang / / ci nas bla med sangs rgyas rgyan thob cing / / ci nas rgyal ba thams cad mnyes 'gyur ba/ / de ltar de dag las ni yongs su bsngo/ /
ye shes dam pa'i rnam pa tshul shes pa/ / de dag rkang gnyis dam pa dran byed cing / / de 'dra'i chos rnams gnas med rab shes pas/ / de 'dra'i bsod nams gnas pa med par 'gyur/ /
de dag 'gro ba kun gyi skyabs yin te/ / las kyi mtha' rnams thams cad rnam par spong / / 'gro ba kun la phan dang bde sems kyis/ / 'jig rten yongs su spang ba gang yang med/ /
chos dang bar du mya ngan 'da' ba dag / gang phyir gzhan min 'grangs pa'i sa la srung / / gang gis rgyal 'gyur sangs rgyas gyur ba'i rnams/ / de ltar dge ba de dag yongs su bsngo/ /
'jig rten 'gro ba'i rgyud la rlom sems med/ / 'dus byas rnams la'ang de dag chags pa med/ / tshig gi lam la de dag gnas pa med/ / tshig med lam la'ang nam yang mi gnas so/ /
chos rnams thams cad ma lus bsdu mdzad do/ / mi yi dam pa sangs rgyas ji snyed pas/ / 'gro rgyud thams cad rnam par phye bas mkhyen/ / thugs kyis rnam par dbye dang rtog mi mnga'/ /
rgyan gcig las ni rgyan rnams kun 'byin kyang / / rnam par rtog pa'i chos su mi byed de/ / de dag thams cad dngos med spyod med par/ / 'jig rten rtog pa med par rab tu shes/ /

By this means they purify the mind, Equal to all the Buddhas— This power of skill in means is inexhaustible; Therefore felicitous results have no limit.
Initiating the will for unsurpassed enlightenment, Without depending on anything in the world, They go to all worlds in the ten directions And are not hindered by anything at all.
All Buddhas appear in the world Because they want to guide beings’ minds; They examine the true natures of their minds And discover they ultimately cannot be found.
All phenomena, without exception, Are included in thusness, with no essential nature; Dedicating with this pure eye They open the prison of birth and death in the world.
Though they purify all existences, Yet they do not have a notion of existences; They know the nature of existents has no existence And purify the joyful mind.
They depend on nothing in one buddha-land, Or in any buddha-lands, And they are not attached to conditioned things, Knowing their phenomenality has no basis.
Hereby they cultivate omniscience; Hereby highest knowledge adorns them; Hereby the Buddhas all rejoice; This is enlightening beings’ work of dedication.
Enlightening beings focus their minds on the Buddhas, Their supreme knowledge, wisdom, and means. Like Buddhas, they depend on nothing at all: May we accomplish these virtues.
Concentrating on saving all, They cause them to abandon evil deeds; Thus benefiting sentient beings, They contemplate attentively without abandoning them.
Abiding in the state of knowledge and guarding the teaching, They do not take nirvana by other vehicles— They only vow to attain the Buddhas’ unexcelled Way; This is the dedication of enlightening beings.
They do not grasp the fabricated unrealities Spoken of by sentient beings, But though they do not rely on speech Still they don’t cling to wordlessness.
All the enlightened ones in the ten directions Comprehend all things without exception; But though they know all things are empty, void, They don’t produce a notion of voidness.
With one adornment they adorn all Yet don’t discriminate phenomena— They enlighten all living beings: All is without inherent nature, without objectivity.
mi phyed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste/ yongs su bsngo ba gnyis pa'o/ /
bam po sum cu rtsa gsum pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba sangs rgyas thams cad la yang dag par bskyed pa zhes bya ba gsum pa gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba la yang rjes su slob bo/ / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba la yang rjes su slob bo/ / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba la yang rjes su slob bo/ / de byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la spyod pa'i tshe mi mthun pa ma yin zhing yid du 'ong ba'am/ mi mthun pa ma yin zhing yid du 'ong bar reg pa'am/ mi mthun pa ma yin zhing yid du 'ong ba'i chos sam/ mi mthun pa ma yin zhing kha na ma tho ba/ med pa rnam par dag pa/ dge ba/ yangs pa/ 'od gsal ba gang gis yid dga' ba skye zhing bde bar 'gyur ba/ dad pa skye ba/ dga' ba skye ba/ rab tu dga' bar gnas pa/ spro ba rab tu 'byung ba/ yid mi bde ba rnam par bzlog pa/ sems bde bar 'gyur ba/ / nyams dga' bar 'gyur ba/ bsam pa 'jam par 'gyur ba/ dbang po sim par 'gyur pa'i gzugs gang ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad mthong bar gyur te/

“What is great enlightening beings’ dedication equal to all Buddhas? Here the enlightening beings follow and cultivate the path of dedication of the Buddhas of the past, future, and present. When they practice and learn the path of dedication in this way, when they perceive any objects of sense, whether pleasant or unpleasant, they do not conceive like or dislike — their minds are free, without faults, broad, pure, joyful, blissful, free from all sorrows and troubles. Their minds are flexible, their senses are pure and cool.

de bde ba'i 'du shes de dag mthong ba'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ bdag gi bde ba yongs su bsngo ba 'dis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa'i bde ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang phyi phyir zhing yang ldan par gyur cig / sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba mtshungs pa med pas yang dag par gzung bar gyur cig / sangs rgyas kyi thugs rje chen po'i bde ba mtha' yas par phyir zhing yang shin tu brtan par gyur cig / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa'i bde ba tshad med pa yang dag par ldan par gyur cig / sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul tshad med pas shin tu bzung bar gyur cig / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba'i bde ba rnyed par dka' bas shin tu khyab par gyur cig / sangs rgyas kyi stobs kyi bde ba tshad med pas shin tu bde bar gyur cig / tshor ba thams cad zhi zhing skye ba med pa'i bde bas 'gyur ba med par bde bar gyur cig/ chags pa med par gnas pa rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bde ba gnyis su med cing yang dag par spyod pas 'khrug pa med pa'i bde bar gyur cig/ ces

“When great enlightening beings gain such peace and bliss, they become even more determined, dedicating their determination to the Buddhas, with these thoughts: ‘With the roots of goodness I am now planting I vow to cause the bliss of the Buddhas to increase more and more — that is, the bliss of the inconceivable abode of Buddhas, the bliss of the peerless concentration of Buddhas, the bliss of unlimited compassion, the bliss of liberation of all Buddhas, the bliss of vast, ultimate, immeasurable power, the bliss of tranquility detached from all cognition, the bliss of abiding in the state of nonobstruction, always rightly concentrated, the bliss of carrying out the practice of nondualism without change.’

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la yongs su bsngos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yongs su bsngo ba byed de/ 'di ltar bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su ma dag pa rnams yongs su dag par bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems rdo rje lta bu shin tu brtan par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i go cha phyir mi ldog pa rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba dang / byang chub tu gzhol ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su bsrung ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad dang mnyam pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par spyod pa thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po thams cad kyi mngon par shes pa shin tu rno bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du thug par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/

“Once the great enlightening beings have dedicated their roots of goodness to the Buddhas, they also dedicate these virtues to the enlightening beings: that is, to cause those who have not fulfilled their vows to fulfill them, to cause those whose minds are not yet pure to attain purity, to cause those who have not fulfilled the ways of transcendence to fulfill them, to settle them in the indestructible will for enlightenment, that they not regress on the way to omniscience, not give up great effort, preserve all the foundations of goodness of the gates of enlightenment, and be able to cause sentient beings to give up conceit, set their minds on enlightenment, fulfill their aspirations, abide in the abode of all enlightening beings, attain the clear, sharp senses of enlightening beings, cultivate roots of goodness, and realize omniscience.

de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don du yongs su bsngo'o/ / de yang dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du na se gol gtogs pa tsam du sangs rgyas zhi ba'i sgra thos sam/ chos nyan tam/ 'phags pa'i dge 'dun bsnyen bkur byed dam/ gang ci yang rung ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la bar chad med par yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yongs su rdzogs par yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos rjes su dran pa rab tu sbyor bar yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'phags pa'i dge 'dun rim gro bya bar yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral bar yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems rnam par dag par yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos khong du chud par yongs su bsngo'o/ / tshad med pa'i yon tan la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / mngon par shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi the tshom rnam par bsal ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnam par dag pa bstan pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la yongs su bsngo ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la'ang yongs su bsngo ste/

“Having thus dedicated their roots of goodness to enlightening beings, the great enlightening beings then dedicate them to all sentient beings, wishing that the roots of goodness of all sentient beings, even the slightest — even seeing a Buddha, hearing teaching, or respecting holy mendicants, for but the time of a fingersnap — all be free from obstruction, that they reflect on the completeness of Buddhas, on the techniques of the teaching, and on the nobility and importance of the community, that they not be separated from vision of the Buddha, that their minds become pure, that they attain the qualities of buddhahood, build up immeasurable virtue, purify spiritual powers, give up doubts about the truth and live according to the teaching. As they make such dedication to sentient beings, they also make such dedication for the Buddhist disciples and the individual illuminates.

'di ltar sems can dmyal ba'i lam rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byol song gi skye gnas rgyun gcad pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten rtsa ba nas gcad pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ngan song gi rgyud thams cad ma lus par rgyun gcad pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can de dag thams cad kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mos shing phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / lhag pa'i bsam pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa rab tu 'thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mi spang ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa shin tu bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad shin tu rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad ye shes mtha' yas pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yang rung ste/ byang chub tu dmigs pa dang bral ba'i sems dang / thams cad mkhyen par dmigs pa la brtson pa'i yid la byed pa dang / bdag gdul ba dang / pha rol gdul ba la gzhol ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / bdag dang gzhan yongs su smin par sbyor ba'i thabs mkhas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang bas yongs su smin par byed pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / sems bskyed pa gnas pa med pa dang 'grogs pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa dang / sngon snying rje chen po bskyed pas khyim na gnas pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan pas rang gi chung ma'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / sbyor ba nyams pa med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam shin tu rnam par dag pas rtsom pa dang / yang dag par rtsom pa dang / sgrub pa dang / yang dag par sgrub pa dang / skyed pa dang / yang dag par skyed pa dang / dmigs pa chen pos yang dag par sdud pa dang / grub par byed pa dang / rgya cher byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / khyim na gnas pa dang / bu dang 'grogs shing gnas pa na

“Also they pray that all sentient beings forever leave all miserable places like hells, ghosthood, and animality, the nether world, and so on, that they further develop the supreme will for enlightenment, concentrate their minds on the earnest search for knowledge of all means of liberation, never repudiate the true teaching of the Buddhas, attain the peace of the Buddhas, be pure in body and mind, and realize omniscience.
“The foundations of goodness of great enlightening beings are all correctly initiated, built up, and developed by great vows, causing them all to expand and to be completely fulfilled.
“When great enlightening beings live at home with spouses and children, they never for a moment give up the determination for enlightenment; with correct mindfulness they meditate on the realm of all knowledge, liberating themselves and others, enabling them to reach the ultimate. Using appropriate means they transform the members of their own households, causing them to enter the knowledge of enlightening beings and causing them to develop to maturity and attain liberation. Though they live together, their minds have no attachments. By their basic great great compassion they remain in home life, and because of their kindness they harmonize with their spouses and children, with no hindrance to the pure Way of enlightening beings.

'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ byang chub sems dpa' khyim na gnas pa'i tshe gang ci yang rung ste/ gos dang / zas dang / mal stan dang / nad kyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / spyod pa dang / ldang ba dang / rten pa dang / skye mched 'byung ba'i las dang / spyod lam la gnas pa dang / spyod lam brtul ba dang / lus dang ngag gi las spyod pa dang / dbang po drug bsdams pa dang / rang gi lus phyi ba dang / mnye ba dang / khrus byed pa dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa dang / brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / lta ba dang / kun tu lta ba dang / log pa dang / sad pa dang / rang gi lus brtan par bya ba de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen par dmigs pa la brtson pa/ sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar sems pa; byang chub tu smon lam tshad med pa btab pa/ sems tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po yongs su sdud pa/ 'gro ba thams cad skyob par brtson pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba la rtag tu brtson pa/ rlom pa dang / bag med pa rnam par bzlog pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos nyid la rab tu brten pa/ rnam par shes pa dang / sems bskyed pa dang / yid la byed pa gzhan med pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub la mngon par gnas pa/ nyon mongs pa'i phyogs thams cad las phyir phyogs pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bslab pa la slob pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam nyams pa med pa/ ye shes kyis la brten pa/ bstan pa'i gnas dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i rtsa bas shes rab che ba/ bung ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs chen po gsog pa/ 'gro ba thams cad las rgyud shin tu 'phags pa/ 'du byed la mngon par zhen pa med pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdams ngag mthun par 'dzin pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ma bsngos pa gang yang med de/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khyim na gnas pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par sdud cing sgrub bo/ / yongs su bsngo ste/

“Though great enlightening beings be in home life and work at various occupations, they never for a moment give up the will for omniscience; that is, whether they are dressing, eating, taking medicine, washing, looking around, walking, standing still, sitting, reclining, speaking, thinking, asleep or awake, whatever they are doing their minds always dedicate it to the path of omniscience. They concentrate and contemplate unremittingly, because they want to aid all sentient beings and settle them in enlightenment; with immeasurable great vows they embody countless great roots of goodness, diligently cultivating virtues to save everyone. They forever divorce arrogance and indulgence and proceed surely toward the state of omniscience, never conceiving any intention of turning to another path. Always contemplating the enlightenment of all Buddhas, they forever abandon all impure ways. Cultivating practice of what all enlightening beings learn, they encounter no obstruction on the path of omniscience and stand on the ground of knowledge. They are devoted to recitation and learning, and collect roots of goodness by means of immeasurable knowledge. Their minds have no affection for any mundane realm, nor are they obsessed with what they practice. They wholeheartedly accept and hold the principles of the Buddhas’ teachings. Thus enlightening beings living at home cultivate and internalize roots of goodness in every way, cause them to grow, and dedicate them to the unsurpassed enlightenment, which is the essence of the Buddhas.

de ltar de chung du na khyi'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byol song gi ris su gtogs pa la zas sna 'ga' ma/ kham 'ga' yongs su gtong ba byed kyang de thams cad de dag nyid la phan pa dang / de dag nyid la bde ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas de dag sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho de dag dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu de dag dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po de dag dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de dag dang / sdug bsngal bsags pa de dag dang / sdug bsngal mngon par 'du byed pa de dag dang / sdug bsngal gyi gter de dag dang / sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba de dag dang / sdug bsngal gyi skye mched de dag nas sems can de dag yongs su sgrol zhing rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de la dmigs pas sems can thams cad mngon du byed do/ / dmigs par byed do/ / yid la byed do/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dang de dag la'ang sngon du 'gro bar byed de/ 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“At such a time, enlightening beings, even when they are feeding domestic animals, all make this vow: ‘I should cause these creatures to leave the realm of animality, to be helped and comforted and ultimately be liberated, having forever crossed over the ocean of suffering, eternally annihilating painful sensations, forever removing suffering physical and mental elements, eternally cutting off painful feeling, accumulation of pain, painful actions, the causes of pain, the root of suffering, and painful situations. May these sentient beings all be able to leave these behind.’ Thus do enlightening beings focus their thoughts on all sentient beings; with their roots of goodness in the forefront, they dedicate them to knowledge of ways of liberation for all beings.

byang chub tu sems bskyed pas yongs su 'dzin to/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la nye bar 'jog go /'khor ba'i dgon pa las rnam par bzlog go /sangs rgyas kyi bde ba bsgribs pa med pa yang mngon du byed de/ 'khor ba'i rgyud las 'byin par byed do/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos la brtson pa'i byams pas kyang yongs su rgyas par byed do/ / snying rje chen pos kyang de dag la snying brtse bar byed de/ bde ba rnam par dag pa'ang de dag la yongs su bsngo'o// dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir yang rab tu 'jug ste/ de dag sangs rgyas kyi chos la nye bar sdud do/ / de dag bdud kyi yul las rnam par bzlog go/ de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la 'jug par byed do/ / de dag 'jig rten gyi rgyud thams cad las gyen du skyod par byed do/ / de dag de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs la yang dag par sgrub par byed do/ / de dag dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la rab tu gzhog ste/

“When enlightening beings first engender the determination for enlightenment, they include all sentient beings, cultivating the foundations of goodness and dedicating them to causing all sentient beings to leave the plain of birth and death forever, to attain the unhindered bliss of the enlightened, emerge from the ocean of afflictions, practice the path of the Buddha teachings, to fill everywhere with kindness, to have vast powers of compassion, cause all to attain pure bliss, preserve foundations of goodness, draw near to the qualities of Buddhahood, leave the realms of demons and enter the realm of Buddhas, to cut off the seeds of mundanity and plant the seeds of enlightenment, to abide in the truth which is equal in all times.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yang rung ste yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ 'di snyam du sems bskyed de/ ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la spyod cing sangs rgyas la rim gro mdzad pa'i dmigs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi dmigs pa la brtson par mdzed pa'i tshe gzugs la gnas pa med pa dang / tshor ba la mngon par ma chags pa dang / 'du shes kyi rnam pa phyin ci log med pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par chags pa med pa dang / skye mched drug las gyen du 'phags pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos dang mi 'grogs pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das par yongs su bsngo ba dang / nam mkha' lta bu'i chos 'byams klas pa rab tu mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad gnas med par rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pas 'byung ba dang / chos thams cad ma 'gags par gzigs pa dang / mi bden pa'i chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa las gyen du 'phags pa dang / chos thams cad mi brdzun zhing bden par gzigs pa dang / chos thams cad 'pho ba med pa la shin tu mos pa dang / chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i mtha' ma nyams pa la gnas pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid las shin tu 'phags pa dang / chos de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa dang / sgo kun nas dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par sgrub pa la brtson pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis gzigs pa thams cad la shin tu gzhol bas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngos pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang chos nyid de dag kho na la mos par byas te/ chos de lta bu la brtson pa'i sems bskyed pa/ chos thams cad dang mi 'gal ba/ sgyu ma lta bu'i chos las byung ba dang / mig yor dang / chu zla lta bu'i rjes su song ba dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor la gdong gi dkyil 'khor yod pa lta bu'i rgyu dang ldan pa'i mthu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i mthar phyin par las kyi rgyud yongs su bsngo'o/ / zhes sems bskyed de/

“Enlightening beings dedicate all the roots of goodness they have collected, will collect, and are collecting in this way, and form this thought: ‘As the Buddhas and enlightening beings of the past have practiced—respectfully serving all enlightened ones, liberating sentient beings so that they be forever emancipated, diligently cultivating and practicing all roots of goodness and dedicating them all without attachment, without depending on form, without attachment to sensation, without erroneous conceptions, without creating fixed patterns, without grasping consciousness, detached from the senses, not dwelling on things of the world, delighting in transcendence, knowing that all things are empty as space, come from nowhere, are unborn and not perishing, and have no true reality; having no attachments, they avoided all discriminatory views, were imperturbable and unaffected by anything, never lost awareness or calm, abiding in reality without form, detached from all appearances, all being one; thus they entered deeply into the nature of all things, always happily practiced all-sided virtues, and saw the congregation of all Buddhas—just as all those enlightened ones of the past dedicated roots of goodness in this way, I, too, should practice dedication in this way, understand these principles, actualize these principles, and, based on these principles determine to learn and act, not violating the specifics of the teachings, knowing that what is practiced is like illusions, like shadows, like the moon’s image in the water, like reflections in a mirror, manifested by the combination of causes and conditions, proceeding thus up to the ultimate stage of enlightenment.’

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rjes su slob cing / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'das pa rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du ma byon pa dang / de bzhin du da ltar byung ba dang / de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba'i rjes su bslab ste dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ /
yang 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di ltar yongs su bsngo'o/ / zhes bya bar thugs su chud pa de lta bu'i bsngo ba rab/ dam pa/ mchog / bla na med pa/ mnyam pa med pa/ mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa/ 'dra ba med pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ gtso bor gyur pa/ thu bor gyur pa/ kun tu snyoms pa/ mi mnyam pa med pa/ bdag nyid che ba/ shin tu yangs pa/ dge ba/ rnam par dag pa/ kha na ma tho ba med pa brjod du med pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / snyam du sems bskyed de/

“Great enlightening beings also form this thought: ‘Just as the Buddhas of the past, when cultivating enlightening practice, dedicated roots of goodness in this way, and so do and will the Buddhas of the present and future, so too should I arouse my will and dedicate roots of goodness like those Buddhas — with foremost dedication, excellent dedication, supreme dedication, superior dedication, unexcelled dedication, peerless dedication, unequalled dedication, incomparable dedication, honorable dedication, sublime dedication, impartial dedication, straightforward dedication, virtuous dedication, far-reaching dedication, good dedication, pure dedication, dedication free from evil, dedication not going wrong.’

byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de ltar yongs su bsngo ba ni lus kyi las rnam par dag pas lus rnam par dag pa yin/ ngag gi las rnam par dag pas ngag rnam par dag pa yin/ yid kyi las rnam par dag pas yid rnam par dag pa yin/ kha na ma tho ba med pa la gnas pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa yin; kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las dang ldan pas dge ba'i rtsa ba la brtson pa yin/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu brtson pas sems nyams pa med pa yin/ chos thams cad byed pa med par zhugs pas shin tu che ba la gnas pa yin/ 'jig rten gyi chos kyis ma gos pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang 'byor pa yin/ ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'i las dang ldan pas las 'byams klas pa mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad rab tu shes pa yin/ gnas pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pas yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba gsum pa sangs rgyas thams cad la yang dag par bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste/

“Once enlightening beings have dedicated roots of goodness in this way, they accomplish pure action of body, speech, and mind, and abide in the abode of enlightening beings without any faults. Practicing good works, they get rid of evils of action and speech. Their minds are without flaw or defilement; they cultivate omniscience, abide in an immeasurably broad mind, and know all phenomena create nothing. They abide in transmundane states and are not influenced by things of the world. They analyze and comprehend innumerable actions and fully develop skill in means of dedication, extirpating the root of grasping and attachment forever. This is the great enlightening beings’ third dedication, dedication equal to all Buddhas.

bsngo ba de la gnas pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las kyi zil dang ldan pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa la zhugs pa yin/ ye shes kyi yul la zhugs pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i las dang ma bral ba yin/ thabs mkhas pa rnam par dpyod pa la mkhas pa yin/ chos kyi dbyings la rab tu zhugs pa yin/ byang chub sems dpas yongs su smin par bya ba'i mtshams sbyor ba la mkhas pa dang ldan pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs dang rgyud du chud pa yin/ chos thams cad kyi rgyud mtha' dang dbus med pa la mkhas pas rab tu dbye ba khong du chud pa yin/ 'jig rten du skye bar snang yang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi brjod pa yin no/ /

“When great enlightening beings abide in this dedication, they enter deeply into the acts of all the enlightened ones, proceed toward the supremely wonderful qualities of the enlightened, enter into the profound realm of pure knowledge, do not depart from the works of enlightening beings, are able to distinguish skillful, subtle means of liberation, enter the profound realm of truth, know well the process of practice of enlightening beings, enter the family of the Buddhas, and with skill in means analyze and comprehend all things. Though they appear physically, born in the world, yet their minds have no attachment to things of the world.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being Diamond Banner, spiritually empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

de dag bsngo ba bslab la bslab pa ste; ; skyes bu'i gtso bo ji snyed 'das pa dang / / gang dag ma byon gang dag bzhugs pa rnams/ / de dag spyod pa'i rjes su dpa' ba slob/ /
bde ba ji snyed gang dag rgyu ba dang / / skyes bu'i gtso bos gang dang rab bsngags pa/ / mig tu 'ong zhing dag pa rgya chen rnams/ / 'jig rten mkhyen pa rnam pa yongs su bsngo/ /
lus kyi bde ba gang dag gshegs pa dang / / mig bde de bzhin rna ba'i bde ba dang / / sna dang lce yi bde ba mtha' yas pa/ / de dag rgyal ba kun la yongs su bsngo/ /
'gro ba kun na dge ba gang yod pa/ / skyes bu 'dul bas thugs su chud pa rnams; ; de dag thams cad ma lus bsdu byas te/ / 'jig rten phan phyir de la rjes su dga'/ /
'jig rten mkhyen pa'i de la dgar byas nas/ / skyes bu seng+ge'i bde ba gang mnga' ba; ; de 'dra'i bde dang 'gro ba ldan 'gyur zhes/ / 'gro ba kun la de dag bsngo ba byed/ /
'jig rten dag na bder 'gyur gang yod pa/ / skyes bu'i dam pas thugs su chud pa rnams/ / bde ba de dang 'gro kun ldan 'gyur te/ / 'jig rten snon ma bzhin du kun gyur cig /
bde ba de dag yongs su bsngo byed kyang / / mtshungs med rtag tu 'gro phan byed pa dag / sems can phan par rtag tu zhugs pa rnams/ / yongs su bsngo bas rlom sems nam yang med/ /
de ltar de dag yongs su bsngo ba na/ / tshe rabs skyes bu seng+ge ci 'dra ba/ / de 'dra'i dam par bsod nams 'di gyur ces/ / snying rje chen pos sems kyang yongs su bskyed/ /
'jig rten 'di na byang chub spyad spyod cing / / 'gro ba dag tu ji ltar las bsgrubs pas/ / rgyal bas ji ltar mkhyen pa mtshungs med pa'i/ / bde ba kun dang 'bral bar ma gyur cig /
gang yang 'gro ba kun na yod pa yi/ / skye mched bsngams [*bsdams] pa yang dag skyes pa rnams/ / ye shes ngang gis bslab bya bslab pa dag / skye rgu kun la phan phyir yongs su bsngo/ /
lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi rnams/ / gang yang rung ba'i lam na yod pa dag / ye shes ngang gis bslab bya bslab pa rnams/ / gti mug med pas yongs su bsngo ba byed/ /
ji snyed de dag rab tu spyod pa rnams/ / rgyal sras rnams kyis yang dag bsdu bya ba/ / de ni mtshungs med rgyal ba'i rjes su 'byung / / de dag zhi ba'i yid phyir yongs su bsngo/ /
'jig rten thams cad ma lus bsdu byas te/ / 'gro yangs 'di na ji snyed dge yod pa/ / bde ba de dang yongs su ldan pa'i phyir/ / de la de dag yongs su bsngo ba byed/ /
bdag la bde ba nam yang mi tshol te/ / bde ba kun la'ang rtag par rab tu zhugs/ / spros pa rnams la nam yang mos pa med/ / bdag med chos la'ang rtag par 'jug pa yin/ /
rgyal ba kun gyis ji snyed gzigs pa yi/ / rgyal sras ji snyed yod pa de dag phyir/ / myur du ma lus sangs rgyas gyur cig ces/ / bsod nams de dag yongs su bsngo ba byed/ /
bdag gis legs bsags las ni gang yod pa/ / de yis 'jig rten ma lus thams cad kyi/ / lam rgyud 'gro bar gtogs pa'i sems can rnams/ / de dag ma lus mi yi gtsor gyur cig /
smon lam mang po ji snyed gang yod pa/ / mtshungs pa med pa'i rgyal bas bstan pa rnams/ / rgyal sras bsam pa yongs su grub gyur te/ / smon lam de dag rnam par dag gyur cig /
'jig rten ji snyed las kyis rnam bris pa/ / phyogs na yod pa thams cad mthong nas kyang / / de dag yongs btsal bslab bya bslab pa rnams/ / ma lus bsod nams thams cad yongs su bsngo/ /
gnyis kyi chos kyis 'jal bar mi byed de/ / gnyis med chos ni de dag mngon par shes/ / gnyis su yod dang gnyis su med pa la/ / rgyal sras de dag bsam pa mi ston to/ /
'gro ba'i 'du shes rgyu ba ji snyed pa'i/ / ma lus 'jig rten 'du shes 'dul byed kyang / / 'gro ba'i 'du shes rgyu ba rab rtogs pas/ / 'du shes yod min 'du shes med mi 'gyur/ /
de dag lus kyis yongs su dag gyur cing / / de dag yid kyang yongs su dag pa yin/ / de dag ngag gis shin tu bsdams byas shing / / de dag yid kyis yongs su dag pa yin/ /
de dag bde gshegs mya ngan 'das pa dran/ / ma byon sangs rgyas de dag rjes su sems/ / phyogs bcu dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang / / de dag rjes slob chos rnams ston pa byed/ /
dus gsum rgyal ba ye shes mkhas pa rnams/ / chags pa med pa'i thugs kyis ji lta bur/ / byang chub don phyir 'phrin las sgrub mdzad pa/ / de dag 'jig rten phan phyir yongs su bsngo/ /
mchog gi blo dang tshul khrims ldan pa'i blo/ / bden pa'i blo dang gzhan du mi 'gyur blo/ / yang dag blo dang rnam par dag pa'i blo/ / de 'dra'i blo yi dam pas yongs su bsngo/ /

Those great enlightening beings Practice the ways of dedication of past Buddhas, And also cultivate the practices Of all the Guides of future and present.
They attain peace and ease in all realms, Praised by all the enlightened ones; Their expansive light and pure eyes They dedicate all to the great Brilliant Sages.
Blissful are the bodies of enlightening beings, And so are all their senses; Such immeasurable, supremely wonderful bliss They all dedicate to the Supreme.
All the good ways in the world And those the Buddhas have accomplished, All they foster, excepting none, Whereby they joyfully benefit the living.
Their joys in the world are infinite: These they dedicate to sentient beings, Vowing to cause them all to be filled With the bliss of the Human Lion.
The various raptures known and perceived By the Buddhas of all lands They vow to foster in sentient beings And become great lamps lighting the world.
The supremely refined pleasure of enlightening beings They dedicate to all sentient beings: Though they are dedicated to the benefit of the living, Yet they have no attachment to dedication.
Enlightening beings, practicing this dedication, Produce a mind of infinite compassion; The virtues of dedication practiced by the Buddhas They vow to cultivate and fulfill the same way.
The subtle bliss of the vehicle of omniscience Such as attained by the Supreme, As well as the infinite bliss of enlightening practice Carried out while they’re in the world,
The bliss of peace while appearing to be in the world, The bliss of tranquility, always guarding the senses, All they dedicate to sentient beings To cause all to develop unexcelled knowledge.
Their work is not physical, verbal, or mental, Yet doesn’t exist apart from this; They just destroy ignorance by expedient means And thus develop supreme knowledge.
The deeds practiced by enlightening beings Build up immeasurable excellent virtues; Following the Enlightened, born in the family of Buddhas, Dispassionate and calm, they dedicate aright.
They take care of all beings there are In all worlds of the ten directions, Dedicating all roots of goodness to them, Vowing to fill them with the bliss of peace.
They do not seek benefit for themselves; They want to cause all to be at ease. They have never entertained arbitrary conceptions: They only observe all things to be empty and selfless.
To all the true children of Buddhas Seen by the innumerable Supreme Ones in the ten directions They dedicate all roots of goodness, Vowing to hasten their ultimate enlightenment.
The conscious creatures in all worlds They embrace impartially, without exception; With the good works they do themselves They cause those beings to soon become Buddhas.
The countless, boundless great vows Expounded by the unexcelled Guides Vow that all Buddha-children become pure And fulfill all their aspirations.
Observing all worlds in the ten directions, Donating all their virtues to them, They vow to cause them all to be wonderfully adorned: Thus do enlightening beings practice dedication.
Their minds do not weigh dualistic things; They only constantly realize the nonduality of things. In all things, whether dual or nondual, They ultimately have no attachments.
All the worlds in the ten directions Are sentient beings’ conceptualizations; Not apprehending anything in conception or nonconception, Thus are conceptions understood.
The enlightening beings’ bodies are purified, So their minds are pure, without blemish: Their speech being already pure and faultless, Know that their minds are pure, without attachment.
Single-mindedly they think of the past Buddhas And also of the Guides of the future, As well as the Honored Ones of the present: They study the teachings they all expound.
All enlightened ones of past, present, and future Have clear penetrating knowledge, their minds unobstructed; Because they want to help sentient beings They dedicate myriad works to enlightenment.
Those of foremost wisdom, vast wisdom, Wisdom free from falsehood, without delusion, Impartial, true wisdom, pure wisdom, And supreme wisdom, explain this way.
sangs rgyas thams cad la yang dag par bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste/ yongs su bsngo ba gsum pa'o/ /

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis yongs su bsngo ba bzhi pa thams cad rjes su song ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba la brtson par byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' thams cad du rjes su song zhing dngos po thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / zhing thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / nam mkha' thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / dus gsum thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / spyod pa'i sgra thams cad kyi rjes su song ba de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yang dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad du rgyas par khyab par gyur cig / 'das pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas thams cad mchod cing bsnyen bkur ba'i rgyur gyur cig/ ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur cig / da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa/ lha rdzas dang lha rdzas ma yin pa'i rim gro 'byams klas pa dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad mngon du gyur ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rgyan rnam par dgod pa'i rgyur gyur cig / blo bdag nyid che ba la mos shing shin tu yangs pa'i don du sgrib pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rgya cher yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad sems bskyed pas rgyas par gyur cig /

“What is the great enlightening beings’ dedication reaching all places? Here when the enlightening beings cultivate all roots of goodness, they think, ‘May the power of virtue of these roots of good reach all places, just as reality extends everywhere without exception, reaching all things, all worlds, all living beings, all lands, all phenomena, all space, all time, all that is compounded and uncompounded, all speech and sound; may these roots of goodness in the same way reach the abodes of all enlightened ones, and be as offerings to all those Buddhas, the past Buddhas whose vows are all fulfilled, the future Buddhas, fully adorned, and the present Buddhas, their lands, sites of enlightenment, and congregations, filling all realms throughout the entirety of space. I aspire, by virtue of the power of faith, by virtue of great knowledge without obstruction, by virtue of dedication of all roots of goodness, to present offerings like those of the celestials, filling infinite worlds.’

sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / nam mkha'i dbyings 'byams klas pa la rab tu gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud dang / las gzhan dang gzhan gyis shin tu bsgrubs pa'i phyogs 'byams klas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med par rnam par rgyu ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi khongs mtha' yas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi dmigs pa la gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams du ma dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs 'byams klas pa dang / sa mtshams med pa'i 'jig rten gyi 'khor dang / snrel zhir rgyu ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par grub pa dang / spyi'u tshugs su rgyu ba'i phyogs kyi 'khor gyi rgyud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa dang / sems can gyi 'khor mtha' dang dbus med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa shin tu bstan pa thams cad ma lus pa de dag na bzhugs shing 'tsho ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul yang dag par ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings su rtsa ba ma rnyed pa 'gro ba thams cad yongs su gzung bar sgrub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par ston pa; sangs rgyas kyi gzigs pa ye shes 'byams klas pa'i mngon par shes pas thugs su chud pa/ rab tu brjod pa rnam par 'phrul pa mtha' dang dbus med pas rab tu byung ba; chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su song ba tha mi dad pa'i chos kyi dbyings gzhi mnyam pa la rab tu zhugs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i lus su gcig pa/ chos thams cad kyi rab tu zhugs pa med pa/ 'gro ba thams cad la yang dag par ston pas na/ phyir ldog pa med par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa thugs su chud pas thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa/ chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis shin tu 'phags pa/ sgrib pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis phyir mi ldog pa/ sangs rgyas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par byung ba'i phyir chags pa med par gzigs pa'i bdag nyid che ba can bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la me tog gam/ spos sam/ phreng ba'am/ byug pa'am/ gdugs sam/ rgyal mtshan nam/ ba dan nam/ rin po che'am/ me mar gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'am/ mchod rten yang rung ste/ dmigs pa tshad med pas sbyar ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dang gang skyes kyang rung ste/

“Great enlightening beings also form this thought: ‘The Buddhas pervade all realms in space, the worlds of all the unspeakably many world systems in the ten directions produced by various actions — unspeakably many buddha-lands, buddha-spheres, all kinds of worlds, infinite worlds, worlds without boundaries, rotating worlds, sideways worlds, worlds facing upward and downward — in all worlds, such as these, they manifest a span of life and display various spiritual powers and demonstrations. There are enlightening beings there who by the power of resolution appear as Buddhas in all worlds for the sake of sentient beings who can be taught; with the knowledge of where all paths lead, they reveal everywhere the boundless freedom and spiritual power of the enlightened, the body of reality extending everywhere without distinction, equally entering all realms of phenomena and principles, the body of inherent buddhahood neither born nor perishing, yet by skillful expedients appearing throughout the world, because of realizing the true nature of things, transcending all, because of attainment of nonregressing power, because of birth among the people of vast power of unobstructed vision of the enlightened.’
“Great enlightening beings, by all the roots of goodness that they plant, vow to make offerings to all such Buddhas, with myriad beautiful flowers, myriad wonderful incenses, garlands, parasols, banners, pennants, clothing, lamps, and all other articles of adornment, and to do the same to effigies, tombs, and shrines of Buddhas. Their roots of goodness they dedicate in this way,

'khrug pa med pa'i sems dang / rtse gcig tu gyur pa'i sems dang / g.yo ba med pa'i sems dang / rmongs pa med pa'i sems dang / mi sgul ba'i sems dang / gnas med pa'i sems dang / mi gnas pa'i sems dang / srog med pa'i sems dang / mi g.yeng ba'i sems dang / zhi ba'i sems su byas te/ 'di ltar yongs su bsngo zhing

with unconfused dedication, single-minded dedication, autonomous dedication, respectful dedication, unshakable dedication, nonobsessive dedication, independent dedication, dedication without the mentality of worldly people, dedication without haste or struggle, dedication with a tranquil mind.

'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di chos kyi dbyings shin tu bstan pas 'dus pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub kyis 'dus pa'i ming mang po dang / tshig dang nges pa'i ngag mtha' yas pa dang / dus tha dad par mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa phyi ma'i mthar thug pa'i bskal par byin gyis brlabs pa'i sku tshe'i tshang dang / mtha' dang dbus med par shin tu bstan pa'i sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis rgyas pa dang / chos kyi dbyings de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'byung gnas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su gang ba'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du dus ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi spos kyi gdugs tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi rgyal mtshan tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi ba dan tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi gzhal med khang tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi dra ba tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi sku gzugs tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi 'od tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi 'od zer tshad med pa yongs su 'bar bar gyur cig / spos kyi sprin tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi gdan tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi 'chags tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi gtsug lag khang tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi zhing tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi ri rab tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi rgya mtsho tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi chu klung tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi shing tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi na bza' tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi pad+mo tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / spos kyi pho brang tshad med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig /

“They also think, ‘Throughout the space of the cosmos, in all ages, past, future, and present, the Buddhas, the World Honored Ones, attain omniscience and become enlightened; with innumerable different names, at various times, they manifest attainment of true awakening, all abiding for a span of life, throughout the future, each adorning themselves with the adornments of the realm of reality, their sites of enlightenment and congregations pervading the cosmos; in all lands they appear according to the time and perform the work of buddhahood. To all these Buddhas I dedicate roots of goodness; I vow to offer respectfully countless canopies of fragrance, banners of fragrance, pennants of fragrance, drapes of fragrance, nets of fragrance, statues of fragrance, lights of fragrance, flames of fragrance, clouds of fragrance, thrones of fragrance, parks of fragrance, shelters of fragrance, worlds of fragrance, mountains of fragrance, seas of fragrance, rivers of fragrance, trees of fragrance, robes of fragrance, lotus blossoms of fragrance, palaces of fragrance, flowers of fragrance;

me tog gi gdugs dpag tu med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / ces bya ba nas tshul de bzhin du me tog gi pho brang gi bar du grangs med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / phreng ba'i gdugs grangs med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / ces bya ba nas phreng ba'i pho brang gi bar du grangs med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / byug pa'i gdugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / ces bya ba nas byug pa'i pho brang gi bar du bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / phye ma'i gdugs mtshungs pa med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / ces bya ba nas phye ma'i pho brang gi bar du mtshungs pa med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / na bza'i gdugs kun tu mtha' yas pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / ces bya ba nas na bza'i pho brang gi bar du kun tu mtha' yas pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / rin po che'i gdugs kun tu mu med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / ces bya ba nas rin po che'i pho brang gi bar du kun tu mu med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / mar me snang ba'i gdugs gzhal du med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / ces bya ba nas mar me snang ba'i pho brang gi bar du gzhal du med pa yongs su 'byung bar gyur cig / lhab lhub kyi gdugs brjod du med pa yongs
