infinite canopies of flowers, and so on, up to infinite palaces of flowers; boundless canopies of garlands, and so on, up to boundless palaces of garlands; incomparably many canopies of powdered incense, and so on, up to incomparably many palaces of powdered incense; uncountable canopies of perfume, and so on, up to uncountable palaces of perfume; incalculable canopies of raiment, and so on, up to incalculable palaces of raiment; inconceivable numbers of canopies of jewels, and so on, up to inconceivable numbers of palaces of jewels; immeasurable numbers of canopies of lamps, and so on, up to immeasurable numbers of palaces of lamps; unspeakable numbers of canopies of ornaments, and so on, up to unspeakable numbers of palaces of ornaments; unspeakably unspeakable numbers of canopies, banners, pennants, drapes, nets, statues, lights, flames, clouds, seats, parks, shelters, lands, mountains, seas, rivers, trees, robes, lotus blossoms, and palaces, all made of jewel crystals, all unspeakably unspeakable in number: in each of these objects are countless balustrades, palaces, bowers, doors, crescents, defensive barriers, windows, pure jewels, and ornaments—all such offerings I present to those Buddhas, aspiring to cause all worlds to become purified and all sentient beings to attain emancipation, abide in the stage of the ten powers and attain unhindered understanding of truth; to cause all sentient beings to be fully endowed with bases of goodness, to gain complete self-mastery, to have minds as infinite as space, going to all fields without going anywhere, entering all lands, passing on good ways, always able to see Buddhas, planting roots of goodness, accomplishing the great vehicle, not clinging to anything, replete with virtue,

'gro ba thams cad kyis theg pa chen po shin tu grub pa dang / chos thams cad ma lus pa la mngon par chags pa med par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus pa la gnas pas kun na gnas par gyur cig /
spyod pa mtha' yas pa byin gyis brlab pa dang / chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la yongs su spyod par gyur cig / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su 'gyur bar shog cig / sems can thams cad kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag ma lus par rkyen du gyur par shog cig / ci nas kyang bdag med pa'i chos kyi dbyings las chos thams cad 'da' bar mi 'gyur bar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag gis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur yongs su spyod pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / chags pa med pa la 'jug pa'i phyir chos thams cad yang dag par zin par gyur cig / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi grogs gcig tu mthun pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / bsgribs pa med pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i chos snang ba thams cad yang dag par zin par gyur cig / mtha' dang dbus med pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul bas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / sems tshad med pas yongs su rgyas par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi stobs dang mi bsnyengs pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / mi gnyis pa'i snang ba grub pas byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / spobs pa dang / gzungs kyi sgor 'jug pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul chen po shin tu bstan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / skye ba dang / rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / nye bar gshegs pa bstan pa dang / mchod pa dang / rim gro dang / sems can gdul ba la 'jug pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dus gsum du byon pa/ mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad ma lus pa'i skye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pas zin par gyur cig / bskal pa 'byams klas pa mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad ma lus par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'brel ba rgyun mi 'chad pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / 'jig rten du skye ba'i yul thams cad ma lus par thams cad du skye ba shin tu bstan pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / sems can gyi khams thams cad ma lus par byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa yongs su smin par bya bas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / bag chags thams cad ma lus par rnyog pa med pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par zin par gyur cig / sems can gyi dbang po 'byams klas pa thams cad ma lus par mtha' dang dbus med pa la 'jug pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / 'gro ba thams cad kyi mos pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa thams cad ma lus bar nyon mongs pa med cing / yongs su dag pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba thams cad ma lus par dus la ji ltar 'bab pa bzhin du kun tu bstan pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ma lus par 'gro ba thams cad sprul pa lta bur khong du chud pas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs thams cad ma lus par sangs rgyas byung pa; thams cad kyi bstan pa gzung zhing bsrung bas yang dag par zin par gyur cig /

establishing innumerable practices, entering into all the boundless realms of reality, developing the spiritual faculties of the Buddhas, and attaining the omniscient knowledge of the enlightened ones. Just as selflessness includes all things, so also may my roots of goodness include all the Buddhas by making offerings to them all; include all truths by understanding them without hindrance; include all enlightening beings by ultimately having the same roots of goodness;
include all practices of enlightening beings by fulfillment through the power of my original vows; include all enlightening beings’ understandings of things by comprehending all things without obstruction; include all the great spiritual powers of the Buddhas by perfecting innumerable roots of goodness; include all the powers and fearlessnesses of the Buddhas by developing immeasurable will and fulfilling them all; include all the enlightening beings’ methods of meditation, powers of elucidation, and concentration formulae by being able to illumine and comprehend nonduality; include the Buddhas’ skill in means by manifesting the great spiritual powers of the enlightened; include all the past, present, and future Buddhas’ birth in the world, attainment of enlightenment, turning the wheel of true teaching, taming sentient beings, and entering final decease, by respectfully presenting offerings to all of them everywhere; include all worlds of the ten directions by adorning and purifying buddha-lands to the ultimate degree; include all ages by appearing therein and cultivating enlightening practice unceasingly; include all realms of being by appearing to be born therein; include all realms of sentient beings by fulfilling the practice of the Universally Good enlightening being; include all delusive habit energy by using appropriate means to clean it all away; include the innumerable differences in faculties of sentient beings by knowing them all; include the understandings and inclinations of all sentient beings by causing them to get rid of confusion and defilement and attain purity; include all activities that edify sentient beings by appearing in forms appropriate to their needs; include all ways of adaptively responding to sentient beings by entering into all realms of sentient beings; and include the essence of knowledge of all enlightened ones by preserving the teachings of the Buddhas.’

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dmigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ste/ las kyis ni/ rnam par smin pa la yongs su rtog par mi byed/ rnam par smin pas ni/ las la yongs su rtog par mi byed de/ chos kyi dbyings rtog pa med pa la yang dag par 'jug go /dge ba'i rtsa ba byed pa med pas gnas pa yin no/ / chos nyid g.yeng nga med pa la'ang rab tu brtson pa yin no/ / de ni/ chos thams cad la yang dad pas yang dag par 'jug ste/ chos gang rang bzhin gyis yongs su grub par byed pa'am/ rnam par byed pa de dag gang yang mi mthong ngo/ / chos nyid dbang po med pa'i mthar thug pa la yang yang dag par 'jug ste/ chos kyi dbyings lta ba po med par yang rab tu shes shing / chos thams cad shes pa po med par yang rab tu rtogs so/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor tshad med par rab tu shes pa chos thams cad kyi rkyen gyi gnas khong du chud pas chos thams cad lus med par rab tu mthong ba/ chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar phyin par rjes su lta ba/ 'jig rten 'gyur ba thams cad sprul pa lta bur rjes su rtogs pa/ chos gcig la sems can thams cad du rjes su mthong ba/ chos kyi dbyings mi gnyis par rab tu rig pa las kyi dmigs pa dang / nye bar len pa la mkhas pas ma btang ba/ 'dus byas kyi khams 'dus ma byas su mngon par bsgrubs pas zhig par mi byed pa/ 'dus ma byas kyi khams 'dus byas su sgro gdags pa thams cad kyis rnam par mi rtog pa/ chos thams cad rab tu zhi ba la gzhol ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par bsgrub pa thams cad mngon par bsgrubs pa/ sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ chos rgya mtsho thams cad mngon par shes pa rmongs pa med par chos nyid la brtson pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba nam mkha' lta bu thams cad yongs su bsngo ba/ bsod nams kyis rgyas par 'gro bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du zhugs pa/ 'jig rten gyi chos kun nas mi rgyu ba mig la rab rib med pa/ ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu thob pa/ thabs mkhas pas yongs su bsngo ba'i ngang tshul can de ci nas kyang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyis brlab pa dang / ci nas kyang zhing thams cad yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nye bar blang bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du bsod nams kyi zhing dam par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyi ded dpon du thog mar 'gro ba dang / ci nas kyang snang ba'i dkyil 'khor skye rgu thams cad la 'char bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang 'gro ba thams cad kyi rten du 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang yon tan thams cad kyi sems can gyi khams thams cad rnam par sbyor bar 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ste; de de ltar yongs su bsngo bas sangs rgyas kyi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa yin/ sems can gyi rigs yongs su smin par byed pa yin/ zhing gi rigs rnam par sbyong ba yin; chos kyi rigs 'gal bar mi byed pa yin/ las kyi rigs yongs su shes pa yin/ mi gnyis pa'i rigs mnyam par byed pa yin/ phyogs kyi rigs su khyab par 'gro ba yin/ 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rigs la yang dag par rtog pa yin/ shin tu mos pa'i rigs rab tu sgrub pa yin/ dbang po'i rigs shin tu snang bar byed pa yin te/

“When great enlightening beings dedicate roots of goodness in this way, they use the absence of object of attainment as a means: they do not distinguish consequences in actions, they do not distinguish actions in consequences; though they have no discrimination, they enter all realms of phenomena and principles; though they have no striving, yet they always abide in roots of goodness; though they initiate nothing, yet they diligently practice excellent principles. They do not believe in things, yet can enter deeply into them; they do not consider things as existent, yet they know and see them all. Creation and noncreation are both ungraspable. They know that by nature all things are never independent. Though they see all things, yet they are not seeing anything; they know everything without knowing anything.
“Thus do enlightening beings comprehend the objective world, knowing that all things are based on causes and conditions. They see the reality-body of all Buddhas and arrive at the untainted ultimate reality of all things. They understand all worlds are like magical apparitions. They clearly realize that sentient beings are only one phenomenon and do not have two natures. They do not give up the realm of action: with skill in expedient means they show the uncreated in the midst of the realm of compounded things, without destroying the characteristics of compounded things; they show compounded things in the midst of the realm of the uncompounded, without distinguishing marks of the uncompounded. Thus enlightening beings always observe all things as ultimately null and void. They develop all pure roots of goodness and arouse the will to save and protect sentient beings. Their knowledge clearly realizes the ocean of all truths. They always gladly cultivate practice to get rid of ignorance and folly. They have already fully accomplished transmundane virtues, and they no longer practice worldly ways. They have attained the pure eye of knowledge, stripped of the blinders of ignorance, and with skill in means they practice the path of dedication.
“Great enlightening beings, dedicating roots of goodness in this way, accord with the will of all the Buddhas, beautify and purify all buddha-lands, teach, edify, and mature all sentient beings, fully accept and maintain all principles of the Buddhas, become supreme fields of blessings for all sentient beings, become wise guides for all caravans, become pure suns for all worlds. Each of their roots of goodness fills the cosmos, able to rescue and safeguard all sentient beings and cause them to be filled with pure virtuous qualities.
“When the great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they are able to preserve the lineage of all Buddhas, to develop all sentient beings to maturity, to beautify and purify all lands, to avoid spoiling all works, to thoroughly understand all things, to impartially observe the nonduality of all things, to go to all lands in the ten directions, to comprehend the ultimate reality apart from desire, to achieve pure faith, and to have clear, sharp faculties.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba bzhi pa ste/ thams cad du rjes su song ba zhes bya'o/ / de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su bsngo bar byed de/ de de ltar yongs su bsngo bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir thams cad du rjes su song ba'i lus kyi las rab tu thob bo/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rnam par bstan pa bsgribs pa med pa'i phyir thams cad du rjes su song ba'i ngag gi las rab tu 'thob bo/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan cing gzung ba'i phyir thams cad du rjes su song ba'i yid kyi las rab tu 'thob bo/ / sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad du rjes su song ba'i rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / chos thams cad la yang dag par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir thams cad du rjes su song ba'i chos khong du chud pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa tshim par bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i gzungs dang spobs pa thob par bya ba rab tu 'thob bo/ / spu'i sbubs gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad gzung bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad du rjes su song ba'i chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / sems can gcig gi lus su sems can thams cad kyi lus yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i lus la 'jug pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / bskal pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba la 'jug pa'i phyir thams cad du rjes su song ba'i bskal pa'i grangs la 'jug pa rab tu 'thob po; ; skad cig gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba thams cad mngon sum du bstan pa'i phyir thams cad du rjes su song ba'i skad cig la 'jug pa rab tu 'thob bo/ /

“This is great enlightening beings’ fourth dedication, dedication reaching all places. When great enlightening beings abide in this dedication, they achieve physical action reaching all places, being able to appear responsively in all worlds; they achieve verbal action reaching all places, expounding the truth in all places; they achieve mental action reaching all places, accepting and holding the truth explained by all Buddhas; they attain the power of psychic travel reaching everywhere, going in response to beings’ minds; they attain recollective and explanatory powers reaching all places, able to please beings according to their mentalities; they gain entry into the realm of reality reaching all places, able to enter all worlds in a single pore; they attain entry into bodies reaching all places, able to enter the bodies of all beings in the body of one being; they attain universal perception of the ages reaching all places, in each age always seeing all the Buddhas; they attain instantaneous universal perception reaching all places, moment to moment seeing all the Buddhas appear before them. When great enlightening beings attain dedication reaching all places, they are able to dedicate roots of goodness in this way.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being Diamond Banner, empowered by the Buddhas, looked over the ten directions and said,

'jig rten mtha' dang dbus med gang la yang / / de dag gnas 'cha' gang yang yod pa min/ / sems can phan pa'i don las phyir mi ldog / mi rab de dag ye shes 'di 'dra'o/ /
zhing rnams la yang gnas par mi byed de/ / phyogs rnams la yang de dag gnas mi 'cha'/ / tshe dang chos kyis rlom sems mi byed de/ / 'jig rten dag la rnam par rtog mi byed/ /
phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten dag na ci yod pa'i/ / 'gro ba de dag ma lus kun bsdus shing / / dngos po dngos med chos la dbang bsgyur 'jug / de dag thams cad ma lus dus su bsngo/ /
'dus byas 'dus ma byas kyi chos blangs shing / / 'jig rten 'di la rnam par rtog mi byed/ / ji ltar 'jig rten de bzhin chos rnams te/ / de ltar 'jig rten sgron ma rnam par dag /
ji snyed las rnams yang dag rtsom pa gang / / rab dang 'bring dang de bzhin tha ma rnams/ / de dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten mkhyen pa rnams/ / ji snyed bzhugs la yongs su bsngo ba byed/ /
de dag yongs su bsngo ba'i mthar phyin pa/ / sangs rgyas mchog rjes bslab bya bslab pa rnams/ / ye shes dam pa rjes su sems byed cing / / mi yi dam pa'i chos rnams rab tu 'thob/ /
sems can phan pa'i don du rtag zhugs shing / / 'gro ba kun tu 'jig rten sgron ma bzhin/ / phyogs rnams kun tu ma lus gyur cig ces/ / dge ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba byed/ /
de dag sems can rnam par rtog mi byed/ / chos la'ang rnam par rtog par mi byed de/ / 'jig rten gyis kyang rlom sems med pa yin/ / 'gro ba kun nas phyir yang mi log go /
brtan pa de dag zhi rab rtag tu zhi/ / de dag mya ngan 'das pa'i spyod yul thob/ / sems can rgyud na'ang mi spyod ma yin te/ / 'di 'dra'i ye shes dam pa khong du chud/ /
de dag nam yang rtog dang rnam rtog med/ / rnam par smin la'ang de dag gnas mi 'cha'/ / 'jig rten thams cad rgyu dang bcas pas na; ; chos rnams rgyud med par yang lta ma yin/ /
de dag spyod yul 'di 'dra thob pa ste/ / de la rtog dang rnam par rtog pa med/ / blo mchog de dag 'gro kun kha lo sgyur/ / ye shes tshul la mkhas pas yongs su bsngo/ /

To all internal and external worlds Enlightening beings have no attachments at all, Yet do not abandon works beneficial to sentient beings: The great ones cultivate this kind of knowledge.
In all lands in the ten directions They do not depend or dwell on anything; They do not grasp things, such as livelihood, And do not arbitrarily create distinctions.
They deal with all sentient beings In all worlds in the ten directions; Observing their essential nature has no existence, They practice dedication reaching everywhere.
Dealing with all compounded and uncompounded things, They do not entertain errant thoughts about them, Or in regard to anything in the world: The Lamps that Illumine the World are aware in this way.
The works carried out by enlightening beings Are different in superior, middling, and lower grades; In all of them they dedicate roots of goodness To all the Buddhas of the ten directions.
Enlightening beings, by dedication, reach transcendence, Accomplishing what they learn from the Buddhas; They always think well based on subtle knowledge And embody the best of human qualities.
Their pure roots of goodness they universally dedicate To help the deluded, never abandoning them: They enable all sentient beings to become Unexcelled lamps that illumine the world.
They never conceptualize sentient beings Nor think of things with false imagination; Though in the world, they have no attachments, Yet also do not abandon conscious creatures.
Enlightening beings always enjoy tranquil nullity By following which they attain the realm of nirvana; Yet they do not abandon the realm of sentient beings: They have attained such subtle knowledge.
Enlightening beings do not conceptualize actions And do not grasp their results: All worlds are born from conditions— Things cannot be seen apart from causality.
Deeply entering such realms, They do not create vain discriminations therein: The tamers of all sentient beings Herein understand skilled dedication.
thams cad du rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ste/ yongs su bsngo ba bzhi pa'o/ /
bam po sum cu rtsa bzhi pa/
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba lnga pa bsod nams mi zad pa'i mdzod ces bya ba gang zhe na/
“What is great enlightening beings’ dedication of inexhaustible treasuries of virtue?

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgrib pa'i las thams cad las bag yangs su bya ba'i phyir bshags pa dang 'brel ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'am/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi dus gsum gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang bas rjes su yi rang ba dang 'brel ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'am/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la nan tan du byas pas phyag bya ba dang 'brel ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'am/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la brtson pas sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba gdab pa dang 'brel ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'am/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa gang la byang chub sems dpa' brtson par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byams klas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dag la yang dag par 'jug par byed pa 'am/ gang yang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang bar byed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la gnas par byed pa'am/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas sems can mtha' dang / dbus med pa dul bar gyur pa de dag la rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas khong du chud par byed pa'am/ gang yang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang po thugs bskyed pa nas bzung ste byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la yang dag par byung bar gyur pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par bstan pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa'i ye shes kyi byin rlabs kyi rjes su yi rang ba'am/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bstan pa yang dag par bzung ba nas nye bar bzung ste chos thams cad kyi mthar thug gi bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ba'am/ sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i bsam pa 'byams klas pa brjod du med pa dang / rang gi dmigs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba gang brtsams pa de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsgribs pa med par dmigs pas mthar phyin par byed pa yang rung ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par phye ba tshad med cing 'byams klas pa/ dmigs pa rgya chen po grangs med pas bsags pa de dag thams cad 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / gang mos par byas pa dang / gang rjes su yi rang ba dang / gang yongs su rdzogs par byas pa dang / gang yongs su grub par byas pa dang / gang spyad pa dang / gang thob par byas pa dang / gang sems pa dang / gang rtsom pa dang / gang mthu dang ldan par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis gang ji snyed du sngon gyi 'das pa'i dus thams cad 'byams klas pa'i dus la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams shin tu bstan pa grangs las 'das pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan byung ba dang / gang ji snyed du de bzhin nyid kyi go skabs thams cad kyi sngon gyi mu'i bskal pa'i mthar gyur pas mtshams med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs mtha' yas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyis thugs su chud pa byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pas rnam par shes pa; byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyis yang dag par bzung ba dag tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan yongs su dag pa byung ba dang / gang yang las dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'am/ gang yang spyod pa las yang dag par byung ba'am/ gang yang sems can bsgral bar bya ba'i tshogs rnam par bstan pa'am/ gang yang shin tu mos pa rnam par dag pa'am/ gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shes par bya ba'am/ gang yang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa yang dag par bstan pa'am/ gang yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams su rnam par rig pa'am/ gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las 'jig rten las 'das pas byung ba'am/ gang yang byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa 'byams klas pas byung ba'am/

Here they dedicate the roots of goodness produced by repentance and removal of hindrances caused by past actions, the roots of goodness produced by paying respect to all Buddhas, the roots of goodness produced by requesting all Buddhas to teach, the roots of goodness produced by listening to Buddhas’ teaching, diligently practicing it, and realizing the vast realm of the inconceivable, the roots of goodness produced by rejoicing at the virtues of all Buddhas and all sentient beings of the past, future, and present, the roots of goodness of all Buddhas, the roots of goodness achieved by the dilligent practice of infinite enlightening beings, the roots of goodness produced by enlightening beings knowing of and rejoicing in the Buddhas of all times attaining true enlightenment, teaching the truth, and taming sentient beings, the roots of goodness in rejoicing at the Buddhas of all times cultivating enlightening practice from their first inspiration, attaining supreme true awakening, finally appearing to enter ultimate extinction, and, after their extinction, the true teaching remaining in the world until passing away; thus enlightening beings think of the inexplicable realm of the Buddhas as well as their own realm and the unhindered realm of enlightenment—such tremendous, innumerable different roots of goodness, all they accumulate, all they believe in, all they rejoice in, all they fulfill, all they accomplish, all they practice, all they attain, all they are aware of, all they embody, all they develop, they dedicate to adorn all the buddha-lands, like the realm of action of all the Buddhas in all worlds in boundless eons of the past—that is, incalculable, innumerable systems of buddha-worlds, known to the knowledge of Buddhas, perceived by enlightening beings, sensed by the great mind, issuing from and drawn forth by pure actions adorning buddha-fields, arising in response to sentient beings, created by the sublime practices of the enlightening being Universally Good,

gang yang mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis rlabs kyis byung ba'am/ phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal par mngon par 'tshang rgya ba rgyun chad pa med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul thams cad shin tu bstan pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'byams klas pa/ ma 'ongs pa'i dus mtha' yas pa'i rigs su shin tu bstan pa/ ma 'ongs pa'i lam gyi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa grangs med par brjod pa/ ma 'ongs pa'i dus rgyun 'chad pa med cing / sa mtshams kyi mtha' med pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par bsgrubs pas thugs su chud pa/ ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi skad cig rgyun 'chad pa med pa/ chos kyi dbyings dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang / bskal pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad mtha' yas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyis mngon par 'tshang rgya ba tshad med par gyur pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus sa mtshams med cing ris su mi chod pa dag tu ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du khyab par gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan dang / rgyan yongs su dag pa rin po che'i rgyan rnam par bres pa du ma dang / spos kyi rgyan yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa thams cad dang / me tog thams cad kyi rgyan gyi char rab tu 'bab pa/ na bza' thams cad kyi rgyan gyi sprin sna tshogs yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ rnam pa tha dad pa'i mdzod de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyan gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis rnam par bres pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rgyan rab tu brgyan par bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa brjod du med pas rab tu brgyan cing grub pa/ grogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par dag pas yongs su bsgrubs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyi rgyan gyis rnam par dag pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang yang ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i mig 'jig rten las 'das pa thun mong ma yin pas rnam par mthong ba/ byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rab tu myong bar 'gyur ba/ chos thams cad sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bur khong du chud pa/ chos thams cad kyi mthu sprul pa lta bus rnam par dag pa; byang chub sems dpa'i las 'byams klas pa/ mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song bas rnam par dag pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pas sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba/ yang dag par rgyu ba/ sangs rgyas kyi bla na med pas snang bar byas pas rgya che ba sna tshogs tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams yang dag par gnas par 'gyur ba dang / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas de dag thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba

in which all the Buddhas become enlightened and manifest various autonomous spiritual powers—and like the purely adorned buddha-lands which will be attained upon enlightenment by the Buddhas throughout the future, pervading the cosmos, boundless, borderless, endless, infinite, all born of the knowledge of the Buddhas, adorned by innumerable beautiful treasures—ornaments of all fragrances, all flowers, all raiment, all treasuries of worthy qualities, all powers of Buddhas, and the embellishments of all buddha-lands; the capitals of the enlightened ones, inhabited by inconceivable pure communities of people with existing affinity through similar practices who will attain true enlightenment in the future, developed by all the Buddhas, imperceptible to the world, visible only to the pure eyes of enlightening beings. These enlightening beings have great powers and have planted roots of goodness in the past; knowing all things are like phantoms and illusions, they cultivate the pure deeds of enlightening beings, entering absorption in inconceivable freedom, and with skill in means can perform the work of Buddhas, emanate the light of Buddhas and illumine the world everywhere without limit.

de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa rab tu byung ba/ shin tu grub pa/ rnam par dag pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa/ kun nas yon tan can/ bsngags par bya ba tshad med pa/ dri zhim po bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtha' yas shing tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ rgyan grangs med pa can/ gtsug lag khang grangs med pa dang ldan pa/ yid du 'ong ba'i sgra grangs med pa yod pa/ mtha' yas par yang dag par ston pa/ rjes su spyod pa'i grogs tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ yon tan sna tshogs zad mi shes pa dang ldan pa/ rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ spos thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ phreng ba thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ phye ma thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ rin po che thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ na bza' thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ rgyal mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ ba dan thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi snam bu kun tu bting bas brgyan pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi stegs bus brgyan pa/ gser gyi dra ba grangs med pas kun tu yog par brgyan pa/ chu klung grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ grangs med pa'i sprin gyi char rab tu 'bab pas brgyan pa/ rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba'i tshogs grangs med pas yid du 'ong ba/ rnam par dag pa de dag dang / de bzhin du ma lus pa thams cad rab tu bzung ste/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan dang / rgyan yongs su dag pa gang ji snyed pa gang dang gang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rab tu mkhyen pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa/ zhing gi gnas su gyur pa thams cad phyogs kyi 'khor mtha' yas par shin tu bstan pas phyogs bcur rnam par bkod pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa dang / las rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa/ nam mkha'i khams dang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyis yongs su bsdus pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams phyogs gzhan dang gzhan gyi rjes su song bar rab tu gnas pa la rnam pa tha dad pas shin tu byung ba'i 'jig rten khams brjod du med par shin tu bstan pa/ 'jig rten gyi 'byung gnas nam mkha'i gos gtugs pa zhing gi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa brjod du med pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos kyis shin tu bstan pa/ de ltar ma lus pa thams cad yongs su bzung ste chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rgyan la 'jug pas rgyan rnam par dag pa thams cad dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa thams cad ji skad du bshad pa dang / ji skad du bstan pa dang / ji skad du brjod pa dang / ji skad du gsal bar byas pa dang / ji skad du smos pa dang / ji skad du smras pa dang / ji skad du bslab pa dang / ji skad du dkrol ba dang / ji lta bur btags pa dang / ji lta bur rnam par bkod pa de dang de dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa skyes pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mnyam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dge ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi bdag nyid che ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yangs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bde bar bskyang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing zil gyis mi non pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing zad mi shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing shin tu che ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi 'phrog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'od gsal ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yid du 'od ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi mthun pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun tu snang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab tu snang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par brgyan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab tu brgyan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing shin tu rnam par phye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mchog dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gtso bo dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing phul dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gya nom pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rmad du byung ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bla na med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mnyam pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dra ba med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas pa dang /

All the Buddhas of the present also adorn worlds in this way, with boundless forms, lights, and colors, all made by virtues: innumerable fragrances, innumerable jewels, innumerable trees, innumerable ornaments, innumerable palaces, innumerable sounds, associates in accord with affinities from the past, manifesting adornments of all worthy qualities, without end—adornments of all fragrances, garlands, powdered incenses, jewels, pennants, multicolored streamers of precious silk, balustrades of jewels, countless ornaments of gold nets, rivers, clouds and rain, and music, innumerable such embellishments adorning the buddha-lands in all worlds throughout space, created by various deeds, known to the Buddhas and told of by the Buddhas: that is, buddha-lands of adornments, buddha-lands of purity, buddha-lands of equanimity, buddha-lands of subtle refinements, buddha-lands of magnificent virtue, buddha-lands of immensity, buddha-lands of peace and bliss, buddha-lands of indestructibility, buddha-lands of inexhaustibility, buddha-lands of infinity, buddha-lands of imperturbability, buddha-lands of fearlessness, buddha-lands of light, buddha-lands free from opposition, buddha-lands of delight, buddha-lands of all-illumining brightness, buddha-lands of splendor, buddha-lands of refined beauty, buddha-lands of wonderful skill, preeminent, excellent, extraordinary, supreme, absolutely supreme, surpassing, unexcelled, peerless, incomparable, indescribable buddha-lands.

de ltar yongs su bzung ste 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam par dag pa gang ji snyed pa'i rgyan rnam par dag pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par dag par gyur cig /
sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad 'di lta bu'i rnam par dag pa dang ldan par gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan ji snyed pa de dag thams cad yang dag par gnas par gyur cig / grub par gyur cig/ rnam par dag par gyur cig / yongs su dag par gyur cig / yang dag par grub par gyur cig / rab tu byung bar gyur cig / rab tu brgyan par gyur cig / kun tu brgyan par gyur cig / byang chub par gyur cig / byin gyis brlabs par gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu ji lta bde bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang ma lus par yongs su bzung ste/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mtha' gtugs pa thams cad ma lus par de snyed kyi rgyan gyis yongs su brgyan par gnas par gyur cig / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad ma lus par dus gsum thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi bdag nyid che ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing blta na mi ngom pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtshungs pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas pa ji snyed pa de dag gi rgyan gyis rnam par dag par gyur cig /

To emulate these adornments of all the buddha-lands of past, future, and present, the great enlightening beings willingly dedicate their own roots of goodness to adorn a world in the same way, with the pure adornments of the lands of all Buddhas of past, future, and present, to produce, purify, gather, manifest, array, and maintain all adornments like those of the lands of all Buddhas, and to do the same for all worlds throughout the space of the cosmos, that they be replete with the various adornments of the lands of the Buddhas of all times.

sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' yongs su rdzogs pa rjes su 'jug pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams la rab tu 'jug pa/ kun tu spyod pa mang ba/ sems can gyi khams rtogs par bya ba khong du chud pa/ chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa rab tu rtogs pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings la 'jug pa rmongs pa med pa; sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rab tu thob pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos rjes su dran pa'i tshul can/ tshad med pa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa la rab tu zhugs pa/ gtong ba la shin tu mos pa/ gtong ba'i rjes su dran pa rab tu thob pa/ ye shes kyi 'od zer dang ldan pa'i chos kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor can/ chags pa med par lta ba/ dmigs su med pa las rab tu byung ba/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi gnas su gyur pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba dam pas thog mar 'gro ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu byung ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyi rjes su song ba/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yul gyi 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa/ bdud kyi las thams cad rnam par sbyangs pa; sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi rang bzhin khong du chud pa/ phyin ci log med pas yang dag par byung ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam la gti mug med pa sha stag gis yongs su gang bar gyur cig /
byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu'i tshul can/ de lta bu'i spyod pa la zhugs pa/ de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba mtshungs pa med pa can; rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las la gzhol ba/ sangs rgyas kyi byang chub snang ba rab tu thob pa/ mun pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad lus gcig gis khyab par byed pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa chen po yang dag pa ston pa/ ye shes chen po khong du chud pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi spyod yul dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa/ zhing thams cad kyi rjes su song ba/ gnas med par sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na gnas pa; nam mkha'i dbyings su mos pas mi gnas pa'i yid dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rnam par phye ba'i bsam pa can/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mnyam par gzhog pa la mkhas pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyod yul gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing la gnas pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs shes par bya ba la mkhas pa/ chos grangs med pa bstan cing bshad pa la 'jigs pa med pa/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dge ba'i rjes su song ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa yongs su 'dzin pa; sgra bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par dbye zhing mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pas grangs med pa'i skad rnam pa tha dad pa shes pa/ bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i sa khong du chud pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rjes su song zhing chags pa med par spyod pa/ nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos kyi tshul la chos su rtogs pas gnas pa med pa/ sems bskyed pa yangs pa shin tu rnam par bsgoms pa rab tu thob pa/ ye shes gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyud la mkhas pa/ don gcig nas gcig tu bstan pa rab tu grub pa de lta bu dag gis 'jig rten gyi khams de dag yongs su brgyan par gyur cig / yongs su gang bar gyur cig / rnam par mdzes par gyur cig / rjes su dong bar gyur cig / kun tu gnas par gyur cig / bsgoms par gyur cig / shin tu bsgoms par gyur cig / sbyangs par gyur cig / shin tu sbyangs par gyur cig / zhi bar byas par gyur cig / sangs rgyas kyi zhing re re'i phyogs re re zhing yang byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa/ grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ gzhal du med pa/ mu med pa/ sa mtshams med pa/ dpag tu med pa/ brjod du med pa/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pas yongs su rgyas par gyur cig / phyogs gcig ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa ma lus pa/ lus pa med pa/ lhag ma med pa thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta bu'i tshul can gyis yongs su rgyas shing yongs su gang bar gyur cig / ces

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all the buddha-lands I cultivate be filled with great enlightening beings who are truly genuine, with comprehensive knowledge, able to distinguish all worlds and sentient beings, to enter deeply into the realm of reality as well as the realm of space, who cast off folly and perfect the recollection of the Buddhas, recollection of the truth of the teaching, recollection of the infinity of the community, omnipresent everywhere, and who also remember equanimity, their sun of truth full and round, their light of knowledge illumining everywhere, seeing without obstruction, born from nonacquisition, producing all aspects of Buddhahood, possessed of myriad supreme roots of goodness, engendering the determination of unexcelled enlightenment, abiding in the powers of Buddhas, heading for omniscience, destroying the works of demons, purifying the realm of sentient beings, entering deeply into the essential nature of things, forever getting rid of delusion, bringing all roots of goodness and great vows to fruition—may such enlightening beings fill those lands, born in such places, having such virtues, always performing the work of buddhahood, attaining the pure light of complete enlightenment, possessed of knowledge of the realm of reality, manifesting the power of spiritual faculties, filling all realms with one body, attaining great knowledge and wisdom, entering the sphere of omniscience, able to distinguish infinite, boundless expressions and meanings of realms of phenomena and principles, having no attachments in any land, yet able to appear in all buddha-lands, their minds like space, not relying on anything, yet able to distinguish all realms of phenomena and principles, able to enter and emerge from inconceivable profound concentrations, intent on omniscience, dwelling in the buddha-fields, attaining the power of buddhahood, expounding countless truths without fear, conforming to the roots of goodness of Buddhas of all times, totally illumining the cosmos of truth of all enlightened ones, able to accept and hold all Buddhas’ teachings, knowing countless ways of speaking, able to enunciate inconceivably many different sounds, entering the unsurpassed stage of freedom of the Buddhas, traveling throughout all worlds in the ten directions without hindrance, practicing noncontention and nonreliance, not falsely discriminating anything, cultivating, practicing, and enlarging the determination for enlightenment, attaining knowledge of skill in means, of expression and meanings, able to explain and expound them step-by-step. I vow to cause such enlightening beings to adorn those lands, distributed throughout, living in peace and accord, well cultivated, extremely well cultivated, pure, extremely pure, calm and serene. May there be, in each and every region of one buddha-land infinitely many such great enlightening beings filling it, and may all buddha-lands throughout space, throughout the cosmos, all be filled with great enlightening beings in the same way.’

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ste/ tshul de lta bus sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang / tshul de lta bus 'byung ba thams cad dang / tshul de lta bus sems can gyi khams thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / tshul de lta bus sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub dang / tshul de lta bus smon lam thams cad dang / tshul de lta bus 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas skyes pa mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / tshul de lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa sku tshe tshad med pa dang / tshul de lta bus thogs pa med par chos kyi dbyings thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor pa phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings expediently dedicate all roots of goodness to all buddha-lands, to all enlightening beings, to all Buddhas, to the enlightenment of all Buddhas, to all great vows, to all essential ways of emancipation, to purifying all realms of sentient beings, to always seeing the Buddhas appear in all worlds, to always seeing the life of the enlightened ones as infinite, and to always seeing the Buddhas pervading the cosmos turning the unimpeded, nonregressing wheel of teaching.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad kyis ma lus par gang bar byas pa'i chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad ma lus par shin tu byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang /

“When great enlightening beings dedicate roots of goodness in this way, because they enter all buddha-lands, all buddha-lands are purified; because they reach all realms of sentient beings, all enlightening beings are purified; because they will the appearance of Buddhas in all buddha-lands, in all buddha-lands in all universes the embodiments of the enlightened transcendentally manifest.

thams cad mkhyen par 'byung bar bgo skal med par yongs su bsngos pa dang / nam mkha'i khams tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba'i sems kyi sa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i tshad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i mnyam pa nyid las kyi rnam par smin pa thams cad las rnam par grol zhing shin tu mos pa dang; yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par mtha' yas par 'brel bar byas pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi rjes su song bas/

“By means of such peerless dedication great enlightening beings proceed toward omniscience, their minds broad and vast as space, without any limitations; entering inconceivability, they know all actions and the resulting consequences are null, so their minds are always equanimous. Having no bounds, they are able to enter all realms of reality.

yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe bdag la mi rtog go/ bdag gi lus la rnam par mi rtog go/ sangs rgyas la mi rtog go /sangs rgyas kyi chos la rnam par mi rtog go /zhing la mi rtog go /zhing gi yang dag par spyod pas rnam par spyod pa la rnam par mi rtog go /sems can la rnam par mi rtog go /sems can gdul ba la rnam par mi rtog go /las la mi rtog go /las kyi rnam par smin pa la rnam par mi rtog go ; sems pa la chags par mi byed do/ / bsam pas kyang mngon par chags par mi byed do/ / rgyu chud gzon par mi byed do/ / rgyu dang 'bras bu chud gzon par mi byed do/ / dngos po nye bar len par mi byed do/ / dngos po'i chos la chags par yang mi byed do/ / 'khor ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa gcig tu mi byed do/ / zhi ba rnam par brtags pa med pas rlom sems mi byed do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gyis snyems par mi byed do/ / chos gang gis kyang chos la gnas par mi byed do/ /

“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they do not conceive of self or possessions, do not conceive of Buddha or Buddha teaching, do not conceive of lands or adornment, do not conceive of sentient beings or civilization, do not conceive of action or results of action; they do not cling to thought or what is produced by thought, they do not deny cause and effect, they do not grasp things, they do not grasp principles, they do not say birth and death has mentation, they do not say nirvana is eternal tranquility, they do not say the enlightened realize buddhahood—there is not the slightest thing that coexists with reality.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag nye bar stobs so/ / khong du chud par byed do/ / yongs su bsngo'o/ / yongs su smin par byed do/ / mnyam par byed do/ / sgrub bo/ / mtshan mar mi byed do/ / dmigs par mi byed do/ / mi 'jal lo/ / mi rtog go /rnam par mi rtog go /

“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they give all roots of goodness over to sentient beings, to assure their development of maturation, teaching and edifying them impartially, without mental images, without objectification, without assessment, without falsehood, avoiding all vain discrimination and conceptual clinging.

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar yongs su bsngo ba ni/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su dran pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yang dag par 'jug pas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mi zad pa yin; zhing rnam par dag pas yongs su bsngo bas dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa yin/ sems can gyi khams rnam par dag pa la rnam par dpyod pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa yin/ chos kyi dbyings su 'jug pa la zhugs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa yin/ nam mkha'i khams ltar tshad med pa'i sems la yongs su bsgoms pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la shin tu mos pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi las la brtson pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa yin/ dus gsum rab tu rnam par 'byed pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa yin te/

“Once great enlightening beings have made this dedication, they attain inexhaustible roots of goodness: that is, they attain inexhaustible roots of goodness because they keep all enlightening beings in mind; they attain inexhaustible roots of goodness because they purify the buddha-lands; they attain inexhaustible roots of goodness because they purify all realms of sentient beings; they attain inexhaustible roots of goodness because they delve deeply into the realm of reality; they attain inexhaustible roots of goodness because they cultivate immeasurable minds equal to the realm of space; they attain inexhaustible roots of goodness because they profoundly understand the realm of all Buddhas; they attain inexhaustible roots of goodness because they diligently cultivate the work of enlightening beings; they attain inexhaustible roots of goodness because they comprehend the past, present, and future.

de nas sems can gyi khams thams cad la sems can med par rab tu rtog cing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos thams cad la srog med par khong du chud cing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos thams cad la byed pa med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la gang zag med par sems shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos thams cad nyon mongs pa med par rab tu rtog cing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos thams cad kyi rten pa yang dag par mthong zhing yongs su bsngo'o/ / dngos po thams cad la mi gnas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / zhing thams cad la yang dag par mi gnas pa nyid du shes shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mi gnas pa nyid du lta zhing yongs su bsngo'o/ / dmigs pa thams cad la dmigs su med pa nyid du shes pas mthong zhing yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings dedicate all roots of goodness in this way, they understand that all realms of sentient beings have no sentient beings; they understand that all things have no life; they know that all things have no creator; they realize all things have no personality; they comprehend that all things have no conflict; they see that all things come from conditions and have no abode; they know all things have no basis; they know all lands have no location; they observe that enlightening beings’ practices also have no locus; they see that all objects have no existence.

de de ltar yongs su bsngo bas zhing gang yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas par mig lam du snang bar mi 'gyur ro; ; kun tu lta yang sems can gang yang mi mthun pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro/ / spyod pa'i tshe chos gang yang yang dag par mi mthong ngo/ / ye shes kyi 'jug pas gang la yang 'jug pa med do/ / nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad la'ang rab tu gnas te/ de yang shin tu shes so/ / bsod nams kyi stobs tshad med pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i skus chos thams cad gang bar shin tu shes so/ / sems can thams cad tshim par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad du 'gro ba la yang dag par spyod do/ /

“When great enlightening beings practice such dedication, their eyes ultimately never see impure buddha-lands, nor do they see sentient beings of differing characteristics; there is not the slightest thing entered by knowledge, nor the slightest knowledge entering things. They understand the body of the Enlightened is not like empty space, because it is perfected by all virtues and infinite sublime qualities, and because in all places it causes sentient beings to accumulate a sufficiency of roots of goodness.

de'i sems bskyed pa re re zhing yang sems can brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa stobs bcu'i sar yang dag par grub bo/ / de nas sems can thams cad bsod nams thams cad kyis yongs su gzung zhing thob par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa bsod nams thams cad kyi 'byung gnas dang ldan pa thams cad rab tu sgrub bo/ / de yo byad ci 'dod pa phun sum tshogs pas bsod nams kyi mdzod yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu dang ldan pa yin no/ / de gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang de dag tu zhing thams cad rnam par sbyong zhing 'gro'o/ / de gang dang gang du spyod pa de dang de dag tu sems can brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi stobs kyis yongs su gzung ba la rab tu gzhog cing yang dag par spyod do/ /

“These great enlightening beings moment to moment attain unspeakably unspeakable numbers of stages of the ten powers, are filled with all virtues, fully develop pure roots of goodness, and are fields of blessings for all sentient beings. These great enlightening beings develop treasuries of virtues like wish-fulfilling jewels, obtaining all comforts as needed, able to adorn all lands wherever they go, purifying untold numbers of sentient beings wherever they go, because of embracing virtue, cultivating and mastering the practices.

de ltar yongs su bsngo ba de la rnam pa de lta bu de'i rgyu mthun pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na gzugs med pa yin/ 'jig rten thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i bsod nams can yin/ bdud thams cad kyis gzi brjid mi zad pa yin/ phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba mi 'phrog pa yin/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i yid yang dag par rtogs pa dang ldan pas smon lam shin tu che ba dang / sems rab tu yangs pa yin/ sems bskyed pa gcig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med par 'gro ba yin/ ye shes kyi stobs mtha' yas pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul yongs su shes pa yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad la shin tu dad pa yin/ ye shes mtha' yas par shin tu 'jug pa la rab tu gnas pa yin/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyis glas pa'i byang chub kyi sems mngon par bsgrubs pa'i mthus nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas par chos kyi dbyings shin tu yangs pa yin no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /

“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they cultivate the practices of all enlightening beings, their virtues are extraordinary, their appearance is incomparable, their spiritual force and radiance surpass all worldlings, so that demons and demonic people cannot look upon them. Their roots of goodness are complete, their great vows are accomplished, their minds ever broadening, equal to the omniscient. In a single moment of attention they can pervade innumerable buddha-lands. The power of their knowledge is immeasurable, and they have arrived at the sphere of all Buddhas. They have profound faith in all Buddhas, and abide in boundless knowledge, the power of their will for enlightenment as vast as the cosmos, as ultimate as space.

'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba lnga pa bsod nams mi zad pa'i mdzod ces bya ba ste/ de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ mi zad pa'i mdzod bcu rab tu 'thob bo/ / bcu gang zhe na/ skra'i sbubs gcig tu sangs rgyas grangs med pa 'byung ba la 'jug pa'i phyir sangs rgyas blta ba'i gter mi zad pa'i mdzod rab tu 'thob bo/ / chos thams cad gcig tu rab tu gzhol ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang ye shes kyi phyir chos la 'jug pa'i gter mi zad pa'i mdzod rab tu 'thob bo/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis chos bstan pa yongs su bzung zhing chud mi zos par bya ba'i phyir dran pas bzung ba'i gter mi zad pa'i mdzod rab tu 'thob bo/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul dang dgongs pa shin tu bstan pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir blo gros rnam par nges pa'i gter mi zad pa'i mdzod rab tu 'thob bo/ / chos kyi tshul rnam par dbye ba la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir rigs pas 'dzin pa'i gter mi zad pa'i mdzod rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam pa'i blos dus gsum thams cad khyab par bya ba'i phyir blo tshad med pa'i gter mi zad pa'i mdzod rab tu 'thob bo/ / sems can thams cad tshim par bya bas mi zad par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi gter mi zad pa'i mdzod rab tu 'thob bo/ / sems can thams cad kyi mun pa dang / rab rib dang / ling tog dang / gti mug dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par bsal ba'i phyir ye shes dang dga' ba dang blo'i gter mi zad pa'i mdzod rab tu 'thob bo/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos nyid tha mi dad pa rab tu bstan pas sems can thams cad shes par bya ba'i phyir spobs pa rnam par nges pa'i gter rab tu 'thob bo/ / byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa med pa'i thabs skyon med pa'i dbang bskur ba'i phyir stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa'i gter mi zad pa rab tu 'thob ste/ gter mi zad pa'i mdzod bcu po 'di dag rab tu 'thob bo/ /

“When great enlightening beings abide in this dedication, they attain ten inexhaustible treasuries: they attain an inexhaustible treasury of seeing Buddhas, because in a single pore they see countless Buddhas appearing in the world; they attain an inexhaustible treasury of entry into truth, because by the power of Buddha-knowledge they see all things in one truth; they attain an inexhaustible treasury of memory, because they retain the teachings expounded by all Buddhas without forgetting any; they attain an inexhaustible treasury of certain wisdom, because they know the secret techniques in the teachings expounded by all Buddhas; they attain an inexhaustible treasury of understanding meaning and intent, because they know the distinctions of principles of the teachings; they attain an inexhaustible treasury of boundless realization, because they comprehend all things of all times by means of spacelike knowledge; they attain an inexhaustible treasury of felicitous virtues, because they satisfy the wishes of all sentient beings without end; they attain an inexhaustible treasury of intrepid knowledge and awareness, because they are able to remove and destroy all sentient beings’ blinders of ignorance and folly; they attain an inexhaustible treasury of definitive powers of elucidation, because they expound the impartial teaching of all Buddhas so that all sentient beings understand; they attain an inexhaustible treasury of the ten powers and four fearlessnesses, because they fulfill all practices of enlightening beings, wrap their heads in the turban of nondefilement, and arrive at an unobstructed omniscience. When great enlightening beings dedicate all roots of goodness, they attain these ten inexhaustible treasuries.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being Diamond Banner looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

bsam pas mthu stobs rnyed pa de dag ni/ / mtha' yas chos la kun tu dbang bsgyur cing / / bsod nams gter la rjes su yi rang ba/ / de dag chags med tshul gyis yongs su bsngo/ /
dus gsum rgyal ba su dag ji snyed pas/ / rnam dag zhing rnams 'jig rten rnam sbyangs pa/ / yon tan kun dang ldan zhing 'phags pa rnams/ / de 'dra'i rnam dag zhing du yongs su bsngo/ /
dus gsum rgyal ba ji snyed bzhugs pa yi/ / tshul rnams kun la rjes su sems byed cing / / thams cad lus pa med par nges bzung ste/ / de 'dra'i zhing ni brtan pa rnams kyis brgyan/ /
dus gsum bskal pa ji snyed yod pa yi/ / zhing gcig yon tan de dag blangs byas kyang / / bskal pa ji snyed de dag zad 'gyur gyi/ / zhing gi yon tan bsngags pa zad mi 'gyur/ /
'di 'dra'i zhing rnams thams cad ma lus par/ / mi yi mchog gis ji snyed mthong gyur pa/ / thams cad ma lus zhing gi yon tan gyis/ / ji snyed 'jig rten de dag brgyan par snang / /
de dag kun kyang rnam dag yid dang ldan/ / de dag rgyal ba'i gsung skyes sras yin te/ / yon tan kun gyis brgyan pa'i sems dang ldan; / zhing gi phyogs rnams rab tu rgyas par byed/ /
de dag lus ni mtshan gyis shin tu brgyan/ / de dag dpe byad bzang pos lus kyang mdzes/ / de dag mtha' yas yang dag so so shes/ / 'gro ba'i rgya mtsho mi zad ji bzhin no/ /
de dag spyod yul dag dang yang dag ldan/ / ting 'dzin kun la gnas pa rjes su thob/ / mtshungs med shin tu rnam par dag pa'i yid/ / thams cad phyogs rnams su ni 'on kyang 'gyed/ /
'di 'dra'i zhing rnams ma lus bzung byas te/ / nyan thos spyod yul dag la dad med pa/ / rang rgyal thams cad shin tu spangs gyur te/ / mi yi dam pas shin tu gang gyur cig /
de dag de 'dra'i yongs bsngo sems ldan pa/ / gang gis ma lus 'jig rten byang chub tu/ / dus gsum rgyal bas mngon par sangs rgyas pa/ / de dang ldan par yongs su bsngo bar byed/ /
phyogs bcu kun na ji snyed yod pa yi/ / bdud dang nyon mongs de dag rab tu 'joms/ / dpal ldan mthu can gzhan gyis pham mi nus/ / rnam par nges pas chos kyi dam pa spyod/ /
de dag smon lam mthu stobs yangs pa yin; ; yongs su bsngo ba chags pa med gyur cing / / bsod nams zad med de dag mdzod du zhugs/ / de ni dus gsum kun tu zad mi 'gyur/ /
de dag spyod pas chos la 'jal bar byed/ / de dag byed pa med pa'i chos la zhugs/ / g.yo med chos kyang de dag rab tu shes/ / las kyi rnam pas yongs su mi sems so/ /
gzugs ni ma yin 'on kyang gzugs med min/ / 'du shes yod min 'du shes med pa min/ / dngos yod ma yin dngos po med pa'ang min/ / dngos med thams cad rang bzhin khong du chud/ /
yod pa ma yin med pa'ang ma yin te/ / rgyu yi rgyud la mngon par chags mi byed/ / rkyen la'ang 'jug par de dag mi byed do/ / nam yang de dag chags par mi byed do/ /
'gro ba 'di na smra tshul ji snyed pa/ / de la nam yang chags par mi byed de/ / 'du shes bsam pa brnga yang rab tu shes/ / bdag med chos kyang so sor shin tu rtogs/ /
de dag sems can mi 'bral zhes 'gyur ba; ; de 'dra'i chos nyid mnyam pa rab tu rtogs/ / de 'dra'i zhing dang de bzhin las kyi rnams/ / dus gsum thams cad ma lus bzung byas shing / /
shes pas de dag de bzhin yongs su bsngo/ / las kyi rnam pa gang gis skyes ldan zhing / / rang bzhin gang dang mtshan nyid gang yin dang / / de na ci 'dra'i chos nyid yod pa dag /
de bzhin de dag dag par yongs su bsngo; ; gang gi yid kyis ngo bo nyid 'jal ba/ / rang bzhin byas pa med par de dag shes/ / 'gro la de dag mi gnas len pa med/ /
'gro ba kun phyir yongs su bsngo bar gzhol/ / spyod yul ma lus thams cad bzung byas shing / / 'od gsal thams cad rjes su sems par byed/ / ma lus de bzhin nyid kyang de dag shes/ /
gang gis lta ba thams cad ma lus shing / / bsam pa'i skyon por rnam par spangs pa rnams/ / rtag tu de dag dri med kun gdung med/ / chags med kun gyi tshul yang rjes su rtogs/ /
de dag gis ni chos rnams ma bshig ste/ / nam yang chos nyid zhig par 'gyur ba med/ / chos la chags par de dag mi byed de/ / de dag 'jig rten sgra brnyan 'dra ba yin/ /
gang gis dus gsum 'jig rten skyes pa yin/ / 'gro ba rkyen 'byung chos kyang rab tu shes/ / bsam pa dag dang bag chags khong du chud/ / thams cad 'jig par byed pa gang yang med/ /
de dag las dang las min rab tu shes/ / las dang rnam par 'gal bar mi byed de; ; las kyi rnam par smin pa chud mi gzon/ / rgyu las 'byung ba'i chos kyang shin tu ston/ /
'di na sems can gang yang 'khor ba med/ / sems can 'byung bar de dag mi byed de/ / sems can rnams la gnas pa med par smras/ / sems can rgyud kyi brda yang rab tu rtogs/ /

Enlightening beings perfect profound mental power, Attaining mastery of all the teachings; The blessings of their petitions and appreciation They dedicate by unimpeded means.
The enlightened ones of past, present, and future Beautify buddha-lands throughout the cosmos: Enlightening beings, fulfilling all virtues, Dedicate them to purify lands the same way.
The teachings of Buddhas of all times Enlightening beings ponder carefully, Taking them all into their minds, Thereby adorning the buddha-lands.
Be the virtues of all buddha-lands extolled Throughout all eons of past, present, and future, The eons of all time may be exhausted But the virtues of buddha-lands have no end.
All such buddha-lands Do enlightening beings see: Therewith is adorned one buddha-land And all buddha-lands, this way.
There are Buddha-children whose minds are pure, All born by transformation from the enlightening teaching, With all virtues adorning their minds, Who fill all buddha-lands.
Those enlightening beings all are endowed With bodies adorned with infinite signs of greatness; With powers of clarification their teaching fills the world, Inexhaustible as the ocean.
Enlightening beings sojourn in many concentrations And have fulfilled all necessary practices; Their minds are pure beyond compare And their light illumines all worlds.
Thus are all buddha-lands Filled with such enlightening beings: They’ve never thought of the listeners’ vehicle Or sought the individual illuminates’ way.
Thus are enlightening beings pure of heart, Dedicating virtues to all living beings, Wanting to cause all to become truly enlightened And fully know the Buddha’s truths.
All demons and enemies in the ten directions The enlightening beings’ awesome power subdues; Their intrepid knowledge and wisdom are invincible As they practice with certainty the ultimate way.
Due to enlightening beings’ great will power Their dedications cannot be hindered; They enter the inexhaustible treasury of virtue Which is forever endless, throughout all time.
Enlightening beings observe all conditioned things And understand their nature is not independent; Thus knowing the nature of things is like this They don’t wrongly grasp acts or results.
There are no things with form, nor formless things; Nor are there concepts of being or nonbeing; Existence and nonexistence—neither exist; They realize all are ungraspable.
All things are born of causes and conditions— Their essential nature is neither existent or nonexistent; And in causes and conditions, what they produce They ultimately have no attachments at all.
Of what all sentient beings say They ultimately don’t grasp anything; They know names and signs are all mentation And clearly understand things are identityless.
As the nature of sentient beings is fundamentally null, So do they know all things are null; All things in past, present, and future, Lands and deeds—all are equal.
Such knowledge do they dedicate, Virtous action born according to their understanding: The signs of these virtues too they understand thus, That there’s nothing to grasp therein.
Thus their mind of dedication’s unsullied; Never calculating the nature of things, Comprehending their nature is not a nature, They do not dwell in the world yet do not leave it.
The good works which they do They dedicate to all living beings, Not failing to realize their true nature, Abandoning discrimination.
All the false views there are They abandon entirely; Free from inflaming afflictions, always cool, They abide in the unobstructed state of liberation.
Enlightening beings do not destroy anything Or annihilate the nature of things: They understand all things are like echoes And have no attachment to them at all.
They know all sentient beings of all times Come from combinations of causes and conditions: They also know their inclinations and habits And never annihilate anything.
They realize the nature of actions is not action And yet do not contradict the characteristics of things, And they do not destroy the results of deeds, But explain the nature of things as conditional.
They understand sentient beings have no birth And there are no sentient beings to transmigrate: There are no real sentient beings to speak to, But according to conventional norms they provisionally teach.
bsod nams mi zad pa'i mdzod ces bya ba ste/ yongs su bsngo ba lnga pa'o/ /

“What is great enlightening beings’ dedication causing all roots of goodness to endure? Here the enlightening beings may be rulers of great nations, their virtue extending to all, their fame shaking the world; their enemies all submit to them, and their commands are all based on correct principles. They hold a single canopy that gives shade to all quarters, and travel everywhere as leaders of the land, unobstructed wherever they turn, tying on the turban of nondefilement. They are sovereign masters of the law, and all who see them submit. They do not torture or punish people, yet all obey, moved by their virtue. They deal with sentient beings with liberality, kind words, beneficial actions, and cooperation; as universal rulers, they provide for everyone.

dbang phyug de lta bu la gnas shing / de lta bu'i chos la gnas pa/ g.yog dang 'khor mang po shin tu 'dus pa/ gzugs dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad blta bas mi ngom pa; yid la kha na ma tho ba med pa/ bsod nams rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa/ zil gyis mi non pa'i mtshan dang ldan pa/ lus shin tu rnam par phye ba mdzes pa dang ldan pa/ blta na bzang ba/ tshul dang mthun pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ stobs dang ldan pa/ thub pa med pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ stobs chen po dang ldan pa/ mthu bo che'i lus kyis bzung ba/ rnam par dag pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ bsgribs pa med pa'i las rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa de/

“Enlightening beings, abiding in such sovereign virtues, have a great retinue; they cannot be undermined, they are rid of all faults. No one ever tires of seeing them; adorned with felicitous virtues, their marks of greatness and embellishments are fully developed. Their bodies and limbs are well proportioned, and they have robust, healthy, ideal human bodies. Their great strength is consummate and they cannot be constrained or overcome by anyone. They attain pure action and are free from all barriers caused by actions.

zas yongs su gtong ba'am/ btung ba'am/ ro'am/ bzhon pa'am; gos sam/ me tog gam/ phreng ba'am/ spos sam/ byug pa'am/ mal cha'am/ gnas sam/ rgyab rten nam/ mar me'am/ sgron ma'am/ nad kyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad rnams sbyin pa'am/ rin po ches gzhal ba'i snod sna tshogs bkang zhing yongs su gtong ba dang / shing rta sna tshogs dang / shing rta du ma bkang zhing / tshad med pa'i rin po che dang nor yongs su gtong ba dang / glang po cang shes sam/ rta cang shes rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa gtong ba dang / slong ba rnams la ci rigs su rgyal po'i stan bzang po gtong ba'am/ gdugs gtong ba'am/ rgyal mtshan dang ba dan gtong ba'am/ rin po che gtong zhing sbyin pa'am/ rgyan dang lhab lhub kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'am/ cod pan nam/ gtsug gi nor bu dag dbang phyug la spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas mtshon chas bcings shing btson ra na 'dug pa'i sems can rnams mthong nas nor thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / g.yog dang bdag tu bcas te byin nas btson ra de dag nas sems can rnams yongs su thar par byed pa/ gsad sar khrid pa mthong nas bdag gi lus dang srog yongs su btang ste gsad pa de slu bar byed pa/ gtsug phud dang thor pag tu bcas pa'i mgo bo dag kyang slong bas bslangs na gtong ba med pa'i sems kyis gtong ba/ mig gnyis yongs su gtong ba'am/ rna ba dang sna yongs su gtong ba'am/ so dang lce yongs su gtong ba'am/ mgo yongs su gtong ba'am/ rkang lag yongs su gtong ba'am/ rang lus kyang dral zhing slong ba la khrag yongs su gtong ba'am/ sha dang rkang yongs su gtong ba'am/ slong ba la rang gi lus las snying phyung ste yongs su gtong ba'am/ slong zhing len pa sna tshogs la sgyu ma dang / mtsher pa dang / mkhal ma dang / pho ba rnams yongs su gtong ba'am/ rang gi lus las yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa bslangs na/ dad pa'i sems kyis yongs su gtong ba'am/ slong ba la mos par lta bas pags pa dang mdog yongs su gtong ba'am/ rkang lag las sor mo yongs su gtong ba'am/ chos 'dod pa'i phyir rang gi sha dang / sen mo yongs su gtong ba'am/

“They fully practice all giving; sometimes they give food and drink, sometimes they give delicacies, sometimes they give conveyances, or clothing, or flower garlands, or incenses and perfumes, beds, seats, houses, lamps, medicines, precious vessels, jeweled carriages, trained elephants and horses, all magnificently adorned—they give all these gladly. If any come and ask for their throne, or canopies or parasols, banners, pennants, treasures, or other adornments, or the jeweled crowns on their heads, or the radiant jewels in their topknots, or even the rank of ruler itself, they begrudge nothing. If they see sentient beings in prison, they give up their treasures, their spouses, children, retinue, and even their own bodies, to rescue them and free them. If they see prisoners about to be executed, they give up their bodies in exchange for those prisoners’ lives. Then again, if they see anyone come begging from them, begging for even their flesh or hair, they gladly give them ungrudgingly; their eyes, ears, noses, tongues, teeth, heads, hands, feet, blood, flesh, bones, marrow, internal organs, skin, fingers, toes, and nails, all they give with a joyful heart.

chos shin tu dkon pa tshol zhing / mes gang ba'i 'obs mi 'greng lag btags bdun du mchong bar byed pa'am/ chos bsrung ba'i phyir sdug bsngal myong ba thams cad kyang rang gi lus kyis bzod par byed pa'am/ chos tshol zhing chos kyi tshig dang yi ge 'bru gcig gi phyir yang rgya mtsho'i mthar thug pa'i sa chen po yongs su gtong ba'am/ chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug byed pa'am/ mi dge ba'i chos las sems can rnams bzlog ste dge ba'i chos la rab tu sbyor ba'am/ skyes bu'i mtshan gcod pa mthong nas sdig pa'i las de dag las sems can de dag rnam par zlog par byed pa'am/

“In their quest for teachings they have never heard they would hurl themselves into pits of fire. In order to preserve the true teaching of the Buddhas they would endure all kinds of pain. In seeking the teaching, for even one word of it they can give up everything within the four seas. They continually civilize and guide sentient beings by means of right teaching, causing them to cultivate good practices and abandon evil. If they see sentient beings physically harming others, they kindly rescue them and cause them to give up wrongdoing.

de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par sangs rgyas par 'jig rten thams cad du sgrog cing / gtsug lag khang dang pho brang gi longs spyod kyi phyir sa dang khams yongs su gtong ba'am/ rim gro bya ba'i phyir bran dang / las byed pa'i mi rnams gtong ba'am/ slong ba la rim gro bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid 'bul ba'am/ chos la dad pas dga' zhing mgu ba'i sems rnyed nas rang gi lus kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la rim gro byed pa'am/ bdag nyid sems can thams cad la gtong ba'am/ sangs rgyas thams cad la rim gro bya ba'i phyir rgyal srid yongs su gtong ba'am/ slong ba rnams ci rigs su yul dang mir bcas pa'am/ grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang ngam/ rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa yongs su gtong ba'am/ slong ba la bu dang bu mo dang chung ma dag yongs su gtong ba'am/ slong ba rnams la ci rigs su khyim thams cad yongs su sbyin zhing gtong ba'am/ bza' shing gi ra ba sbyin pa'am/ slong ba sna tshogs dang / len pa sna tshogs dang / sems can sna tshogs dang / gang zag sna tshogs sems sna tshogs dang ldan pa la phyogs tha dad pa nas 'ongs ba tshad las 'das pa'i mi dang / mi sna tshogs dang / sbyin pa'i gnas sna tshogs la mchod sbyin bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong du ma grangs med pa rnams byed cing yongs su gtong ba'am/ de sbyin pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i tshe sems 'di ltar bskyed de yongs su bsngo zhing / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi snying po'i rjes su song bas gzugs shin tu bzung ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi snying po'i rjes su song bas tshor ba shin tu bzung ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi snying po'i rjes su song bas 'du shes shin tu bzung ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi snying po'i rjes su song bas 'du byed shin tu bzung ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi snying po'i rjes su song bas rnam par shes pa shin tu bzung ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi snying po'i rjes su song bas srid pa thams cad shin tu bzung ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi snying po'i rjes su song bas 'khor shin tu bzung ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi snying po'i rjes su song bas longs spyod shin tu bzung ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi snying po'i rjes su song bas sbyin pa shin tu bzung ba

“If they see Buddhas attain supreme enlightenment, they praise them, causing everyone to hear and know of them. They may donate land and provide for and attend to them. They may give their own bodies to those who ask, or they may give them to the Buddhas.
