Because of their quest for the truth they are extremely joyful; they provide service and support for sentient beings. They might give up their kingship, their cities, towns, villages, palaces, gardens and groves, spouses, children, and retinues, fulfilling all requests. Sometimes they give away all necessities of life to establish great assemblies of giving, from which none are prohibited, and provide for the needs of all the sentient beings who come—all kinds of fields of blessings—whether they come from afar or nearby, whether they are intelligent or stupid, no matter what they look like, whether they are male or female, whether human or nonhuman, their mental patterns different, their requirements each different; the enlightening give to all to satisfy everyone.
“When enlightening beings give in this way, they develop a mind of good control, with which they practice dedication: controlling the body well, controlling sensation, conception, action, and consciousness well, controlling sovereignty well, controlling followers well, controlling means of subsistence well, controlling generous giving well, they accordingly cause all roots of goodness to be firm and enduring.

des dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ bla na med par dmigs nas bza' ba dang btung ba 'di dag 'di ltar btang ba dang / 'di ltar byin pa dang / 'di ltar chags pa med pa dang / 'di ltar bcings pa med pa dang / 'di ltar nye bar btang ba dang / 'di ltar ma bzung ba dang / 'di ltar lhag par bsam pa dang / 'di ltar dngos po yongs su btang ba dang / 'di ltar dmigs pa la mi gnas pa dang / 'di ltar gtong ba dang ldan pas sems can thams cad ye shes kyi kha zas dang ldan pa dang / chags pa med pa la brtson pa/ sems kyi zas yongs su shes pa dang; chags pa med pa'i zas dang / dga' ba'i zas dang / zang zing med pa'i zas dang / ye shes kyis 'tsho ba dang / chos kyis brtan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su bzung ba'i chos kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku la yang dag par spyod pa dang / sbyin pa'i gnas dang / snying brtse ba'i kha zas rab tu len par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zas sbyin pa de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Whatever great enlightening beings give, their charity being boundless, they dedicate those roots of goodness in this way: when they give fine food to sentient beings, their minds are pure and have no covetousness or attachment to what they give, nor do they begrudge anything; they practice giving fully, praying that all sentient beings gain the food of knowledge and wisdom, their minds unobstructed, comprehending the nature of food and having no greed or attachment, only enjoying the food of truth and the food of emancipation, filled with knowledge and wisdom, firmly abiding by the truth, embodying roots of goodness, with the body of reality and the body of knowledge traveling in purity; taking pity on sentient beings, to be fields of blessing they appear to take solid food. This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of good roots when they give food.

byang chub sems dpa' btung ba'i sbyin pa gtong ba'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos kyi btung ba 'thung ba la brtson pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i skom pa rgyun chad pa dang; sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi skom pa las mi ldog pa dang / 'dod pa'i yul gyis skom pa las phyir ldog pa dang / chos kyis tshim pa'i dga' ba rab tu 'thob pa dang / chos kyi sku shin tu tshim pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis tshim par byed pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / shes rab rgya mtsho la zhugs pa dang / chos kyi ri rab dang ldan pa dang / chos kyi btung bas ngoms par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po btung ba'i sbyin pa de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings give something to drink, they dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: they pray that all sentient beings drink of the water of the flavor of truth, diligently cultivate the whole way of enlightening beings, cut off thirst for the world, always seek enlightened knowledge, leave the realm of desire, attain the joy and bliss of truth, produce their bodies from the pure teaching, always tune and control their minds by means of concentration, enter the ocean of knowledge, produce great clouds of teaching, shower great rain of teaching. This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when they give things to drink.

byang chub sems dpa' bro ba'i sbyin pa skyon thams cad bsal nas rnam par dag pa skyur ba dang / mngar ba dang / kha ba dang / bro ba dang / tsha ba dang / bska ba sna tshogs kyi ro mchog dang ldan pa/ shin tu 'jam pa'i ro mchog gi rnam pa dang ldan pa/ ro sna tshogs bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong bsags pa dang ldan pa/ khams rnams mnyam zhing 'khrugs pa med par gzhog pas lus kyi stobs ston par byed pa/ sems dga' ba/ dad cing mos pa dang / spro ba dang / gsal ba bskyed pa/ zhim zhing tshul dang ldan pa'i ro'i dam par gyur pa/ nang gi dbang po rnam par dag par byed pa; lto la bde bas yang dag par ston pa/ snyoms pa thams cad sel bar byed pa/ nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa/ nad med par byed pa/ rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ro dam pa sna tshogs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa slong zhing len pa sna tshogs la sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad bdud rtsi'i ros brtan pa'i sems kyis ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad kha zas kyi ro thams cad kyi las yongs su shes shing / chos kyi ro'i ye shes la rab tu gnas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gnas pa'i mtha'i chos kyi grong khyer du phyin te/ chos kyi ro du ma'i chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rgyas par byed pas 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ngal zhugs shing chos kyi sprin gyi char 'bebs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i chos kyi dga' bas rgyud tshim par gyur te/ ye shes mchog gi ro la sems rnam par gzhog par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ro thams cad kyi mtshan ma la mi 'dzin pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos la brtson pa'i sems dang ldan zhing / ro'i mchog thams cad la chags pa med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu 'jug pas byung bas chos kyi ro gcig par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa las phyir mi ldog cing ro mchog gi ngo bo nyid las byung bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad dbang po thams cad dbye ba'i ye shes la mngon par mkhas pas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ro tha dad pa med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsgribs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis tshim par spyod cing / chos kyi ros yid rgyas par gyur cig / ces de ltar ro'i sbyin pa'i tshogs la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi ye shes chags pa med pa'i phung po sna tshogs bsgrub pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' bzhon pa'i sbyin pa gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa la zhon par gyur cig / theg pa chen po rab tu thob cing rnam par zhig pa med pa'i theg pa dang / mchog gi theg pa dang / dam pa'i theg pa dang / mgyogs pa'i theg pa dang / stobs chen po'i theg pa dang / bsod nams dang ldan pa'i theg pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa dang / mtha' yas pa'i theg pas byung ste yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzhon pa'i sbyin par gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' gos kyi sbyin pa gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyis rab tu yog pa'i lus kyi phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / cha byad ngan pa thams cad rnam par bzlog par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / lus sba bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / lus kyis 'khyud na lus la bde bar reg par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / kha dog dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / kha dog 'jam par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / kha dog shin tu 'jam par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / bde bar 'gro ba rab tu 'thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas bde bar bsnyen bkur bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo bar byed do/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po me tog gi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dra sna tshogs kyi me tog dang / kha dog rnam pa tha dad pa'i me tog dang / yid du 'ong ba'i me tog du ma dang / mig tu 'ong ba'i me tog dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i me tog dang / dus thams cad na yod pa'i me tog dang / lha rdzas dang mi'i me tog dang / 'od mdzes pa'i me tog dang / shin tu dri che zhing yid du 'ong bar mdzes pa'i me tog dang / 'di lta bu'i me tog rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon du gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten rnams la 'bul ba dang / chos dkon mchog la mchod pa byed pa dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog la 'bul ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen byang chub sems dpa' la 'bul ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / pha dang ma rnams la sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe chung du na bdag gi lus dang de ma yin pa gzhan bkren pa phongs pa slong zhing len pa sna tshogs la de dang de dag sbyin par bya ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad chos thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pa'i sems dang ldan pas/ sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi me tog rgyas pa rab tu mthong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas la dga' ba rab tu rnyed nas blta na mi ngoms par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems can kun gyi sems mi 'khrugs pas blta na yid du 'ong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i las la lta zhing nye bar spyod pas lta ba yangs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la lta ba dang / sems ma nyams pas rjes su lta ba'i dran pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyi nyon mongs pa'i dug bsreg pa'i phyir dug sman bzang po nyams su myong ba lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi rgyal po chen po la 'gro ba thams cad 'god pas smon lam chen po mthong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems can kun gyi rab rib dang / thing tog dang / mun pa bsal ba'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba mthong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub kyi zla 'od dge ba rnam par spel ba'i phyir zla ba lta bur mthong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong zhing chos kyi rnam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyis rgya mtsho'i rin po che'i gling du 'jug pa mthong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad kyis bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag pa rab tu 'thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba'i me tog yongs su gtong bar gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag de ltar yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings give various flavors — pungent, sour, salty, bland, as well as sweet, various flavors, rich, able to cause the body’s elements to be settled and harmonious, the skin and body well developed, the energy strong, the heart clear and pure and always joyful; not causing vomiting when eaten, making the senses clear and sharp, the internal organs fully developed and impervious to poison and disease, without distress, forever attaining comfort. These roots of goodness they dedicate in this way: ‘May all sentient beings gain the supreme flavor of ambrosia; may all sentient beings obtain the flavor of the knowledge of truth, and comprehend the function of all flavors; may all sentient beings obtain the flavor of infinite truths, know the realm of reality, and abide at peace in the great citadel of truth in ultimate reality; may all sentient beings produce great clouds of teachings throughout the cosmos, shower the rain of truth everywhere, teach, edify, and civilize all sentient beings; may all sentient beings gain the flavor of supreme knowledge, that the unexcelled joy of truth fill their minds and bodies; may all sentient beings obtain all the excellent flavors of nonattachment, and not be addicted to mundane tastes, but always diligently cultivate and practice all aspects of buddhahood; may all sentient beings gain the flavor of one truth and realize that all Buddha teachings are without difference; may all sentient beings gain the flavor of supreme victory and ride on omniscience, never turning back; may all sentient beings gain the flavor of entry into the truth of the nondifference of all Buddhas, and be able to distinguish all faculties; may all sentient beings attain increase of the savor of the teaching and always be able to fulfill the Buddhas’ teaching of nonobstruction.’ This is the great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving flavorings, to cause all sentient beings to cultivate virtue and all be fully endowed with the body of unobstructed knowledge.
“When great enlightening beings give conveyances, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings gain the vehicle of complete omniscience, and ride in the Great Vehicle, the indestructible vehicle, the supreme vehicle, the highest vehicle, the swift vehicle, the vehicle of great power, the vehicle replete with virtue, the vehicle leaving mundanity, the vehicle that produces the innumerable enlightening beings.’ This is the great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving conveyances.
“When great enlightening beings give clothing, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings gain the raiment of shame and conscience wherewith to cover their bodies; may they give up the erroneous practice of heretics who expose their bodies; may their color be lustrous and their skin fine and soft; may they attain the foremost bliss of the Buddhas, and attain the most pure comprehensive knowledge of ways of liberation.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving clothing.
“Great enlightening beings are constantly giving out various fine flowers—flowers of subtle fragrance, flowers of various colors, innumerable extraordinary flowers, beautiful flowers, delightful flowers, flowers of all seasons, celestial flowers, flowers of the human world, highly prized flowers, extremely fragrant and delightful flowers—innumerable such fine flowers they offer to living Buddhas and to the shrines of extinct Buddhas, to those who expound the teaching, to mendicants, to all enlightening beings, to good teachers, to Buddhist disciples, to self-enlightened ones, to parents, relatives, even themselves, as well as to all the poor and destitute. When they give, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain the flowers of concentration of the Buddhas, able to cause all the teachings to bloom; may all sentient beings become as pleasing and endlessly delightful to all they meet, as the Buddhas are; may all sentient beings be satisfied by what they see, and be free from disturbance and agitation; may all sentient beings fully carry out far-reaching pure works; may all sentient beings always remember good associates, their minds unchanging; may all sentient beings be like all-curing medicine, able to remove the toxins of all afflictions; may all sentient beings fulfill great vows and all get to be rulers of unexcelled knowledge; may all sentient beings, with the light of the sun of knowledge and wisdom, destroy the darkness of ignorance and folly; may all sentient beings’ pure moon of enlightenment wax full; may all sentient beings enter the land of great treasures, meet true knowers, and fully develop all roots of goodness.’ This is the great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving flowers, to cause sentient beings to all attain pure, unobstructed knowledge.

byang chub sems dpa' phreng ba'i sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de sems can thams cad blta na mdzes pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / blta na yid du 'ong ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / blta na bzang ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / blta na sdug pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / blta na mngon par dga' ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / blta na mya ngan med pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / blta na rab tu dga' ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / blta na yid mi bde ba med pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas mthong ba dang ldan pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa mthong ba rnam par dag pa 'thob pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/ de ltar na/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phreng ba'i sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' spos kyi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar bsngo ste/ spos yongs su btang bas bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad tshul khrims kyi spos dang ldan par gyur cig / ma nyams pa'i tshul khrims dang / ma 'dres pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnyog pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'gyod pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / kun nas 'khor pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa'i tshul khrims dang / log par ma zhugs pa'i tshul khrims dang / mtha' yas pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur cig / tshul khrims kyi phung po gang dang sangs rgyas thams cad dang ldan pa de'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang sems can thams cad ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spos kyi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings give garlands, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be a pleasure for all people to behold, so that all who see them admire them, all who see them feel friendly toward them, all who see them like them, all who see them look up to them, all who see them are relieved of anxiety, all who see them become joyful, all who see them give up evil, all who see them may always approach the Buddhas, and all who see them are purified and attain omniscience.’ This is the great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving garlands.
“When great enlightening beings give incense, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be filled with the fragrance of morality, and attain to the standards of not being heedless, not being impure, not being defiled, having nothing to regret, becoming free from bondage, being unfrenzied, nontransgression, nonextremism, emancipation from the world, and the transcendent ways of enlightening beings. May all sentient beings, by these precepts, all accomplish the body of morality of all Buddhas.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving incense, in order to cause sentient beings all to be able to complete the body of unobstructed morality.
bam po sum cu rtsa lnga pa /

byang chub sems dpa' byug pa'i sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsdo ste/ byug pa'i sbyin pas yongs su bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad gtong pa thams cad yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pas bsgos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyis shin tu rnam par dag cing tshul khrims kyis bsgos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chags pa med pa'i bsam pa rab tu thob cing bzod pas bsgos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la brtson 'grus kyi go cha bgos shing brtson 'grus kyis bsgos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas mngon du bzhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pas bsam gtan gyis bsgos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyal po la skad cig gis rnam par dag cing shes rab kyis bsgos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'jigs pa med pa rab tu 'thob cing chos kyis bsgos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad yon tan thams cad kyi ye shes rab tu thob cing yon tan gyis bsgos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob cing byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su bsngo ba thams cad kyis bsgos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i chos thams cad rab tu spangs shing chos dkar pos bsgos par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byug pa'i sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' mal cha'i sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad shes rab dang / ye shes chen po thob pa'i phyir lha rdzas kyi mal cha rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad so so'i skye bo ma yin pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi gos bgo ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i mal rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad yongs su spang ba'i phyir bde ba'i mal rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par rol ba'i cho 'phrul yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir rin po che lta bu'i mal rab tu thob par gyur cig/ sems can thams cad chos thams cad legs par bkod pa'i gos bgo ba'i phyir mnyam pa med pa'i mal rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zil gyis mi non pa rnam par dag pas rgya chen po'i mal rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi bde ba dang ldan pas dge ba'i mal rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dmigs pa la brtson pas shin tu dag pa'i mal rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyabs pa dang ldan pas shin tu brtan pa'i mal rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas gzims pa lta bur glo g.yas pas 'bebs pa dang ldan pas seng+ge'i mal rab tu thob par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis shin tu bsam pa'i dbang po yang dag par rgyu ba dang ldan pa mal cha'i sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gnas kyi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad yon tan gyi gnas la brtson zhing ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas spyod yul du gyur pa dang / gnas pa med cing rten pa med pa'i gnas nas mi g.yo ba dang / gnas thams cad rnam par sgom pa dang / 'jig rten gyi gnas nas rnam par 'das pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gnas yongs su zin pa dang / bla na med pa'i gnas kyi mthar phyin pa dang / bde ba'i gnas la brtson pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas la shin tu gnas pa dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gnas dang mi 'bral zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la gnas par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar sems pa/ sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo bas yongs su skyob pa la gnas kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la de ltar yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' rgyab rten gyi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun la phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems kyis ye shes kyi rten chen po la spyod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rten la spyod pa dang / bla ma'i rten la spyod pa dang / legs par spyod pa'i rten la spyod pa dang / byams pa chen po'i rten la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po'i rten la spyod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems shin tu yangs pa'i rten la spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lam gyi rten la spyod cing / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rten la spyod par gyur cig / ces yongs su bsngo'o/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgya brten gyi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad yon tan thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / shin tu dag par 'gyur ba dang / ye shes rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / lam rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / chos rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / bsam pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / mos pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / smon lam rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / mngon par shes pa'i yon tan dang / ye shes rnam par dag par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings give perfumes, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be perfumed with the fragrance of generosity, able to give whatever they have. May all sentient beings be perfumed with the fragrance of morality, attaining the ultimately pure morality of the enlightened. May all sentient beings be perfumed with the fragrance of tolerance, giving up all harmful intentions. May all sentient beings be perfumed with the fragrance of energy, always wearing the armor of heroic effort of the great vehicle. May all sentient beings be perfumed with the fragrance of concentration, abiding peacefully in the concentration in which the Buddhas appear to them. May all sentient beings be perfumed with the fragrance of wisdom, in a single moment becoming sovereigns of unexcelled knowledge. May all sentient beings be perfumed with the fragrance of truth, attaining fearlessness in the highest teaching. May all sentient beings be perfumed with the fragrance of virtue, developing all knowledge of great merit and virtue. May all sentient beings be perfumed with the fragrance of enlightenment, attain the ten powers of buddhahood, and reach the other shore. May all sentient beings be perfumed with the sublime fragrance of pure ways and forever annihilate all bad qualities.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving perfumes.
“When great enlightening beings give couches, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings obtain celestial couches and realize great knowledge and wisdom; may all sentient beings obtain the couch of sages, give up the mentality of ordinary men and abide in the aspiration for enlightenment; may all sentient beings obtain the couch of peace and happiness, forever parting from all the pains and afflictions of birth and death; may all sentient beings obtain the couch of the ultimate and get to see the autonomous spiritual powers of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings obtain the couch of equanimity, and always cultivate all good ways; may all sentient beings obtain the couch of supremacy and fulfill pure action which has no peer in the world; may all sentient beings obtain the couch of tranquility, realize the truth and reach ultimate reality; may all sentient beings obtain the couch of purity, and cultivate the Buddha’s sphere of pure knowledge; may all sentient beings obtain the couch of security and have the constant protection of good teachers; may all sentient beings obtain the couch of lions and lie on their right sides the way Buddhas do.’ This is the great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving couches.
“When great enlightening beings give rooms and shelters, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings gain peaceful residence in pure buddha-lands and diligently cultivate all virtues, abide peacefully in the realm of profound concentration and give up all attachment to dwelling places, realize all dwelling places have no existence, detach from all worlds, abide in omniscience, take in the abodes of all Buddhas, live in the abode of peace and comfort of the ultimate path, always rest on supremely pure roots of goodness, and never leave the unexcelled abode of the Buddhas.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving shelters, because they wish to benefit all sentient beings and think of how to help them out according to their needs.
“When great enlightening beings give places to live, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings obtain what is really good for them, that their minds be happy and at peace; may all sentient beings live according to the Buddha, according to great knowledge, according to good teachers, according to what is most worthy of respect, according to good actions, according to great kindness, according to great compassion, according to the six ways of transcendence, according to the great determination for enlightenment, and according to the path of all enlightening beings.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving places to live, because they want to cause everyone’s virtue, ultimate state, knowledge, path, principles, morality, aspirations, faith, vows, and all qualities of spiritual faculties, to be pure.

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di lta ste/ til mar gyi mar me'am/ mar gyi mar me'am/ rin po che'i mar me'am/ nor bu'i mar me'am/ ro'i mar me'am/ mar me chen po'am/ a.a ga ru'i mar me'am/ tsan+dan gyi mar me'am/ spos kyi ro thams cad kyi mar me'am/ kha dog mtha' yas par snang ba'i mar me'am/ rnam pa de lta bu'i mar me dag de yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pa byed pa na/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'gro ba thams cad la bde ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ mar me sbyin pas yongs su bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos la snang ba mtha' yas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten thams cad shin tu phra ba dmigs par bya ba'i phyir snang ba shin tu gsal zhing dang bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems can med pa'i khams yongs su shes shing snang ba rab rib med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'od 'gyed pa'i lus su mngon par byung zhing snang ba mtha' yas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos thams cad la phyir mi ldog pa'i sems dang ldan zhing 'od kun tu snang ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad snang bar byed pa dang ldan zhing / sangs rgyas kyi 'od rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings thams cad 'od gcig gis rgyas par byed cing thogs pa med pa'i snang ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i zhing du 'od zer rab tu 'gyed cing snang ba dpag tu med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi skar mdas 'gro ba thams cad snang bar byed pa'i 'od dang ldan zhing 'od snang ba'i skar mda'i rgyal po lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad zhing kun tu 'od 'gyed pa'i rnam par 'phrul pas byung zhing snang ba kha dog mtha' yas par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mar me'i sbyin pa rab tu gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / sems can thams cad la bde ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su bzung bas yongs su 'dzin to/ / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa bas yang dag par bzung bas yang dag par 'dzin to/ / sems can thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i skal pas bgo bsha' byed do/ / sems can thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa bas snying brtse bar byad do/ / sems can thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i skal ba sbyin par byed do/ / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa bas rab tu 'dzin to/ / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa bas sbyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa bas dmigs par byed do/ / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par byed de/ / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba shes pas rnam par dpyod par byed de; de ltar mar me sbyin pas bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de ci nas kyang sems can thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rab tu dgod pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba thogs pa med par 'gro pas de lta de ltar yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nad kyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ de dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad dmigs pa kun las shin tu 'das par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rab tu thob cing lus nad med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i nad thams cad sos par gyur te sman lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa'i tshul gyis sman a.a ga ru lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa'i dug gi gsal shing 'byin cing sangs rgyas kyi sman du gyur cig / sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par sbyong ba'i spyod pa dang ldan zhing nye bar bgrod pa'i ngang tshul can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad shin tu mi 'khrugs pa'i chos dang ldan zhing sman gyi rgyal po lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad gso ba la zhugs shing sman gyi sdong po lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi snang ba rab tu thob cing nad thams cad byang bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sman gyi sbyor ba la brtson pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi sman la mkhas par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sman gyi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad shin tu gso ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / shin tu bde zhing dga' ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o; / sems can thams cad shin tu rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas snyun mi mnga' ba lta bu rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o; ; sems can thams cad kyi zug rngu thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi lus nyams pa med cing brtan pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad rdo rje'i ri khor yug lta bur gzhom du mi chom pa dang / stobs dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad stobs thams cad kyis brtan cing bsam pa shin tu mtho ba thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi bde ba'i rnam pa zil gyis mi non pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi lus sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis brtan pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snod sna tshogs dang / bre dang / lnga bre'i sbyin pa byed pa 'di lta ste/ gser gyi snod dang / gser gyi bre dang / lnga bre rin po che sna tshogs kyis yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ dngul gyi snod dang / dngul gyi bre dang / lnga bre rin po che sna tshogs kyis yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ bai DUr+ya'i snod dang / bai DUr+ya'i bre dang / lnga bre rin po che rnam pa tha dad pas yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ shel gyi snod dang / shel gyi bre dang / lnga bre rin po che'i rgyan rnam pa tha dad pas yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ mu sa ra gal ba'i snod dang / mu sa ra gal ba'i bre dang / lnga bre mu tig dmar pos yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ asma gar+b+ha'i snod dang / asma gar+b+ha'i bre dang / lnga bre rin po che byi ru dang / nor bu rin po che 'od zer snang bas yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ rin po che shi la'i snod dang / rin po che shi la'i bre dang / lnga bre kha zas zhim po ro'i mchog sna tshogs kyis yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ tsan+dan gyi snod dang / tsan+dan gyi bre dang / lnga bre lha rdzas lta bu'i gos phrugs kyis yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ rdo rje snod dang / rdo rje'i bre dang / lnga bre spos rin po che bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ snod sna tshogs dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa'i tshogs kyis bkang ba dang / bre dang lnga bre du ma sna tshogs bsags par bye ba tshad med pa nor gyi dbyig dang / dngul dang / gser phyes yongs su bkang ba de dag yon gyi gnas bsam gyis mi khyab par mos pa'i sems dang ldan pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la 'bul lam/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen shin tu dkon par sems bskyed pas byang chub sems dpa' dkon mchog thams cad la 'bul lam/ sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa shin tu bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la 'bul lam/ 'phags pa'i skye bo la shin tu mos pa'i sems kyis gang zag gi rnam pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la 'bul lam/ bla ma la bsnyen bkur zhing bshes gnyen la rim gro bya ba'i sems kyis pha dang ma dag la sbyin pa byed dam/ de dang de dag tu yon tan gyi tshogs bsags pa dang / gdams ngag dang / bslab pa dang / 'phags pa'i bstan pa la gnas par brtson pas slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / sbyin pa'i gnas la 'bul lam/ sems can thams cad la zhe mi sdang ba'i mig gis byams pa yongs su bsgoms shing / gtong ba'i sems kyis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gcig tu nges par zhugs pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa thams cad brtson zhing tshogs chen po grangs med pas 'gro ba thams cad yongs su mi gtong zhing mi spang ba'i sems la shin tu gnas te sbyin pa'i dngos po thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa dang / yon gyi gnas thams cad rab tu bzung ba'i sems la gnas pas bkres pa dang phongs pa'i slong ba rnams la snod sna tshogs dang / bre dang / lnga bre yo byad kyi tshogs rnam pa tha dad pas yongs su bkang ba de dag sbyin pa dang / yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad dran pa'i dbang po nam mkha'i dbyings ltar yangs pa dang ldan te/ 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i skad thams cad gzung ba dang / blang ba dang / yid la bya ba'i dran pa rmongs pa med cing snod tshad med pa'i snying po can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo rgyun 'chad pa med pa'i chos can du gyur te/ snod bzang po rnam par dag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos yang dag par 'dzin pa'i chos can du 'gyur te/ bla na med pa'i snod rin po che lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub dbyer med pa la mos pas yang dag par bzung zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos yangs pa'i snod du gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa rgya che zhing mthu che ba la yang dag par gzhol bas rin po che'i snod rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa shin tu brgyan pa lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mtha' dang dbus med pa tshad med pa la mos pa rnam par dag cing / yon tan thams cad kyi snod dang 'byung gnas su gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa bsgribs pa med pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mthar gtugs te thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi khongs su chud par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems can gyi khams thams cad ma lus par thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs la rab tu gzhag pa'i phyir phyi ma'i mtha' bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i snod du gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung gi yan lag gis chos bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur te/ yon tan mchog thams cad dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi snod du gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la gsol ba 'debs pa dang / chos yongs su 'dri ba la smra ba'i sngon du 'gro ba'i skyes bur gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa gang bar byed pa shod ba'i snod du gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i snod du gyur pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings give lamps — butter lamps, oil lamps, jewel lamps, crystal lamps, lacquer lamps, fire lamps, aloe lamps, sandalwood lamps, lamps of all fragrances, lamps with lights of infinite colors—when they give innumerable such lamps, in order to benefit all sentient beings, to include all sentient beings, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain infinite light and illumine the true teachings of all Buddhas; may all sentient beings attain pure light, and clearly perceive the most subtle and minute forms in the world; may all sentient beings attain unclouded light, and realize that the realms of sentient beings are empty, without existence; may all sentient beings attain boundless light, so their bodies emit subtle radiance illumining everything; may all sentient beings attain all-illuminating light, and their minds never retreat from the teachings of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings attain the pure light of Buddhas, appearing in all lands; may all sentient beings attain unobstructed light, one light illumining everything in the cosmos; may all sentient beings attain uninterrupted light, illuminating the buddha-lands, the light unbroken; may all sentient beings attain the light of the banner of knowledge, illumining the world; may all sentient beings attain light of infinite colors, shining on all fields and manifesting spiritual powers.’ Thus enlightening beings, when they give lamps, wishing to benefit all sentient beings, to give peace and happiness to all sentient beings, follow all sentient beings by these roots of goodness, embrace all sentient beings by these roots of goodness, distribute to all sentient beings these roots of goodness, treat all sentient beings kindly by these roots of goodness, satisfy all sentient beings by these roots of goodness, take care of all sentient beings by these roots of goodness, rescue all sentient beings by these roots of goodness, focus their minds on sentient beings by these roots of goodness, equally benefit all sentient beings by these roots of goodness, and observe all sentient beings by these roots of goodness. This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving lamps. They dedicate thus without hindrance, causing sentient beings to dwell on roots of goodness.
“When enlightening beings give medicines, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain ultimate emancipation from all shrouds and bonds; may all sentient beings forever be rid of the body of sickness and attain the body of the enlightened; may all sentient beings become great medicines themselves, annihilating the sickness of all that is not good; may all sentient beings perfect the medicine that relieves all illness and abide securely in the enlightening beings’ stage of nonregression; may all sentient beings develop the medicines of enlightenment and be able to extract the poison arrows of all afflictions; may all sentient beings draw near to worthies and sages, annihilate afflictions, and cultivate pure practices; may all sentient beings become great physicians, forever eliminating all illnesses and not letting them recur; may all sentient beings be indestructible trees of medicine, able to cure all sentient beings; may all sentient beings attain the light of omniscience and remove the myriad arrows of sickness; may all sentient beings know how to formulate worldly medicines, to cure the illnesses there.’ When great enlightening beings give medicines, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way to cause all sentient beings to be forever free from sicknesses, to be ultimately at ease, to be ultimately pure, to be free from illusion like the Buddha, to remove the arrows of all sicknesses, to attain an inexhaustible, healthy body, to attain an indestructible body, to attain a strong body, to attain the complete comfort of Buddhahood, which cannot be taken away, and to attain the independent, strong body of all Buddhas.
“Great enlightening beings are able to generously give all kinds of vessels—gold vessels filled with jewels, silver vessels filled with jewels, lapis lazuli vessels filled with various precious substances, glass vessels filled with innumerable jewel ornaments, mother-of-pearl vessels filled with red pearls, agate vessels filled with coral, white jade vessels filled with myriad delicacies, sandalwood vessels filled with celestial raiment, diamond vessels filled with myriad sublime fragrances—countless precious vessels of all kinds, filled with innumerable various treasures; they give them to Buddhas, because they believe the Buddhas’ field of blessings is inconceivable; they give to enlightening beings, because they know that wise teachers are hard to find; they give to holy mendicants, to cause the Buddha teachings to remain in the world; they give to disciples of Buddhas and to individual illuminates, because they have pure faith in the sages; they give to their parents, out of respect; they give to their teachers and predecessors, that they may always teach, to induce the cultivation of virtues in accord with the injunctions of the sages; they give to the lowly, poor, and destitute, because they regard all sentient beings equally with the loving eye of great benevolence and compassion; they give out of devotion to fulfillment of the transcendent generosity of all enlightening beings of past, present, and future; they give everything to everyone, because they never reject sentient beings. When they give in this way, they have no attachment to the gift or the receiver.
“When great enlightening beings give various precious vessels filled with innumerable precious things like this, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings become vessels equal to the boundless receptacle of space, with vast recollective power able to absorb and retain all worldly and transmundane scriptures, without forgetting anything; may all sentient beings become vessels of purity, able to understand the extremely profound true teaching of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings become vessels of unexcelled jewels, able to receive and hold the teachings of Buddhas of all times; may all sentient beings become vast vessels of teaching of the enlightened, with indestructible faith taking in the methods of enlightenment of the Buddhas of all times; may all sentient beings become vessels adorned by supreme treasures, abiding in the most powerful will for enlightenment; may all sentient beings become vessels which are receptacles of virtue, developing pure faith in the infinite knowledge and wisdom of the enlightened; may all sentient beings become the vessel of approach and entry into omniscience and ultimately attain the unhindered liberation of the enlightened; may all sentient beings become vessels of enlightening practices throughout the future, able to cause sentient beings to all abide securely in the power of omniscience; may all sentient beings become vessels of the supreme qualities of the family of Buddhas of all times, able to receive and retain what is said by the Buddhas in their sublime voices; may all sentient beings become vessels containing the congregations and enlightenment scenes of all Buddhas of all worlds throughout the space of the cosmos, becoming great human beings, leaders in praising the Buddhas and requesting them to turn the wheel of true teaching.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving vessels, because they want to cause all sentient beings to be able to complete the vessel of the practice and vows of the Universally Good enlightening being.

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shing rta sna tshogs dang / shing rta du ma dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi shing rta tshad med pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / bla ma dang / ston pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dge 'dun dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sbyin pa'i gnas sna tshogs slong zhing len pa dang / phyogs gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i gang zag sna tshogs dang / phongs pa dang / bkren pa slong ba dpag tu med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sgra thos te 'ongs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid ches pas skabs phye ste 'ongs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi smon lam dang / sbyin pa'i sgra thos te 'ongs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / sems kyis bos shing bstabs pa de dag la sbyin zhing gtong ba 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i shing rta la rgyan gyis shin tu mdzes par byas pa sbyin pa'am/ gser gyi shing rta la dril bu'i dran bu'i dran pa rab tu 'khor bas brgyan pa rin po che'i srad bu'i lnga ldi bkye ba sbyin pa'am/ bai DUr+ya'i shing rta la rin po che bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma rnam pa sna tshogs kyis shin tu spras pa sbyin pa'am/ dngul gyi shing rta la shin tu dag pa'i gser rab tu bzang po'i dra bas g.yogs shing rta cang shes la bcas pa rin po che bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas brgyan cing klubs pa sbyin pa'am/ gser gyi shing rta la rin po che'i dra ba dang / rgyan thams cad phun sum tshogs pas brgyan cing glang po che cang shes la bcas pa sbyin pa'am/ tsan+dan gyi shing rta la rin po che'i dam pa sna tshogs kyis shin tu spras te rin po che'i seng+ge'i khris brgyan pa/ na chung brgya phrag stong zhon pa rgyan thams cad dang / rin po che sna tshogs thams cad kyi gdugs phun sum tshogs pa/ skyes bu cang shes brgya stong du mas drangs pa sbyin pa'am/ shel gyi shing rta la rin po che du mas kha dog rnam par 'byed par shin tu mdzes par byas shing / na chung bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pas yongs su gang ba/ rin po che'i bla re yog par bres pa/ rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sna tshogs kyis phyogs bzhi nas brgyan pa sbyin pa'am/ a.asma gar+b+ha'i shing rta la rin po che sna tshogs du mas shin tu mdzes par byas te spos sna tshogs dri zhim pos bdugs pa/ spos kyi dam pa thams cad kyi byug pas rab tu byugs pa/ me tog gi rgyan thams cad kyis chal par bkang ba/ bu mo brgya phrag stong gis rin po che'i srad bu thogs te 'khrul pa med par drangs pa sbyin pa'am/ dri zhim po sna tshogs kyi shing rta la ras dang gos sna tshogs kyi bla re bres pa rin po che'i dra bas yog par khebs pa/ spos dri zhim po shin tu yid du 'ong ba rnam par dag pa mi mthun pa med pa tshor na dga' ba shin tu 'thul ba mtshams kyi lha'i bus drangs pa/ rin po che'i 'khor lo rin po che thams cad kyis shin tu brgyan cing mdzes par byas pa sbyin pa'am/ rin po che thams cad tshogs pa'i 'od 'byung ba'i shing rta la kha dog rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba'i rin po che rnam pa du ma'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi dra ba'i bla re bres pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi phreng ba mtha' yas pa kun nas dbyangs pa/ bu dang bu mo bskyon pa/ spos sna tshogs kyi phye mas mtha' 'khor shin tu sbyangs pa/ sbyin pa byed pa na de dag las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la shing rta 'bul ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad sangs rgyas la yon tshad med pa 'bul bar dad cing sbyin pa'i gnas kyi dam pa la shin tu mos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i gnas mtha' yas pa rnam par dag pas sangs rgyas la rab tu brten par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gtong ba rgya chen po yongs su grub pas sangs rgyas thams cad la yongs su gtong bar mos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa bsgribs pa med pa rab tu thob cing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi smon lam dang bral te sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'i yon tan thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis myong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad mtha' yas pa'i ye shes la shin tu mos shing sangs rgyas la yon gsol ba zad mi shes par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyal pos rnam par dag cing ye shes kyi mchog la rab tu brten par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul thams cad du 'gro ba thob ste gang du dga' bar 'gro bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes mtha' yas pa'i 'byung gnas la rab tu 'khod pa 'grub pa'i phyir ye shes chen po la rab tu brten par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi zhing las rnam par skye ba'i chos can du gyur te bsod nams kyi zhing dam par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bskyed pas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mos shing sangs rgyas thams cad la mi dga' ba med pa'i sems su gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems kyi skad cig gcig gis chos kyi dbyings thams cad du ngal ba med par zhugs te sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su sgrub pa lhun gyis grub par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad kyi drung du phyin pas byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pas nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du shin tu rnam par phye ba'i lus la rab tu zhugs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gnas dpe med pa'i lus rab tu thob pas ngal zhing dub pa med par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gro bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i yid kyis 'gro ba dang ldan zhing lus kyi mgyogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems kyi skad cig gcig gis bsam pa dang khams khyab par byed pas sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba thams cad yang dag par ston pa'i snang ba gzhan zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / khyu mchog gi mthu 'byin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la bde bar 'gro bas rab tu brtson par gyur cig / sems can thams cad stobs bcu'i ye shes thams cad ma lus pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba thob pas shin tu myur du 'gro bar gyur cig/ sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings thams cad tha mi dad par 'jug pa la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud thams cad du 'gro ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / tshul shes te byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa khong du chud pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas 'dod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos nyid thams cad kyi rjes su song zhing chos ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bas 'dra ba med pa'i ye shes kyi tshul thob par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon du gyur pa'am/ de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten la shing rta 'bul pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa bsgribs pa med par 'byung ba'i mthar phyin par yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i bshes gnyen la shing rta 'bul ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad byas pa'i drin mi gtong ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi gtong ba'i sems stong ba med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad skal pa mnyam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang don mthun par gyur cig/ sems can thams cad gtong ba dang / yongs su gtong ba thams cad kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bla ma'i rim gros cher brtson par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang nye bar byas te spyad pa bsgrub pa'i phyir bsam pa dge ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mthun pa'i bsnyen bkur la nan tan byed pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems 'khrul pa med cing nyams pa med pa dang 'dres pa med cing rnyog pa med pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la grol ba'i bsam pa can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad yo byad ci 'dod pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la lus yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad byams pa dang ldan zhing 'khon med par rim gro byed pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung zhing rab tu brtan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kun tu mthun pa yang dag par mnyam pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mthun par gyur cig / sems can thams cad smon lam gcig pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las 'byung ba dang / stobs kyi mthar gtugs pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa yongs su dag pa dang mthun zhing gcig par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yul la rnam par 'phrul pa ye shes mngon par shes pas shes rab bzang pos chos kyi brtson 'grus la shin tu byung bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos thams cad gzung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthas gtugs par khong du chud pas rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thogs pa med pa'i theg pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar gtugs te theg pa chen pos mngon par spyod cing yang dag par gnas par gyur cig/ sems can thams cad bde ba'i phyogs las phyir mi ldog pa'i yid dang ldan zhing 'gro ba thams cad shes pa'i ye shes 'dzin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos la ji ltar thos pa bzhin du rmongs pa med pas chos thams cad la rab tu gzhol zhing ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i mngon par shes pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad la 'byung ba'i mthar thug ste sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba'i yid dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad nyams pa med pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dpe med pa rab tu thob pas mgyogs pa dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas 'gro bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / theg pa chen pos 'dul ba la rab tu zhugs pas 'gro zhing 'ong ba phun sum tshogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi shing rtas 'gro ba'i mthar thug pas gti mug med par 'gro bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis thams cad du 'gro ba'i tshul shes shing chags pa med pa'i shing rta bzhon pa dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i bshes gnyen la shing rta 'bul ba dang / yongs su gtong bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la tshul gyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas bsnyen cing bkur ba'i yongs su sgrub pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa thams cad la shin tu bslab pa'i sems dang ldan pa shes rab kyis shin tu rtogs pa'i bsam pa can/ yon tan gyis rnam par dag pa'i yid dang ldan pa/ mthun par yongs su gtong pa'i bsam pa can; dge 'dun rin po che shin tu dkon pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ tshogs rin po che la shin tu mos pa'i bsam pa can/ bstan pa rab tu gzung ba'i yid dang ldan pa/ lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu brtan pa'i bsam pa can/ rim gro byed pa dang ldan pa/ mchod sbyin chen po'i mchod sbyin shin tu byas pa/ bstan pa'i yon tan chen po brjod pa/ sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yon tan tha mi dad pas 'od gsal zhing rnyog pa med par dag pa de/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog la shing rta 'bul ba'i tshe dge 'dun dkon mchog la shing rta phul bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la yang dag par gzhol bas yang dag par zin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'phags pa'i skye mched las chos gzhan med par shin tu grub pas sems nang du gzhol bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas yang dag par bzung bas 'phags par red par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten kun gyi shes pas yid ches par bya bas grangs su bgrang bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings mi gnyis pa'i rang bzhin shes pa khong du chud pas chags pa med pa'i dbyings la yang dag par gzhol bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyis yang dag par byung bas cang shes kyi kun nas bskor bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rdul thams cad dang bral bas nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos la spyod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'phags pa'i dge 'dun so so'i skye bo med pa'i sas bla na med pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog rab tu brjod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chags pa med par gyur pa'i ye shes la shin tu brtson pa'i chos can du gyur te 'phags pa'i chos dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad khams gsum thams cad kyis gos pa med pa'i sems dang ldan zhing tshogs kyi rgyal po dam par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la mkhas pas legs par bcas pa'i ye shes kyi bzhon pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par shin tu 'gro ba'i 'gros la mkhas pas sems skad cig gi rdzu 'phrul rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing nam mkha' lta bu'i lus kyi shing rta sgrub par gyur cig / sems can thams cad nam mkha'i dbyings dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs par khyab par byed pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'gro ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad ma lus par gang du dga' bar 'gro zhing rgyu ba dang ldan pas lus yang ba'i khyad par rjes su rtogs pa rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus yang dag par ston pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi 'khor mtha' yas pa la mkhas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus 'phos pa med par 'gro ba yang dag par ston pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul chen po'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mig yor lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro ba mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes rab tu thob pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la mi gnas pa'i lus rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dus la ji ltar bab par sems can yongs su smin par byed cing 'dul ba mi gtong ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba yang dag par ston par gyur cig / sems can thams cad skad cig gcig gis chos kyi dbyings thams cad la chags pa med cing bsgribs pa med pa'i tshul gyis sems skad cig gcig gis phyogs thams cad du 'gro ba'i rdzu 'phrul la mngon par mkhas par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge 'dun la shing rta 'bul zhing yongs su gtong bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag de ltar sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta la gnas pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad shes pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i gnas kyi 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ rim gro can/ zhes dang ldan pa/ bdag nyid che ba'i yon tan rgya mtsho gang chen mtsho'i tshul la mkhas pa/ yon tan dang ye shes kyi 'byung gnas kyi rigs dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la rnam par sems pa/ mthu chen por skyes pa/ bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems dang ldan pa; byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dus brjod du med pa thams cad du spyod pa rnam par spyad pa la rab tu zhugs pa/ bdud kyi bcings pa thams cad las sems rab tu grol ba/ bdud du ma'i sde dang bdud thams cad kyi shes pa'i stobs rab tu 'joms pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ gzhal du med pa'i chos la mkhas pas snang bar gyur pa de/

“Great enlightening beings give various chariots, adorned with jewels, to the Buddhas, to enlightening beings, teachers, worthy companions, disciples of Buddhas and individual illuminates, and innumerable various such fields of blessings, including the poor and destitute. Of these people, some come from afar, some come from nearby; some come because they have heard of the enlightening beings, some come because of affinities with the enlightening beings, some come because they have heard of the vow of generosity which the enlightening beings made in the past, some come at the request of the enlightening beings themselves. At such a time, the enlightening beings may give jeweled chariots or gold chariots, all beautifully adorned, covered with nets of chimes, with precious streamers trailing; they may give chariots of the finest lapis lazuli, decorated with countless rareties; they may give silver chariots, covered with golden nets, drawn by swift horses; they may give chariots adorned with countless mixed jewels, covered with jewel nets, drawn by elephants; they may give sandalwood chariots, with wheels of sublime jewels, canopies of mixed jewels, with lion seats of jewels set out in fine arrays with a hundred thousand girls sitting in rows thereon, the carts driven by a hundred thousand strong men; or they may give chariots of clear crystal, decorated with mixtures of gems, filled with beautiful women, covered with jeweled curtains, with banners and pennants on the sides; they may give chariots of stores of agate, embellished with all precious substances, perfumed with various fragrances, adorned with all kinds of beautiful flowers, with a hundred thousand girls holding jewel ornaments, the carts pulled by steeds equally well-trained, able to travel over dangerous places with ease; or they may give chariots of solid perfume, with wheels of precious substances, with massive, beautiful adornments, covered with jeweled drapes, trailing jewelled nets, the insides spread with various precious robes, emitting fine, pure, pleasing fragrances, attended by countless celestials as they move along, providing all kinds of precious substances from time to time; they may present chariots of luminous jewels, the beautiful hues of the various jewels thoroughly translucent, covered with nets of many wonderful jewels, with ornaments of mixed jewels hanging down on all sides, sprinkled with powdered incense, fragrant and clean inside and out, with charming men and women riding on them.
“When great enlightening beings present such chariots of myriad beautiful gems to Buddhas, they dedicate the roots of goodness thus: ‘May all sentient beings be able to make offerings to the highest field of blessings, give to Buddhas with deep faith, and attain infinite rewards; may all sentient beings turn their whole minds to the Buddha, and always meet infinite pure fields of blessings; may all sentient beings begrudge nothing to the Buddhas, and fully perfect the mind of great relinquishment; may all sentient beings practice giving to the Buddhas, give up the aspirations of the two lesser vehicles, and attain the unobstructed liberation and omniscient knowledge of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings practice endless giving to the Buddhas and enter the knowledge and wisdom of Buddhas, with infinite virtues; may all sentient beings enter the supreme knowledge of Buddhas and be able to become sovereigns of pure, unexcelled knowledge; may all sentient beings attain the Buddhas’ spiritual faculty of reaching everywhere without obstruction, and go wherever they wish freely; may all sentient beings enter deeply into the Great Vehicle, attain immeasurable knowledge, and be stabilized therein, imperturbable; may all sentient beings be able to bring forth ways to omniscience and become supreme fields of blessings for humans and celestials; may all sentient beings have no antagonism toward the Buddhas, diligently plant roots of goodness, and happily seek enlightened knowledge; may all sentient beings spontaneously be able to go to all buddha-fields, going throughout the cosmos in a single instant, without tiring; may all sentient beings attain the free spiritual faculties of enlightening beings, distribute their bodies throughout space, approach and make offerings to all Buddhas; may all sentient beings attain the incomparable body, going everywhere in the ten directions, without wearying; may all sentient beings attain a vast body flying swiftly wherever they want to go, never flagging; may all sentient beings attain the ultimate power of freedom of all Buddhas, in a single instant manifesting the Buddhas’ spiritual powers and mystic displays throughout space; may all sentient beings cultivate peaceful, blissful practice, following the path of all enlightening beings; may all sentient beings attain speed in action, and consummate the knowledge and spiritual abilities of the ten powers; may all sentient beings enter all lands in the cosmos, annulling the boundaries so they are equal and without distinction; may all sentient beings carry out the practice of universal goodness and wisdom, never retreating, reach the other shore, and attain omniscience; may all sentient beings climb into the vehicle of peerless knowledge and, following the nature of things, see the truth as it really is.’ This is the great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when presenting precious chariots to all Buddhas of the present or to the memorial shrines of Buddhas after they have passed away; this is to cause sentient beings to gain the unobstructed vehicle of ultimate emancipation of the enlightened.
“When great enlightening beings give precious chariots to good teachers such as enlightening beings, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings always remember the teachings of the wise and concentrate diligently on preserving them so they may not be lost; may all sentient beings share the same benefits as good teachers, all-inclusive, and have the same roots of goodness; may all sentient beings draw near to good teachers, respect and provide for them, giving up all they have to please them; may all sentient beings develop good aspirations and follow good associates, never leaving them; may all sentient beings always get to meet good teachers, wholeheartedly attend to them, and not oppose their instructions; may all sentient beings like good teachers and never reject them, so there is no alienation, no mixup, and no error; may all sentient beings be able to give themselves to good teachers, following their instructions without opposition; may all sentient beings be accepted by good teachers, cultivate great compassion, and depart from all evils; may all sentient beings follow good teachers and listen to the truths spoken by the Buddhas; may all sentient beings have the same roots of goodness as the teachers, with pure results of action, and practice the same vows as the enlightening beings, ultimately accomplishing the ten powers; may all sentient beings be able to accept and apply the methods of good teachers, and reach the realms of all concentrations, knowledge, wisdom, and spiritual powers; may all sentient beings be able to accept and hold all right teachings, put them into practice, and reach the other shore; may all sentient beings ride in the Great Vehicle, without any hindrance or obstruction, and ultimately complete the path of omniscience; may all sentient beings manage to climb into the vehicle of all knowledge and reach the abode of peace, without ever turning back; may all sentient beings know how to act according to reality, and attain the ultimate of all the Buddha-teachings they hear, never forgetting; may all sentient beings be accepted by the Buddhas and attain unhindered knowledge of ultimate truth; may all sentient beings attain autonomous spiritual powers which never fade away, and be able to go wherever they want to in a single thought; may all sentient beings come and go freely, widely teaching and guiding, causing others to abide in the Great Vehicle; may all sentient beings’ acts be fruitful, borne by the vehicle of knowledge to the stage of the ultimate; may all sentient beings gain the vehicle of nonobstruction and reach all places by unimpeded knowledge.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving various chariots and cars to good teachers; it is to cause sentient beings to be filled with virtues equal to the Buddhas and enlightening beings.
“When great enlightening beings give precious chariots to mendicants, they engender the will to practice all giving, the will to comprehend thoroughly by knowledge, the will to purify virtuous qualities, the mind which accords with relinquishment, the thought that true Buddhist mendicants are hard to meet, a mind of deep faith in the religious community, and the will to uphold right teaching. They abide in supreme aspiration, to an unprecedented degree. They hold great assemblies of giving, producing immeasurably great merit, with profound faith in the Buddha’s teaching which cannot be undermined. They dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings enter comprehensively into the Buddha-teachings and keep them in mind; may all sentient beings leave the state of ordinary ignorant people and enter the realm of sages; may all sentient beings quickly enter the ranks of the sages and be able to use the Buddha-teachings to awaken and guide step-by-step; may all sentient beings be respected and trusted by all the world; may all sentient beings enter into the equality of all things and know that the inherent nature of things is nondual; may all sentient beings be born from the realm of enlightened knowledge and be surrounded by docile harmonious people; may all sentient beings abide by the methods for removing defilement, getting rid of the stains of all afflictions; may all sentient beings be able to form a supreme religious community, leave the state of ordinary people and enter the congregation of worthies and sages; may all sentient beings diligently practice good principles, attain unhindered knowledge, and be endowed with sagelike qualities; may all sentient beings attain wisdom, not be attached to the past, present, or future, and be free as kings among the masses; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of knowledge and wisdom and turn the wheel of right teaching; may all sentient beings be endowed with spiritual faculties and be able to go to innumerable worlds in a single thought; may all sentient beings ride the body of space, their knowledge unobstructed in any world; may all sentient beings enter all congregations of Buddhas throughout cosmic space, and accomplish the foremost practices of transcendence; may all sentient beings attain physical lightness and comfort and extraordinary knowledge and wisdom, and be able to enter all buddha-fields; may all sentient beings attain unbounded skillful power of psychic travel, manifesting their bodies in all lands; may all sentient beings attain a body which relies on nothing at all, appearing everywhere like a reflection, by spiritual faculties; may all sentient beings attain inconceivable autonomous spiritual powers, whereby they appear before those who may be taught, to edify and civilize them; may all sentient beings attain unhindered means of entry into the reality realm, in a single thought traveling throughout all lands in the ten directions.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving precious chariots to mendicants; it is to cause sentient beings to all ride the vehicle of pure, unsurpassed knowledge, and in all worlds turn the unobstructed wheel of knowledge of truth.

nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la shing rta 'bul ba'i tshe shing rta yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i sbyin pa yongs su smin pa grub pas sbyin pa'i gnas kyi dam par yid ches par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gcig tu spyod cing mi gnyis par yang dag par spyod pas 'du 'dzi med pa la dga' bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad bsod nams kyis yang dag par bsdu ba la brtson pas sbyin pa rnam par dag par byed pa'i mchog tu gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba grangs med pa'i 'bras bu rab tu gtong bas ye shes kyi mu stegs las byung bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i dkyil 'khor mchog gis rnam par dag pas bsgribs pa med par rtogs par khong du chud par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin byed pa med par khong du chud pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos la rnam par spyod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsod nams kyi zhing sbyin pa'i gnas 'gro ba thams cad dga' bar byas pas bsod nams tshad med pa shin tu bsags par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i gnas su byas te phan 'dogs pa rnam par dag pas cho 'phrul mtha' yas pas rnam par rol ba yang dag par ston par gyur cig / sems can thams cad stobs bcu'i theg pa mchog gi 'bras bu yongs su stobs pas sbyin pa'i gnas yon tan zad mi shes par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsod nams kyi phung po mi zad pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mthar thug par gyur te sbyin pa'i gnas don yod pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ma thos pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos tshig dang / yi ge 'dzin cing sdig pa'i chos rab tu zhi bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sgra don yod pa ye shes kyis rnam par rig pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyan pa la mos shing brtson par gyur cig / sems can thams cad la thos pa rjes su bsgrags pa'i chos can du gyur te sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad zhags pa thub pa dgu bcu rtsa drug gi lta ba las rnam par 'das te bstan pa la gnas pa'i bya ba la mos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog rnam par spel bar byed cing 'phags pa mthong ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'phags pa mthong zhing 'grogs pa'i bde ba dang ldan zhing ye shes kyis spyod pa'i gang zag la mos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi lta ba rjes su thos pa las byung bas thos pa don yod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bstan pa rab tu gzung ba dang yongs su bsrung ba la zhugs pas sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la ye shes kyi mkhas pa rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa gsal bar bya ba'i snang ba rab tu thob pas chos thams cad thos pa shin tu 'dzin pa la zhugs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i mdzod kyis dga' bar spyod cing gtong ba shin tu byed pa dang / mchod sbyin shin tu byas pas sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la shing rta 'bul ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa rnam par dag pa mchog dam pa phul rab tu 'thob cing / ci nas kyang mi 'jigs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa rab tu 'thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i gnas dang len pa sna tshogs phyogs gzhan dang gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i gang zag dang / slong ba phongs pa dang / bkren pa mang po tshad med pa byang chub sems dpa'i sgra thos te 'ongs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang sems bskyed pas mos shing bstabs pa thams cad gtong bas shin tu re ba'i yid can de dag 'ongs pa mthong nas slong ba la rim gro bya bas mi ngoms pa'i sems kyis slong ba 'ongs pa rnams la bzod pa gsol ba'i sems bskyed de/ 'di ltar bdag nyid phyogs de dag tu khyod kyi drung du song ste rim gror bya ba zhig na/ de 'di ltar khyod 'dir phyin te shin tu ngal bar gyur to/ / zhes spyi bos btud de bzod pa gsol bas slong ba thams cad bzod pa byas/ rim gror byas/ ngal ba bstis nas ci 'dod pa sbyin pa de dag gis shin tu rim gro byed de/ 'di ltar nor bu'i shing rta 'dzam bu'i gling gi na chung bzang mo rin po ches yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ gser gyi shing rta yul gyi na chung rin po che shin tu rnam par dag pas yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ bai DUr+ya'i shing rta na chung ma'i 'khor glu dang rol mo brdung zhing dkrol ba dang ldan pas yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste; dngul gyi shing rta shin tu mdzes pa bud med gzhon nu lha'i bu mo lta bus yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ rin po che bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i shing rta bud med cang shes rin po che rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa tshul mkhas pas yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ tsan+dan gyi shing rta byang chub sems dpa' bzhon par 'os pa dang; 'di lta ste/ shel gyi shing rta bud med bzang mo bzhin bzang ba/ cha byad sdug gu shin tu brgyan pa/ gzugs mdzes pa/ blta na sdug cing mi mthun pa med pas yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ asma gar+b+ha'i shing rta dbang bskur bas yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ spos dam pa'i shing rta bu dang bu mos yongs su bkang ba dang / 'di lta ste/ rin po che'i tshogs thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i shing rta nang gi bshes gnyen dbyer mi phyed pas yongs su bkang ba dang / de rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shing rta grangs med pa rnam pa sna tshogs slong mo pa thams cad la sbyin zhing yongs su gtong bas/ slong ba 'dod par bya ba'i dngos po rab tu thob pas yid la bsam pa
