shin tu rdzogs nas slong ba de dag thams cad sbyin pa thams cad sbyin pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par bzung ste shin tu tshim par byas shing bsam pa rdzogs par byas nas dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes par byas te dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad byang chub kyi shing drung du bsam gyis mi khyab cing thogs pa med pa'i shing rta'i 'khor lo phyir mi ldog pas 'gro ba dang ldan te theg pa chen po'i shing rta la zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la spyod cing phyi ma'i mtha' bskal ba'i mur thug par phyir mi ldog par chos kyi shing rta cang shes la zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa'i rlom sems med cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i rigs kyi lam la brtson pas chos thams cad ci yang ma yin pa'i shing rta la zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thogs pa med pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro ba la brtson pas kun tu 'gro ba dri ma med pa'i shing rta la zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos la dga' bas mos shing yang dag par 'gro ba la brtson pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa'i shing rta rjes su mthun pa la rab tu gnas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i lam bcu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rab tu dga' ba'i yid dang ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i shing rta la zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad tshul dang 'dra ba'i yul na gnas pa dang ldan pa dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa thob pas sngon byas pa'i bsod nams shin tu bsags pa dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam la shin tu brtson pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyad pa rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pas 'khor lo bzhi pa'i shing rta la zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa'i stobs dang / ye shes la brtson pas phyogs thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings su chos kyi snang ba gtong ba la bslab par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi shing rtas 'byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob ste sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi shing rta la zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad phyogs thams cad du legs pa dang / bde ba yang dag par ston pas bsod nams thams cad dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa dang / chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i shing rta la mkhas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jungs pa'i dri ma rab tu byang ste sbyin pa gtong bas 'byung ba'i shing rta dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa ma lus par tshul khrims rnam par dag pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa'i shing rta dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems 'khrugs pa med par gnas pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsam pa 'khrug pa med cing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'byung ba'i shing rtas snying po byang chub tu 'gro bar spyod pa'i go cha bgos pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad shin tu mgyogs pa'i shing rtas snying po byang chub tu byung ste bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi shing rta la shin tu zhon zhing sangs rgyas kyi yul sprul pas rgyas par byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos yongs su gtong ba la 'jigs pa med pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du sbyin pa gtong ba'i phyir chos kyi rgyal po'i shing rta la zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi phyogs thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa rmongs pa med pa'i phyir smon lam la mi gnas pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad theg pa chen po mnor bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skye zhing lus yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi shing rta la zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i smon lam skyo ba med par yongs su rdzogs par bya ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa rin po che'i shing rta la zhon par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i gnas dang / len pa dang / slong ba sna tshogs la shing rta dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / spro ba'i yid kyi rnam par rtog pas sbyin pas yongs su bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa la zhon pa shin tu bsgrubs pas ye shes dang / sems kyi rnam pa mtha' yas pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings give precious chariots to Buddhist disciples and individual illuminates, they engender these frames of mind: consciousness of fields of blessings; honor and respect; consciousness of oceans of virtues; consciousness of ability to produce virtue and wisdom; consciousness of birth from the power of the virtues of the enlightened; consciousness of myriad eons of cultivation; consciousness of ability to cultivate enlightening practices over innumberable eons; consciousness of escape from the bondage of all delusion; consciousness of destruction of all demons; consciousness of the light of wisdom illumining the unexcelled truth. The roots of goodness in this giving of chariots they dedicate in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be supreme fields of blessings, believed in by the world, fulfilling unexcelled transcendent generosity; may all sentient beings give up useless talk, always enjoy solitude, and have no second thoughts; may all sentient beings become most excellent pure fields of blessings, taking in all sentient beings and inducing them to cultivate acts which produce felicity; may all sentient beings become fonts of wisdom and be able to bestow on living beings immeasurable, innumerable rewards of roots of goodness; may all sentient beings persist in unhindered action, fully developing a pure, excellent field of blessings; may all sentient beings abide in non-contention, realizing that all things do nothing and have essencelessness for their essence; may all sentient beings always get to be near the supreme field of blessings, fully cultivating immeasurable virtues; may all sentient beings be able to manifest immeasurable spiritual powers and include all conscious beings in a pure field of blessings; may all sentient beings be endowed with a field of blessings of inexhaustible virtues, able to bestow on beings the ten powers of the enlightened, the fruit of the foremost vehicle; may all sentient beings become fruitful, genuine fields of blessings, and develop the inexhaustible collection of blessings of all knowledge; may all sentient beings attain the way to extinguish wrongdoing, and be able to receive and hold the expressions and meanings of Buddhas’ teachings which they have never heard; may all sentient beings always diligently listen to and absorb all Buddha-teachings, and understand everything they hear, so that it is not in vain; may all sentient beings hear the principles of the Buddhas, comprehend their ultimate import, and be able to expound them according to what they have learned; may all sentient beings believe and practice the instructions of the enlightened, and forever give up all the false views of erroneous philosophies; may all sentient beings always see worthies and sages and develop all the most excellent foundations of goodness; may all sentient beings always trust people who act wisely, and associate with and respect the sages; may all sentient beings, hearing the names of Buddhas, not let it go to waste, but all get to see with their eyes those they have heard of; may all sentient beings analyze and know well the right doctrines of the Buddhas, and be able to protect those who hold the Buddha-teaching; may all sentient beings always enjoy listening to all Buddha-teachings, absorb and hold them, read and recite them, expound upon them, illumine them, and comprehend them; may all sentient beings believe and understand the true virtues of the Buddha’s teachings, and give whatever they have in respectful offerings.’ This is the dedication of roots of goodness of great enlightening beings when giving various chariots and cars to disciples of Buddhas or individual illuminates, to cause all sentient beings to attain fulfillment of pure, supreme knowledge and spiritual powers, to cultivate practice diligently, and attain omniscience, power, and fearlessness.
“When great enlightening beings give precious chariots to fields of blessings including the poor, the destitute, and the orphaned, they joyfully and tirelessly give whatever is needed, and even apologize to those people, ‘I should have gone to offer you provisions, rather than trouble you to come so far and wear yourself out.’ Then they bow and kneel before them, ask about their health, and give them whatever they need. Sometimes they give crystal chariots with the finest women in the land; sometimes they give gilded chariots with women prized in society; sometimes they give lapis lazuli chariots with dancing girls; sometimes they give chariots of various extraordinary jewels with maidens like goddesses; sometimes they give chariots adorned with innumerable jewels, with bejewelled women, gentle and bright, eloquent and intelligent; sometimes they give sandalwood chariots to ride; sometimes they give crystal chariots with bejewelled women in them, incomparably beautiful, dressed in sumptuous robes, a delight to all who see; sometimes they give agate chariots, with crown princes riding in them; sometimes they give chariots of aromatic resins with all their sons and daughters in them; sometimes they give chariots adorned with all precious substances, with their relatives and good friends, so hard to give up, riding in them.
“Great enlightening beings respectfully give innumerable such precious chariots when they are asked for, to satisfy all wishes and make people happy and content. They dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings ride the universal vehicle, which rolls unimpeded and never turns back, to reach inconceivable trees of enlightenment; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of knowledge of the great teaching, based on pure causes, and cultivate enlightening practice throughout the future, never turning back; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of the nonexistence of all things, forever part from all conceptual clinging, and always practice the path of omniscience; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of truthfulness and honesty, without flattery or deception, and go to all buddha-fields freely, without hindrance; may all sentient beings follow and abide by the vehicle of omniscience, pleasing each other with the principles of buddhahood; may all sentient beings all ride the vehicle of pure practices of enlightening beings and fulfill all the ways of emancipation and the bliss of concentration of enlightening beings; may all sentient beings ride a vehicle of four wheels—that is, living in a good land, staying with good people, building up excellent virtues, and making great vows—hereby fulfilling the pure religious practice of all enlightening beings; may all sentient beings obtain the vehicle of the light of truth illumining everywhere throughout the ten directions, and cultivate the power of knowledge of all enlightened ones; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of Buddha-teaching, and arrive at the other shore of all things; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of the inconceivable teaching of myriad felicitous virtues, and show the right path of peace and serenity throughout the ten directions; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of great generosity, sloughing off the dirt of stinginess; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of pure morality, maintaining pure precepts as boundless as the cosmos; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of forbearance, and always be free of the pollution of anger toward sentient beings; may all sentient beings ride the nonregressing vehicle of great diligence, steadfastly cultivate excellent practices, and proceed on the path of enlightenment; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of meditation concentration, quickly reach the site of enlightenment, and realize enlightened knowledge; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of wisdom and skill in means, and emanate bodies filling the realms of the Buddhas in all universes; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of mastery of the teaching, develop fearlessness, and constantly distribute to all people teachings of methods to attain omniscience; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of knowledge without attachment and be able to enter everywhere in the ten directions into the real nature of things, and not be disturbed by anything; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of the teachings of all Buddhas, appearing to be born in all lands throughout the ten directions, without losing the path of the Great Vehicle; may all sentient beings ride the vehicle of the supreme treasury of omniscience, and fulfill the practices and vows of the Universally Good enlightening being, without growing weary of it.’ This is the great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving precious chariots to fields of blessings, including the poor and the orphaned, to cause sentient beings to have immeasurable knowledge, to be joyful and buoyant, and to all ultimately attain the vehicle of universal knowledge.
bam po sum cu rtsa drug pa/

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po glang po cang shes yan lag bdun shin tu gnas pa/ lo drug cu lon pa/ mche ba drug dang ldan pa/ kha dog pad+ma lta bu/ gdong rnam par dag pa/ dkar zhing dri ma med pa/ gser gyi rgyal mtshan can/ gser gyi rgyan dang ldan pa/ gser gyi dra bas lus kun nas yog pa/ sna rin po che sna tshogs kyi dra ba'i rgyan du bcug pa/ gser ltar blta na mdzes pa/ dpag tshad stong gis khyon du ngal ba med par 'gro ba sbyin zhing gtong ba'am/ rta cang shes gom pa zo mdog bde bar 'dong zhing 'degs pa dang / bya ltar mgyogs pa dang ldan pa; rdog ma lcang lor 'khril ba/ nam tsong dang rmig par ldan pa/ rmig pa'i dbyibs mtho zhing skyon med pa/ gser gyi dril bu'i dra bas brgyan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang zla ba dang ldan pa/ glo kun nas brgyan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi gdong rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan pa/ zhon na bde ba/ lus la byams pa; shin tu mgyogs pa/ phyogs bzhir yid ltar mgyogs pa'i shugs dang ldan pa/ lha rdzas lta bu'i lhab lhub thams cad dang ldan pa de lta bus bla ma'i skye bo dang / bla mar bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / pha dang / ma dang / phongs pa dang / bkren pa dang / slong ba dang / len pa'i 'gro ba thams cad la sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba dang / sems yangs pas sbyin pa dang / sems la chags pa med pas gtong ba dang / rjes su 'gyod pa med pas yid mgu bar byed pa dang / snying rje chen pos yongs su rgyas pa'i bsam pas gtang ba chen po rab tu gtong zhing byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad la rab tu brtson pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs su mngon par skyes pa'i bsam pa yongs su spyong pa'i che dge ba'i rtsa bde dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yon tan gyi rgyan gyis byung ste cang shes kyi theg pa la rab tu gnas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su 'gro ba'i chos kyi theg pas byung ste theg pa bzang po'i bzhon pa la mngon par zhon par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi theg pas snang bar gyur te theg pa chen po la shin tu mos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad smon lam thams cad sgrol ba la rab tu zhugs pas brtsam pa chen po'i theg pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba mnyam par sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rab tu 'thob pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa mnyam pa nyid kyis byung bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i ye shes rin po che sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos la shin tu 'byung ba'i chos can du gyur te theg pa rin po che yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pa'i sems dang rgyud du gyur te byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgyan rnam par bsags pa'i theg pas shin tu byung bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad mtha' yas pa'i theg pa myur ba la mngon par brtson pa'i ye shes kyi chos can du gyur te bskal pa grangs med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rjes su bsam pa rjes su sems shing rnam par sbyong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yang dag par sgrub pa la mkhas pas longs spyod kyi mchog thams cad dang / cang shes kyi theg pa chen po'i sbyin pa byed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi mthar gtugs par mngon par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir theg pa shin tu mtho bar gnas shing rab tu brten pa dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po glang po cang shes dang / rta cang shes bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa'i sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad chags pa med pa'i theg pa la mngon par bskyon zhing ye shes kyi bzhon pa yongs su 'grub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa bsgribs pa med pas 'byung ba'i mthar thug par yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur pa/ chos kyi dbang byed pa stan gyi sbyin pa byed cing rgyal po bzhugs pa'i khri stan bzang po baiDUr+ya'i rkang pa can seng+ge'i khri la gnas pa gser gyi rgyu dang / rin po che'i dri bas blas pa/ stan reg na bde ba grangs med pa du ma bting ba/ nyen kor spos kyi dam pa thams cad kyis shin tu dri zhim par byas pa/ nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyal mtshan bsgrengs pa/ rin po che bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ gser gyi dra ba'i bla re bres pa/ gser gyi dril bu'i dra ba 'khrol ba'i sgra yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs 'byung ba/ rin po che'i 'bru bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcus kun nas bskor te rnam par phye bas shin tu 'phags shing blta na mdzes pa/ srog chags bye ba/ khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pas kun nas blta ba/ gdugs khab gcig gis sa chen po thams cad skyong bar dbang bskur ba/ rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug thams cad la dbang ba'i stan du bya ba de la 'dug cing / 'khor lo thogs pa med pas bskyang ba dang chis bya ba la rgyal po'i bka' thams cad nyams pa med par nyan pa dpal rnam par snang ba dang / in+d+ra nI la dang / nor bu rin po che'i snying pos spras pa/ nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma che phra lta bu rab tu brgyan pa/ rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs rmad du byung bas brgyan pa/ rin po che khyad par du 'phags pa rgya mtshos spras pa; rgya mtsho dang / rgyal mtshan dang / bkra shis dang / bum pa sna tshogs yongs su gang ba dang / dga' ba 'khyil ba'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis rnam par brgyan pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi gyim pag dri ma med cing rdul dang bral bas bkab pa de la 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad kyi bdag po spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas mngon par dbang bskur ba'i bsod nams kyi stobs dang ldan pa; byams pas dbang bskur ba/ pha rol gyi 'khor bcom pa dang ldan pa/ bka' la zlog pa med pa/ 'dug na dga' ba de lta bu'i stan gyi rnam pa tshul de 'dra ba sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba dang / de dang de dag gis rgyal po bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa la khri stan bzang po'i rnam pa de lta bu'i sbyin pa byed cing yongs su gtong ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sbyin pa'i gnas kyi dam pa la gsol ba'am/ skyes bu dam pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam/ 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog gam/ chos smra ba'am/ chos la dgab pa'i phyir yongs su g.yogs pa'i sems kyis sam/ pha dang / ma dang / bla ma'i skye bo'am/ nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i sbyin pa'i gnas sam/ byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa thams cad dam/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod rten mchod pa'i phyir ram/ phongs pa dang / bkren pa slong ba dpag tu med pa dag gam/ sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir yang rung ste/ sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par 'tshang rgya ba'i ye shes dang ldan zhing shin tu byang chub pa'i stan dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bdud kyi dkrug ma dang dpung rab tu gzhom pa'i phyir chos kyi dbang phyug thams cad kyi rdo rje'i ri rnam pa thams cad du thub pa med pa'i lus dang ldan zhing 'gro ba thams cad la dbang ba'i stan rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad kyis blta bar 'os shing sangs rgyas rnam par rol pa'i seng+ge'i gdan rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun la chos kyi dbang phyug gis skyong ba'i phyir stan gyi rgyan dang 'khor rnam par dag pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba tshogs chen po rnam par dag pas khams gsum pas zil gyis mi non pa'i stan rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bskal pa grangs med par sangs rgyas kyi gdan gyi yon tan bsngags pa mthar thug pa med pa dang ldan zhing 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa/ stan gyis rgyas par byed pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings thams cad lus kyis rgyas par byed pa'i phyir gter chen po'i tshogs kyi stan la gnas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ji ltar dam bcas pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad la chos kyi sbyin pas rim gro byed pa'i phyir rgyan gyi rnam pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i stan rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba yang dag par ston pa'i phyir dge ba'i stan la rab tu gnas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par 'tshang rgya zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid che ba thams cad dang khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba yang dag par ston pa'i phyir rin po che thams cad kyi stan dang / spos thams cad kyi stan dang / me tog thams cad kyi stan dang / gos thams cad kyi stan dang / phreng ba thams cad kyi stan dang / nor bu rin po che thams cad kyi stan dang / baiDUr+ya sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i stan dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa ltar tshad med pa'i stan dang / 'gro ba thams cad ma lus par rgyan gyis rnam par dag pa'i stan dang / rdo rje'i gdan thams cad la 'khod par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' stan gyi sbyin pas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad kyis mgos btud pa'i byang chub kyi stan rab tu 'thob cing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings give prize elephants, which are docile, physically complete and in their prime years, with six tusks, pure and clean, lotuslike mouths red in color, bodies pure white, like mountains of snow; they are ornamented with golden banners, covered with nets of jewels, with various exquisite gems adorning their trunks; all find endless delight in looking at them; they can walk thousands of miles without tiring. Also, enlightening beings give trained prize horses with all the characteristics of celestial steeds, with moonlike discs of exquisite jewels as luminous ornaments, covered with nets of gold bells, stepping evenly and straight so that the riders are comfortable, going wherever wished as fast as the wind, traveling freely and unimpeded throughout the four continents. Enlightening beings give these prize elephants and horses to their parents, teachers, and to poor, suffering beings; their hearts are broad and without regret or grudge, only increasing in joy and feeling more and more compassion and pity as they cultivate the virtues of enlightening beings and purify the enlightening mind. They dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings abide in the vehicle of harmony and docility and increase in all the virtuous qualities characteristic of enlightening beings; may all sentient beings attain the vehicle of liberative skills and be able to produce all enlightening teachings as necessary; may all sentient beings obtain the vehicle of resolute faith, universally illumining the power of unhindered knowledge of the enlightened; may all sentient beings attain the vehicle of inspiration, and be able to conceive all great vows; may all sentient beings fulfill the impartial vehicle of the ways of transcendence, and completely fulfill all impartial roots of goodness; may all sentient beings perfect the vehicle of treasures, bearing the unexcelled treasure of knowledge of all verities of Buddhahood; may all sentient beings perfect the vehicle of adornment by the practices of enlightening beings, causing the flowers of the meditations of enlightening beings to bloom; may all sentient beings obtain the vehicle of unbounded swiftness, purifying the enlightening mind and earnestly contemplating for countless eons, comprehending all things; may all sentient beings perfect the great vehicle of supreme self-mastery, with skill in means fulfilling the stages of enlightening beings; may all sentient beings perfect the highest, broadest, sturdiest Great Vehicle, able to carry all sentient beings to the state of all-knowledge.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving elephants and horses, to cause sentient beings to all ride the vehicle of unobstructed knowledge, the vehicle to perfect completion and arrival at Buddhahood.
“When great enlightening beings give seats or lion thrones to sit on, those seats are high and wide and extremely beautiful, with lapis lazuli legs, spread with soft, supple raiment made of gold thread, arrayed with jeweled banners, perfumed with various delicate fragrances, decorated with ornaments of innumerable various jewels, covered overhead with golden nets and jewel chimes rustling in the breeze and producing exquisite sounds, magnificently embellished all around with adornments of myriad unusual designs, looked up to by all people, occupied only by crowned monarchs proclaiming the law respectfully followed by all states. Those monarchs are also adorned with beautiful jewels—luminous jewels, sapphires, giant sapphires, jewel crystals from the finest mines, bright and clear as the sun, pure and cool as the moon; surrounding in profusion, like myriad stars, are ornaments of supreme beauty, incomparable jewels of the sea, solid banner-like treasures of the sea, with extraordinary patterns and unusual appearances; their heads are crowned with turbans of finest gold and pure jewels, they receive the rank of coronation, reign over the continent Jambu, endowed with immeasurable charismatic power, making kindness principal, conquering all those who are hostile and inimical, obeyed wherever their commands reach. Great enlightening beings, becoming such monarchs, then give such jewel-adorned thrones to Buddhas, the foremost fields of blessings, and to enlightening beings, genuine teachers, wise and holy mendicants, preachers of the teaching, parents, relatives, Buddhist disciples and individual illuminates, as well as those setting out on the vehicle of enlightening beings, and also to monuments of Buddhas, and to all the poor and destitute, the orphaned and homeless—they give everything according to need. These roots of goodness they dedicate in this way: ‘May all sentient beings sit on the seat of enlightenment and thoroughly awaken to the truth realized by all Buddhas; may all sentient beings sit on the seat of freedom and attain independence of things, which even diamond mountains could not break, and be able to smash and conquer all the hordes of delusions; may all sentient beings gain the Buddha’s lion throne of freedom, looked up to by all beings; may all sentient beings obtain chairs adorned with unspeakably unspeakable numbers of various exquisite jewels, become masters of the teachings, and guide sentient beings; may all sentient beings attain the throne which is supreme in all worlds, adorned by extensive great foundations of goodness; may all sentient beings obtain seats which pervade unspeakably unspeakable numbers of worlds, such as could not be fully eulogized in immeasurable eons; may all sentient beings obtain the seat of profound mystic virtues, and their bodies fill all universes; may all sentient beings obtain seats of inconceivable numbers of all kinds of jewels, and extensively carry out the giving of teaching to whatever sentient beings are considered in their past vows; may all sentient beings obtain seats of refined subtlety and manifest the spiritual powers of untold Buddhas; may all sentient beings obtain seats of all jewels, of all incenses, of all flowers, of all robes, of all garlands, of all crystals, and so on—seats of inconceivably many various precious things, seats of innumerable worlds, pure seats of the adornments of all worlds, seats of all diamonds, and manifest the powers and freedom of Buddhas, and fulfill most perfect enlightenment.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving seats of precious things, to cause sentient beings to obtain the seat of great enlightenment beyond the world and spontaneously become aware of the truths realized by all Buddhas.

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gdugs kyi sbyin pa byed cing / dbang phyug gi lus la dgab pa'i gdugs rin po che rgyan chen pos shin tu brgyan pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong khyad par 'phags shing dbang che ba'i yo byad du bya ba/ rin po che'i rtsa ba can dril bu'i dra bas kun nas bskor ba/ rin po che'i srad bus gser gyi dril bu dpyangs pa'i sgra 'byung ba/ rin po che baiDUr+ya'i phreng ba rab tu dpyangs pa/ nyen kor nas rnga'i sgra dbyangs yid du 'ong ba 'byung ba/ gser gyi dra ba rnam par dag pas g.yogs shing brgyan pa/ rin po che'i dra ba brgya phrag stong gi bla re bres pa/ nor bu rin po che'i 'bru grangs med pas spras pa/ rin po che bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas sna tshogs su bres shing brgyan pa/ a.a ga ru dang / tsan+dan dang / spos kyi dam pa sna tshogs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas nyen kor dri zhim par bsgos shing bdugs pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser ltar 'od gsal zhing dag pa/ rgyan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mtha' yas pas brgyan pa/ de bas kyang ches lhag pa'i gdugs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa dag kha na ma thob med pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa byed cing / sems can thams cad kyi gtso bo mngon du gyur pa'am/ de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten brgyan pa'i phyir ram/ chos btsal ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam/ byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba btsun par bya ba dag gam/ pha dang / ma'am/ dge 'dun dkon mchog gam/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa'am/ sbyin pa'i gnas kyi gang zag sna tshogs sam/ slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / byang chub kyi theg pa grub pa'am/ de la zhugs pa dag gam/ phongs pa dang / bkren pa slong ba dang len pa dag la 'bul ba dang / yongs su gtong ba dang / sbyin par byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste; sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi g.yogs pa rab tu thob ste dge ba'i rtsa bas yang dag par yog par gyur cig / sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad las yongs su 'das te yon tan dang ye shes kyis mngon par bkab par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi sdus dang / mun pa dang / yongs su gdung ba thams cad las rnam par 'das te lus shin tu bkab par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad kyis blta na sdug cing sangs rgyas thams cad la mnga' ba'i ye shes kyi snying po can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos la log pa med par 'jug par brtson pas ma 'khrugs pa'i chos dkar pos shin tu bkab par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi lus kyis sangs rgyas kyi sku'i mthar gtugs te mngon par bkab pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten kun la stobs bcu'i ye shes kyi bla res skyob pa'i gdugs su red par gyur cig / sems can thams cad khams gsum thams cad las shin tu 'phags shing chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snying po dang ldan pas ye shes kyis rnam par snang bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i gnas dam pa la bsod nams thams cad kyis mchod pa'i phyir gdugs su 'os par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi gdugs rnam par sangs rgyas pas gdugs kyi dam par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gdugs kyi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi chos la dbang ba'i gdugs yang dag par bzung ba thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / gdugs gcig gis nam mkha' thams cad kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba yang dag par bstan pa las phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings thams cad gdugs gcig gis brgyan te de bzhin gshegs pa mchod par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan yid du 'ong pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la mngon par dgab pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad ma lus pa gdugs kyi rgyan gyis kun tu yog par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi mtshan la mos pa'i sems can thams cad dang / 'gro ba'i tshogs thams cad gdugs thams cad kyis dgab pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / rin po che thams cad kyi gdugs sna tshogs brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pas sangs rgyas gcig la phul bas sangs rgyas thams cad la brjod du med pa'i gdugs phul bar sems shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub mngon par byang chub pas 'phags pa'i gdugs kyis sangs rgyas thams cad dgab pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi sku ji snyed 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad na bzhugs pa thams cad la gdugs kyis dgab pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / nor bu rin po che thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i gdugs dang / rin po che thams cad kyi phreng ba brgyus shing klubs pa dang / spos thams cad kyi mchog gi dri zhim po'i ngad 'byung ba'i gdugs dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyis rnam par spras pa'i gdugs dang / rgyan mdzes shing rnam par dag pa'i gdugs dang / rgyan tshad med par yangs shing rgya che ba dang / gser gyi dra bas kun nas yog par brgyan pa/ dril bu'i dra ba kun nas dbyangs pa'i sgra yid du 'ong zhing snyan pa 'byung ba'i gdugs dang / ye shes bsgribs pa med cing chags pa med pa'i gdugs dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la mngon par dga' ba'i gdugs yongs su gtang ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gdugs kyi sbyin pas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la ye shes mchog gi gdugs kyis mngon par dgab pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyis kun nas g.yogs shing rab tu brgyan pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang / yon tan dang / dgongs pa dam pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems rin po che mtha' yas pa la dbang bsgyur ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos thams cad la ye shes kyi dbang bsgyur ba kun tu rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis mngon par g.yogs par yongs su bsngo ba'i don du yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'gro ba thams cad kyis ye shes mchog gi gdugs rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi stobs bcus bla re bres pa'i gdugs su 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig gis g.yogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos thams cad la dbang phyug tu dbang sgyur ba'i dbang thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / mthu chen po dang / dbang chen po'i sems kyi rgyud thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / blo yangs pa dang sems rgya che ba thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / yon tan tshad med pas 'gro ba thams cad mngon par dgab pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / yon tan thams cad kyis sems mngon par dga' ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyis 'gro ba thams cad mngon par dgab pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ye shes chen pos mnyam par dgab pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi bsngo ba'i tshul ma lus par thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / bsam pa dge ba dang / yid kyi dbang po rnam par dag pa dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bsngo ba chen pos mngon par dgab cing yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rin po che sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa'i yu ba can rin po che'i dril bu'i dra ba 'khrol ba'i sgra yid du 'ong ba 'byung ba/ snam bu rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs dbyangs pa/ kha dog dang tshon sna tshogs kyi snam bus brgyan cing bsgrengs pa/ gser gyi dra bas kun nas dbyangs shing klubs pa/ gser gyi dril bu'i sgra 'byung ba/ dril bu g.yer kha'i dra bas shin tu brgyan pa'i rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong kha dog tha dad pa/ tshon tha dad pa/ shin tu mtho ba/ rin po ches rnam pa sna tshogs su brgyan pa/ rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo zla gam gyis mdzes par brgyan pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor btsugs pa/ 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba/ rgyal mtshan gyi rgyan gyis sa thams cad kun tu yog pa/ rgyal mtshan gyi rgyan rnam pa du ma 'od dang ldan pas rab tu brgyan pa'i rgyal mtshan rnam pa sna tshogs bsgrengs pa'i rgyan de lta bu dag 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la mos pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi rgyan gyis kun tu khyab par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyis klas pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad 'byams klas pa la gnas pa/ yangs pa/ kun tu rgyal mtshan gyi sbyin pa yongs su btang bar mos pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyas par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa dang mos pa'i khyab par rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon du gyur pa rnams la 'bul ba'am/ de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten nam/ chos dkon mchog mchod pa'am/ dge 'dun dkon mchog la 'bul lam/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen byang chub sems dpa' rnams sam/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams sam/ 'khor gyi tshogs su gyur pa'am/ gang zag gi rnam pa gzhan su yang rung ste/ slong ba thams cad la rim gror bya ba'i phyir sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba na rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sbyin pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad ye shes kyi rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan la thub pa med pas dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams thams cad yang dag par sgreng ba'i rgyal mtshan can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi go 'phang bris pa sbed pa'i chos nyid kyis chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i rgyal mtshan sgreng bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi chos yang dag par 'dzin pa'i chos can du gyur te rin po che'i gzhi la sangs rgyas kyi chos bris pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun la mar me snang bar gyur te rgyal mtshan shin tu 'phags par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bdud thams cad rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir thub pa med pa'i rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad bdud thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i chos can du gyur te ye shes dang / stobs kyi rgyal mtshan rab tu sgreng bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad rgyal mtshan thams cad mi ltung ba'i snang ba can du gyur te ye shes mthu bo che'i rgyal mtshan dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyis chos kyi dbyings thams cad rnam par dag par gyur te ye shes kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa'i rgyal mtshan dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa la brtson zhing rgyal mtshan sna tshogs rab tu bsgrengs pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing brjod du med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i phyir rin po che'i rgyal mtshan gyi rgyan dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad zhags pa thub pa dgu bcu rtsa drug gi rgyal mtshan gyis dben zhing sems 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur te sangs rgyas kyi rgyal mtshan rab tu thob par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya che zhing yangs pa dang / zab mo thams cad dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / rnam par 'phrul ba dang / 'byung ba'i rgyal mtshan dang ldan zhing / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa rnam par dag pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin po che thams cad gtong ba la mos pa dang / sems can thams cad nor gyis phyug par byed pa dang / rin po che'i mdzod thams cad 'byed pa dang / rin po che thams cad gtong ba dang / rin po che'i 'byung gnas thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / nor bu rin po che thams cad kyi sbyin pa byed pa dang / rin po che kun gyis sems can thams cad la khyab par byed pa dang / rin po che'i tshogs thams cad phangs par mi sems pa'i yid kyis gtong ba dang / rin po che'i tshogs thams cad 'thor ba'am/ rin po che thams cad yongs su gtang bar sems bskyed pa'i tshe srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa la rin po che byin pas yongs su bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad dran pa'i rgyud rmongs pa med cing sangs rgyas mthong ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi mdzod 'dzin pas/ chos dkon mchog gi snang ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sbyin pa dang / yongs su gtong ba shin tu brtan pas dge 'dun dkon mchog yongs su 'dzin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems rin po che rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rmongs pa med par gzhol bas ye shes rin po che la zhugs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes rin po che tshad med pa yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rin po che grangs med pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad stobs bcu'i ye shes rin po che mngon par 'tshang rgya ba la brtson pas yon tan rin po che mtha' yas pa'i bsngags pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes rin po che shin tu yangs pa'i mthar thug pas ye shes rin po che bcu drug gi snyoms par 'jug pa rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rin po che la rnam par sangs rgyas pas rin po che'i dam pas sbyin pa'i gnas kyi mchog tu gyur cig / sems can thams cad tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pa'i mdzod kyi chos rin po che rab tu ston pa la brtson pas rin po che'i dbang po dam par gyur cig/ ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin po che de dag yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi spyan rin po che rnam par dag cing nyams pa med pas ye shes dam pa rin po che yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings give various precious canopies, these canopies extraordinary, used by nobles, adorned with various great jewels, most excellent among billions of fine canopies, with supports made of all precious substances, covered with fine meshes, with golden bells on jeweled strings hanging down all around and draped with crystal necklaces making elegant sounds in harmony with the stirring of the breeze, all decorated with treasuries of pearls and jades, filled with innumerable various rareties, scented with sandalwood and aloe, fully embellished with infinite precious substances like radiantly pure gold: such canopies they give with pure hearts to Buddhas, or to monuments of Buddhas after their extinction, or, for the sake of the teaching, they give them to enlightening beings, good teachers, famous ministers of the teaching; or they give them to parents, or to mendicants, or to all the Buddhist teachings, or to various sentient beings as fields of blessings, or to religious leaders or venerable adepts, or those who have just set their minds on enlightenment, and to all the poor, destitute, orphaned, and homeless—to all who seek, they give. These roots of goodness they dedicate in this way: ‘May all sentient beings cultivate foundations of goodness whereby to cover their bodies, and always be protected by the Buddhas; may all sentient beings make virtue and wisdom their canopies and forever part from all the afflictions of the world; may all sentient beings shade themselves with virtues and get rid of the dust and dirt and searing afflictions of the world; may all sentient beings attain a treasury of knowledge and wisdom, causing everyone to always enjoy seeing them; may all sentient beings shade themselves with the pure way of dispassionate tranquility, and all attain the indestructible state of Buddhahood; may all sentient beings shield their bodies with good and ultimately attain the pure body of reality of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings become universal canopies and cover the whole world with the knowledge of the ten powers; may all sentient beings attain sublime wisdom, transcending the world, free from attachments; may all sentient beings gain the canopy of worthiness, become superlative fields of blessings, and receive all offerings; may all sentient beings obtain the supreme canopy, attain unsurpassed knowledge, and naturally realize enlightenment.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving canopies, umbrellas, and parasols, to cause all sentient beings to obtain the canopy of freedom and be able to uphold all good ways; to cause all sentient beings to be able to cover all fields and lands in all realms in space, and manifest the free spiritual powers of the Buddhas, without regressing; to cause all sentient beings to be able to adorn all worlds in the ten directions with one canopy, and offer it to the Buddha; to cause all sentient beings to offer beautiful banners, pennants, and jeweled canopies to all the enlightened ones; to cause all sentient beings to obtain a canopy of universal adornment and cover the lands of all the Buddhas; may all sentient beings obtain a vast canopy to cover sentient beings everywhere and cause them all to engender faith in the Buddha; to cause all sentient beings to offer innumerable canopies of wonderful precious adornments to one Buddha, and to do the same for innumerable Buddhas; to cause all sentient beings to attain the high, wide canopy of the enlightenment of Buddhas, covering all the enlightened ones; to cause all sentient beings to obtain canopies adorned with all jewels, canopies adorned with all jewelry, canopies adorned with all solid perfumes, canopies with pure adornments of various jewels, canopies with pure adornments of innumerable jewels, immense canopies with adornments of pure jewels, covered with jewel nets, hung with jewel bells waving in the breeze producing sublime sounds, covering the bodies of the Buddhas in all worlds in the space of the cosmos; to cause all sentient beings to obtain canopies adorned with unhindered, unimpeded knowledge, covering all the enlightened ones; also because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain the highest knowledge and wisdom; and because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain the adornment of the virtues of buddhahood; because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain the immeasurable, boundless treasures of the free mind; because they want to cause all sentient beings to be filled with the independent knowledge of all truths; because they want to cause all sentient beings to cover all with virtues; because they want to cause all sentient beings to perfect the canopy of supreme knowledge; because they want to cause all sentient beings to perfect the all-covering canopy of the ten powers; because they want to cause all sentient beings to be able to cover all buddha-fields in the cosmos; because they want to cause all sentient beings to be masters of all the enlightening teachings; because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain the free mind of great mystic power; because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain vast knowledge permanently; because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain immeasurable ultimate virtues, covering all; because they want to cause all sentient beings to cover their minds with virtuous qualities; because they want to cause all sentient beings to shield all living creatures with an impartial mind; because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain skillful means of dedication; because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain pure minds of supreme aspiration; because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain pure wills with good intentions; and because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain great dedication covering all living beings.
“Great enlightening beings may give various splendid banners and pennants, their poles made of various jewels, pennants made of precious silk, banners of various mixed colors and patterns, draped with jeweled nets, shining colors filling everywhere, jewel bells gently stirring, ringing in harmony, with rare jewels shaped like the half moon and gold more radiant than the sun placed atop each banner, decorated with various wonderful things caused to appear by results of actions in various worlds—such marvelous banners and pennants, uncountable millions of billions of them, their radiance joining and highlighting each other, the light pure, covering the ground, filling all buddha-lands in the realms in space in ten directions, the great enlightening beings, with pure-hearted faith give to Buddhas currently existing, or to their monuments after death, or to the treasury of the teaching, or to the religious community, or to enlightening beings, or to Buddhist disciples, or to self-enlightened beings, or to good teachers, or to Buddhist disciples, or to self-enlightened ones, or to the masses, or to particular people—to all who come seeking they give, and dedicate these roots of goodness in this way; ‘May all sentient beings be able to set up banners of virtue on all foundations of goodness, so that they cannot be destroyed; may all sentient beings set up the banner of mastery of all the teachings, respecting, admiring, and diligently preserving them; may all sentient beings write down the true teachings on precious silk, preserving the treasury of teachings of Buddhas and enlightening beings; may all sentient beings set up high, outstanding banners, and light the lamp of wisdom, illuminating all the world; may all sentient beings set up the banner of steadfastness and be able to destroy all delusive actions and manias; may all sentient beings set up the banner of the power of knowledge, which no delusion can damage; may all sentient beings attain the banner of great knowledge and wisdom, destroying all the flags of worldly pride; may all sentient beings gain the banner of great light of the sun of knowledge, and illumine the whole realm of reality with the light of the sun of knowledge; may all sentient beings be endowed with banners adorned with innumerable jewels, filling all worlds in the ten directions, and offer them to the Buddhas; may all sentient beings obtain the banner of realization of thusness, and destroy all the erroneous views of misleading paths.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving banners and pennants, to cause all sentient beings to attain the pure paths of the banner of the extremely profound, lofty, and wide-ranging practices of enlightening beings, and the banner of the action of spiritual powers of enlightening beings.
“Great enlightening beings open up storehouses of myriad treasures and hundreds of billions of trillions of fine, rare jewels to all the countless sentient beings, giving whatever they wish unbegrudgingly. They dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings always see the treasure of the Buddha, give up folly and cultivate right mindfulness; may all sentient beings be fully endowed with the light of the treasure of the Teaching and preserve the treasury of teachings of all Buddhas; may all sentient beings be able to support the entire treasure of the community, tirelessly providing for its needs; may all sentient beings attain the highest treasure of mind, omniscience, and may their pure aspiration for enlightenment never recede; may all sentient beings attain the treasure of knowledge, entering into all things without doubt or confusion; may all sentient beings be endowed with the treasure of virtuous qualities of enlightening beings, reveal and expound immeasurable knowledge; may all sentient beings attain a treasure of immeasurable sublime qualities, cultivate and attain the knowledge of the ten powers of true awareness; may all sentient beings attain the treasure of the sixteen knowledges of refined meditation, and ultimately fulfill broad, great knowledge and wisdom; may all sentient beings develop the treasure of the supreme field of blessings, and awaken to the unexcelled knowledge and wisdom of the enlightened; may all sentient beings become masters of the most excellent treasure, and expound all truths with inexhaustible discernment.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving treasures, to cause all sentient beings to obtain the jewel of complete, supreme knowledge, the treasure of the unobstructed pure eye of the enlightened.

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus dang / yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad rgyan sna tshogs kyis shin tu brgyan pa/ lus blta na sdug pa/ rnam par dag cing mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan pa/ rin po che thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pa/ rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis shin tu brgyan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi lus rgyan gyis brgyan par brtson pa/ sems can thams cad la bu'i 'du shes kyis 'jig rten gyi bde ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi bde ba thams cad stob pa/ dga' ba sna tshogs kyis sems can rab tu dga' bar byed pa de/ rgyan sna tshogs rnam ba tha dad pa dag sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba'i tsho rgyan yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad ye shes kyi rgyan rnam par dag pas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rgyan du red par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsod nams kyi rgyud kyi mtshan rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing / mtshan gyi lus shin tu brgyan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsod nams brgya pa'i mtshan dang ldan pa'i lus can du red de lus mtshan gyis shin tu brgyan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad lus kyi yan lag mtshan kun gyis brgyan pa dang ldan zhing / lus mtshan gyis shin tu rnam par bris pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pa'i mdzod dang ldan zhing / tshig gi rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dbyangs kyi yan lag yid du 'ong zhing rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing yon tan gyis brgyan pa'i dbyangs dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshig gi tshul rnam par dag pas 'gro ba kun mgu bar byed cing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyis tshig yid du 'ong bar brgyan pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kun la lta bas snyoms par 'jug cing sems kyi rgyan gyis brgyan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos snang ba thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu thob cing gzungs thams cad kyi rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis rgyud shin tu brgyan pas sems ye shes kyis yang dag par brgyan pa dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi rgyan de dag yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med pa thams cad kyi yon tan dang / ye shes kyi rgyan yongs su rdzogs te sems can thams cad kyi ris na nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa med par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang phyug la spyi po nas dbang bskur bas mngon par dbang bskur ba/ cod pan dang gtsug gi rin po che'i spyin ba byed cing yongs su gtong ba dang / mngon par stob pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa dang / ltos pa med par yongs su gtong pa'i sems rnam par 'phel bar byed pa dang / sbyin pas bsgos pa'i rgyud yongs su sgom pa dang / sbyin pa la dbang sgyur bar rab tu 'jug pa dang / sbyin pa'i ye shes la rab tu slob pa dang / sbyin pa gtong ba'i dbang po yongs su skyed pa dang / sbyin pa gtong ba'i blo rgya cher byed pa'i tshe cod pan dang / gtsug gi rin po che yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyis spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas dbang po thams cad la shin tu dbang bskur bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi gtsug gi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas spyi bo gtsug tor can gyi mgo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyi yon tan gyi spyi bo'i mthar phyin pas ye shes rin po che mchog gis sems can thams cad yang dag par sdud par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyi spyi bos phyag bya bar 'os shing ye shes rin po che'i mchog la yang dag par gnas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi skyid pa la dbang bsgyur ba rab tu thob ste ye shes kyi cod pa na shin tu bcings par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten kun gyis blta bar mi nus pa'i chos can du gyur te ye shes kyi nor bu rin po ches mgo rab tu brgyan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad spyi bor gyur pa'i ye shes kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rnam par lta pa'i chos can du gyur te spyi bo shin tu btsun pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes rin po che'i rgya mtsho'i snying po rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing stobs bcu'i rgyan cod pan gyis mgo rab tu brgyan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'dod pa'i khams kyi dang po nas bdud thams cad rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir sa'i dam pa la gnas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad stobs bcu'i mthar thug ste chos kyi ye shes kyi spyi bo rnam par dag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i dbu zil gyis mi non pa'i snang ba rab tu thob ste rgyal po'i mchog dam par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po cod pan dang / gtsug gi rin po che yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba des sems can thams cad kyis ye shes mchog gi 'byung gnas rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes kyi cod pan dang / nor bu rin po che rab tu thob pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings may give various beautiful decorations — decorations for all bodies, causing the body to be beautiful and pleasing to all. Great enlightening beings regard all creatures in the world equally, like an only child, and want to cause them all to have adornments purifying their bodies, to attain supreme peace and comfort, to attain the bliss of enlightened knowledge, abide by the Buddha-teachings and benefit living beings. With innumerable, various exquisite jewel ornaments such as these they diligently practice giving, and when they are giving they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings develop unexcelled, wonderful adornments and adorn humans and celestials with pure virtue and knowledge; may all sentient beings attain features of pure adornment, adorning themselves with pure felicitous virtues; may all sentient beings attain features of most sublime adornment, and array themselves with all marks of virtue; may all sentient beings attain features of unconfused adornments, adorning themselves with all marks of Buddhahood; may all sentient beings attain the features of adornment by good, pure speech, endowed with all kinds of unlimited intellectual powers; may all sentient beings attain the features of adornment by voices with all good qualities, their voices pure and clear, pleasing to all who hear; may all sentient beings attain the feature of adornment by the delightful speech of the Buddhas, causing living beings to hear the teaching, rejoice in it, and cultivate pure practice; may all sentient beings attain the features of adornment of mind, entering deep meditative concentration and seeing the Buddhas; may all sentient beings attain the features of adornment by total mental command, illumining the true teachings of all Buddhas; may all sentient beings attain the features of adornment by wisdom and knowledge, adorning their minds with the wisdom and knowledge of buddhahood.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when generously giving all kinds of ornaments, to cause sentient beings to be endowed with the adornments of the complete fulfillment of all the innumerable qualities of Buddhas, complete virtue and knowledge, and to forever shed all conceit and self-indulgence.
“Great enlightening beings give to all sentient beings the jeweled crowns and topknot jewels they received when crowned as independent kings, without regret in their hearts, always cultivating themselves diligently to be generous donors, learning the wisdom of giving, developing the faculty of relinquishment; with knowledge and skill in means, their minds broad and magnanimous, they give to all, and dedicate those roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be crowned by the Buddha-teachings and achieve universal knowledge; may all sentient beings attain the foremost knowledge and reach the other shore; may all sentient beings save living beings with the treasure of sublime knowledge and cause them all to fulfill the summit of virtue; may all sentient beings attain completion of the precious crown of knowledge and wisdom and be worthy of the honor of the world; may all sentient beings’ heads be graced with the crown of knowledge and become autonomous monarchs and masters of the law; may all sentient beings tie the clear jewel of knowledge to their heads, invisible to all worldlings; may all sentient beings be worthy of the obeisance of the world, perfect the peak of wisdom, and illumine the Buddha-teachings; may all sentient beings be crowned with the crown adorned by the ten powers, filled with the purity of the ocean of jewels of knowledge and wisdom; may all sentient beings reach the summit of the great stages of enlightenment, attain omniscience, fulfill the ten powers, and destroy the bands of maniacs at the peak of the realm of desire; may all sentient beings manage to attain the highest summit of sovereignty, and attain the peak of radiance of omniscience, which cannot be outshone.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving jeweled crowns, to cause sentient beings to attain the realm of utmost purity of supreme knowledge, and the crown of jewels of wisdom.

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos btson rar bcug cing btson chas bcings pa'i sems can sdug bsngal ba/ sdug bsngal gyi khyim gyis bskor ba/ shing sgrog dang / lcags sgrog dang / ltung gis bcings pas lus lcags thag gis btags pa/ bsdams pa; shin tu brgyus pa'i lus can/ mi bde bas lus shin tu mnar ba/ skyabs med par ltung ba/ bkres pa dang skom pas nyen pa/ gos med pa/ mun pas yog cing khebs pa; shin tu rke ba/ brla lcags sgrog gis sgrogs pa de lta bu dag mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can dang / rgyal po mig bzang gis ji ltar byas pa bzhin du bdag dang 'khor du bcas pa nor thams cad dang bcas par yongs su btang ste byin nas btson ra de nas sems can de dag yongs su thar par byed do/ / des btson ra de nas sems can de dag thar par byas nas kyang nor gyi sbyin pa thams cad mngon par byin nas sman dang / sman pa dang / sngags kyi rnam pas lus nad med par byas te bde ba dang / yid dga' ba la rab tu bkod nas chos rin po che thos par byas te dga' ba'i gtam gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba la bkod nas sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa las mi nyams par byed do/ / de de ltar sems can btson ra nas bkye bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sred pa'i bcings pa dang / zhags pa las shin tu grol bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes mthong ba'i pha rol tu phyin cing 'khor ba'i rgyud shin tu chad par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bag la nyal ba shin tu bcom ste/ kun nas 'khor ba dang rnam par bral bsam rig pa'i mun pa dang / rab rib dang / ling tog rnam par bsal cing rab rib med pa'i ye shes yang dag par mthong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun dgon par bya ba'i ye shes kyi mthar thug par gyur te khams gsum pa'i bcings pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa med pa'i sar ye shes bsgribs pa med pa mthong ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob cing nyon mongs pa'i bcings pa thams cad shin tu shigs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rlom sems kyi g.yo ba rnam par rgyu ba thams cad yang dag par gzhom pa'i phyir g.yo ba med pa'i ye shes la yang dag par gzhol zhing / g.yo ba dang rlom sems kyi bcings pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad khams gsum thams cad du chags pa med par gnas shing 'dod pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral te 'dod pa'i bcings pa thams cad rnam par spangs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsam pa sangs rgyas thams cad la btang bas lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu grol bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa dag tu sems chags pa med pa dang / grol zhing bcings pa med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba dang / theg pa chen po la dgod par bya ba'i phyir rnam par rgyu zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'dod par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad btson ra dang / btson tsha nas bkye bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad shin tu grol zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang sems can la la zhig srog dang dbral ba'i phyir gsad du khrid pa/ sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis mi bzad cing 'dar ba/ bcing ba lngas bcings pa/ skye bo brgya phrag stong gis kun nas bskor cing 'dzam bu gling du gtogs pa sna tshogs nas bshal zhing dkri ba/ gnyen bshes kyi rgyud dang / mdza' bo'i rgyud thams cad dang bral bar gyur pa/ ral gris gtsab cing gsheg pa/ gsal shing bsgrengs pa la bskyon pa/ lus thams cad kun nas glegs te me 'bar ba'i nang du dor ba'am/ sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa mi bde ba thams cad kyis mi bde bar bya ba gtse ba sna tshogs thams cad du bsgre ba zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mthong bar gyur na/ de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de gsad par bya bde'i don du lus yongs su gtong ste/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' mi pham pa dang / rgyal po khyad par du 'gro bas ji ltar byas pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams kyang sems can gsad pa bslu ba'i don du lus yongs su gtong zhing / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad nyams su len pa de bzhin du rab tu gtong ba byed cing tshig 'di skad du smra'o/ / khyed kyi mi bde ba 'di dag bdag la gyis shig / lus 'di yongs su gtong gi / nga'i srog gcad par gyis shig / nga la ni/ ci byas so cog kyang mi nyan pa med kyi/ khyed kyis mi 'di la ci bya bar 'dod pa de las grangs med pa'i 'gyur du sdug bsngal gyi rnam pas gtse ba thams cad kyis mi bde ba sna tshogs su gyis shig / ces te/ 'di ltar bdag gis gsad par bkri ba mthong yang bdag gi lus dang / srog gis mi blu ba ni/ bdag la tshul dang mi 'dra'o/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ bdag gis ni/ sems can thams cad la dmigs te 'gro ba thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed do/ / snyam nas bdag gi lus dang srog yongs su btang ste gsad par bya ba de blus nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad gzhan gyis gtse ba'i sdug bsngal nye bar byung bas lus dang srog shin tu mi 'phrog par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad las thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub stobs bcur lung bstan pa'i gnas rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ngan song thams cad kyi lam las yongs su 'das te 'jigs pa thams cad las rab tu thar par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'chi ba med pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings su zhugs pas 'tsho ba thams cad kyi skabs rab tu rnyed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su bzung bas dgras 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad kha na ma thob med pa'i las dge ba thams cad spyod pas ral gris gtsab pa lta bu'i mi bde ba thams cad las 'das par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub kyi shing dam pa'i drung du phyin cing 'jigs pa med par bdud kyi sde thams cad rnam par 'thor bas bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs shing skrag pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'jigs pa med pas rnam par dag cing khyu mchog dang / seng+ge'i nga ro 'byin pas 'khor gyi 'jigs pa dang bag tsha ba thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las la yang dag par spyod cing 'gro ba thams cad kyi nang na bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i seng+ger gyur cig / sems can thams cad skye bo kun yongs su skyong ba'i sems dang ldan zhing 'gro ba kun tu 'jigs pa med pa'i khang par zhugs par gyur cig / ces de ltar gsad par gyur ba dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang gi lus dang srog btang ste blus nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i btson ra'i sdug bsngal kun spangs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bde ba mi spang pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings see sentient beings in prisons or dungeons, dark and dim, shackled and chained, unable to rise or sit in comfort, assailed by myriad pains, without relatives or friends, without refuge or salvation, naked, hungry, emaciated, suffering unbearable torture, the enlightening beings, having seen this, give what they have, all their wealth, their spouses, children, and households, and even their own bodies, to rescue those creatures in prison, like the enlightening being Great Compassion and the enlightening being King of Wondrous Eyes did; and, having rescued them, they give them whatever they need, relieving their suffering, enabling them to gain peace and comfort—after that, they give them the supreme treasure of the teaching, cause them to give up indulgence, firmly establish roots of goodness, and not shrink away or withdraw from the Buddhist teaching. When great enlightening beings rescue sentient beings from prison, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be ultimately liberated from the bonds of covetousness and craving; may all sentient beings cut off the stream of birth and death and climb up onto the shore of wisdom; may all sentient beings do away with ignorance and folly, develop knowledge and wisdom, and shed the fetters of afflictions; may all sentient beings destroy the bonds of the worlds of desire, form, and formlessness, attain universal knowledge and be ultimately emancipated; may all sentient beings forever cut off all the bonds of afflictions and reach the other shore of knowledge and wisdom, the ground of nonobstruction, where there are no afflictions; may all sentient beings be free from stirring thoughts, musing, and vain discrimination, and enter the realm of equanimous, imperturbable knowledge; may all sentient beings shed the bonds of desires, forever leaving behind all mundane cravings, and have no attachments in the worlds of desire, form, or formlessness; may all sentient beings attain supreme aspiration and always have the Buddhas teach them; may all sentient beings attain liberated minds, with no attachments and no bondage, broad and vast as the cosmos, comprehensive as space; may all sentient beings attain the spiritual powers of enlightening beings, taming sentient beings in all worlds, causing them to detach from the mundane and abide in the Great Vehicle.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when saving sentient beings suffering in prison, to enable sentient beings to enter the realm of knowledge and wisdom of the enlightened.
“Great enlightening beings, seeing prisoners bound hand and foot, suffering all sorts of pain, beaten and oppressed by their jailers, on the brink of death, having given up all earthly comforts, forever parted from their relatives and friends, laid out on butchering blocks to be dismembered, or impaled on wooden stakes, or doused with oil and set afire, the enlightening beings, having seen them oppressed by such tortures, give up their own bodies to take their places, as did the enlightening beings Invincible, King of Most Excellent Action, and other great enlightening beings who gave up their own lives to spare others, bearing cruel suffering in their stead. At that time the enlightening beings say to the wardens, ‘I wish to give up my body in exchange for their lives. You may apply those tortures to me. Just as you are doing to those people, you may do what you want, even more, to me—I will endure even incalculable times as much, so that they may be freed. If I see them about to be killed and do not give up my life to redeem them from their misery, then I cannot be said to be dwelling in the mind of an enlightening being. Why? Because I have made the determination for omniscient enlightenment for the purpose of saving all beings.’
“When great enlightening beings give up their own lives to save sentient beings, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain endless, ultimate life and be forever free from disaster, oppression, and affliction; may all sentient beings stay with the Buddhas, receive universal knowledge, fulfill the ten powers, and receive the prediction of enlightenment; may all sentient beings rescue conscious beings everywhere, cause them to be free from fear and to forever leave the states of woe; may all sentient beings attain total life and enter the realm of undying knowledge; may all sentient beings be forever free from hostility and enmity, have no calamities, and always be in the care of Buddhas and good teachers; may all sentient beings abandon all weapons and instruments of evil and suffering, and practice all kinds of pure, good action; may all sentient beings be free from all fears and crush the armies of demons at the tree of enlightenment; may all sentient beings be free from terrors, their hearts pure and fearless in regard to the highest teaching, and be able to make the supreme lion’s roar; may all sentient beings attain unobstructed lionic knowledge and wisdom and cultivate right action in all worlds; may all sentient beings reach the realm of fearlessness and always attend to the salvation and protection of suffering sentient beings.’ This is great enlightening beings; dedication of roots of goodness when giving up their own lives to save prisoners about to be executed, to cause sentient beings to be free from the pains of birth and death and to attain the sublime bliss of the enlightened.

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la mgo las gtsug phud dang thor pag tu bcas pa bslangs na/ rgyal po gtsug na rin po che dang / byang chub sems dpa' yan lag dam pa shin tu 'phags pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis ji ltar byin pa de bzhin du des slong ba de dag mthong nas gtong bar mos pa'i tshig dge bas thor pag dang gtsug phud du bcos te khyer cig / ces stob cing / kye tshur sheg / bdag gi mgo las gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas pa longs shig / ces nas byang chub sems dpa' 'dzam bu'i gling na btsun pa mi'i dam pa des yid rtse gcig tu byas te yid ma 'khrugs pa dang / yid ma 'dres pa dang / las gzhan la mi sems pa'i yid dang / 'jig rten las 'phags pa'i yid dang / rab tu zhi ba'i yid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yid dang / dag pa'i yid dang / drang ba'i yid dang / rig pa la brtson pa'i yid kyis gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas pa de slong ba la gtong ba'i tshe gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas par tshon gyis phog ste mgo las phab nas pus mo g.yas pa'i lha nga sa la bcugs te rim gro dang bcas pa'i lus kyis sor mo bcu'i thal mo sbyar nas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi spyod pa rjes su dran pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / dga' bas rnam par spel ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / chos kyis yongs su rgyas pa'i yid kyi dbang dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas dengs par mi 'gyur ba'i yid kyi dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang tha dad par khong du chud pa dang / tshor ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de dag thams cad mi rtag go /zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa'i gtong ba'i sems dang / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa las phyir mi ldog pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pas thob pa/ gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i tshul la gnas te gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas pa mgo las phog ste yongs su gtong pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i gtsug gi mchod rten du gyur te gtsug gtor bltar mi snang bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad skra shin tu phra ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par bsal cing skra rdo rje nag po'i dam pa lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad skra stug cing skra mtshams legs pa dang / skra snum par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mgo legs pa las shin tu legs par skyes pa'i skra rab tu 'jam pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad skra dga' ba 'khyil ba ltar g.yas phyogs su 'khyil cing dpal gyi be'u dang / bkra shis kyi skra dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par 'das shin sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang ldan pa'i skra thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba thams cad rgyas par rang gi skra las 'od zer rab tu 'gyed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dbu shin tu rnam par dag pa ltar skra shin tu mdzes par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems ma nyams shing sangs rgyas kyi dbu skra dang / dbu lta bur mdzes pa dang ldan pas spyi bo la gzhag pa'i mchod rten du 'os pa'i skra dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dbu ltar chags pa med pa'i skra mdzes par skyes pas mun pa dang rdul mi chags pa dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug phud dang thor pag tu bcas pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi sa lta bur shin tu zhi ba'i sems yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs bcu'i mthas gtugs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba rnams la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba byed pa dang / rgyal po zla 'od dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa gzhan dag gis gtong ba'i mig yongs su sbyangs pa'i sems dang / ye shes kyi mig yongs su sbyangs pa'i blo dang / chos kyi snang ba rab tu thob pa'i yid kyi gnas dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur pa'i yid kyi rnam pa dang / mngon par
