shes pa thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i yongs su bsngo ba dang / ye shes kyi skye mched la yang dag par btang ba'i sems dang / dus gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' dang mnyam par byas pa'i sbyin pa dang / gtong ba'i sems dang / zhe sdang ba med pa'i mig gis dad pa mi ldog pa'i dbang dang / slong ba rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i sems dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan la gzhol bas byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po dang / byams pa dang / snying rje yongs su sgom pa dang / dbang po drug shin tu bsdams pas slong ba rnams la mig byin pa de bzhin du/ de yang mig yongs su gtong zhing chos de lta bu la zhugs pa'i sems kyis slong ba dang / 'dod pa dag la sbyin pa byed cing mchod sbyin gyi don la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi mthu shin tu bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi dga' bar lta ba dang / bag med pa'i sred pa rnam par zlog par byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dga' ba dang / 'dod pa sna tshogs mthong bas rang gi dga' ba khong du chud par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba myong bar byed pa dang / ci bslangs pa'i dngos pos kha mi stong bar byed pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i sbyin pa rjes su srung ba dang / rlom sems med pas shin tu sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba dang / slong ba rnams kyis dngos po ci bslangs pa sbyin par byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad kyi mig tu gyur te mig gi dam par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi mdzod shin tu yangs pas nyams pa med pa'i mig tu gyur cig / sems can thams cad snang ba mi 'phrog pa dang ldan zhing sha'i mig rnam par dag pa yongs su grub par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes shing lha'i mig rnam par dag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'dong zhing chos kyi mig rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gtong ba thams cad rnam par ston pas shes rab kyi mig thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chags pa med pa'i mig gi mthar thug ste kun tu lta ba'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems can gyi khams yongs su shes shing rab rim med pa'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad stobs bcu mnga' ba'i de bzhin gshegs par phyin pas bsgribs pa'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig yongs su gtong ba na thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshad kyi mig gi chos sems can thams cad yongs su bsngo ba la nye bar 'god do/ /

“Great enlightening beings give the knot of flesh on their heads to beggars as did the enlightening beings Jewel Topknot King, Supremely Wonderful Body, and countless others. At such a time, seeing a beggar come, the enlightening beings’ hearts fill with joy and they say, ‘If you need a flesh topknot, take it from me—mine is the best in the land.’ And when they say this, their minds are undisturbed, they do not think of other actions; they relinquish the world and seek dispassionate serenity; ultimately pure, diligent, straightforward, they are bent on omniscience. They then take a sharp knife and cut off the topknot of flesh on their heads; with their right knee kneeling on the ground, they join their palms and give their topknots away with a concentrated mind, thinking of the practices of all Buddhas and enlightening beings of the past, present, and future, conceiving great joy, increasing in determination. Intellectually they skillfully analyze and understand phenomena, and do not grasp pain, knowing that the sense of pain has no signs and no origin, that all sensations occur relatively and none are permanent. Therefore they develop great blissful faith that they should practice great relinquishment like all enlightening beings of past, future, and present, seeking universal knowledge without retreating, without relying on others’ teaching or the power of a teacher.
“When great enlightening beings carry out this giving, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain the invisible crown and develop the pagodalike topknot of enlightening beings; may all sentient beings have hair like the Buddha, and be able to extinguish all afflictions of sentient beings; may all sentient beings have glossy hair, thick hair, hair which doesn’t grow on the forehead; may all sentient beings have hair like the Buddha and forever be free from all afflictions and binding habits; may all sentient beings have radiant hair, shining with light that illumines all worlds in the ten directions; may all sentient beings have undisturbed hair, clean like the Buddha’s; may all sentient beings develop the pagodalike hair of the saint, so that for all who see it it is like seeing the Buddha’s hair; may all sentient beings have hair like the Buddha, without stain, without attachment, forever rid of all obscuring dust and dirt.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving their flesh topknots, to cause sentient beings to be dispassionate and serene of mind, fulfill all concentration formulae, and consummate the enlightened one’s knowledge of all ways of liberation and its ten powers.
“Great enlightening beings give their eyes to those who come and ask for them, just as the enlightening beings Gladdening Practice, Moonlight King, and countless others gave theirs. When great enlightening beings give their eyes, they arouse a pure mind to give eyes; they arouse the mind of the eye of pure knowledge, arouse a mind resting on the light of truth; arouse the mind witnessing the unexcelled Buddha Way; awaken a mind dedicated to great knowledge; awaken a mind to give with equanimity equal to the enlightening beings of past, present, and future; awaken the unobstructed eye; arouse a mind of indestructible pure faith; arouse a mind of joyful acceptance in regard to those who ask. To consummate all spiritual powers, to produce the enlightened eye, to increase and broaden the great determination for enlightenment, to cultivate great compassion, and to master the senses, they set their minds on these things.
“When great enlightening beings give eyes, they conceive great love for those who ask, and establish charity for them, increasing the power of the teaching, giving up mundane emotional views and indulgence, cutting off the bonds of desire, cultivating enlightenment, and obligingly satisfying their requests with unperturbed minds, always in accord with the practice of nondualistic equanimity. These roots of goodness they dedicate thus: ‘May all sentient beings attain the supreme eye and guide everyone; may all sentient beings attain the unobstructed eye and open up the treasury of universal knowledge; may all sentient beings attain the pure physical eye, its light perceptively penetrating, impossible to block; may all sentient beings attain the pure celestial eye, seeing the births and deaths and fruits of actions of all sentient beings; may all sentient beings attain the pure objective eye and be able to enter the realm of those who realize thusness; may all sentient beings attain the eye of wisdom and abandon all conceptual grasping and attachment; may all sentient beings be endowed with the Buddha-eye, capable of total awareness and understanding of all things; may all sentient beings perfect the universal eye, comprehending all realms without hindrance; may all sentient beings attain the pure, unclouded eye, realizing the realm of sentient beings is empty and has no existence; may all sentient beings be fully endowed with the pure unobstructed eye and all be able to consummate the ten powers of the enlightened.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving eyes, to cause all sentient beings to attain the pure eye of universal knowledge.
bam po sum cu rtsa bdun pa/

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar rgyal po khyad par du 'gro ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' mdud pa med pa'i spyi gtsug gis yongs su btang ba bzhin du slong bar nye bar 'ongs pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa blangs pa'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su rigs dang ldan par byung bas sangs rgyas kyi rigs su byung ba'i sbyin pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rjes su dran pa'i spyod pa la brtson pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu mthun par skyes pa dang / dbang po dang / ye shes dang / yon tan gyis shin tu btsun pa dang / khams gsum ma dag cang snying po med pa la snying por rab tu rtog pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' blta ba rab tu thob pas rang gi lus la chags pa med pa'i sems dang / gnas med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rjes su dran par gnas pa dang / rdul ba dang / zhi ba'i sems dang / dbang po'i rgyu ba shin tu zhi ba dang / 'gro ba'i mya ngan thams cad nas sems can thams cad gdon par sems pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i shes rab dang / bsod nams kyi 'byung gnas dang / rgyud ched du brjod pa rgya mtshos gtong ba'i sems yangs par byas pa dang / don la rnam par nges pa'i chos dang / mgon po thams cad kyi lam du 'jug pa dang / chos kyi dbang phyug la ye shes kyis spyod pa dang / rang gi lus snying po med pa las snying po blang pa'i blos yongs su gtong ba'i tshe rna ba dang / sna yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos thams cad kyi sgra rnam par rig par bya ba la chags pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad kyis sgra thams cad skad ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir bsgribs pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi snyan dang ldan pas thogs pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rna ba'i skye mched shin tu bsgoms pas rna ba rnam par dag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rnam par shes pa zhi ba skye ba'i phyir bsgribs pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung khong du chud pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsgribs pa med pa'i chos rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir gnas med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad phyir rgol ba 'jig par byed pa'i shes pa la mi phyed pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rna ba shin tu dag pa la dbang sgyur bas kun tu 'jug pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi snyan rang tu 'thob par bya ba thob pas lha'i rna ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / ces
de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rna ba yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi rna ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir yongs su bsngos nas sna rnam par dag par yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad legs par mtho ba'i sna dang / dpe byad bzang po'i sna dang / mtshan bzang po'i sna dang / shin tu yid du 'ong pa'i sna dang / rnam par dag pa'i sna dang / rim gyis gzhol ba'i sna dang / mdzes par 'phags pa'i sna dang / dgra thams cad rab tu 'dul ba'i sna dang / ngo blta na sdug pa'i sna dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi shangs rab tu 'thob pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad ngo la mi sdug pa med pa dang / chos thams cad kyi ngo dang / chags pa med pa'i ngo dang / blta na sdug pa'i ngo dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i ngo dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i ngo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal gyi dkyil 'khor lta bu'i ngo dang / kun nas lta ba'i ngo dang / yid du 'ong zhing tshad med pa'i ngo dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rna ba dang / sna yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo ste/ ci nas kyang sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shin tu 'dus par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shin tu shes par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shin tu 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad shin tu mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sgo khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad shin tu zil gyis mi non pa'i yongs su dag pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la snang ba rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus dang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyid pa zil gyis mi non pa'i sa la gnas te a.u dum war ltar shin tu dkon par sems pa'i sems rnam par dag pa dang / gtong ba mi dad cing 'byams klas pa dang / dad cing rlung sprugs te btang ba'i sems dang / yongs su gtong ba'i blo mtha' yas pa dang / dul ba dang / yongs su dul ba'i yid kyis gtong ba'i dbang po dang / gtong ba thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i mthar thug pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i smon lam dang / 'gro ba thams cad bde bar byed pa'i gtong ba'i 'bras bu dang / gtong ba chen po dang / shin tu gtong ba dang / rab tu gtong ba dang / mchog tu gtong ba'i sems kyis rang gi lus dang / yan lag dang / gdong gis kyang phan 'dogs pa dang / mi smon par gtong ba'i sems kyis rnam pa de lta bu'i chos la rab tu gnas te/ ji ltar rgyal po me tog so dang / glang po'i rgyal po mche ba drug pas so ji ltar byin pa de bzhin du rang gi lus dang / kha nas so yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyis mchod rten du mchod par 'os par gyur te mche ba dkar zhing rno ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi mtshan rab tu thob pas so mnyam zhing thags bzang bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la legs par zhugs shing dul ba'i sems kyis nye bar spyod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gdong gi dkyil 'khor blta na sdug cing kha'i nang dang so rnam par dag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad kha dang so dpe med par rnam par dag cing bzhin dran pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad so bzang po'i gseb nas spos zhim po'i mchog grangs med pa yid du 'ong ba dga' ba skyid pa'i ngad 'byung bas yongs su dag cing so bzhi bcu tshang ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad shin tu dul ba'i so rab tu thob cing bkra shis dang / dga' ba 'khyil ba dang / pad+mo sna tshogs kyis mdzes par bris pa'i so dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gdong gi dkyil 'khor nas tshad med pa'i 'od zer snang ba 'byung bas 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mtha' yas pa rab tu 'byung ba'i so dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad kha zas la ma chags ma zhen cing kha na ma tho ba med par spyod pas sbyin pa'i gnas dam pa'i mthar thug par gyur te so'i thags legs shing 'bras can kha phye ba lta bur gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i dam pa lung ston cing so'i gseb kun nas 'od 'phro ba/ kha dog mtha' yas pa'i snang ba 'byung ba dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' so'i sbyin pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can ma lus pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang dag par bskyed pa dang / chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyis chos thams cad shes pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings are able to give ears and noses to those who ask, as did King of Superlative Action, Invincible, and countless other enlightening beings. When they give, they hand them over personally to those who ask, single-mindedly cultivating the deeds of enlightening beings, endowed with the seed nature of buddhahood, born in the house of the enlightened. Recollecting the acts of giving practiced by the enlightening beings, they constantly strive to activate the pure faculties of enlightenment of Buddhas, their virtues and wisdom. Observing all realms of existence, they see that not one thing endures. They aspire to always be able to see the Buddhas and enlightening beings. They recollect all Buddha-teachings according to the situation. They know the body is illusory, empty, void of existence, with nothing to cling to. Thus when enlightening beings give away ears and noses, their minds are always dispassionate and peaceful; they have tamed their senses. They save sentient beings from the dangers of perversity and evil, develop all knowledge and virtues, enter the ocean of great generosity, comprehend the meanings of the teachings, fully cultivate the ways they point out, acting in accord with knowledge and wisdom, attaining mastery of truth, and substitute an indestructible body for the perishable body.
“When great enlightening beings give ears, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain unobstructed ears and hear all sounds speaking the truth; may all sentient beings attain unblocked ears and be able to understand all sounds; may all sentient beings attain the ears of the enlightened and perceive all without hindrance; may all sentient beings attain pure ears, not producing false discriminations based on the medium of hearing; may all sentient beings attain ears without deafness, causing ignorant consciousness not to arise; may all sentient beings attain ears pervading the cosmos and know the voices of teachings of all Buddhas; may all sentient beings attain unobstructed ears and realize all ways of nonobstruction; may all sentient beings attain indestructible ears, that no one be able to break down the discourses of good teachers; may all sentient beings attain all-hearing ears, far-reaching and pure, supreme of all ears; may all sentient beings be endowed with the celestial ear and the enlightened ear.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving ears, to cause all sentient beings to attain pure ears.
“When great enlightening beings give noses, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain high, straight noses, refined noses, well-formed noses, beautiful noses, pleasing noses, pure noses, docile noses, outstanding noses, enemy-conquering noses, the noses of the enlightened; may all sentient beings attain faces free from anger, faces of all truths, faces of nonobstruction, faces good to see, docile faces, pure clean faces, impeccable faces, round full faces like the Buddha, faces pervading all places, faces of immeasurable beauty.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving noses, to cause sentient beings to ultimately gain entry into the teachings of all Buddhas, to cause sentient beings to ultimately absorb the teachings of all Buddhas, to cause sentient beings to ultimately comprehend the teachings of the Buddhas, to cause sentient beings to ultimately abide by the teachings of the Buddhas, to cause sentient beings to ultimately always see the Buddha, to cause all sentient beings to attain realization of the principles of Buddha, to cause sentient beings to ultimately develop indestructible minds, to cause sentient beings to adorn all buddha-lands, to cause sentient beings to all attain the body of great power of the enlightened ones. This is the dedication of roots of goodness of enlightening beings when giving ears and noses.
“Great enlightening beings, abiding securely in the state of indestructible freedom, are able to give teeth to sentient beings, as did Flower Teeth King, Six Tusk Elephant King, and other enlightening beings of antiquity. When great enlightening beings give teeth, their minds are pure, to a degree rarely found: that is, they give with an inexhaustible mind, give with a mind of great faith, give with a mind at every step attaining immeasurable detachment, give with a mind in control of the senses, give with a mind relinquishing all, give with a mind aspiring to universal knowledge, give with a mind to comfort sentient beings, give with great generosity, ultimate generosity, superb generosity, supreme generosity, give with a mind to relinquish their own physical necessities without resentment.
“At this time, the enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings have sharp, white teeth, becoming supreme reliquaries, receiving the offerings of humans and celestials; may all sentient beings have even teeth, like those of the Buddha, without any gaps; may all sentient beings have well-controlled minds and skillfully carry out the transcendental practices of enlightening beings; may the mouths of all sentient beings be pure and clean, their teeth bright white, showing clearly; may all sentient beings have teeth with memorable adornments, their mouths pure and clean, with no foul appearance; may all sentient beings have a full set of teeth, always producing various rare, exquisite fragrances; may all sentient beings have well-controlled intellects and their teeth be clean and bright, like white lotuses, forming gammadion patterns; may all sentient beings’ mouths and lips be fresh and clean, their teeth clean and white, shining with innumerable lights illuminating everywhere; may all sentient beings’ teeth be fine and sharp, so there are no whole grains left in their food when they eat and they have no attachment to taste and become excellent fields of blessings; may all sentient beings always radiate light from between their teeth, giving enlightening beings the foremost prediction of enlightenment.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving teeth, to cause sentient beings to be endowed with omniscience, their knowledge of all things clear and pure.

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la lce bslangs na/ ji ltar rgyal po bzhin bzang dang / byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis kyang skye ba'i skye mched rnam pa sna tshogs dag la gnas shing tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa de dang de dag tu yongs su btang bar gyur pa de bzhin du/ ngas kyang slong ba de dag rgyal po la 'os pa'i seng+ge'i gdan dag la bkod cing slong bas mos pa'i sems kyis yid du 'ong zhing 'jam pa'i ngag dang / byams pa la spyod pa'i sems kyis rang gi lce gtong ba'i tshe/ gshe ba med pa'i sems dang / rma med pa'i sems dang / nyams pa med pa'i sems dang / rigs chen po'i rigs dang ldan pa'i sems dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs su byung ba'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems la dgod cing gzhag pa'i sems dang / rgyud 'khrugs pa med pa'i sems dang / mthu stobs chen po'i shugs kyi sems dang / lus la ma chags pa'i sems dang / tshig tu brjod pa la chags pa med pa'i sems su byas te pus mo'i lha nga sa la btsugs shing bdag gi kha nas lce byung ste lus thams cad la slong ba dbang byed du bcug nas tshig mnyen zhing 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / byams par spyod pas tshig tu brjod cing / ci nas kyang khyed dga' zhing yid bde ba dang / mgu zhing rangs par bdag gi lce longs la/ gang du dgos pa de'i dgos pa sgrubs shig / ces nas de lce sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba'i tshe lce yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad tshig gi tshul thams cad kyis shes par byed pa'i phyir lce shin tu yangs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi tshig bden pa gnyis su bya ba med pa dang ldan par gyur te gdong gi dkyil 'khor khebs pa'i lce dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi cho 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa yang dag par ston pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du khyab pa'i lce dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ro bro ba'i mchog shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing shin tu bslab pa'i lce dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyi tshig shes pas the tshom gcod pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshig gi dbyings mtha' yas pa yod pa'i lce dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad lce'i mdzod nas 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa 'gyed pa'i phyir snang ba mtha' yas pa 'byung ba'i lce dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos thams cad rnam par nges pa'i spobs pa'i tshogs mi zad pas ston cing brjod pas tshig shin tu nges pa brjod pa'i lce dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad spyod pa kun brjod pa tshad med pa'i mdzod kyi lce dang ldan zhing 'dul ba'i mtha' dang mnyam par sems can kun gyi tshig thams cad dang / smra ba thams cad rnam par 'grel ba'i lce dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad spyod pa rjes su rjod pa'i tshig gi rgya mtsho thams cad la rab tu zhugs pas dbyangs kyi tshogs dang / tshig gi rnam par shes pa'i lce dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad spyod pa thams cad mngon par rjod pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob cing chos thams cad kyi tshig thams cad shin tu ston pa'i lce dang / ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs pa'i smon lam la rab tu brtson pa de lce yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes chags pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi dam pa mgo lta bu'i ye shes la 'jug cing / sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i mgo byang chub khong du chud par byed pa dang / chos thams cad kyi mchog tshul gyi mgo dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par lta ba dang / ye shes rnam par dag pa'i mgo la yang dag par lta ba dang / bsgribs pa med pa'i mgo yongs su sgrub pa dang / sa dam pa'i mgo rjes su lta ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi ye shes dam pa mgo lta bu 'dod cing tshol ba dang / khams gsum pa thams cad kyis bltar med pa'i ye shes kyi mgo'i dam pa yang dag par sgrub pa dang / phyogs thams cad du phyin pa'i ye shes kyi rgyal po'i mgo la mngon par mos par byed pa dang / chos thams cad la dbang byed pa zil gyis mi non pa'i mgo yongs su grub par byed cing / de lta bu'i chos la spyod par brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi rigs thams cad kyi yongs su gtong ba'i tshul la bslab pa/ sangs rgyas la mos pa skyes pas dge ba'i rtsa ba rab tu thob pa/ slong ba mtha' yas bas dga' bas yongs su rgyas pa'i sems dang ldan pa yid kyi dbang po shin tu gsal ba/ rgyud rab tu shing sems dang yid shin tu pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos la dga' ba'i snang ba thob pa/ byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa shin tu rgya che ba rgyun mi 'chad par sems pa/ gtong ba chen po gtong ba/ shin tu gtong bas gtong ba'i yid dang ldan pa/ dbang po shin tu dga' bas nye bar brtan pa'i chos can/ lhag pa'i bsam pa yangs shing dge la rgya che bas sbyin pa gtong bar mngon par 'dod pa/ de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' ye shes mchog dang / skyes bu dam pa ka shi'i rgyal po dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag kyang mgo yongs su gtong bar gyur pa de ltar mgo gtong ba'i tshe mgo yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi dbu rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / spyi gtsug bltar mi snang ba dang / skye mched zil gyis mi non pa dang / zhing thams cad du mngon par 'phags pa dang / bum pa rgyas pa dang / dga' ba 'khyil ba dang / skra dang mgo'i 'od dang / 'od zer sna tshogs kyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad du rmad du byung ba dang / dpal gyi be'us brgyan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi dbu dang ldan pa dang / ye shes kyi mgo rtogs par bya ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi mchog tu phyin pa'i mgo dang ldan pa dang / mgo rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mgo yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mgo yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos kyi mchog yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ye shes kyi yan lag dam pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba rnams la dad pa'i lag pa thog mar 'gro ba dang / phan 'dogs pa'i tshul dang / chos spyod pa la brtson par 'gro zhing ldog pa dang / rin po che'i lag pa thog mar 'gro bas lag pa gtong ba dang / spyod pa don yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod pa dang / lag shin tu brkyang zhing gtong ba'i sems ma 'khrugs pa dang / rim par spyod pa'i tshul shin tu nges pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' seng+ge'i rtsal gyis spyod cing / lag pa yangs pa gtong ba la mos pas lag pa yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul gyi gzhi chen po rab tu brtan pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yi dam dang / tshor bas ma nyams pa'i blo dang ba dang / 'gro ba ma yin par 'gro ba las phyir log pa'i 'gro bas byang chub tu 'byung bas de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu brtson pa dang / rgyal po dga' ldan dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan tshad med pa dag kyang skye ba'i skye gnas sna tshogs dag na gnas shing lag pa yongs su gtong bar gyur pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems yangs shing rgya che ba tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas rgya mtsho mthong bar gyur pa/ chos kyi rgyud kyi sgo rnam par bye ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab par gtong ba'i lag pa dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'dzin pa'i smon lam can; sems bskyed pa rdul med pa dang 'grogs pas kun nas bskor ba med pa/ ye shes dang chos kyi lus rgyun mi 'chad pa/ mi shigs mi chod pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ bdud kyi las thams cad kyis mi sgrub pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis nye bar brtan pas sems spel ba/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis spyad pa dang gcig tu gyur pa'i gtong bas byung ba de/ slong ba la rkang lag gi sbyin pa byed cing yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te rkang lag yongs su btang ba yongs su byin pa 'di la dge ba'i rtsa ba ci yod pa de dag 'di ltar sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa thob cing rin po che'i lag pa dang ldan par gyur cig / de dag rin po che'i lag pa des sems can thams cad la sbyin pa'i gnas kyi 'du shes rab tu thob ste phan tshun gyi lus la rin po ches brgyan pa 'thob par gyur cig / mngon par 'thob par gyur cig / rab tu 'thob par gyur cig / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyi sprin gyis sangs rgyas thams cad mchod par gyur cig / sems can de dag thams cad kyang phan tshun du zhe sdang ba med pa'i sems dang ldan zhing phan tshun byams pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rjes su dong zhing 'jigs pa med pa la gnas te mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i phyir thams cad lag na rin po che thogs pa dang / lag na spos thogs pa dang / lag na gos thogs pa dang / lag na gdugs thogs pa dang / lag na phreng ba thogs pa dang / lag na me tog thogs pa dang / lag na phye ma thogs pa dang / lag na lhab lhub thogs pa dang / lag na me tog mtha' yas pa thogs par gyur te kun nas sgo dang ldan pa'i thabs la gnas shing sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod par brtson pa'i sems dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun tu 'gro ba'i rdzu 'phrul dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i lag pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / cho 'phrul gyi lag pa mtshan bzang po dang ldan pa'i lag pa dang / 'od zer gyi mdzod mtha' yas pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu gtong ba'i lag pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad lag mthil gcig gis yog par byed pa'i lag pa dang / dra bar 'brel cing sen mo zangs ltar 'dug pa'i lag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi phyag shin tu yangs pa dang ldan pas sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod pa byed par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yon tan rgya mtsho thams cad la rab tu zhugs pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / khas len pa'i ngang tshul dang / slong ba thams cad la mngon par mos shing 'dod pas dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / dad pa chen po rab tu thob pa dang / slong ba 'bod par ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pas rkang lag yongs su gtong ba byed cing / 'gro ba thams cad kyi byang chub tshol ba'i tshe rkang lag yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar thams cad gtong ba'i don du yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i bsam pa dang / sems dang / yid du ldan pa/ byang chub kyi sems kyis rab tu dga' ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mngon par dad pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ tshor bas dengs par mi 'gyur ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ slong ba thams cad la mngon par mos pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ len pa thams cad la zhe mi sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gtong ba'i lam du rab tu zhugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gtong bas sbyin par bya ba'i rjes su srung ba'i sems dang ldan pa; byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa rgya chen pos gtong ba shin tu gtong ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ phyir mi ldog pa'i sems rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ldan pa/ bdag gi lus la phangs par mi lta ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi 'byung gnas dang / rgyal po yid bde bar sems pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag kyang skye ba'i skye gnas de dang de dag la gnas shing khrag yongs su gtong bar gyur pa de ltar slong ba rnams la rang gi lus kyi khrag gtong ba'i tshe khrag yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos dang ye shes kyi lus dang ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i lus phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rdo rje'i snying po dang 'dra bar dge sbyong gi lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad lus nyams pa med cing dag pa dang ldan te lus la rma med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyis mi 'phrog pa'i sems dang ldan zhing sprul pa lta bu'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'od dang ba'i lus nyams pa med pa dang ldan zhing yid du 'ong ba'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mi gnas pa dang ldan zhing chos kyi dbyings su mngon par skyes pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gzhan thams cad lus thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i lus dang ldan zhing rin po che lta bu'i 'od yod pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su chos kyi skyid pa la dbang sgyur ba'i lus dang ldan zhing ye shes dam pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyis blta na don yod par skyes pas rin po che rgya mtsho lta bu'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten kun gyi gtse bas gos pa med cing bar snang gi rang bzhin gyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi lus las khrag gi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe ye shes kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po la rab tu gzhol ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / dag pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / yangs pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / dga' ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o// rangs pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / spro ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / zhum pa med pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / bde ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / dang ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / mgu ba'i yid dang / rab tu dga' ba'i yid dang / yid bde zhing rangs pa skyes pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtong ba'i sems gzhal du med pa'i dga' bas rnam par 'phel ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang mkhas pa'i skye bos bsten pa'i zla med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dam pa 'jig rten gyi dri ma bsal ba dang / slong ba thams cad kyis zad par mi nus pa'i nang gi lus nye bar blangs pa'i yongs su gtong ba dang / yon tan rin po ches yang dag par blangs pa'i dge ba 'byams klas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yi dam gyis nye bar blangs pa'i sbyin pa'i tshogs chen po dang / slong ba thams cad kyi yid kyis 'dod par bsam pa btang yang 'gyod pa med pa'i sems dang / sbyin pa la dmigs pa'i dngos pos shin tu brtags pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i rten dang / len pa rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i sems nyams pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mngon du gyur pa pha lta bu'i 'du shes su mngon par 'dzin pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i sems can thams cad rnam par dag pa la gnas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i snying rje chen pos yongs su skyob pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub la mngon du gyur pa'i stobs bcu rnam par spyod pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mthun pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i khyu mchog dang / seng+ge'i nga ro bsgrags pa dang / dus gsum mngon du gyur pa'i dus thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / dus gsum thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal par thug par zhe non pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / yongs su yid chad pa med pas mngon du gyur pa'i sems bskyed pa grangs med pas de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' phan pa tshol ba dang / rgyal po thams cad gtong ba dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag kyang skye ba'i skye mched sna tshogs dag na gnas shing sha dang / rkang yongs su gtong ba de lta slong ba rnams la lus las sha dang / rkang yongs su gtong ba'i tshe sha dang / rkang yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di sems can thams cad rdo rje'i snying po ltar mkhregs pa'i yan lag dang ldan zhing mi shigs pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gsob med pa'i lus rab tu thob pas gsog ma yin pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing / sangs rgyas kyis brgyan pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mtshan sum cu gnyis kyis lus shin tu grub pas bsod nams brgya pa'i mtshan gyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu tha mi dad cing ma nyams pa dang ldan te dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par bris pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rab tu thob pas mtha' las 'das pa tshad med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bdud thams cad kyi dkrug ma rab tu 'joms pas kun tu khyab pa'i spyod lam dang ldan zhing thub pa med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang lus gcig par gyur cig / sems can thams cad nam mkha'i dbyings kun tu chos kyi skus khyab par byed pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i lus mngon par grub par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad shong ba'i lus dang ldan zhing byang chub kyi lus dam pa dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen par dmigs pa'i sems dang ldan pa slong ba la sha dang rkang yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi sku mtha' las 'das pa tshad med pa rnam par dag pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i rgyud la bslab pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sbyin pa thams cad byin pas spyod pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chen po thob pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ pha rol tu 'gro ba'i sbyin pa grub pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis byin pa'i rjes su bslab pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sbyin pa dang yongs su gtong ba thams cad kyi zad mi shes pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sbyin pa'i gnas thams cad la shin tu gnas pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i las pa rab tu gnas pa de sems dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad yid la bya bas mngon du gyur pa'i gtong ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ slong ba thams cad rgyun mi 'chad par rgyu ba rab tu mchod dang sems dang ldan pa/ de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' yongs su skyo ba med pa dang / rgyal po g.yo ba med pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag gis kyang snying yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar slong ba kun las 'ongs pa rnams kyis bslangs shing rang gi lus las snying yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pa byed pa dang / spong ba dang / thob par byed pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyong ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir stobs bcu'i byang chub la dmigs par byed pa dang / smon lam chen pos nan tan du byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yang dag par gnas pa dang / smon lam yongs su mi gtong bas sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste; sems can thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin lta bus yongs su bzung ba'i snying dpal gyi be'us brgyan pa dang ldan zhing rdo rje'i ri 'khor yug thams cad ltar mi shigs shing rdo rje'i snying po lta bu'i snying dang ldan pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa'i snying dang / thub par dka' ba'i snying dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi 'phrog pa'i snying dang / dpa' ba'i rgyal mtshan ye shes kyi snying po can gyi snying dang / mthu bo che chen po dam pa'i sems kyi rgyal mtshan can gyi snying dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bo lta bur mi 'phrog pa'i snying dang / mthu bo che ltar mi shigs pa'i snying po can gyi snying dang / bdud kyi las dang / bdud kyi dpung dang / bdud kyi sde rnam par 'joms pa'i snying dang / brtan pa'i snying dang / gzengs mtho ba'i snying dang / dpa' ba'i snying dang / rtul phod pa'i snying dang / mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i snying dang / rdo rje'i go cha chen po yang dag par bgos pa'i snying dang / shin tu btsun pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i snying dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pas byang chub snang bar gyur pa'i snying dang / byang chub kyi shing drung du 'dug nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rjes su rtogs shing / rmongs pa med par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i snying dang / stobs bcu mngon par byang chub pa rab tu 'thob pa'i snying dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying gi sbyin pas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad kyis gos pa med pa'i stobs bcu mnga' ba'i thugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan par yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba mngon par dang par byed pa'i lta ba dang / gsal zhing dga' bar byed pa'i mig dang / byang chub dang mnyam par bya ba'i byams pa dang / ci 'dod pas slong ba phu dud du bya ba'i sbyin pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pa'i gtong ba dang / lus la snying po med par rtogs pas snying po blang ba'i sems dang bar gyur pa'i lus rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa dang / spyang ki dang / wa dang / khyis bza' bar 'gyur ba'i lus su rab tu rtogs pa dang / gzhan la rag lus shing lus mi rtag par yid la byed pa dang / lus kyi rgyus thams cad khong du chud pa dang / gzhan la dad pa'i sems dang / de lta bu'i chos de dag yid la bya ba la brtson pa de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' legs par byin pa dang / rgyal po sdig pa bsal ba dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag gis kyang slong ba rnams la rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba yongs su gtong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' slong ba de dag la mi 'gal ba'i mig gis blta zhing 'di ltar sems bskyed de 'di ltar bdag gi lus mi rtag cing 'di ltar mi gtsang na/ 'on kyang rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba lta bu dag kyang slong ba dag la dgos pa ltas sbyin par bya'o/ / zhes de lta bur yid la byed cing dga' ba'i rgyu dang / de ltar chos nyid shes pa'i bsam pa dang / slong ba mthong ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'du shes pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis lus snying po med pa de las snying po blang bar 'dod de/ de lta bur yid la byed cing rab tu rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba de dag yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad ye shes kyi snying po'i lus dang ldan zhing lus kyi phyi nang shin tu gtsang zhing dag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i smon lam yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi lto dang yang dag par ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad nang spos zhim po'i mchog thams cad dang ldan zhing phyi rol tu 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pas blta na bzang ba'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rim gyis gzhol zhing mnyam pa'i lus kyi yan lag dang ldan te gzhu lta bu'i lto dang ldan pa'i lus su gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dga' bas lus shin tu bskyed pas lus chos kyi zas dang ye shes kyis gso bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad dga' ba'i lus dang chos kyi lus kyis yang dag par spyod pa zad mi shes pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i chos snang ba dang ldan pas gzungs kyi snying pos lus kyi nang rnam par dag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad nang gi bsam pa'i rgyud shin tu sbyangs pas lus yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyis ngom par byed pa'i chos kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / ye shes kyi rnal 'byor khong du chud par gyur cig / sems can thams cad phyi rol gyi lus 'gro ba thams cad la ye shes kyi rgyal mtshan mdzes shing snang bar gyur pas nang gi lus dag cing zhi bar gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba de dag rang gi lus las slong ba rnams la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi lus phyi nang yongs su dag cing bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes la rab tu 'khod pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi 'byung gnas dang / rgyal po skar ma'i 'od dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis kyang yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa slong ba rnams la yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa bslangs pa na slong ba rnams la gtong ba'i tshe slong ba mthong ma thag tu sems dga' ba dang / sems mos pa dang / sems dad pa dang / sems rab tu spro ba dang / sems 'thad pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang / chags pa med pa'i sems dang / dag pa'i sems dang / slong ba rnams la rim gror bya ba'i sems rab tu 'thob ste/ de yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa de dag bslangs pas slong ba la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ rang gi lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad rus pa dang / sha dang / khrag med pa'i lus dang ldan zhing sprul pa lta bu'i lus can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad lus la thub pa med cing zil gyis mi non pas rdo rje lta bu'i stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chags pa med cing grol ba dang / bcings pa med pa'i ye shes kyi lus kyis byung ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang chos su ldan pa'i lus phun sum tshogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dbang po tha mi dad cing gcad du med pa rab tu thob pas ye shes kyi stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi stobs dang / dbang gi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas chos kyi stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad lus shig shig po med pas yan lag shin tu brtan pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun yongs su smin par byed cing 'dul ba la zhugs pas 'gro ba thams cad ji ltar mos pa'i lus dang yan lag gi byin gyi rlabs dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mthu bo che'i yan lag dang / nying lag yang dag par zin pas stobs chen po dang ldan zhing ye shes la gnas pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chad cing dub pa med pa'i lus rab tu thob pas shin tu brtan par lus kyi rgyud 'brel ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mthu dang brtson 'grus chen po dang ldan pa'i lus kyis shin tu brtan zhing stobs dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mtha' yas pa'i ye shes kyi khyu mchog gi mthu 'byin pa'i lus dang ldan zhing chos kyi lus kyis 'gro ba thams cad du rnam par brgyan pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad kha na ma tho ba med cing blta na don yod pa dang ldan te bsod nams kyi stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gnas med pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug ste gnas pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bsam pa byin gyis brlabs pa dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyis yongs su bzung ba'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam gyi lus kyi rjes su song bas 'gro ba thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la phyir phyogs pa med cing mngon par lta ba'i snang bas sgo kun nas lta ba'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa la spyod pa bsam pa mthar phyin par bya ba la brtson pas brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i lus phun sum tshogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes brtan par gnas pa thob pas nga rgyal dang / rlom pa dang / dregs pa thams cad rgyun 'chad cing rnam par dag pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du las grub par gyur pas brtul zhugs dam pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig ;sems can thams cad 'jig rten du skyes pa'i lus thams cad las rnam par 'das shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge bas byung ba'i lus su gyur cig / ces
de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa de dag slong ba rnams la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub par bya ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“If people come to great enlightening beings asking for their tongues, they compassionately speak kind and gentle words to them, as did Handsome King, Unregressing, and countless other enlightening beings of ancient times. When great enlightening beings are born in the various realms of existence, when countless sentient beings come to them asking for their tongues, they place those people on lion seats, and, with minds free from anger, malice, and resentment, with minds of great power, minds born of the essence of Buddhas, minds abiding in the abode of enlightening beings, minds never polluted or disturbed, minds abiding in great power, minds with no attachment to the body, and minds with no attachment to words, they kneel on the ground, open their mouths, show their tongue to the beggars, and say to them with kind and gentle words, ‘This body of mine is all yours—you may take my tongue and use it as you will, to fulfill your wishes.’
“At that time, the enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain the universal tongue and be able to expound all principles of speech and language; may all sentient beings attain tongues that can cover their faces, and may their speech be nondual and all true to reality; may all sentient beings attain a tongue that covers all buddha-lands, demonstrating the autonomous spiritual powers of Buddhas; may all sentient beings have soft, thin tongues, always tasting fine, pure flavors; may all sentient beings have eloquent tongues, able to cut through the net of doubts of all beings; may all sentient beings have luminous tongues, able to radiate countless billions of light beams; may all sentient beings attain tongues of definite certainty, inexhaustibly explaining all things with discernment; may all sentient beings attain masterful tongues, able to unlock all essential mysteries, causing all to accept and believe what they say; may all sentient beings attain tongues of universal fluency, able to enter into the ocean of all languages; may all sentient beings attain tongues capable of explaining all aspects of the teachings, thoroughly attaining ultimate perfection of knowledge of words and speech.’ This is enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving tongues, to cause sentient beings to all attain complete unobstructed knowledge.
“Enlightening beings give their heads to those who come ask for them, as did Supreme Knowledge, Great Light, and other great enlightening beings. The giving that the great enlightening beings practice is because they want to develop the head of supreme knowledge comprehending all truths, because they want to develop the head realizing great enlightenment and saving sentient beings, because they want to have the supreme head seeing all things, because they want to attain the head of pure knowledge which sees truly, because they want to develop the head of nonobstruction, free from hindrance, because they want to realize the head attaining the highest states, because they seek the head of knowledge supreme in the world, because they want to develop the head of pure wisdom, the crown of which cannot be seen by any in the realms of desire, form, or formlessness, because they want to attain the head of sovereignty of knowledge appearing throughout the ten directions, and because they want to fulfill the head of freedom which cannot be broken by anything at all.
“Great enlightening beings, abiding by this practice and diligently applying it, then, because they have already entered the family of the Buddhas, emulate the giving practiced by the Buddhas. Conceiving pure faith in the Buddhas, they develop and mature roots of goodness, and cause those in need to all be happily satisfied. Their own minds are pure and joyful beyond measure; with pure faith and understanding they clearly illumine the Buddha teachings, activate the will for enlightenment, and abide in equanimity and resignation. All their senses are blissful; their virtous qualities grow and develop and they give rise to good aspirations, and always like to practice magnanimous giving.
“At that time the enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain the head of the enlightened, and attain the invisible crown, which none anywhere can surpass, the supreme head in all buddha-fields, hair curling to the right, radiant, clean, lustrous, adorned with gammadions, a wonder of the world; may they be endowed with the head of Buddhas, the head of consummate knowledge, the foremost head in the world, and be heads of completeness, of purity, and of comprehensive knowledge sitting on the site of enlightenment.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving their heads away, to enable sentient beings to attain the highest truth and achieve unexcelled great wisdom.
“Great enlightening beings give their hands and feet to sentient beings, like Always Diligent, Sorrowless King, and countless other enlightening beings and others gave their hands and feet in various places of birth in all realms of existence. Using faith for hands, they initiate beneficial works, coming and going, reaching everywhere, diligently practicing the true teaching, aspiring to attain jewel-producing hands, giving their hands, fulfilling the path of enlightening beings without doing anything in vain. They always extend their hands to obtain great wisdom, and walk peacefully as they go, bold and fearless. By the power of pure faith they fulfill diligent effort, to destroy unwholesome states and to perfect enlightenment.
“When great enlightening beings give in this way, they open the gate of pure teaching with hearts of immeasurable magnanimity, enter the ocean of Buddhahood, perfect the hand of giving, and provide for all in the ten directions. With the power of will they maintain the path of universal knowledge, and abide in the mind ultimately free of impurity, the body of reality, and the body of knowledge, endless and incorruptible. They cannot be shaken by any delusive influences; following good teachers, they make their minds firm and stable, and cultivate the practice of transcendence by giving, same as all enlightening beings.
“When great enlightening beings give their hands and feet, seeking omniscience for the sake of all sentient beings, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be endowed with spiritual powers, and all attain jewel-producing hands, and, having attained jewel-producing hands, respect each other as fields of blessings and give each other all kinds of jewels, and also give myriad jewels to Buddhas, producing clouds of wonderful jewels covering all buddha-lands.’ They cause sentient beings to be kind to each other and not harm each other. They roam the buddha-fields, secure in fearlessness, naturally endowed with ultimate spiritual powers. They also cause all to attain hands producing jewels, hands producing flowers, hands producing clothing, hands producing canopies, hands producing garlands, hands producing incense, hands producing ornaments, boundless hands, immeasurable hands, universal hands, and, having attained these hands, to always diligently travel to all buddha-lands by means of spiritual power. They can touch all buddha-worlds with one hand, and hold all sentient beings with the hand of freedom. They attain hands of sublime features, emanating immeasurable light. They can cover all sentient beings with a single hand. They attain hands like the Buddha, with webbed fingers and copper fingernails. At this time the enlightening beings cover all sentient beings with the hand of great vows, praying that all sentient beings set their minds on always gladly seeking unexcelled enlightenment, producing the ocean of all virtues, rejoicing when they see people come begging, never tiring of them, entering the ocean of buddhahood, with the same roots of goodness as the Buddha. This is enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving hands and feet.
“Great enlightening beings wound themselves and draw blood to give to sentient beings like Principled Action, Benevolent King, and countless other enlightening beings in various realms of existence. When they give blood, they arouse a mind to achieve omniscience, a mind of longing for great enlightenment, a mind of pleasure in cultivating the practices of enlightening beings, a mind not to grasp painful sensations, a mind of gladness to see beggars, a mind not averse to beggars, a mind directed toward the path of all enlightening beings, a mind to preserve the equanimity of all enlightening beings, a mind to increase and broaden the benevolent giving of enlightening beings, an unregressing mind, an unremitting mind, a mind free from self-love. The roots of goodness they dedicate in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain fulfillment of the body of reality and the body of knowledge; may all sentient beings attain an adamantine, indefatigable body; may all sentient beings attain an indestructible body that nothing can injure; may all sentient beings attain a phantom-like body, appearing throughout the world without limit; may all sentient beings attain a delightful body, clean, beautiful, strong and healthy; may all sentient beings attain a body born of the realm of reality, same as the enlightened, depending on nothing; may all sentient beings attain a body like the radiance of beautiful jewels, which no worldly people can outshine; may all sentient beings attain a body which is a treasury of knowledge, and realize freedom in the realm of immortality; may all sentient beings attain a body of an ocean of jewels, which is unfailingly beneficial to all who see it; may all sentient beings attain the body of space, which none of the troubles of the world can affect.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness, with the mind of the Great Vehicle, a pure mind, a broad mind, a joyful mind, a happy mind, an enraptured mind, a mind in control, a peaceful mind, an unpolluted mind, when giving blood from their bodies.
“When great enlightening beings see people come and ask for their bodies’ marrow and flesh, they are joyful and speak gently to them, telling them to take their bodies’ marrow and flesh as they wish, just as Benefactor, All-Giving King, and innumerable other enlightening beings gave their marrow and flesh in various circumstances in various realms of being. When they give to those who ask, their joy is great, their generosity grows; they cultivate roots of goodness the same as all enlightening beings, depart from the dust and dirt of the world, and attain profound determination. They give their bodies to all, their minds inexhaustible; endowed with immeasurable great roots of goodness, they embody the treasures of all virtues. According with the principles of enlightening beings, they tirelessly put them into practice, their minds always delighting in the virtues of giving. They give all without regret, clearly observing that all things come from conditions and have no substance; they have no greed for the act of giving or for the rewards of giving, and give impartially to whomever they meet.
“When great enlightening beings give in this way, all the Buddhas appear to them, because they think of them as parents and receive their protection; all sentient beings appear to them, because they cause all to live in peace by the pure teaching; all worlds appear to them, because they adorn and purify all buddha-lands; all living beings appear to them, because they serve all with great compassion; all Buddha qualities appear to them, because they like to observe the ten powers of the enlightened ones; all enlightening beings of the past, present, and future appear to them, because they share the same complete roots of goodness; all fearlessnesses appear to them, because they are able to make the supreme lion roar; all the past, present, and future appear to them, because they have attained knowledge of equality observing all; all worlds appear to them, because they initiate great, far-reaching vows to cultivate enlightenment throughout the future; the tireless practices of enlightening beings all appear to them, because they develop infinite great aspirations.
“When great enlightening beings give marrow and flesh, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain the indestructible body; may all sentient beings attain the enduring mystic body, which never diminishes; may all sentient beings attain mentally produced bodies, adorned and pure like the Buddha’s body; may all sentient beings attain bodies adorned with all marks of merit and signs of greatness; may all sentient beings attain bodies beautifully adorned with all kinds of embellishments, endowed with the ten powers, indestructible; may all sentient beings attain the body of those who realize thusness, ultimately pure, impossible to delimit or measure; may all sentient beings attain the body of firmness and stability, which no demons or enemies can injure; may all sentient beings attain the body of oneness, and be one with the Buddhas of all times; may all sentient beings attain the unobstructed body, pervading space with the pure body of reality; may all sentient beings attain the body of the matrix of enlightenment, able to contain all worlds.’ This is the dedication of roots of goodness of enlightening beings giving marrow and flesh, seeking universal knowledge, to cause all sentient beings to attain the ultimately pure infinite body of those who realize thusness.
“Great enlightening beings give their hearts to those who come and ask for them, as did No Regret, Unobstructed King, and countless other great enlightening beings. When they give their own hearts to beggars, they cultivate the mind of free giving, develop the mind of total giving, learn the mind of carrying out transcedent giving, perfect the mind of transcendent giving, cultivate the mind of giving of all enlightening beings, the inexhaustible mind relinquishing all, the mind accustomed to giving all, the mind taking on all enlightening beings, practice of giving, the mind correctly mindful of the manifestation of all Buddhas, the mind presenting gifts to all who come and ask, without end.
“When great enlightening beings give in this way, their minds are pure: in order to liberate all sentient beings, in order to attain the realm of enlightenment with the ten powers, in order to cultivate practice in accord with their great vows, because they want to abide in peace in the path of enlightening beings, because they want to develop omniscience, and because they do not give up their original vows, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain diamond treasury hearts, which all diamond mountains cannot break; may all sentient beings attain diamond-realm hearts, adorned with the mystic gammadion; may they attain unshakable hearts, attain hearts that cannot be frightened; may they attain ever inexhaustible hearts benefiting the world; may they attain hearts that are treasuries of knowledge and wisdom, marked by great courage; may they attain hearts marked by firm strength; may they attain hearts as infinite as the ocean of living beings; may they attain hearts which nothing can spoil; may they attain hearts destroying all delusive activities and armies of demons; may they attain fearless hearts; may they attain hearts of great spiritual force; may they attain hearts of constant energy; may they attain hearts of great courage; may they attain hearts that cannot be shocked; may they attain hearts with indestructible armor; may they attain the supreme hearts of enlightening beings; may they attain hearts full of the light of enlightenment into the Buddha teachings; may they attain hearts sitting under the tree of enlightenment, abiding by the true teachings of all Buddhas, divorcing all illusions and attaining omniscience; may they attain hearts accomplished in the ten powers.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving their hearts, to cause all sentient beings to be unstained by the world and to be endowed with the ten-powered mind of the enlightened.
“If anyone comes to great enlightening beings asking for their internal organs, they give all, like Good Giver, Demon-Conquering Sovereign, and countless other great enlightening beings. When practicing this giving, they are glad to see people come begging and look upon them lovingly; in the quest for enlightenment they give as they are asked, without any regret in their hearts. They observe that this body has no permanence or stability, and reflect that they should give this body away and get an indestructible body. They also are mindful that this body will eventually decay, disgusting to all who see, and will be eaten by animals, that this body is impermanent, eventually to be abandoned and eaten by others, without awareness or cognition. When enlightening beings make these observations, they know that the body is transient and the height of impurity; understanding the teaching, they become very joyful. With a respectful mind, they see those who come ask of them as good friends who have come to protect them, and generously give them whatever they ask, substituting the enduring body for the unstable one.
“When great enlightening beings give in this way, they dedicate all the roots of goodness, that all sentient beings may attain the body of the treasury of knowledge, inwardly and outwardly pure; that all sentient beings may attain the body of the treasury of virtue, able to preserve the vow for omniscience; that all sentient beings may attain a supremely wonderful body, inwardly full of sublime fragrance, outwardly radiating light; that all sentient beings may attain a body without a protruding belly, upper and lower body straight, limbs and joints well coordinated; that all sentient beings may attain the body of knowledge and wisdom, filled with joy, enriched and nourished by the savor of the Buddha teaching; that all sentient beings attain an inexhaustible body and cultivate peaceful abiding in the most profound nature of truth; that all sentient beings may attain the body of the pure treasury of concentration spell formulae, and elucidate all truths with marvelous eloquence; that all sentient beings may attain the body of purity, body and mind both inwardly and outwardly clean; that all sentient beings may attain the body of practice of deep contemplation with knowledge of realization of thusness, filled with wisdom, showering the rain of truth; that all sentient beings may attain a body that is inwardly tranquil while outwardly being a supreme representation of knowledge for sentient beings, emanating great light universally illuminating everything. This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving internal organs, to cause sentient beings to be inwardly and outwardly pure and to all achieve stability in unobstructed knowledge.
“Great enlightening beings give those who ask for them their limbs, joints, and bones, like Treasury of Truth, King of Light, and innumerable other great enlightening beings. When they give their limbs, joints, and bones, upon seeing people come begging, they give rise to love, joy, pure faith, peace of mind, courage, kindness, an unobstructed mind, a pure mind, a mind to give whatever they are asked. When the great enlightening beings give their limbs and bones, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain phantomlike bodies, and receive bone, flesh, and blood bodies no more; may all sentient beings attain indestructible, invincible bodies; may all sentient beings attain the body of reality, replete with all knowledge, born in the realm where there are no bounds, no attachments, no fetters, may all sentient beings attain the body of powers of knowledge, all faculties complete, fully developed, uninterrupted and incorruptible; may all sentient beings attain the body of the power of truth, with independent power of knowledge reaching the other shore; may all sentient beings attain a healthy, enduring body, upright and true, never decaying; may all sentient beings attain a body able to respond to needs, to teach and civilize all beings; may all sentient beings attain a body perfumed by wisdom, with the great strength of limb of the mighty; may all sentient beings attain a permanent, enduring body, forever free from all fatigue, may all sentient beings attain a stable body of great strength, able to fulfill the great power of energy and effort; may all sentient beings attain the equally omnipresent body of reality and abide in the realm of immeasurable supreme knowledge; may all sentient beings attain the body of the power of virtue, beneficial to all who see it, removed from all evil; may all sentient beings attain an independent body, which rests on nothing, and all be endowed with nonreliant, unattached knowledge, may all sentient beings attain a body under the protection of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings attain a body beneficial to all living beings, able to enter into all realms of existence; may all sentient beings attain a body of universal manifestation, able to reflect all the Buddha teachings; may all sentient beings attain a body endowed with vigor, concentrating on and diligently cultivating the practice of the knowledge of the Great Vehicle; may all sentient beings attain a pure body free from pride and conceit, their knowledge always stable and not shaken by anything; may all sentient beings attain a body of firm action, accomplishing the work of universal knowledge of the Great Vehicle; may all sentient beings attain a body of firm action, accomplishing the work of universal knowledge of the Great Vehicle; may all sentient beings attain a body in the house of Buddhas, forever leaving all mundane birth and death.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving limbs and bones, to cause all sentient beings to attain omniscience and be eternally pure.

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi lus las slong ba dag gis mdog dang ldan pa'i pags pa bslangs pa'i tshe mtshon cha thogs pa'i slong ba mthong yang dga' bar byed pa'i dbang pos slong ba la lta zhing slong ba rnams la drin du gzo ba'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag nas legs par bting ba'i stan la slong ba rnams bkod de/ slong ba rnams la rim gro'i 'du shes nye bar gzhog pa dang / len pa rnams la shin tu dkon pa'i 'du shes yang dag par skyed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gzhir gyur pa smon par bya ba yang dag par mthong bar sems shing slong ba rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i sems kyis rtog cing 'dzum dang ldan par lta bas slong ba rnams la blta zhing tshur sheg / longs shig ces bya ba'i tshig brjod pa dang slong ba rnams la bdag nyid ci dga' bar bya bas gtong ba de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' dag pa'i snying po dang / ri kyi rgyal po gser gyi rtsib logs ltar mdog dang ldan pa'i pags pa slong ba rnams la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyis mi ngoms shing rnam par dag pas shin tu 'jam pa'i mdog dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rdo rje'i mdog thub par dka' ba'i kha dog dang ldan zhing ma 'dres pa'i kha dog dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'dzam bu chu klung gi snying po ltar dag cing gser gyi mdog dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du kha dog rnam par sbyangs pas dag cing kha dog mtha' yas pa'i mdog dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge sbyong de bzhin gshegs pa shin tu gzhon pa'i kha dog gis rnam par dag cing rnyog pa med cing dang ba'i kha dog dang / mdog gi mchog dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rang bzhin gyis kha dog rnam par dag cing / kha dog dang mdog gi dam pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos rnam par bris shing sangs rgyas kyi kha dog rnam par dag pas mdog dang kha dog shin tu rnam par dag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad kha dog dang mdog bzang po phun sum tshogs shing 'gro ba kun tu mdog gi snang ba rab tu 'gyed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor brjod du med pa rnam par 'gyed pa'i rgyal mtshan dang ldan zhing mdog 'od zer gyi dra ba can dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gzugs thams cad kyi kha dog rnam par dag ste/ mdog dang kha dog shin tu snum pa dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi lus las mdog dang ldan pa'i pags pa slong ba rnams la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems la phyin ci log med pa/ bzhin 'dzum pa can/ yid bde ba thob pa/ theg pa chen po la legs par gnas pa/ grags pa 'dod pa med pa'i sbyin pa can/ snying thag pa nas sbyin pa la gnas pa/ gtong ba chen po la yid rab tu zhugs pa/ 'jungs pa'i dri ma la mi gnas pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ phrag dog dang 'jungs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la rab tu zhugs pa de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' lta ba'i brtson 'grus dang / 'dzam bu gling gi bdag po gser gyi 'od dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa gzhan dag gis kyang sor mo rnams yongs su btang bar gyur pa ltar slong ba la rkang lag gi sor mo yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sor mo byin pa dang / ci bslangs pa'i dngos po btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi phyag sor thob par gyur te/ sor mo ring bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sor mo rim gyis gzhol bar legs par grub pas sor mo zlum pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sen mo gang ba'i sor mo rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing sen mo zangs kyi kha dog lta bu'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos thams cad 'dzin par brtson pa'i sor mo dpe byad bzang po dang ldan zhing skyes bu dpa' bo thams cad mkhyen pa'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad stobs bcu'i phyag sor dang ldan par gyur te/ dpe byad bzang pos grub pa'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad shin tu sbyangs pa'i sor mo tshul dang mthun par skyes pas sor mo'i dam pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sor mo'i chos nyid kyi yan lag dang / bum pa gang ba dang / bkra shis kyis rnam par mdzes pa dang ldan zhing sor mo'i rtse mo la 'khor lo yod pa'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad stobs bcu'i phyag sor 'phrin las kyi rnam par smin pa rgyu mthun par byung ba lta bu dang ldan zhing pad+mo bzang po dang dga' ba 'khyil bas sor mo thams cad kyi tshigs dang yan lag shin tu brgyan cing dpe byad bzang pos mdzes par rnam par phye ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa snang bar bya ba la brtson zhing / 'od zer gyi dra ba'i mdzod rab tu 'gyed ba'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sor mo shin tu mdzes pa dra bas legs par 'brel ba dang ldan zhing sor mo legs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sor mo yongs su gtong ba'i tshe sems can thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad sems can rnam la yongs su bsngo'o/ / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'dod pa la/ la la zhig gis chos thob par bya bar bsam ste des 'di skad du gal te khyod kyi sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo nga la byin na ni/ ngas khyod la chos bstan par bya'o/ / zhes zer pa zhig yod na/ de la 'di skad du smras te/ bdag gi sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo ci bder khyer la bdag la chos bstan par mdzod cig / ces ji ltar rgyal po dbang phyug tu gyur pa legs par bshad pa chol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zad mi shes pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan tshad med pa chos kyi chos bzang po nyid la brtson pa/ 'gro ba kun tu chos kyi lo shin tu legs pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar slong ba rnams la rang gi sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi phyag sen rab tu grub cing / zangs kyi kha dog lta bu'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dpe byad bzang po'i sen mo rab tu thob cing mdog snum pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sen mo'i dam pa dang ldan zhing 'od 'tsher ba'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sen mo bzang po dang ldan zhing thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyag sen mo rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi gos shing mtshungs pa med pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'od kyis snang bar bya ba la brtson zhing shin tu brgyan pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad nyams pa med cing rnam par dag pa'i sen mo gang ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes che zhing yangs pa rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing / sangs rgyas kyi
