chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i mtshan dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i las rnam par smin pas rnam par dag cing mdzes par skyes pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'od zer kha dog mtha' yas pa rab tu 'gyed pa'i mdzod dang ldan zhing mgon po thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyag sen dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'dod pa'i phyir sen mo dang shar bcas pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku dang phyag sen gyi rgyan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / thogs pa med pa'i stobs kyi mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o// //

“When great enlightening beings see people come to them with knives and ask for their skin, their hearts become joyful, their senses delighted, just like someone who has been done a great favor; they welcome them, invite them in, set out a seat for them, and bow to them respectfully, thinking, ‘These seekers are most rare; they come seeking aid from me, working to fulfill my vow for omniscience.’ Joyfully, with a mild countenance, they say to them, ‘This body of mine I relinquish entirely—take as much of my skin as you need,’ just like Treasury of Purity, Golden-sided Deer King, and countless other great enlightening beings of the past. At that time, the enlightening beings dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings have fine skin, like that of the Buddha, its color pure and clear, so that people never tire of seeing it; may all sentient beings have unbreakable skin, like diamond, which nothing can break; may all sentient beings have golden skin, like the finest real gold, pure and clear; may all sentient beings have clear, lustrous skin, endowed with the softness and purity of the ascetic, characteristic of the Buddha; may all sentient beings attain skin of the finest color, inherently pure, its color and features incomparable; may all sentient beings develop the pure-colored skin of Buddha, adorned with the marks and embellishments of greatness; may all sentient beings have skin of exquisite color, radiating great light, illuminating everything; may all sentient beings have skin like luminous mesh, like the lofty banner of the world, radiating unspeakably many spheres of light; may all sentient beings have lustrous skin, its color and features all pure.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving their skin, to cause all sentient beings to reach all pure adorned buddha-fields and be endowed with the great virtues of Buddha.
“Great enlightening beings give their fingers and toes to those who ask for them, like Persevering, Sovereign King of Jambudvipa, and countless other great enlightening beings. At that time the countenance of the enlightening beings is peaceful and happy, their minds are stable and healthy, without any delusion. Riding the Great Vehicle, they do not seek satisfaction of sensual desires, nor do they prize name and fame; they only conceive the great determination of enlightening beings, getting rid of all defilements of greed and jealousy, turning wholeheartedly to the supremely wonderful teaching of the enlightened ones.
“When great enlightening beings give in this way, they concentrate the roots of goodness and dedicate them thus: ‘May all sentient beings have slender, long fingers, no different from Buddha; may all sentient beings have fingers of even circumference, the upper and lower parts in proportion; may all sentient beings have fingers with ruddy copper nails, the nails rounded and shiny; may all sentient beings have the fingers of the omniscient supreme human, able to hold all truths, may all sentient beings have fingers with the refinements of Buddhas’ fingers, and be adorned with the ten powers; may all sentient beings have the fingers of a great human, slender and even; may all sentient beings have fingers marked with lotus gammadions, adorned with marks and embellishments resulting from the working of the ten powers; may all sentient beings have fingers that are mines of light, radiating great light beams illumining unspeakably many buddha-worlds; may all sentient beings have well-proportioned fingers, adorned with the characteristics of Buddhas’ fingers.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness in giving fingers and toes, to cause all sentient beings to attain purity of mind.
“When great enlightening beings are seeking the teaching, if someone says, ‘If you can give me your fingernails, I’ll give you the teaching,’ the enlightening beings reply, ‘Just give me the teaching, and you may take and use my fingernails as you wish,’ as did Sovereign King Seeking Truth, Inexhaustible, and countless other great enlightening beings. In their search for the true teaching, and because of their desire to expound the true teaching for the benefit of sentient beings, to cause all of them to be fulfilled, they give their fingernails away to those who ask for them. At that time the enlightening beings dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings have the ruddy copper nails that are a mark of the Buddha; may all sentient beings have glossy nails, adorned with embellishments; may all sentient beings have shiny clean nails, clear as mirrors, finest of all; may all sentient beings have the nails of the omniscient, and be endowed with the marks of great human beings; may all sentient beings have peerless nails, not defiled by or attached to any world; may all sentient beings have nails with marvelous adornments, with light illumining all worlds; may all sentient beings have unbreakable nails, pure, clean, and complete; may all sentient beings have nails marked by entry into the techniques of all Buddha-teachings, vast knowledge and wisdom thoroughly pure; may all sentient beings have well-formed nails, the fruit of enlightening actions, all sublimely pure; may all sentient beings have the nails of the great omniscient guide, radiating treasuries of beautiful lights of infinite hues.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving their nails in their quest for the teaching, to cause sentient beings to be endowed with the unobstructed power of nails of omniscience of all Buddhas.
bam po sum cu brgyad pa/

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi don du chos tshol ba lhur len pa shin tu dkon pa'i chos tshel [*tshol] ba la zhugs pa la chos ston pa'i gang zag la las me'i rlubs su lus gzhug par byas te 'di skad du/ gal te khyod mi 'greng bdun du brkos pa'i me'i rlubs su mchong phod na/ ngas khyod la chos kyi sbyin pa bya'o/ / zhe na/ de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgra de thos nas shin tu dga' zhing yid bde ba dang / rab tu 'dun pa'i yid skyes nas 'di snyam du sems te/ ngan song thams cad dang / mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su blangs pa dang yang bsngo zhing bdag gis dam pa'i chos btsal dgos na/ 'di ltar me'i rlubs su mchod pa tsam gyis dam pa'i chos rnyed par 'gyur na lta kye ma de ltar dkon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag kyang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal lta bu med par me'i rlubs tsam du mchong bas rnyed pa 'di ni/ ngo mtshar che'o/ / snyam nas 'di ltar bdag gis mi 'greng bdun du brkos pa'i me'i rlubs su mchong bar bgyi'i; khyod kyis bdag la sangs rgyas kyi chos bshad du gsol zhes nas de ji ltar rgyal po legs par bshad pa tshol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag gis kyang me'i rlubs su mchod par byas pa de ltar chos kyi don du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad dang bsdo ba'i lus kyis me'i rlubs su mchong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las shin tu phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can du gyur te thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bde ba thams cad myong bar gyur te g.yang sa thams cad las phyir log par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jigs shing skrag pa thams cad dang bral zhing bag tsha ba med pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rgyan rab tu thob cing tshol ba la brtson par gyur cig / sems can thams cad me gsum rab tu zhi bas gnas pa'i sems dang ldan zhing ngan song gi lam thams cad dang shin tu bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bde ba'i rnam pa rab tu thob ste yid bde ba thams cad dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad me gsum dang bral zhing byang chub kyi sems kyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug zhi bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba'i dga' bas yang dag par spyod cing byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa med pa la rab tu gzhol zhing shin tu thos pa'i chos can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rjes su shin tu song ba'i chos dang ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pas rnam par rol pa'i bde ba rab tu thob par gyur cig ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos tshol zhing me'i rlubs su mchong pas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sgrib pa'i las dang spyod pa'i mthar phyin cing / ye shes kyi me shin tu rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam pa'i chos kyi phyir sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad bdag gi lus kyis bzod par byed cing / dam pa'i chos brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gsal bar byed pa dang / bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po'i tshogs yang dag par gsog pa dang / stobs bcu la brtson par byed cing thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa yangs par byed pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po la bdag mngon du mthun par yang dag par lta zhing sems can thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par sgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa dang / ye shes chen po la brtson zhing sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su srung ba'i tshe ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos bzang po tshol ba dang / rgyal po shugs chen po 'dzin pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan tshad med pa dag gis kyang ji ltar spyad pa bzhin du de sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa gcig ma yin pa nyams su 'bab pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs myong ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa thams cad dang phrad pa rang gi lus kyis nye bar len cing bzod par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba'i gang zag sems gtum pa can sdig pa'i las kyis bsgribs pa/ bdud kyi las kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag las sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa de dag thams cad nye bar len cing bzod par byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar dam pa'i chos shes par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad bde ba'i nan tan gyis mngon par shes pa myur ba dang ldan zhing sdug bsngal dang / mi bde ba yongs su spangs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bde ba'i rnam pa thams cad rab tu 'thob pa la gnas par sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad mig yor lta bu'i bde ba rab tu thob cing sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad 'gag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi spyod pa'i mthar phyin te sdug bsngal gyi btson ra nas phyir log par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal gyi lam rgyud dang 'tshe ba thams cad las phyir log cing bde ba'i lam mthong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal thams cad shin tu rnam par chad pas chos kyi dga' ba dang bde ba'i rnam pas shin tu brtan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad phan tshun du zhe mi sdang zhing byams pa rab tu thob pas sdug bsngal las grol bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'khor ba thams cad na yod pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu byang zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bde ba'i don mthong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad kyis lus la gnod par 'gyur ba med cing 'dra ba med pa'i bde ba rnam par dag pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bde ba bsgribs pa med pa'i mthar phyin te bde ba'i khyad par thams cad rab tu thob par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos kyi phyir sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad bzod par byed cing nyams su len pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'gro ba thams cad g.yang sa las bsrung zhing thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam par thar pa'i bsgribs pa med pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam pa'i chos btsal ba la shin tu brtson pa/ chos kyi tshig dang yi ge 'khor lngas yang dag par len pa/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su btsal pa dang rjes su dran pa la gnas pa/ chos kyi dga' bas spro zhing mos pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ zang zing med pa'i chos rab tu btsal pa la brtson pa/ 'jig rten pa'i rgyal po'i srid dang skyid pa'i ljan ljin thams cad las rnam par 'das pa/ sangs rgyas kyi rgyal srid dang / chos kyi skyid pa la mngon par mos pa/ 'jig rten gyi dga' ba thams cad kyis ma gos pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dga' bas sems shin tu spel ba/ 'jig rten gyi skyid pa zang zing dang bral ba'i yid dang ldan pa/ spros pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la gnas pa rab tu thob par mngon par zhugs pa des rgya mtsho'i mthar thug pa'i sa chen po grong rdal bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dang / yul dang yul grub bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dang / skye bo du mas yongs su gang ba/ bde ba'i rnam pa thams cad dang / skye bos rgyas pa'i khyim gyis gang ba/ bza' shing gi ra ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong rtse zhing dga' bar bya ba'i gzhi dang ldan pa/ chu klung yid du 'ong ba sna tshogs dang / grib shing dang / bza' shing mdangs dga' bas shin tu brgyan pa; 'khrug long med cing shin tu bde pa/ gzhan gyi khams shin tu bcom pa/ bdag gi khams la nyams pa med pa/ gser dang / rin po che'i mdzod dang / bang ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis brgyan pa/ bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma dang / 'khor sna tshogs dang / chung ma'i 'khor sna tshogs yod pa/ grong khyer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang / pho brang chen po yod pa de lta bu'i chos kyi don dang / chos btsal ba'i phyir tshig dang yi ge'i 'bru gcig gi don du yang rgyal po'i srid snying po med pa las snying po bskyed cing chos la dkon pa'i 'du shes rab tu bskyed nas 'gro ba thams cad kyi don du sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa bsgribs pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam rnam par dag pa tshol zhing / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen dpal dang / rgyal po khyad par dpal dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis kyang ji ltar spyad par gyur pa de bzhin du yongs su gtang bar bya ba'i tshe sa chen po rgya mtsho'i mthar thug pa yongs su btang ste chos btsal bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad lag shin tu che bar gtong ba la mngon par mos shing shin tu yangs pa'i gtong ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gyod pa med par sbyin pa'i bdag por gyur te gtong ba thams cad yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad lus dang srog dang yo byad la mi lta bas chos tshol ba la shin tu brtson par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad kyi the tshom gcod pas tshim par bya ba la brtson zhing chos thob par bya bas shin tu dga' bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos la yid dga' ba rab tu thob cing chos la mngon par dga' bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba'i sems chen pos spyod pa dang / byang chub tshad med pa rnyed pas lus dang / srog dang / 'jig rten gyi skyid pa yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad lus dang srog la mi lta zhing chos kyi dga' ba'i mthar thug pas chos kyi rim gro dang / sri zhu rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu dkon pa/ mnyen pa la brtson zhing sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i mthar phyin cing sangs rgyas kyi byang chub snang ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rab tu shes pa'i yid kyis the tshom gyi zug rngu dang bral zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa mang bar gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad sems can thams cad kyi don du chos btsal ba dang / chos thams cad kyi don dang / bde ba'i lam gyi ye shes mthong ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings seek the treasury of Buddha teachings with reverence and respect, considering it difficult to find. If someone who can expound it comes to them and says, ‘If you can throw yourself into a pit of fire seventy feet deep I will give you the teaching,’ the enlightening beings, hearing this, jump for joy and reflect, ‘I would stay forever even in miserable places like uninterrupted hell and experience immeasurable suffering for the sake of the truth; how much the more readily would I jump into the fire of the human world to hear the teaching. How wonderful it is that the true teaching is so easy to obtain; without suffering the infinite tortures of hell one gets to hear it merely by entering a pit of fire. Just explain to me and I’ll go into the pit of fire,’ and like the enlightening beings King in Quest of the Good Teaching and Adamantine Meditation, they enter the pit of fire in quest of the teaching.
“At this time, the enlightening beings dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings abide in the teaching of universal knowledge, the abode of Buddhas, and never regress or retreat from unexcelled enlightenment; may all sentient beings be free from all perils and experience the peace and ease of buddhahood; may all sentient beings attain fearless minds and be free from all terrors; may all sentient beings always gladly seek truth, full of joy and bliss, adorned by the teachings; may all sentient beings leave the courses of evil and extinguish the raging fires of the three poisons; may all sentient beings always be in peace and happiness, full of the supremely refined pleasures of the enlightened; may all sentient beings attain the mind of enlightening beings and forever part from the fires of craving, anger, and delusion; may all sentient beings attain the pleasures of concentration of enlightening beings and see the Buddhas everywhere, their minds full of joy; may all sentient beings skillfully explain the true teaching, ultimately never forgetting its principles; may all sentient beings have the sublime bliss of spiritual powers of enlightening beings and ultimately abide in knowledge of all ways of enlightenment.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when plunging into a pit of fire in quest of the true teaching, for the purpose of causing sentient beings to give up hindering actions and all attain the full endowment of the fire of wisdom.
“When great enlightening beings, in quest of the true teaching, analyze and expound the path of enlightening beings, point out the road of enlightenment, proceed toward highest knowledge, diligently cultivate the ten powers, extend the mind of universal knowledge, attain the state of unobstructed knowledge, purify sentient beings, abide in the sphere of action of enlightening beings, earnestly cultivate great knowledge, and preserve complete enlightenment, they experience immeasurable suffering and tribulation, as did Seeker of the Good Teaching, Brave King, and countless other great enlightening beings. To save even the most evil people, who repudiate the truth, are shrouded by evil deeds, are in the grip of delusion, the enlightening beings, for the sake of the truth, accept for those people all the torments they should suffer. These roots of goodness they dedicate in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be forever freed from all suffering and oppression, and attain peace and happiness, freedom and spiritual power; may all sentient beings be forever free from all miseries, and attain all happiness; may all sentient beings annihilate the body of accumulated suffering, attain the body of illumination, and always experience ease and bliss; may all sentient beings escape from the prison of suffering and perfect wise action; may all sentient beings see the path of peace and depart from all evil courses; may all sentient beings attain the joy and bliss of truth and forever end all misery; may all sentient beings extirpate all suffering, love one another, and have no malevolence; may all sentient beings attain the bliss of the Buddhas and leave the pains of birth and death; may all sentient beings attain pure, peerless peace and ease, impervious to all pains and vexations; may all sentient beings attain all supreme bliss, ultimately filled with the unobstructed bliss of buddha-hood.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when accepting suffering for the sake of the truth, because they want to rescue all beings and bring them to safety, free them from peril and difficulty and cause them to live in the realm of omniscient, unhindered liberation.
“When great enlightening beings occupy the rank of ruler and seek true teaching, they consider even one sentence, one word, one phrase, one doctrine hard to obtain, and will give up everything within the seas, near or far—land, cities, towns, populace, storehouses, gardens, ponds, houses, forests, flowers, produce, including all rare and precious things, palaces, bowers, spouses, children, retinues, even rulership—they are able to give up all, seeking that which endures while in the midst of the transient; because they want to benefit all living beings, they earnestly seek the Buddhas’ path of unhindered liberation and ultimately pure universal knowledge, as did Great Moral Force, King of Supreme Virtue, and countless other great enlightening beings. They diligently seek true teaching, even a little bit; for every one word they prostrate themselves on the ground. Properly meditating on the teachings of all Buddhas of past, present, and future, they devotedly practice them, never greedy for fame or fortune. They abandon the independent rulership of all worldly realms to seek autonomous mastery of truth. They have no attachment to worldly pleasures, and nourish their minds with transmundane teachings, forever leaving behind all idle speculations and inanities of the world, abiding in the truth of the Buddhas, which is free from inanity.
“At that time, enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings always gladly give generously, relinquishing everything; may all sentient beings be able to give up whatever they have without regret; may all sentient beings always seek the truth without begrudging their lives or sustenance; may all sentient beings gain the benefit of the teaching and be able to stop everyone’s doubts and confusion; may all sentient beings be able to give up their lives and sovereignty in quest of the Buddha teaching, cultivating highest enlightenment with great determination; may all sentient beings honor and respect the true teaching with ever profound aspiration, not begrudging their bodily lives; may all sentient beings preserve the most difficult-to-find Buddha teaching, always practicing it diligently; may all sentient beings attain the Buddhas’ light of enlightenment, accomplishing the practice of enlightenment, awakening without relying on another for understanding; may all sentient beings always be able to analyze all Buddha teachings, pull out the arrow of doubt, and attain peace of mind.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving up their countries and cities in quest of the true teaching, in order to cause sentient beings’ knowledge and insight to be complete, and always to be able to remain in the path of peace.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbang phyug byed cing srog gcod pa spangs pa la sems can rnams rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / pho brang 'khor dang / rgyal po'i gnas thams cad kyi shan pa dang / gsad pa'i gnas thams cad rnam par gcod pa dang / rkang gnyis pa dang; rkang bzhi pa dang / ri mang po la mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa byed pa dang / ltod pa med pa'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa dang / 'khon med pa'i sems kyis rgyal po'i srid thams cad la gnas pa dang / sems can gyi mi bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad sel ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad la bde bar byed pa'i sems rin po che bskyed pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad ni/ rin po che dang 'dra ba'i bsam pa rin po che rab tu sgrub pa dang / sdom pa gsum rnam par dag pa la bdag gnas shing gzhan rab tu 'jog pa'i tshe srog gcod pa spangs pa dang /
bslab pa lnga la sems can rab tu bzhag pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i sems so sor thob cing srog gi dbang po gcad du med pa dang / tshe ring zhing shes rab rab tu thob par gyur cig/ sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i tshe dang ldan zhing tshe dpag tu med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gzhan gyi gnod pas srog 'gag par mi 'gyur zhing rga shi med pa'i chos la rab tu brtson par gyur cig / sems can thams cad tshe ji srid du 'dod cing bsam par gnas pa la mkhas shing nad med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa bye ba brgyar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas shing sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la zhugs te tshe 'gag pa med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad stobs bcu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsags pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur cig / tshe'i dngos po 'dzin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad tshe'i tshad 'gag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad tshe'i tshad zad mi shes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la brtson zhing sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba dang / mnyes par bya ba'i dus dang mnyam par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'phags pa'i chos la dga' ba rab tu thob cing srog gi dbang po 'gag pa med pa dang 'phags pa'i skye mched la bslab par bya ba shin tu bslab par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mthu stobs dang brtson 'grus zad mi shes pa rab tu thob ste/ sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis dbang sgyur ba la rab tu 'jog pa dang / rga ba dang na ba med pa'i tshe phun sum tshogs par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i ye shes shin tu rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir srog gcod pa spangs pa dang / sdom pa gsum rnam par dag pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byol song gi skye gnas su gyur pa rkang bzhi pa dang / mir gyur pa rnams kyi pho mtshan bcad par gyur cing skyes pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bar gyur ba/ skyes bu'i dngos po gzhig par gyur pa/ nyug rum gyi dngos po la bzhag par gyur ba/ lus la gnod pa shin tu mi bzad par gyur pa mthong ba dang / skyes pa'i dngos po las bzlog par gyur pa pho mo gnyis ka ma yin pa'i skye gnas su bzhag par gyur pa/ sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas mnar bar gyur pa/ lus mi bde bas shin tu gzir bar gyur ba/ skyes par tshul gyis dpag pa tsam du gyur pa/ brten pa'i lus 'gag par gyur pa dang / sems can rnams kyi gnod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mthong na/ byams pa chen pos sems can rnams yongs su skyob cing snying rje chen po sngon du btang ste/ 'gro ba thams cad la phan 'dogs pas 'dzam bu'i gling gi skyes pa las nyams par 'gyur ba thams cad rnam par zlog go /rab tu rgyun gcod do/ / yongs su skyob bo/ / rnam par chad par byed do/ / chos dang mthun pa'i mdzod dang / bang ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dag kyang gtong zhing tshig 'di skad du brjod de; khyed kyis gang gi phyir sdig pa'i las rnam pa 'di lta bu bya bar gyur pa/ de'i bde ba dang phan pa'i rnam pa thams cad ngas sbyar gyi/ sdig pa'i las kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag tshul bzhin ma yin pa la 'jug par sems skyes pas bde ba myong ba'i don du khyed ma byed cig / de ltar pha rol la sdig pa'i las 'di lta bu dag byas shing bdag gis bde ba'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ba 'di ni/ gnas ma yin te/ de'i gnas med do/ / 'di ltar sdig pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu la spyod pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis smad pa'o; ; zhes nas de ma yin pa'i mi dge ba'i chos gzhan dag byed pa mthong na yang rnam par zlog par byed cing / sems can thams cad sbyin pa thams cad yongs su btang bas yang dag par sdud do/ / yo byad thams cad kyis kyang mngon par sdud par byed do/ / 'di lta ste/ dben pa'i chos la yid ches par byed pa dang / dge ba'i las shin tu bsags pa dang / mi dge ba'i las phan tshun du byams pa'i sems kyis gcod pa dang / phan tshun du mi gnod cing mi 'tshe ba'i phyir legs par bshad pas kyang shin tu ngom par byed do/ / sems can de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i tshig thos nas sdig pa'i las de las ldang ngo/ / rnam par ldog go /mi spyod do/ / des de ltar bsgrubs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ste; sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi mtshan gsang ba sbubs na 'dug pa dang ldan zhing / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad brtson 'grus dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa rnam par dag pas spyod cing skyes bu'i mtshan dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chags pa med pa dang dpa' ba'i ye shes la yang dag par gnas pa las phyir mi ldog cing shin tu brtan pas dbang bsgyur ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'dod pa'i dga' bas mi ldog mi chags pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad smad pa med pa thams cad mkhyen par 'byung ba'i ye shes bzang po dang ldan zhing skyes bu dam pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad stobs bcus byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan zhing skyes bu chen po'i stobs dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rmad du byung ba'i tshogs la gnas pa rab tu thob cing du thams cad skyes bu'i dbang po nyams pa med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad khams gsum thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas dbang bsgyur zhing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan gyi dga' ba la ma chags pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyi shes shing yid ches pa'i dul ba dang ldan zhing skyes bu mkhas pa'i dam par gyur cig / sems can thams cad skyes bu'i dam pa sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pa la zhugs pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i mthu rtsal dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyes bu'i dam pa yongs su srung ba la zhugs pa/ skal ba dang ldan pa/ 'phags pa'i skye gnas su skye ba 'thob pa'i ye shes kyi skye gnas dang / rigs la yang dag par brtson pa skyes bu khyad par du 'phags pa'i tshul shes pas yang dag par spyod pa/ skyes bu'i tshul bdun yang dag par mthong zhing rtogs pa/ skyes bu'i mthu rtsal dam pa dang / skyes bu'i mthu rtsal ma nor ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i skyes bu'i mthu rtsal dang / dpa' ba'i skyes bu'i mthu rtsal dang / brtan pa'i skyes bu'i mthu rtsal gyis yang dag par bzung ba de/ skyes bu'i dbang po gcad pa med par byas pa dang / skyes bu'i dbang po brtan par byas pas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyi mthu rtsal yongs su dag pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / mkhyen pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bur 'grub par yongs su bsngo'o/ / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par sangs rgyas pa; 'jig rten thams cad du grags par byed pa dang / kye ma sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ngo/ / kye ma sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ngo/ / zhes sangs rgyas kyi sgra sgrog cing / sangs rgyas kyi dbyangs kun tu grags par byed pa dang / sems can gyi nga rgyal dang / bag med pa dang / spros pa thams cad rnam par zlog pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong bar sems can rnams yang dag par stob pa dang / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la sems can rnams rab tu gzhog pa dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas la gzhol bar byed pa dang / sangs rgyas dmigs pa la brtson pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems can thams cad la rim gro byed pa dang / sangs rgyas rnam par rtog pa sems can rnams la ston pa dang / sangs rgyas rjod pa la sems can rnams yang dag par 'dzud pa dang / bskal pa bye bar yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das skye ba ni/ shin tu dkon no/ / zhes bya ba'i tshig sems can rnams la brjod pa dang / sems can de dag gis kyang de'i phyir sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas la rim gro dang zhe sa byed pa dang / dga' ba dang / spro ba skyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mtshan nyan pa dang / sangs rgyas grangs med pa la shin tu bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gsog pa dang / srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gter rnam par sbyong ba dang / srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi drung du yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sems can de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dam pa rab tu shes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la yid ches pas sangs rgyas kyi chos la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad du bskal pa grangs med par bskyed cing spel ba'i dge ba'i rtsa bas sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las yang dag par sgrub pa'i che dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste; dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par mi byed pa dang / sangs rgyas blta ba dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba yid la bya ba dang ma bral zhing sangs rgyas blta bar brtson pa'i yid dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang chos kyi mdzod yang dag par 'dzin cing ye shes sgom pa shin tu mang bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos mnyan pa dang mi 'bral zhing bskal pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yang dag par gnas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sgra 'byin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas 'byung ba mthong zhing ye shes yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / mthong bar bya ba'i mthu la brtson zhing yid la bya ba las gzhan med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad nam mkha'i dbyings kun tu sangs rgyas mthong ba'i 'byung gnas la zhugs shing phyogs kun tu sangs rgyas mthong ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu sangs rgyas byung ba brjod pa la brtson zhing sangs rgyas kyi skus byin gyis brlabs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad mos pa dang / dad pa mi shigs pa dang / snying thag pa'i bsam pas sangs rgyas thams cad 'grogs par gyur te/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rdzogs par thos par byas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas skye ba don yod pas 'gro ba thams cad rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad rab tu brjod par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas skye ba brjod pas yang dag par gzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / mnyes par byed pa dang / mi mnyes par mi byed cing / sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i mthar phyin par yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings, becoming monarchs of great countries, masters of the law, promulgate commands to eliminate work involving killing: in all cities, towns, and villages, all butchery and slaughtering is prohibited—to all creatures, legless, two-legged, four-legged, or many-legged, they give freedom from fear and aggression. Extensively cultivating the practices of all enlightening beings, they treat beings with humanity and kindness, not acting in aggressive or harmful ways. They conceive the wonderful, precious will to give peace to sentient beings, and establish profound determination for buddhahood; always abiding themselves by the three kinds of pure precepts, they also induce sentient beings to do the same.
“Great enlightening beings, causing sentient beings to abide by the five precepts and forever stop occupational killing, dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings awaken the determination for enlightenment, be filled with knowledge and wisdom, and preserve everlasting life; may sentient beings live for immeasurable ages, make offerings to all Buddhas, with reverence and respect diligently cultivating to increase the lifespan even more; may all sentient beings fully practice the method of removing old age and death, so that calamities and poisons cannot threaten their lives; may all sentient beings fully develop bodies free from illness and affliction, so they may live as long as they wish; may all sentient beings attain inexhaustible life, and abide by the practice of enlightening forever and ever, teaching and taming all sentient beings; may all sentient beings be doors of life, wherein the good foundations of the ten powers grow; may all sentient beings be replete with roots of goodness, attain unlimited life, and fulfill great vows; may all sentient beings see all the Buddhas and serve them, and live indefinitely, cultivating and building up roots of goodness; may all sentient beings learn well what there is to learn from the enlightened, attain the joy of the way of sages and infinite life; may all sentient beings attain a permanent life-root, neither aging nor becoming ill, progress with vigor and courage to enter the knowledge and wisdom of buddhahood.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when abiding by the three bodies of pure precepts and forever stopping slaughter, to cause sentient beings to attain the complete ten-powered knowledge of Buddhas.
“When great enlightening beings see people cruelly castrating domestic animals, making their bodies incomplete and causing them pain, they are moved to compassion and save the animals out of pity, and order all the people in the land to stop this practice. The enlightening beings then say to those people, ‘Why do you do such an evil thing? I have a treasury full of all kinds of conveniences which I will give to you according to your needs. What you are doing is wrong and I urge you not to do it. This occupation of yours is not right or reasonable—even if you gain something, what is the use? To harm others for your own profit after all isn’t right. All bad actions like this are not praised by the enlightened.’ And having spoken thus, they give them all their goods, and also explain the sublime teaching to them with fine words to gladden them: that is, they point out to them the way to peace and serenity, causing them to believe and accept, to do away with what is not good, to practice pure deeds, to be kind to one another and not to harm each other. Those people hearing this, forever give up evil.
“At that time, the enlightening beings dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be physically complete; may all sentient beings be courageous and cultivate pure religious practices, may all sentient beings have brave, bold strength, always be leaders, and abide in unobstructed knowledge, never retreating; may all sentient beings forever abandon craving and have no attachments; may all sentient beings develop rectitude and intelligence, and their knowledge increase, worthy of the praise of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings be endowed with the strength of great people and always be able to cultivate the roots of goodness of the ten powers; may all sentient beings never be emasculated, always cultivating rare qualities of virtue and knowledge; may all sentient beings have no attachment or ties to sensual desires, attain mental liberation, detach from the mundane and abide in enlightening practice; may all sentient beings become people of supreme knowledge and wisdom, trusted and obeyed by all; may all sentient beings fully possess the great knowledge and wisdom of enlightening beings, soon to become Buddhas.’ This is enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when prohibiting all castration, to cause sentient beings to have healthy bodies, and all be able to protect good human beings, to be born in the families of worthies and sages, full of intelligence, always cultivating healthy practices, with healthy capabilities, endowed with the healthy seed of enlightenment, the true teaching, courage, vigor, wisdom, and purity of genuine humans.
“If great enlightening beings see a Buddha appear in the world and expound the true teaching, they announce to all in a loud voice, ‘A Buddha has appeared in the world! A Buddha has appeared in the world!’ This is to cause sentient beings to hear the name of Buddha and give up all pride and inanity. They also exhort and lead them to hasten to see the Buddha, to remember the Buddha, to resort to the Buddha, to concentrate on the Buddha, to contemplate the Buddha, to laud the Buddha; also they extensively explain to them how rare it is to meet a Buddha, who appears but once in a quadrillion eons. Due to this, sentient beings get to see the Buddha, give rise to pure faith, dance for joy, and respectfully attend the Buddha. Also, from the Buddha they hear the names of many Buddhas and go on to meet countless Buddhas, plant roots of goodness, cultivate and develop them.
“Then, countless quadrillions of sentient beings, because of seeing the Buddha, all attain purity and ultimate pacification. Those sentient beings think of the enlightening beings as most excellent friends and benefactors, as due to the enlightening beings they achieve enlightened qualities and distribute the roots of goodness they have planted over countless eons throughout the world, thus performing Buddha-work.
“When great enlightening beings teach sentient beings and induce them to see Buddha, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings go to see Buddhas of their own accord, without being urged to do so, and may they serve, provide for, and gladden them all; may all sentient beings always enjoy seeing Buddhas, without any feeling of rejection; may all sentient beings always diligently cultivate vast knowledge, absorbing and retaining the treasury of all Buddha teachings; may all sentient beings understand all Buddha teachings they hear and cultivate enlightening practice for immeasurable eons; may all sentient beings abide in right mindfulness, and always see the Buddhas’ emergence with the eye of knowledge; may all sentient beings not think of different occupations, but always think of seeing Buddha and diligently cultivate the ten powers; may all sentient beings always see Buddhas in all places, comprehending that the realization of thusness pervades the realm of space; may all sentient beings become equipped with the free body of buddhahood, realizing enlightenment and expounding the truth throughout the ten directions; may all sentient beings meet good teachers, always hear the Buddha teachings, and attain unbreakable faith in the Buddhas; may all sentient beings be able to eulogize the emergence of Buddhas, and cause those who see them to attain universal purity.’ This is enlightening beings’ dedication of the roots of goodness of praising Buddhas’ appearance in the world, to cause sentient beings to see all Buddhas, provide for and serve them, and attain ultimate purity in the highest teaching.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi pho brang gi longs spyod dam/ byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ci dga' ba'i longs spyod dam/ 'phags pa'i dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi longs spyod dam/ pha ma gnas pa'i gnas sam/ nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas sam/ gang zag gi rnam pa spyin pa'i gnas dag gam/ de ma yin pa'i phongs pa dang / bkren pa slong zhing len pa dag gam/ 'khor bzhi phongs pa med par gnas pa'i gnas sam/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten brtsigs pa'i gnas sam/ yo byad sna tshogs gzhag pa'i gnas ci 'dod pa'i longs spyod du bya ba'am/ 'jigs pa dang dogs pa med cing dgra dang bral ba/ skyi g.ya' ba med pa'i gnas kyi sa dag 'bul ba'i tshe sa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang bas yul ci 'dod par byin bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa yongs su dag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa la dran pa'i dbang po rmongs pa med cing sa lta bur red par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa thams cad srung ba la zhugs shing yang dag par 'dzin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad la zhe sdang ba med cing dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par sbyang ba la brtson pas sems sa dang mnyam par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa la mkhas shing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa la zhugs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dul ba rnam par dag pa'i lam la zhugs te gnas su red par gyur cig/ sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi stobs la rab tu dgod par brtson zhing sangs rgyas lta bur 'gro ba thams cad la phan 'dogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dga' ba bla na med pa la rab tu gzhog pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyi dga' bar red par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa'i chos kyi 'byung gnas su gyur te rab tu dgod pa la mkhas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyis rnam par rtse zhing yongs su spyod pa thob ste sa lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang sems can gyi khams thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su dag pa thams cad rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings give away land — they may give it to Buddhas, building retreats, or they may give it to enlightening beings and teachers, to use as they wish, or they may give it to mendicant groups for a place of abode, or they may give it to their parents, or to other people, to Buddhist disciples, to individual illuminates, to various fields of blessings, including the poor, orphaned, homeless, and others. They give whatever is wished, to fulfill their needs. They may build Buddhas’ mausoleums, and provide all necessary articles for such places, so they may be used as wished, without fear or hesitation.
“Whenever great enlightening beings give land, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings fully realize the pure stage of universal knowledge and arrive at the consummation of the practices of Universal Good; may all sentient beings attain the stage of total mental command and receive and hold all Buddha teachings with right recollection; may all sentient beings attain sustaining power and be able to preserve all Buddha teachings; may all sentient beings attain a mind like the earth, with intentions ever pure and free from evil thoughts toward sentient beings; may all sentient beings maintain the lineage of Buddhas, accomplishing the processes of the stages of enlightening beings, without interruption; may all sentient beings become abodes of safety for all, causing all to be harmonized and pacified and to abide in the path of purity; may all sentient beings benefit the world the same as enlightened ones, causing all to diligently cultivate themselves and abide securely in the power of buddhahood; may all sentient beings be liked by all the world and cause everyone to abide in the highest happiness of Buddhahood; may all sentient beings attain skill in means of liberation and abide in the power and fearlessness of buddhahood; may all sentient beings attain knowledge like the earth and freely practice all Buddha teachings.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving land, to cause sentient beings to all attain ultimate consummation of the pure state of all enlightened ones.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byung ba rnams la rim 'gro'i don du bdag gi bran dang / las byed pa rnams 'bul ba'am; byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par spel ba'i brtson pa rnams sam/ 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog gam; pha dang / ma dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma'i sbyin pa'i gnas la bran dang / las byed pa'i mi 'bul ba dang / sems can nad pa rnams la rim gro byed pa med pas 'chi bar mi 'gyur bar rim gro bya ba'i phyir bran dang / las byed pa'i mi sbyin pa'am/ de ma yin pa'i sems can g.yog med pa la bran dang / las byed pa'i mi gtong ba'am/ phongs pa dang bkren pa slong zhing len pa gzhan dang gzhan dag la bran dang / las byed pa'i mi gtong ba'am/ de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten bsrung ba'i phyir 'bul ba'am/ dam pa'i chos yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir yi ge dang grangs la shin tu bslab pa'i mi bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po 'bul ba byed cing rim gro pa de dag kyang mkhas pa/ tshul shes pa/ cang shes pa/ brtson pa/ le lo med pa/ drang ba/ drang po dang ldan pa/ phan par sems pa/ bde bar sems pa; byams par sems pa/ rim gro byed pa'i ngang tshul can/ 'khon med pa/ gcugs med par yongs su spyod pa/ gzo dang sgyu rtsal sna tshogs dang / grangs la shin tu bslab pa'i shes pa gsal ba can/ rim pa'i tshul shes pa dga' bar byed cing / rim gro byed pa la brtson zhing gtong ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i las las byung ba / yid du 'thad pa/ rim gro byed pa/ sems shin tu dang ba de lta bu'i rim gro ba dag gnas gar 'os pa dang / ci rigs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa de dang de dag la 'bul zhing yongs su gtong ba dang / sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ rim gro ba yang dag par btang ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad bsnyen bkur ba dang rim gro bya ba la mkhas shing brtson te cang shes kyi sems dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bka' yang dag par len cing sangs rgyas thams cad dang mthun pa'i rim gro par gyur cig / sems can thams cad yid la bya ba dang / bsam pa dang / rnam par rtog pa gzhan med cing sangs rgyas thams cad la rtag tu skabs phye bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad dge ba thams cad yang dag par sdud pa la brtson zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs las mi nyams pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rjes su snyegs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad don yod par dus thams cad du 'phrad cing sangs rgyas thams cad la dus dang mthun par rim gro dang bsnyen bkur byed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad yi ge rnam par dag pas mi 'jigs par spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi don 'dzin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas la lus dang srog phul zhing sangs rgyas thams cad la ngom mi shes par lta bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi gnas thams cad yang dag par 'joms pas sangs rgyas thams cad la lta ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa dang / de ma yin pa'i gnas gzhan med cing sangs rgyas thams cad la brten par 'gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa mngon du gyur pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur te sangs rgyas kyi rjes su 'brang bar blo gros dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rim gro ba yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi rdul med cing rdul dang bral ba/ dri ma med pa/ rnyog pa med pa'i sar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku gzhan la rag lus pa med pa'i rten gyi tshul rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dma' bar byas shing / sa la gding ba'i rdog lam dang 'dra ba'i sems su byas te/ sa dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa/ mi 'gyur ba/ mi skyo ba/ sems can thams cad la rim gro byed pas ngal ba med pa'i yid dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi sbyin bdag dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad nye bar stob pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba byams pas nye bar byas pa/ nyams su len cing rna la gzon pa'i ngang tshul can/ dge ba shin tu brtan pa la brtson pa/ yid la byed pa bzang pos gnas pa la brtson pa/ sems can gyi khams thams cad bsnyen bkur ba'i sems kyis bdag nyid rim gro bar 'bul ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ ci nas kyang sems can thams cad shin tu rim gro byas pa dang / ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i don nyams pa med pa dang / ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i lam du legs par zhugs par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su bdag nyid bgrang bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bden pa'i tshig dang 'grogs pa rjes su srung bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang khams gsum thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang lhag pa'i bsam pas rtogs par sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba skyon med cing / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad de dag thams cad yon tan chen po la rab tu zhugs te thams cad mkhyen pa'i mthar shin tu thug par 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo'o/ / de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ 'di ltar lus kyi rim gro sems can thams cad la yongs su btang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang bsags pa des sems can thams cad yongs su rtogs pa'i chos can/ rab tu 'dzin pa'i chos can/ yang dag par len pa'i chos can/ mi 'khrugs pa'i chos can/ chud mi za ba'i chos can/ mi nyams pa'i chos can/ mi 'bral ba'i chos can/ yid shin tu dul ba'i chos can/ ma dul ba 'dul ba'i chos can/ chos kyis nye bar dul ba'i chos can gyi rim gro pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad la shin tu nye bar sems pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas thams cad la rim gro'i nan tan du byas te/ sems can de dag thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba des mchod rten gyi dam par 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad bsnyen bkur bar 'os par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i gnas dam par 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad la snying brtse ba'i phyir len pa'i dam par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi don dam pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa tshad med pa'i phyir sbyin sreg dam pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / khams gsum thams cad na 'byung ba'i dam par 'gyur ba dang / lam ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ded dpon dam par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bzung ba'i phyir gzungs kyi dam pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ba dang / nam mkha'i dbyings ltar chags pa med pa'i lam gyi 'byung bas chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dam par 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag rim gro par phul bas/ yang dag par gzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can gyi khams thams cad phyag bya bar 'os pa'i ye shes kyi phung po dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos la dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / rab tu dga' zhing dang ba'i sems kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la chos dkon mchog bla na med pa la mos pa'i bsam pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la phar sems pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / chos bye ba grangs med par tshad med pa'i chos kyi khong du chud cing yang dag par bzung ba dang / shes rab chen po rin po che la yang dag par gzhol ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon du gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa mtha' yas pa rjes su dran pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul dang / don gyi rjes su 'brang bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ldem po dag khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sprin las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi char mngon par bab pa dang / rtul phod pas dbang bsgyur ba sems kyi dpa' bas thob pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa gang zag gi mchog gi sar shin tu bstan pa dang / chos chen po bye ba brgya stong tshad med pas shin tu brtan pa'i dbang pos bdag gi lus 'bul zhing de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos de lta bu dag nyan pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa la dga' ba tshad med pa rnam par 'phel ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ chos spyod pa la yang dag par gnas pa'i sems can dam pa rang gi the tshom chod pa/ gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pa la rab tu zhugs pa/ rab tu dag pa'i mtshan mas sems ma nyams pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / yon tan gyi 'byung gnas rab tu thob pa/ bsam pa tshad med pa'i spyod pa'i rjes su zhugs pa/ sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ rdo rje'i snying po lta bu'i ye shes dam pa'i khyad par khong du chud pa'i sems brtan cing shin tu gnas pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na gnas shing rnam par dag par byed pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na gnas pa las mi 'bral ba de chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag la rab tu gnas te rang gi lus de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon par 'bul ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yang dag par bzung ba'i lus dang ldan zhing / mi dma' ba'i lus yongs su rdzogs pa rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba dang mi 'bral ba'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan pas sangs rgyas thams cad la nye bar brten cing spyod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi yon tan dang ldan zhing nyams pa med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par bya ba la brtson zhing mi dmigs pas tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bdag tu bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba las gyen du 'phags shing bdag gi med pa'i lus rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad lus 'phos pa med par lus yang dag par ston cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du lus rnam par bkram par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bdag gi med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gro bas gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i rgyud kyi rigs dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi skur mngon par skyes par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bzod pa'i stobs kyis sems la thub pa med cing chos kyi stobs dang ldan pa'i lus can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs pas 'dra ba med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i dbyings su byung bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa la rang gi lus phul bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang sems can gyi khams thams cad dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang rgyud du yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la 'gro ba kun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ltar phan 'dogs pas bdag nyid yongs su gtong ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par sems pa dang / mar me lta bur bdag sems can rnams la bsnyen pa dang / bde ba lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la byin gyis rlob pa dang / chos kyi gzhi lta bur bdag 'gro ba thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / snang ba lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad mig yor lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la snang bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu lta bur bdag 'gro ba thams cad la ston pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la stob pa dang / lam lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la yang dag par ston pa dang / bla na med pa'i bde ba'i rnam pa rab tu thob pa lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la yongs su sbyong ba dang / nyi ma lta bur bdag 'gro ba thams cad la snyoms pa byed pa dang / de lta bu'i chos dang ldan par bdag sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe bdag btang bas byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi sar rab tu phyin par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du dul ba thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi phyir spyod pa mkhas shing spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad don dang / chos dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba'i mthu yod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung bas rab tu tshim par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dge bas ma rig pa'i bsam pa spang bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub kyi shing drung du dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pas shin tu byung bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'tshe ba'i sems bskyed pa dang bral zhing nyon mongs pa'i dgra shin tu choms par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir yongs su srung ba thob par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la bdag yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa dang / sems can thams cad kyis bla na med pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas thams cad la drin du gzo ba'i sems bskyed pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rim gro bya ba dang / bu ltar bsam pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sems 'di snang zhing dang bar byin gyis brlab pa dang / 'jig rten gyi 'du shes las bdag phyir log par bya ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi rigs su gtogs par bgrang ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas thams cad dang mthun par gzung ba dang / bdag bdud kyi yul las ring du bya ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi yul la mos par bya ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snod du byin gyis brlab pa dang / de lta bu'i chos la brtson par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur te/ sems nye bar brtan pa rnam par dag pa rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sdig to'i las thams cad la zhe sdang zhing cang shes dang yang dag par 'grogs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad shin tu bzung ba'i chos can du gyur te/ mi byed pa'i g.yog dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dbang bskur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa thob ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi slob mar gyur cig / sems can thams cad mi dge ba thams cad las shin tu 'das te sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su bzung bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i chos skyon med pa la yang dag par spyod cing sangs rgyas thams cad dang mthun par gyur cig / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su lung bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas la dmigs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dbang sgyur zhing sangs rgyas thams cad la rag lus par gyur cig / sems can thams cad len pa med pa'i las mngon par 'du byed cing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis nye bar bzung bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi spyod pas sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par bya ba la brtson zhing sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i dam par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rim gro byed pas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mngon du gyur pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'jig rten thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / khams gsum pa thams cad las 'byung ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / gnod pa med pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / tshad med pa'i byang chub yangs pa thob pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis snang bar byas pa'i shes pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis shin tu bzung bas yongs su bsngo'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos la mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig tu byas te yongs su bsngo'o; ; ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'gyod pa med pa'i sems shin tu rdzogs par 'gyur bar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o// //

“Great enlightening beings give servants as offerings to all Buddhas and enlightening beings, genuine teachers; or they may give them to the religious community, or to their parents, honorable fields of blessings, or again they may give them to sentient beings suffering from illness, to fulfill their needs and preserve their lives, or they may give them to the poor and helpless and all others without attendants, or they may give countless servants from time to time to look after the shrines and mausoleums of Buddhas or to transcribe the true teachings of the Buddhas. Those servants are all intelligent and highly skilled, naturally obedient, always diligent and never lazy, with honest minds, peaceful and happy minds, altruistic minds, humane and benevolent minds, respectful minds, minds free from resentment and hostility, able to adjust to the customs of those for whom they work, able to be of benefit to everyone. Also, from the influences of the enlightening beings’ pure conduct, they have talent and artistry, and are masters of crafts and mathematics. They are skilled in service and able to please.
“At that time, the enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain docile minds, cultivating roots of goodness with all Buddhas; may all sentient beings obediently provide offerings to all Buddhas and be able to hear and absorb what the Buddhas teach; may all sentient beings be accepted by the Buddhas, always observe the enlightened ones, without any other thought; may all sentient beings not spoil the seed of buddhahood, diligently cultivating all roots of goodness in accord with the Buddhas; may all sentient beings always diligently provide for all Buddhas, not wasting any time; may all sentient beings hold the sublime doctrines of the Buddhas, their words pure, traveling without fear; may all sentient beings always be happy to see Buddhas, never tiring, not begrudging their lives to the Buddhas; may all sentient beings get to see the Buddhas, their minds without indulgence or attachment, free from worldly dependence; may all sentient beings only take refuge in Buddha and forever leave all false resorts; may all sentient beings follow the Buddha-way, their minds always blissfully contemplating the supreme Buddha teaching.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving servants, to cause sentient beings to get rid of defilement, clear the ground of buddhahood, and be able to manifest the free body of the enlightened.
“Great enlightening beings give their bodies to those who come ask for them; when they give, they engender a humble mind, a mind like the earth, a mind enduring all suffering without changing or wavering, a mind to serve sentient beings tirelessly, a mind regarding all sentient beings like a benevolent mother, turning over all their virtues to them, a mind of forgiveness for the various impositions and aggressions of ignorant evil beings, and rest on the foundations of goodness, diligently performing service.
“At that time enlightening beings dedicate all the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings never lack what they need, cultivate the practices of enlightening beings unremittingly, not give up the just rewards of all enlightening beings, remain on the path traveled by enlightening beings, comprehend the equal real nature of enlightening beings, get to be of the number of the family of Buddhas, abide by truthful speech, sustain enlightening practice, cause all worldlings to be able to clarify the Buddha-teaching, deeply believe in it, and realize the ultimate consummation of the teaching, and cause sentient beings to produce pure, excellent roots of goodness, abide in great virtue, and fulfill universal knowledge. Also with these roots of goodness I will cause all sentient beings to always get to attend all Buddhas, to understand all their teachings, to bear the teachings, reading and reciting them, never forgetting them or letting them be lost or scattered, their minds well subdued. Those who are not self-controlled I will tame, training them with the methods of stillness and serenity. I will cause sentient beings, in the presence of the Buddhas, to persevere in these things. Also, by these roots of goodness I will cause all sentient beings to be the foremost monument, worthy of receiving the various offerings of the world. I will cause all sentient beings to become supreme fields of blessings, attain Buddha knowledge, and enlighten everyone. I will cause all sentient beings to become the best of recipients, able to benefit all living beings. I will cause all sentient beings to become the best of benefactors, able to foster the endowment of all roots of goodness. I will cause all sentient beings to become the finest receivers of gifts, able to cause the givers to obtain infinite rewards. I will cause all sentient beings to attain emancipation from the realms of desire, form, and formlessness. I will cause all sentient beings to become the foremost of leaders, able to show the world the path that accords with truth. I will cause all sentient beings to attain marvelous total mental command, fully holding all the true teachings of the Buddhas. I will cause all sentient beings to attain realization of the infinite primary cosmos of reality, and fulfill the true path unobstructed as space.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving their own bodies, to cause all sentient beings to attain the body of infinite knowledge of the sanctified ones.
“Great enlightening beings are joyful when they hear the teaching; they conceive pure faith, and are able to offer their own bodies to the Buddha, raptly believing in the treasure of the unexcelled teaching. They think of the Buddhas as their parents, and read and recite, absorb and hold the teachings of the path of nonobstruction, entering into all the gates of countless teachings, jewels of wisdom, roots of goodness. Their minds always think of infinite Buddhas. They enter the sphere of buddhahood and attain to deep comprehension of its principles. They are able, with the subtle, mysterious pure voice of the enlightened, to produce clouds of Buddha teachings and shower rain of Buddha teachings. Bravely and freely they are able to analytically explain the supreme state of the omniscient. Fully consummating the vehicle of all-knowledge, they fulfill all potentials with immeasurable hundreds of thousands of millions of great teachings.
“When great enlightening beings hear such teachings from Buddhas, their joy knows no bounds; they abide firmly by the truth, cut off their own doubt and confusion, and also cause others’ doubts to be removed as well. Their minds are always light and happy, full of virtuous qualities, replete with roots of goodness. Their attention is continuous, helping sentient beings without their minds ever being exhausted. They attain supreme knowledge and become treasuries of diamonds. They associate closely with Buddhas and purify buddha-fields, always diligently attend all the enlightened ones. At that time the enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain a fully developed, most excellent body, in the care of all Buddhas; may all sentient beings always be near the Buddhas, abide with the Buddhas, and always gaze upon them, never leaving; may all sentient beings attain a pure indestructible body, endowed with all virtue and knowledge; may all sentient beings always diligently serve all Buddhas, and carry out the ultimate pure practice of nonassumption; may all sentient beings attain the egoless body, divorced from self and possession; may all sentient beings be able to distribute their bodies throughout the lands of the ten directions, like reflections appearing, without coming or going; may all sentient beings attain the body of freedom, going everywhere in the ten directions without self or reception; may all sentient beings attain the buddha-body, born in the home of the unexcelled embodiment of the realization of thusness; may all sentient beings attain the great power of forbearance of the body of power of truth, which none can break down; may all sentient beings attain the incomparable body and realize the pure body of reality of the enlightened; may all sentient beings develop the body of transmundane virtues, born in the pure realm of reality where nothing is obtained.’ This is the dedication of roots of goodness of enlightening beings when offering their bodies to Buddhas, to cause sentient beings to dwell forever in the house of the Buddhas of past, present, and future.
“Great enlightening beings give their bodies to all sentient beings, because they want to cause them to develop roots of goodness, and to remember and think of roots of goodness. Great enlightening beings wish their bodies to be great bright lamps able to illumine all sentient beings, to be means of life supporting all beings, to be treasuries of wonderful teaching able to sustain all living beings, to be pure light to awaken all sentient beings, to be lights of the world causing all sentient beings to always see, to be causes and conditions of roots of goodness causing sentient beings to always get the opportunity to meet them, to be genuine teachers causing all sentient beings to receive instruction and guidance, to be even paths on which all sentient beings may tread, to be unexcelled, complete comfort enabling all sentient beings to be freed from suffering and be purified, to be clear suns universally and impartially benefiting the world.
At that time enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings always associate with the Buddhas and enter the realm of Buddha knowledge; may all sentient beings attain adaptable knowledge and abide in unexcelled awareness; may all sentient beings always be in the assemblies of Buddhas and their minds be well tuned; may all sentient beings always comport themselves with the dignity of Buddhas; may all sentient beings attain nirvana and profoundly understand the meaning of the teaching; may all sentient beings be complete in knowledge and conduct and be born in the house of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings give up ignorant craving and abide in the aspiration of buddhahood; may all sentient beings develop excellent roots of goodness and sit at the tree of enlightenment; may all sentient beings slay the brigands that are the afflictions and get rid of these enemies; may all sentient beings fully preserve all Buddha teachings.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving their bodies to all sentient beings, because they want to benefit all sentient beings and cause them to reach the realm of supreme peace.
“Great enlightening beings personally attend the Buddhas, wanting to requite their great benevolence, thinking of them as like parents. They have deep faith in the Buddhas, and preserve enlightenment, abiding by the principles of the Buddhas, detaching from mundane conceptions. Born in the house of the enlightened, they follow the Buddhas, leaving the realm of delusion. They arrive at the sphere of action of all Buddhas and become vessels of the teachings of all Buddhas. At that time the enlightening beings dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain pure minds and adorn themselves with the jewel of universal knowledge; may all sentient beings abide in good self-control and avoid all bad actions; may all sentient beings gain indestructible, steadfast retinues, able to absorb the true teaching of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings become students of Buddhas and reach the enlightening beings’ stage of coronation; may all sentient beings always be in the keeping of the Buddhas and forever give up whatever is not good; may all sentient beings follow the Buddhas and practice the supreme principle of enlightening beings; may all sentient beings enter the sphere of Buddhas and receive the prediction of omniscience; may all sentient beings be thoroughly equal to the Buddhas and master all the Buddha teachings; may all sentient beings be in the care of the Buddhas and always be able to practice acting without grasping or attachment; may all sentient beings become the foremost attendants of the Buddhas, and in the company of the Buddhas cultivate the practice of knowledge and wisdom.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when attending Buddhas, because they want to actually realize the enlightenment of the Buddhas, because they want to save all sentient beings, because they want to transcend all in the triple world, because they want to perfect nonmalevolence, because they want to attain immeasurably great enlightenment, because they want to develop knowledge illuminating the Buddha teachings, because they want to always receive acceptance by the Buddhas, because they want to gain the protection of the Buddhas, because they want to truly understand all Buddha teachings, because they want to develop roots of goodness equal to those of the Buddhas of all times, and because they want to fully develop an unembittered mind and realize the teachings of all Buddhas.
bam po sum cu dgu pa/

'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad las rnam par 'das pa/ rgyal po'i srid la zhen pa'i bsam pa med pa/ ma chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ skyid pas ma bcings pa/ rgyal po'i srid la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa/ yongs su gzung ba la mi gnas pa/ ma btang ba gtong ba/ dbang phyug la ma chags pa/ gnod pa med pa'i las dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar sems pa de rgyal po'i srid yongs su gtong ba'i tshe rgyal po'i srid byin pas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ ci nas kyang las kyi rnam par smin pa la ye rdam [*rngam?] pa med pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang 'jig rten gyi chos la dga' ba mi skye ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang srid par skye mched la mngon par zhen pa med pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi gnas la gnas kyi 'du shes mi skyed pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la mngon par zhen pa med pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang phyi nang gi chos thams cad du lus la gnas pa'i sems mi skye ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la rmongs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar dge
