ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang ring du mi 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa chen po'i smon lam nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad mngon par mnyes par 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / gzhan yang 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ rgyal po'i srid byin pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos kyi dbang phyug gi dam pa thob ste chos kyi rgyal po'i srid la dbang bsgyur ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rgyal po'i dkrug ma dang / dgra thams cad rab tu gzhom pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rgyal srid rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rgyal srid chen po la rab tu gnas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med pa bskor ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul gyi rgyal srid la rab tu gzhol bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi dbang phyug sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par yang dag par 'dzin pa'i tshul du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas mngon par byung bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir srid yangs shing / tshad med pa rjes su skyong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas 'byung ba rgyun ma chad pa dang ldan zhing chos kyi dbyings la nges pa'i rgyal srid dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gdul pa la thogs pa med par zhugs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad ye shes kyi dbang phyug tu gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams kun gyi sems can theg pa chen po la rab tu gzhog pa'i tshul gyis 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad du chos kyi sbyin bdag tu gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur te ltod pa med pa'i rgyal srid rab tu thob par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal po'i srid yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang 'gro ba thams cad du shin tu bde ba dang / legs pa 'byung ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems mi 'khrugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems rtse gcig pa dang / smon lam tshad med par byas te snying rje chen po bskyed cing byams pa chen po'i stobs nye bar bzhag ste bsam pa shin tu tshim par byas nas sems can gyi don la bdag rab tu bzhag ste ye shes chen po la shin tu mos par byas nas sangs rgyas kyi chos la mnyam pa'i sems su byas te dge ba'i chos nyid la rnam par dpyod cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal srid la rab tu gzhol bar sems bskyed pa dang / chos kyi dbang phyug la shin tu brtson pa'i bsam pa dang / ye shes la dbang sgyur ba thob pa'i yid kyi dbang po dang / yon tan thams cad rnam par spyod pa'i rab tu 'jug pa dang / blo brtan pa dang ldan pa'i bsam pa yangs pa dang / tshogs su gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / brtsam par skabs phye ba dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi smon lam dang / gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos dang / shin tu brtan pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i stobs dang / brtsams pa thams cad mthar 'byin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i smon lam gyis mi dang yul du bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa thams cad gtong bar yongs su btang bas slong ba rnams la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe yul dang mir bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ yul dang mir bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i gnas rab tu byin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams cad rnam par sbyangs te sangs rgyas thams cad bzhugs shing spyod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad la 'bul bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad zhi ba'i gnas rab tu thob cing dgon pa shin tu dben pa la mngon par mos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i dben pa'i mthar thug par grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i gnas la gnas pa med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi smra ba thams cad las rnam par 'das te 'du 'dzi med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gyod pa med pa'i sbyin bdag tu gyur te gtong ba'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad gnas med pa'i bsam pa rab tu thob cing khyim gyi gnas dang rab tu bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad gtong ba shin tu gtong ba'i sems dang ldan zhing gtang bar bya ba gtong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad khyim gyi gnas la chags pa las rnam par 'das te gnas pa chud za ba med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gnod pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / 'jigs pa thams cad las rnam bar 'das te gtse ba thams cad kyis yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'bul bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par spyod par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po yul dang mir bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi gnas yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po g.yog dang 'khor la dga' ba'i mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing ltos pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'khor ba thams cad la zhen pa med pa'i rgyud can/ 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad kyis sems bcings pa med pa/ gzugs kyi rnam pa thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad la sems mi brkam pa/ 'dod pa'i dga' ba sna tshogs su yongs su spyod pa la rtog pa med par gnas pa/ 'dod pa'i sbyor ba thams cad la chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ bud med kyi dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dga' ba yongs su spyod pa/ thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa/ bud med rin po che'i yan lag dang nying lag thams cad la ma chags pa/ 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad las phyir mi ldog pas g.yog 'khor dang / chung ma'i 'khor dang rol mor bcas pa/ glu dang / gar dang / rnga dang / rol mo dkrol bar byed cing spyod pa/ bsnyen bkur zhing rim gro bya ba la shin tu mkhas par gyur pa/ gzo dang sgyu rtsal shin tu bslab pa/ 'jig rten pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa/ dga' bar byed pa yid du 'ong ba'i rim gros rtse bar byed pa/ bkur sti'i tshul la mkhas pa/ rol mo brdung ba'i sgra yid du 'ong ba shin tu phyung ba dang / rol mo dkrol ba dang / glu'i sgra mi mthun pa med pa dang / gar gyis nye bar spyod pa dang ldan pa/ bud med cang shes kyi tshogs kyis kun nas bskor ba bzhin sdug gu dang / cha byad sdug gu'i bu mo rin po che dang ldan pa/ phreng ba dang / spos dang / rgyan gyis rim gror byed pa/ bzhad gad dang / rol mos dga' bar rtse zhing bkur sti rnam pa sna tshogs yid du 'ong ba ston pa'i bud med rin po che 'grogs 'grogs pa dag nyan cing mthun par 'dzin pa/ nges pa'i tshig dga' bar byed cing rim gror byed pa/ rgyan bzang po rab tu mang pos blta na yid du 'ong bar brgyan pas shin tu rnam par dag pa; rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' las kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang rgyu mthun par byung ba las shes shing byang chub sems dpa'i dbang gi rjes su 'brang ba/ sems dga' bar byed pa de lta bu g.yog 'khor dang / chung ma'i 'khor dang / rol mor bcas pa shin tu bshes pa/ de dag thams cad yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'gro ba thams cad nas 'byung ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos la dga' ba rab tu thob pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / snying po blang ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / ye shes rdo rje'i dbyings mi shigs pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu 'thob pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / snying po len par byas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / bla na med pa'i sems dang ldan pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / ye shes kyis khong du chud pa'i chos dang ldan pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su red par byas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad dang mi 'gal bar byas te yongs su bsngo'o; ; de lta bu'i chos la rnam par spyod cing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi rgyud du byung ba/ sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnam par dag pas rab tu skyes ba/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam du sems mngon par skyes pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i las dang / ye shes 'byams klas pa la zhugs pa; 'jig rten gyi dri ma thams cad rab tu spyod pa/ sbyin pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ yon tan chen po'i dkyil 'khor gyis sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa / 'jig rten thams cad kyi gnas dang 'gro ba thams cad kyi rten du gyur ba/ sems can thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba la yang dag par zhugs pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad gzung ba la yang dag par brtson pa de 'khor thams cad yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin mi 'phrog pa rab tu thob ste ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa'i 'khor gyis bskor bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas mthong bas spro ba dang dga' ba rab tu thob ste sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyan la mnyam par gzhog par gyur cig / sems can thams cad tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par 'phrul pa la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse zhing spyod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems la 'khrug pa med cing chos dang mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ting nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang sgyur zhing byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin zab mo rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad yang dag par bral ba'i yid rab tu thob ste ting nge 'dzin gyi 'khor dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa shin tu thob ste ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs la mkhas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ting nge 'dzin thams cad sgom pa la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par shes par gyur cig / sems can thams cad rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sems kyis mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par spyod cing chags pa med cing ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khor thams cad yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi 'khor gzhan gyis mi phyed cing rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi tshogs rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / skal pa mnyam pa'i sems can dang 'grogs pa dang / mthun pa'i g.yog 'khor rab tu 'thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rab tu 'grub pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i bsod nams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam par dag pa 'thob pa dang / g.yog nges pa dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi mdzod shin tu rigs pa la zhugs pas rab tu ston pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad 'thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o; ; 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las rnam par 'das pa dang / sems can thams cad grogs su 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o; ; rnam par dag pa'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos snang ba thams cad kyi rgyan yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon sum du rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings give up their countries, able to relinquish all things, including kingship; their minds attain freedom from all worldly concerns, and they have no ties, no bonds, no obsessions or attachments. They avoid evil deeds and work for the benefit of sentient beings without attachment to the results of their deeds. They do not take pleasure in worldly things, and are no longer attached to or eager for any realm of existence. Though they live in the world, they do not set their hearts on it. They do not cling to material, mental, or sense phenomena, and their minds do not rest on anything internal or external. They never forget the practices of enlightening beings, and never abandon the wise; keeping the far-reaching practical commitments of enlightening beings, they always gladly serve all good companions.
“At such times, the enlightening beings dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings become monarchs of truth, masters of truth, and reach the other shore; may all sentient beings become monarchs of the Buddha teaching and destroy their enemies, the afflictions; may all sentient beings dwell in the sovereignty of buddhahood, attain enlightened knowledge, and expound the Buddha teachings; may all sentient beings live in the realm of buddhahood and be able to turn the wheel of the teaching of unexcelled freedom; may all sentient beings be born in the house of the enlightened ones, master the teachings, and preserve the family of Buddhas forever; may all sentient beings reveal innumerable true teachings of the king of truth, perfecting boundless great enlightening beings; may all sentient beings abide in the pure realm of reality, become monarchs of the great truth, and manifest the emergence of Buddhas, continuing unbroken; may all sentient beings be monarchs of knowledge and wisdom in all worlds, edifying and guiding living beings without ever abandoning them; may all sentient beings be donors of truth to all sentient beings in all worlds throughout the space of the cosmos, enabling them all to abide in the Great Vehicle; may all sentient beings manage to become monarchs replete with myriad virtues, with roots of goodness equal to those of the Buddhas of past, present, and future.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving away kingship, because they want to cause all sentient beings to ultimately live in peace.
“When great enlightening beings see people come asking for the magnificent buildings of the royal capital as well as the revenues from customs duties collected at the borders, they give it all ungrudgingly, wholeheartedly turning toward enlightenment, making great vows, abiding in great benevolence, practicing great compassion, their minds joyfully intent on helping sentient beings. By great knowledge they understand the profound truth and abide in the equal real nature of Buddhas. They practice giving because they are determined to find omniscience, because they have profound longing for freedom, because they seek realization of independent knowledge, because they purify all virtues, because they abide in steadfast great knowledge, because they extensively gather all kinds of roots of goodness, because they carry out the undertakings of all the Buddha teachings, because they spontaneously awaken to the principle of great knowledge, because they abide in enlightenment without regressing, because they cultivate the practical vows of all enlightening beings, and because they thoroughly consummate knowledge of methods of enlightenment.
“These roots of goodness they dedicate in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be able to purify infinite lands and present them to the Buddhas to live in; may all sentient beings always enjoy living in forests, silent, peaceful, undisturbed; may all sentient beings not dwell in capitals or cities, their hearts delighting in peace and quiet, forever attaining ultimate serenity; may all sentient beings be forever unattached to any world and always gladly avoid all mundane talk; may all sentient beings attain hearts free from covetousness, giving whatever they have without regret; may all sentient beings attain emancipated minds, giving up occupation with business; may all sentient beings be free from miserliness and always practice generous giving; may all sentient beings have unattached minds, transcending the events of home life; may all sentient beings attain freedom from suffering and eliminate all fear of calamity; may all sentient beings purify all worlds in the ten directions and present them to the Buddhas.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving away royal capitals, to cause sentient beings to all be able to purify the buddha-fields.
“Great enlightening beings’ ladies-in-waiting are all beautiful and talented, witty and graceful, skilled in conversation, dancing, and singing, adorned with various clothes, flowers, and perfumes, endlessly delightful to all who see them: such precious women, countless numbers of them, are all born of the good deeds of enlightening beings, free to do as they will, yet impeccably respectful and agreeable—all of them the enlightening beings give to those who ask for them, without longing for them, without missing them, without obsession with them, without attachment to them, without clinging to them, without craving for them, without thinking about them, without pursuing them, without attachment to their appearance, without lust for them.
“At such a time the enlightening beings contemplate the roots of goodness and dedicate them to enabling all sentient beings to attain emancipation, to attain the joy of the Buddha teachings, to attain the enduring in the midst of the unenduring, to attain the incorruptible mind of adamantine knowledge, to enter the site of Buddha’s enlightenment, to reach the other shore, to attain the supremely enlightened mind, to be able to comprehend all things, to produce all roots of goodness, to enter the house of the Buddhas of all times.
“Great enlightening beings, abiding by this principle, are born in the house of the enlightened, develop the pure, supreme causal basis of the Buddhas, produce the supreme path of universal knowledge, enter deeply into the far-reaching work of knowledge of enlightening beings, and get rid of all worldly defilements and afflictions. They are always able to provide offerings to the virtuous fields of blessings. They expound the wondrous teaching to sentient beings, skillfully arranging it, causing them to cultivate pure practices, always endeavoring to embody all roots of goodness.
“At such a time the enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings always attain a retinue of innumerable concentrations, the supreme concentration of enlightening beings, continuing uninterrupted; may all sentient beings always delight in seeing Buddha and enter absorption in the adornments of Buddhas; may all sentient beings accomplish the inconceivable concentration of enlightening beings, sporting freely in immeasurable spiritual powers; may all sentient beings enter concentration in accord with truth and attain incorruptible minds; may all sentient beings thoroughly attain the most profound concentration of enlightening beings, and realize freedom in all meditations and concentrations; may all sentient beings attain liberated minds and accomplish the group of all concentration states; may all sentient beings attain skill in all kinds of concentration, able to take in all aspects of concentration; may all sentient beings attain concentration of supreme knowledge, able to learn and practice the various methods of concentration; may all sentient beings attain unobstructed concentration and enter into deep meditation concentration, never regressing or losing it; may all sentient beings attain unattached concentration, their minds always sensing truly and not grasping duality.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving away their retinues, because they want to cause all sentient beings to gain indestructible pure retinues, because they want to cause all sentient beings to gain retinues of enlightening beings, because they want to cause all sentient beings to be able to fulfill the powers of omniscience, because they want to cause all sentient beings to realize supreme wisdom, because they want to cause all sentient beings to have amenable retinues, because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain the pure reality-body of the enlightened, because they want to cause all sentient beings to attain orderly, reasonable powers of elucidation and skillfully expound the inexhaustible treasury of the Buddha’s teachings, because they want to cause all sentient beings to forever relinquish all conventional mundane virtues and equally cultivate pure transmundane virtues, because they want to cause all sentient beings’ purifying work to be complete, and develop all pure qualities, and because they want to cause all Buddha teachings to be evident to all sentient beings, universally purified by the light of truth.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bu dang bu mo dang chung ma yongs su gtong zhing / ji ltar gzhon nu shin tu sbyang ba dang / rgyal po rgyan thams cad ston pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam la mngon par gnas pa gtong ba dang / yongs su gtong ba thams cad rnam par 'phel bar byed pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i gtong ba'i lam rnam par sbyong ba/ phyis 'gyod pa med par gtong ba'i sems rnam par sbyong ba/ gtong ba rin po che thams cad kyis thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa la mnyam par bzhag pa/ 'gro ba thams cad rnam par dag par byed pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu sgrub pa/ lhag pa'i bsam pas dag pa'i byang chub rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyis bdag mngon par bskyab par yang dag par lta ba/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub tu sems mngon du gyur par byin gyis rlob pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs la gnas pa'i sems bskyed pa yongs su sgyur ba rnams kyis bu dang bu mo dang chung ma yongs su btang ba de ltar bu dang bu mo dang chung ma de dag bsam pa stobs dang ldan par byas te btang ba dang / bdag de bzhin nyid du mos par byas te sbyin par byed pa dang / bdag nyid 'jig rten thams cad kyis ci 'dod par spyad par yang dag par lta ba dang / bdag sems can thams cad la sbyin pa kun gyi 'byung gnas su gyur par byin gyis rlob pa dang / gang gis sems can dma' bar gyur pa de dag gis yongs su rgyas par byed pa dang / de lta bu'i tshul gyis bdag yang dag par 'dzin pa dang mchod rten dam par 'gyur ro/ / zhes 'gro ba thams cad bdag spro bar byed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems nyid 'gro ba thams cad la shin tu sgrub pa dang / bdag 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa'i mu stegs su lta ba dang / bdag 'jig rten thams cad kyi 'babs bde bar rab tu rtogs pa dang / bdag 'gro ba thams cad kyi sbyin bdag tu mos par byed pa dang / bdag ye shes kyi yid dang ldan par byas shing bdag byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rab tu brtson par yang dag par shes pa dang / bdag ji ltar smras pa de ltar byed pa la sbyor ba dang / bdag thams cad mkhyen pa'i go cha bgos par rab tu rtog cing ye shes dang bsod nams kyi zhing tshol ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad la dam bcas pa'i sems rjes su srung ba dang / rab tu nan tan byed pa la bdag shin tu gzhog pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad du snang ba'i ye shes yang dag par skyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gtong ba'i sems yid la byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon sum du dmigs par byed pa'i tshe chags pa med pa dang / grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sems dang ldan na/ sems can thams cad kyi don du ye shes dang bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ bu dang bu mo dang chung ma yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par 'gengs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo phyir mi ldog pa yang dag par bskor bas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la 'jog par byed cing bdag gi lus kyi sprul pa rab tu 'gyed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du smon lam gyis 'dong zhing lus la mngon par chags pa med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad kyi chags pa dang khong khro ba spangs shing sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i sems dang bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rjes su spyod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras su red par gyur cig / sems can thams cad tha dad pa med pa'i sems kyis byung zhing sangs rgyas thams cad la rab tu 'du shes thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku las byung ba gsung las skyes par gyur te nges par sangs rgyas kyi sras su gyur cig / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir go skabs rab tu thob par gyur cig / sems can thams cad yang dag par bral ba'i mthar phyin te sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i chos gtong ba la brtson zhing sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yang dag par 'god pa dang ldan par gyur te/ sems can thams cad rkyen thams cad kyis zad par mi nus shing shin tu rtogs par gzhag pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub kyi shing drung du rnam par mchog thams cad dang ldan pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par sangs rgyas te chos las skyes pa dang / chos las byung ba'i bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma rab tu 'phro bar byed par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma yongs su btang ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rab tu 'thob pa dang / khams gsum pa thams cad la chags pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings can give away their beloved spouses and children, as did the Loving Prince, Adornment Manifesting King, and countless other great enlightening beings. At such a time, the enlightening beings mount the mind of all-knowledge, carry out total giving, and purely cultivate the path of giving of enlightening beings, their minds clear and without regret. They give up what they prize in quest of omniscience, to cause sentient beings to have profound, pure aspirations, accomplish the practice of enlightenment, observe the path of enlightening beings, reflect on the enlightenment of the Buddhas, and abide in the family of Buddhas.
“When great enlightening beings have developed such a giving mind, they determine to seek the body of buddhahood; they observe their own bodies to be bound to everything and unable to be independent. Still, they help all sentient beings with their own bodies, like continents of treasure, giving all, causing the unfulfilled to be fulfilled. Thus do enlightening beings care for sentient beings, wishing to cause their own bodies to be the best of monuments, to cause all to become joyful. They want to create an egalitarian, equanimous attitude in the world. They want to be reservoirs of pure coolness for sentient beings. They want to give all peace and happiness to sentient beings. They want to be great donors to sentient beings. They are capable of such magnificent commitments because their knowledge is free and they know the practices carried out by enlightening beings. Proceeding toward omniscience, they vow to become supremely wise fields of blessings. They care for all sentient beings and always follow and protect them, while being able to accomplish their own salvation. Their light of knowledge and wisdom illumines the whole world. They always conscientiously remember the generosity of enlightening beings and always raptly contemplate the sphere of realization of thusness.
“Great enlightening beings dedicate the roots of virtue collected by giving away spouses and children with unbound, unattached, liberated minds in this way: ‘May all sentient beings, abiding in the enlightenment of Buddhahood, produce phantom bodies pervading the cosmos, turning the wheel of teaching that never turns back; may all sentient beings attain the body of nonattachment and go to all buddha-fields by the power of will; may all sentient beings give up the mind of love and hate and sever the knot of greed and anger; may all sentient beings be children of the Buddhas, following the course of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings steadfastly think of the Buddhas as themselves; may all sentient beings always be children of Buddha, born by transformation from the teaching; may all sentient beings reach the ultimate and accomplish the independent knowledge and wisdom of the enlightened; may all sentient beings realize the enlightenment of buddhahood and be forever free of afflictions; may all sentient beings be able to fully expound the way to enlightenment, always blissfully practicing the giving of the unsurpassed teaching; may all sentient beings attain a rightly concentrated mind, their concentration unbroken by any objects; may all sentient beings sit at the tree of enlightenment, attain supreme true awakening, and teach innumerable good men and women born by transformation from the teaching.’ This is enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving spouses and children, to cause sentient beings to all realize the unattached knowledge of unhindered liberation.

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khyim gyi dngos po la chags par gnas pa'i rnam pa la mos pa med pa/ khyim gyi rnam par rtog pas yongs su rtog pa med pa/ khyim gyi yo byad thams cad yongs su gnyer ba med pa/ khyim gyi chags pa thams cad kyi 'dod par gyur pa med pa/ khyim gyi longs spyod thams cad la ro myong bar lta ba med pa/ khyim gyi longs spyod thams cad khong du chud pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ khyim la mngon par chags pa thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ khyim dang gnas la brten pa thams cad la mngon bar mos pa med par gyur pa/ khyim dang gnas la brten pa thams cad yud tsam gyi 'du shes kyi byin gyis brlabs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la shin tu 'byung ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa; byang chub sems dpa'i gnas thams cad la zhugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ gcig nas gcig tu rjes su 'gyod pa med par gtong ba/ dmigs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi sgo nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par bsngags pa/ 'gyod pa med par gtong ba'i sems dang ldan pa; khyim yongs su bzung ba shin tu gtang ba la mngon par chags pa med pa'i yid dang ldan pa/ phyogs dang yul thams cad la gnas pa med par gnas pa/ khyim dang gnas la chags pas brtson pa med pa/ yongs su bzung ba thams cad sbyin par shin tu btang bas gtong ba/ slong ba thams cad mthong na rab tu dga' ba dang / spyo ba dang / yid dga' ba skye bas slong ba rnams la tshul dang ldan pa'i sems kyis khyim nas khyim gyi yo byad dang rgyan thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i tshe khyim gyi sbyin pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad dkon mchog dam par 'byung ba la mngon par mos shing bu dang bu mo shin tu btang bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad khyim med par rab tu byung zhing khyim las rnam par grol te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod par gyur cig / sems can thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyis 'jungs pa med par gnas shing thams cad yongs su gtong ba la mngon par mos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gsog pa med cing chog shes pa la brtson pas khyim gyi chos dang rab tu bral bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi pho brang dang gnas la yang dag par gnas shing khyim dang gnas la gnas pa med par gyur cig / sems can thams cad kyi bar du gcod pa'i nan tan thams cad 'gags par gyur te sgrib pa'i chos thams cad shin tu spangs par gyur cig / sems can thams cad gos pa med pa'i sems kyi gnas la brten pas ljan ljin med pa'i khyim dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad khyim na gnas pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa mthong ba'i ye shes dang ldan zhing yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas kyi rjes su song ba'i sems kyi ye shes dang ldan zhing khyim gyi gnas rnam par rig pa rab tu mthong bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad khyim gyis sangs rgyas kyi rnam par gcod pa rab tu thob cing sems can thams cad mtha' yas pa sim par byed par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khyim gyi sbyin pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam dang / rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings give houses and furniture to any who ask for them, practicing the principle of generosity, having no attachments to home, leaving behind all thoughts of home life, fed up with family business, having no craving or taste for comforts and conveniences. Their minds are without ties or attachments; they know the household is fragile, and they disdain it, having no craving for it at all, only wanting to leave home and cultivate the practices of enlightening beings, adorning themselves with the enlightening teachings and qualities of buddhahood. They give up all without regret, always praised by the Buddhas, generously giving whatever they have—houses, goods—wherever they are, without attachment in their minds. When they see beggars come they are joyful, and the enlightening beings dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings be liberated from the ties of householding, enter homelessness, and cultivate religious practice in Buddhism; may all sentient beings get rid of the taint of miserliness and gladly give all, their minds never shrinking back; may all sentient beings forever detach from householding, have few desires, be content, not storing anything; may all sentient beings leave the home of conventional society and live in the home of the enlightened; may all sentient beings be free from clinging to home and family, and though they live at home have no attachment in their minds; may all sentient beings be skillful teachers and guides, expounding enlightened wisdom without leaving lay life; may all sentient beings, while physically living at home, mentally always live in accord with Buddha-knowledge; may all sentient beings, while in the state of lay home life, dwell in the state of buddhahood and cause infinite sentient beings to develop joyful minds.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving houses, to cause sentient beings to accomplish the various practical vows and spiritual powers and knowledge of enlightening beings.

'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bza' shing gi rab dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang / longs spyod mang po sna tshogs kyi gnas yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pa dang / stob pa dang / bdag sems can thams cad kyi bza' shing gi ra bar gyur pa'o/ / zhes yang dag par lta ba dang / bdag chos kyi dga' bar gyur par 'jig rten thams cad la yongs su ston pa dang / bdag sems can thams cad la yid bde ba'i sbyin pa byed par byin gyis rlob pa dang / bdag 'gro ba thams cad du dga' ba mtha' yas pa yang dag par skyed par shin tu ston pa dang / bdag khams gsum thams cad na chos dkar po'i skye ba'i sgor gyur par yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / bdag 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems dga' ba rtag tu skye bar byed par 'jig rten thams cad du gnas par byed pa dang / bdag sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub stob par smon lam 'debs pa dang / bdag skye rgu thams cad kyi pha dang 'dra bar nan tan byed pa dang / bdag khams gsum thams cad na ye shes kyi 'byung gnas su gyur par rab tu rtog pa dang / bdag sems can gyi khams thams cad na yo byad kyis mi brel bar byed par rab tu gzhog pa dang / bdag smon lam thams cad kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ma dang 'dra bar skyed par yang dag par sgrub pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi skyon gyis skyo ba med par yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi gnod pas 'khrul pa med pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'jig rten gyi gnas drin du mi gzo bas yongs su gang bas yongs su yi chad pa med pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad las 'thob par bya ba la re ba med pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'jig rten thams cad la smon pa med pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'jig rten thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i sems kyis 'gro ba thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / bar snang dang mnyam pa'i sems kyis 'gro ba thams cad gos pa med par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtog pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal blang ba'i go cha bgos pa'i sems kyis skye rgu thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o/ / lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad shin tu zlog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa chen po dang smon lam mnyam pa med pa la rab tu brtson pa dang / theg pa chen po'i smon lam gyis skyo ba med par yongs su bsngo ste/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bza' shing gi ra ba yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / de de ltar yid la byed pas rab tu rtog pa'i sems dang ldan par byas shing 'di ltar yang yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad kyis gong nas gong du ye shes kyi bza' shing gi ra ba rab tu thob ste dge ba'i rtsa ba gsar pa dang gsar ba yang dag par 'byung ba dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad la lta zhing bsnyen bkur ba dang rim gro byed pa'i phyir 'khrug pa med pa'i chos can du gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi bza' shing gi ra ba la dga' ba rab tu thob ste/ chos la rab tu dga' bas dga' bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad mngon par dga' ba'i bza' shing gi ra bar sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir dga' ba'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad ye shes kyi yul la rnam par rtse zhing spyod pas sangs rgyas kyi dgyes pa dang / rol ba la rab tu brtson par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang / 'dul bar 'dong bas dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang / longs spyod la rab tu brtson par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pas phyi ma'i mthar thug pa'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems kyis gnas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i rtse ba dang longs spyod dang dga' ba la mos par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bza' shing gi ra ba sems chen po bskyed pas dga' ba la brten cing chos kyi dbyings thams cad sangs rgyas kyis gang bar chud par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su sangs rgyas mchod pa dang rim gro bya ba la dga' zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro ba la brtson par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rab tu brgyan par bya ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir dga' zhing mos pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bza' shing gi ra ba rtse ba dang / dga' ba dang / longs spyod kyi gnas yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bza' shing gi ra ba la rol ba'i gnas su 'dong zhing sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba 'grub par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings give all kinds of gardens, groves, terraces, and pleasant parks, with this thought: ‘I should make a fine grove for all sentient beings; I should show all sentient beings the pleasure of the teaching; I should give all sentient beings joy; I should show all sentient beings boundless enjoyment; I should open the gate of the teaching of purity for all sentient beings; I should cause all sentient beings’ minds to swell with joy; I should cause all beings to attain complete enlightenment; I should cause all beings to fulfill the great vow; I should be like a benevolent father to all sentient beings; I should cause all sentient beings to observe with knowledge and wisdom; I should give all beings the necessities of life; I should be like a loving mother to all sentient beings, nurturing all roots of goodness and great aspirations.’
“When great enlightening beings cultivate roots of goodness like this, they do not detest evil sentient beings and do not make the mistake of thinking to reject them; even if all the beings in the world are ingrates, they never have any hatred or resentment, and never give a thought to revenge—they only want to annihilate their innumerable sufferings and afflictions. In all worlds their minds are like space, unaffected and unattached; everywhere they observe the true character of all things. They take the great vow to extinguish the suffering of sentient beings, never wearying of or abandoning the determination of the Great Vehicle. Annihilating all views, they cultivate the impartial practice and vows of enlightening beings.
“Great enlightening beings, having contemplated in this way, unify all their roots of goodness and dedicate them all in this way: ‘May all sentient beings richly produce innumerable good qualities moment to moment, and develop minds like supreme gardens and groves; may all sentient beings attain imperturbability, see all Buddhas, and make them happy; may all sentient beings enjoy the garden of truth and attain to sublime enjoyment of the gardens of the buddha-lands; may all sentient beings attain pure minds and always see the garden of psychic powers of the enlightened ones; may all sentient beings attain the playful enjoyment of buddhahood, always sporting in the realm of wisdom; may all sentient beings attain the pleasure of carefree roaming, traveling to the assemblies at enlightenment sites in buddha-fields everywhere; may all sentient beings accomplish the liberated roaming of enlightening beings and carry out the practices of enlightening beings throughout the future without ever tiring of it; may all sentient beings see all Buddhas filling the cosmos, develop vastly broad minds, and abide in the groves of buddhahood; may all sentient beings be able to go to all buddha-fields and give offerings to the buddhas in each and every field; may all sentient beings attain hearts of good desires, purifying and adorning all buddha-fields.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when giving away all gardens, groves, and terraces.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mchod sbyin bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa du ma rung ba/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsngags pa/ sems can thams cad la mi 'tshe bar gzhol ba/ 'gro ba thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba la brtson pa; gtan pa med pa'i las kyi lam gsum shin tu dag pa/ ye shes kyis grub pa'i mchod sbyin yo byad grangs med par gsog pa/ dmigs pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pas rnam par dag pa/ sbyin pa rnam pa tha dad pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par bzung ba/ yo byad kyi rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa/ sbyin pa'i tshogs sna tshogs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa can gyi mchod sbyin du byed pa'i tshe mchod sbyin byas pa'i sbyin pa chen pos yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag byang chub kyi sems dkon pa sbyin pa'i tshogs tshad med pas sems can thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa/ dge ba brtsams pa/ thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar rnam par dag pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ mos pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bsam pa can/ sems can grangs med pa mngon par mgu bar byed pa/ byams pa tshad med pa sgom pa dang / yang dag par spyod pas nye bar gnas pa/ 'gro ba thams cad snying rje chen pos yongs su bskyabs pa shin tu grub pa/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par mnyes par byed pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs kyi phyir rjes su 'gyod pa med pas gtong ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ phyis mya ngan du bya ba med par yang dag par spyod pas khyad par rnam par 'phel bar byed pa/ dad pa'i dbang po sems skad cig gis tshad med par rnam bar 'phel bar byed pas gtong ba dang ldan pa de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ theg pa chen po'i sems bskyed pas grub pa'i mchod sbyin byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad gtong ba chen po dang / shin tu gtong ba dang / rab tu gtong ba dang / mchog tu gtong ba dang / gya nom par gtong ba dang / phul du gtong ba dang / bla na med par gtong ba dang / mnyam pa med par gtong ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad las 'phags pa'i gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsngags pa'i chos gtong ba dang ldan zhing sbyin bdag gi dam pa sems can gyi khams thams cad ngan song nas 'don pa/ ye shes kyi lam la rab tu gzhog pa'i smon lam mnyam pa med pa dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba nor ba med pa dang ldan pa/ bdag mnyam pa med pa'i ye shes rjes su sangs rgyas pa dang ldan zhing sems can thams cad zhi ba'i ye shes la rab tu gzhog pa/ mngon par shes pa'i ye shes nyams pa med par 'gro ba thams cad la shin tu mkhas par byas pa/ ye shes kyi sa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos la gzhol ba/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad phyir mi ldog pas rgyun chad pa med par gyur te mchod sbyin shin tu byas par gyur cig / sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun la rim gro byed cing bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug par rgyun chad pa med pas phyir mi ldog pa'i mchod sbyin byed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad tshad med mtha' yas pa'i bsod nams bsags pa'i pha rol tu phyin cing dge ba'i rtsa ba legs par bskyed pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bsod nams kyi dkyil 'khor gyis chos kyi dbyings tshad med par bla na med par snang ba'i bde ba yongs su gtong zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsngags par 'gro ba thams cad kyi sbyin bdag tu gyur cig / sems can thams cad sems can gyi khams su snyoms par dge ba'i rtsa bas yang dag par 'dzin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob cing mnyam pa'i sems kyis mchod sbyin byed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad theg pa'i mchog la 'gro ba thams cad rab tu 'god bar brtson zhing mchod sbyin gyi dam pa byed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad dus ma yin pa thams cad las 'das shing dus ma yin pa thams cad la bab pa'i mchod sbyin gyi mthar phyin par 'gro ba thams cad mtshan nyid gcig tu gyur pa'i mchod sbyin byed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad skyes bu dam pa'i mchod sbyin phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan zhing mchod sbyin legs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyis nye bar bstan te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar phyin pa la bkod de mchod sbyin gyi rgyan mtha' las rgyal ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mchod sbyin byed par gyur cig / sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings tshad med par bsod nams kyi mchod sbyin byed pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'i bsod nams bsags pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par sgrub cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam par dag pa dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad smon lam chen pos sems can gyi khams thams cad sgrol zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas su gzhog pas 'gro ba kun gyi mchod sbyin gyi bdag por gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mchod sbyin byas pa'i bsod nams chen po sbyin pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang sems can kyi khams thams cad kyis mchod sbyin legs par byas par 'gyur ba dang / mchod sbyin chud mi za bar 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mngon par mnyes pa'i mchod sbyin dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad la zhe sdang med pa'i mig gi mchod sbyin du 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i mchod sbyin du 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis grub pa'i mchod sbyin byas par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba dang mi 'bral ba'i mchod sbyin du 'gyur ba dang / cho ga dang shin tu ldan pa'i mchod sbyin du 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad kyis yongs su grub pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi mchod sbyin du 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i mchod sbyin byed cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod sbyin gyi mthar thug par 'gyur bar yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings perform countless great charitable works, all pure, approved by the Buddhas, never injuring a single sentient being, causing all sentient beings to avoid all evils, to purify their action, speech, and thought, and to achieve wisdom. They clear countless spheres of purity and pile up therein countless fine things to support life; activating the most rarely attained spirit of enlightenment, they practice unlimited giving, causing sentient beings to abide in the path of purity, good in the beginning, the middle, and the end, and to engender pure faith. They gladden countless sentient beings according to their hearts’ desires; with great benevolence and compassion they bring all to safety. They serve and provide for the Buddhas of the past, present, and future. Because they want to develop the seed of Buddhahood, they practice giving without regret in their hearts, increasing the development of the faculty of faith, fulfilling superlative conduct, moment to moment progressing to transcendence.
“At such times the enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings develop the mind of the Great Vehicle and be able to accomplish the giving of the Great Vehicle; may all sentient beings be able to carry out giving to the masses, total giving, good giving, supreme giving, unexcelled giving, most unsurpassable giving, incomparable giving, giving transcending all worlds, giving praised by all the Buddhas; may all sentient beings become the best of donors, rescuing sentient beings from the various conditions of misery and enabling them to enter the path of unobstructed knowledge, cultivating impartial vows, roots of goodness in accord with truth, attaining nondiscrimination, realizing inherent knowledge; may all sentient beings abide securely in the dispassionate, serene knowledge of meditation concentrations, enter the undying path, consummate knowledge of all spiritual powers, persevere bravely to fulfill the enlightened qualities adorning all the stages and reach the other shore, never turning back; may all sentient beings set up great charities without ever wearying, providing for and helping sentient beings unceasingly, consummating the unexcelled knowledge of all means of liberation; may all sentient beings always diligently plant all roots of goodness, and reach the other shore of myriad virtues; may all sentient beings always be praised by the Buddhas and be great donors in the world, replete with virtues, filling the cosmos, illumining the ten directions, giving unexcelled happiness; may all sentient beings establish great charities, widely gathering roots of goodness, equally including all sentient beings, and arrive at the other shore; may all sentient beings accomplish supreme giving, causing sentient beings everywhere to abide in the foremost vehicle; may all sentient beings give at appropriate times, forever avoid improper timing, and consummate great giving; may all sentient beings accomplish good giving and reach the other shore of great giving of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings ultimately always carry on magnificent giving, considering all Buddhas their teachers, able to approach them all and make great offerings; may all sentient beings abide in pure giving, gathering infinite virtues, equal to the cosmos, and reach the other shore; may all sentient beings be great donors in all worlds, vowing to liberate all creatures and live in the realm of the enlightened.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness when establishing great charities, to cause sentient beings to practice supreme giving, giving to consummate buddhahood, giving to perfect goodness, incorruptible giving, giving of offerings to Buddhas, giving without resentment, giving to save sentient beings, giving to attain omniscience, giving to always see the Buddhas, giving with great perseverence, great giving to perfect the virtues of all enlightening beings and the knowledge and wisdom of buddhahood.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yo byad kyi tshogs dang / dngos po la chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa; mngon par ma chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i sems dang / 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad re zhing 'dod pa med pa'i sems dang / skyon med pa'i sems dang / rmongs pa med pa'i sems dang / chos la rtogs pas shin tu btsal ba'i sems dang / sems can thams cad don la gzhag par yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ longs spyod mtha' yas pa rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad la dmigs pa tshad med pa'i rim gro byed pa'i tshul can/ sems can la phan pa rnam pa tha dad pas rnam pa sna tshogs du mar yang dag par spyod pa/ dngos po'i rnam pa tshad med pa brjod du med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba'i rkyen mtshan nyid sna tshogs can thams cad sbyin pa'i tshogs la rab tu brtson pa/ gtang bar bya ba mtha' yas pa stob pas gtong ba thams cad yang dag par gtong ba la gzhol ba/ phyi nang gi yul zad mi shes pa'i dmigs pa thams cad shin tu ston pas de dag gtong ba dang / yongs su gtong ba dang / stob pa dang / spyin par byed pa dang / 'bul ba dang / bsam pa'i stobs rnam par 'phel bar byed pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad du yon tan chen po thob pas sems rin po che dang 'grogs pa dang / lan la re ba med par 'gro ba thams cad snying rjes rjes su skyong ba dang / 'gro ba rin po che thams cad kyi bsam pa rin po che shin tu sgrub pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang gcig tu bgrang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa bas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i tshe yo byad thams cad kyi sbyin pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can gyi khams thams cad ma lus par yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dul ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / zhing thams cad ma lus par gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med cing rgyan rnam par dag pas rnam par dbye ba dang / rab tu brgyan pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings thams cad ma lus par sems gcig gis rgyas par dgang ba dang / rnam bar dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / nam mkha'i khams thams cad ma lus pa'i mthar thug par yongs su rgyas par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dus mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad ma lus pa la 'jug cing thams cad mkhyen pas 'dul bas dus thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ye shes kyi byin gyis brlabs thams cad ma lus pa la mkhas pa yang dag par bstan pas 'gro ba thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thams cad ma lus par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya bas phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par bstan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pas sems can kun gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos shes par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / bskal pa'i grangs thams cad ma lus pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas rgyas par dgang ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi grangs dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyu dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang / che ba dang / chung ba dang / phra ba dang / yangs pa dang / snrel zhir rgyu ba dang / spyi'u tshugs su bstan pa dang / rgyan gcig pa dang / rgyan tha dad pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs su bgrang zhing bstan pa thams cad ma lus par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas yongs su rgyas par dgang ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad ma lus pa la dus gsum du brtson pas sems skad cig re re zhing thams cad mkhyen par gdul ba dang / rab tu dgod par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can gyi khams grangs med pa thams cad gzung bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi lam rgyun mi gcad pa la zhugs pa/ snying rje chen po'i 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob cing / byams pa chen po tshad med pa la gnas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi rjes su slob par zhugs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag thams cad kyi tshul la gnas pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyun mi 'chad par skyed pa/ dus thams cad du slong ba la skyo ba med par rim gro byed pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ gtang ba thams cad btang bas 'gyod pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sbyin pa brtsams pa thams cad mkhyen par yongs su bsngo ba la brtson pa des slong ba de dang de dag 'ongs shing yo byad kyi dngos po mtha' yas pa slong ba dang / slong ba thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dus gzhan dang gzhan du slong ba 'ongs pa dang / slong pa de dang / de dag yul de dang der 'ongs shing / dus gzhan dang gzhan du phyin pa dmigs pa'i dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa slong ba dang / slong ba'i sems can sna tshogs bsam pa mthun pas gdong du blta ba dang / sems can slong ba grangs med par 'dus shing byang chub sems dpas skabs phye ba la gnas pa dang / sbyin pa 'thob pa la sdod pa'i slong ba sna tshogs dang / len pa sna tshogs dang / sems can sna tshogs dang / gang zag gzhan dang / gzhan sems sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ phyogs gzhan dang gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i mi rnam pa tha dad pa gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa/ skye gnas tha dad pas zin pa/ sbyin pa'i gnas gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa de lta bu'i slong ba'i tshogs chen po srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa kun nas 'dus pa mthong na/ slong ba de dag thams cad la sems dga' ba dang / sems dad pa dang / slong ba la byams pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba'i 'du shes kyis snying rje chen pos rim gro byed pa'i sems dang / yid rab tu spro ba dang / sems shin tu tshim pa rab tu thob ste phyir ldog pa med pa'i dad pas gtong ba rgyun mi chad par bya ba'i sems dang / skyo ba med cing khyad par du 'phel bar gtong ba'i sems kyis slong ba ji ltar 'ongs pa dang / dngos po ci slong ba de dag yongs su tshim pa dang / yongs su rgyas pa dang / lag gang ba dang / snod gang ba dang / bsam pa gang ba dang / ci 'dod pa'i dngos po thob pa dang / yid bde ba mtha' yas pas rgyas pa dang / dbul ba bor ba dang / nor dang / yo byad thams cad bstud pas brtan pa dang / dngos po yongs su gtang ba thams cad kyis shin tu bsdud pa dang / ci bslangs pa'i dngos po thams cad thob pas yid bde ste sgra che zhing mtho ba 'byin pa dang / ci bde bar 'dong zhing spyod pa dang / bsam pa ji bzhin du shin tu tshim pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par sbyin pa thob pa dang / chad cing dub pa med pa'i sems dang ldan par byed de/ slong ba de dag mthong ba tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shin tu dga' bar 'gyur gyi/ brgya byin gyi stan la 'dug pas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du gnas pas ni/ ma yin no/ / rab mtshe ma'i dbang phyug la bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med par gnas pas ma yin no/ / dga' ldan du skyes te skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba las rnam par 'das pas ma yin no/ / rab 'phrul dga'i dbang phyug la bskal pa grangs med par bde ba'i rnam pa thob pas ma yin no/ / dbang bsgyur ba'i dbang gis bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab par yid du 'ong ba'i bud med kyi bde ba la gnas pas ma yin no/ / tshangs pa'i stan la gnas pas bskal pa brjod du med par tshangs pa'i bde ba la spyod pas ma yin no/ / mir gyur te 'khor los bsgyur ba'i srid stong gsum gyi mthar thug pa'i bde ba'i rnam pas bskal pa sa mtshams med cing tshad med par dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang / longs spyod thob par gyur pas ni/ ma yin no/ / dge rgyas kyi lha'i bde ba la bskal pa mtshungs pa med par bde ba'i rnam pa zad mi shes pa dang 'grogs pas ma yin no/ / gtsang ma'i gnas na gnas pas bskal pa mu med par bde ba dang 'grogs par gyur pas ma yin te/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba sna tshogs mthong na dga' bar 'gyur ro/ / spro ba skye'o/ / mos pa 'byung ngo/ / rab tu dga' ba 'grub bo/ / dad pa 'phel lo/ / bsam pa 'byung ngo/ / dbang po las su rung bar 'gyur ro/ / dga' ba'i sems yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro/ / mos pa chen pos bskyed pa'i sems kyi shugs rnam par 'phel lo/ / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rtsa ba brtan zhing rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro/ / de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag slong ba de dag dang sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / bde ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / don gyi phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / rnam par dag pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub kyi phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / yid bzang po'i 'byung gnas su 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / theg pa chen po'i bzang pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / brtsams pa bzang po thams cad shes pa dang / 'byor bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas stobs bcu'i ye shes mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de yang sems chags pa med pa dang / grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i lus kyi las kyi phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems chags pa med pa dang / grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i ngag gi las kyi phyir yongs su “Great enlightening beings give all necessities of life unbegrudgingly, without seeking reward, without hoping for worldly prosperity or happiness. They rid the mind of errant thought, and meditate well on the truth, because they want to benefit all sentient beings and clearly perceive the true nature of all things. According to the various different needs of sentient beings, they prepare innumerable things to support life, the embellishments of which are all fine and beautiful. They carry out unbounded giving, total giving, and giving of everything internal and external. When they carry out this giving, they increase their power of determination, gain great virtue, perfect the jewel of mind, and are ever able to safeguard all sentient beings, causing them all to develop the most excellent aspirations, yet with never a thought of seeking reward. Their roots of goodness are equal to those of the Buddhas of past, present, and future, and by them they all fulfill the knowledge of all means of liberation.
“Great enlightening beings dedicate all the roots of goodness in this giving to sentient beings, that all sentient beings may be purified and master themselves; that all sentient beings may extinguish afflictions and purify all buddha-fields; that all sentient beings, with a pure mind, may pervade the cosmos in a single moment of thought; that all sentient beings may fill the cosmos of space with knowledge; that all sentient beings attain universal knowledge, enter everywhere in the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness, and tame sentient beings, at all times turning the irreversible wheel of the pure teaching; that all sentient beings may be endowed with omniscience and be able to manifest the techniques of spiritual powers to benefit sentient beings; that all sentient beings be able to awaken to complete enlightenment and forever ceaselessly expound the true teaching in all regions, causing all beings to get to hear and know of it; that all sentient beings may cultivate the practices of enlightening beings for countless eons and manage to fulfill them all; that all sentient beings may cultivate the practices of enlightening beings in all worlds that may be accounted or spoken of, be they defiled or pure worlds, small or large, gross or subtle, inverted or upright, uniformly or variously adorned, extending throughout them all; that all sentient beings may in every passing moment perform the work of Buddhas of past, present, and future, teaching and transforming sentient beings and turning them toward universal knowledge.
“Great enlightening beings provide sentient beings with everything they need, in order to cause the Buddha-teaching to continue unbroken. With great compassion they save all sentient beings. Abiding stably in great benevolence, they cultivate the practices of enlightening beings. They never violate the teachings of the Buddha; with skill in means, they practice whatever is good, not letting the lineage of Buddhas die out. They give whatever is required, without being troubled; they give all with never a regret, being always earnestly dedicated to the path of universal knowledge.
“At such times, the various forms and species of living creatures from the lands of the ten directions, various fields of blessings, all come and gather around the enlightening beings, making various requests of them: the enlightening beings, seeing them, receive them all, their hearts becoming joyful, like seeing good friends; with great compassion and mercy they want to satisfy their wishes. Their generosity increases unceasingly, and without weariness; they fulfill their requests, satisfying them according to their needs, freeing them from the miseries of destitution. Then the seekers are very happy and spread the voice of praise of the virtue of the enlightening beings, so that their good repute becomes widespread and everyone comes to them. The joy of the enlightening beings upon seeing them has no measure—even if one experienced the pleasures of Indra, king of gods, for a trillion quadrillion eons, experienced the pleasures of the Suyama heaven for countless eons, experienced the pleasures of the Tushita heaven for immeasurable eons, experienced the pleasures of the heaven of good emanations for boundless eons, experienced the pleasures of the heaven of free enjoyment of others’ emanations for incomparable eons, experienced the pleasures of the Brahma kings for uncountable eons, experienced the three thousand royal pleasures of world monarchs for unaccountable eons, experienced the pleasures of the heaven of universal purity for unthinkable eons, and experienced the pleasures of the heaven of pure abodes for unspeakably many eons, none of it could equal the joy and delight of great enlightening beings upon seeing the needy come to them. They are happy and ebullient, their faith grows, their aspiration is pure, their faculties are harmoniously tuned, their resolution is fully developed, and they progress toward complete enlightenment.
“The great enlightening beings dedicate these roots of goodness to the welfare of all sentient beings, to the peace and happiness of all sentient beings, to the true benefit of all sentient beings, to the purification of all sentient beings, to induce all sentient beings to seek enlightenment, to cause all sentient beings to attain equality, to cause all sentient beings to attain intelligent, benevolent minds, to cause all sentient beings to enter the Great Vehicle, to cause all sentient beings to attain wisdom, and to cause all sentient beings to fulfill the practical undertakings of the Universally Good enlightening being, fulfill the vehicle of the ten powers, and actually realize true awakening.
“When great enlightening beings dedicate roots of goodness this way, they are liberated in word, thought, and deed; they have no attachments or bonds, no concept of sentient beings, no concept of a life, no concept of a personality, no concept of a person, no concept of a youth, no concept of one born, no concept of an agent, no concept of a receiver, no concept of existence, no concept of nonexistence, no concept of present life or afterlife, no concept of dying here and being born there, no concept of permanence, no concept of impermanence, no concept of the three realms of existence, no concept of the nonexistence of the three realms; they are not perceiving, nor are they not perceiving. Thus, they are not practicing dedication bound, not practicing dedication liberated from bonds, not practicing dedication by action, not practicing dedication by the results of action, not practicing dedication with discrimination, not practicing dedication indiscriminately, not practicing dedication thinking, not practicing dedication after thought, not practicing dedication with mind, not practicing dedication mindlessly.
“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they do not cling to inside or outside, subject or object, cause or effect, right or wrong, thought or nonthought, from the birth of form, the passing away of form, or to sensation, perception, patterning, or consciousness, or to the birth or passing away of sensation, perception, patterning, or consciousness. If great enlightening beings are able to not be bound by these things, then they are not bound by form or by the birth or passing away of form; they are not bound by sensation, perception, patterning, or consciousness, or by the birth or passing away of sensation, perception, patterning, or consciousness. If they are able to not be bound by these things, then they also are not released from these things. Why? Because there does not exist the slightest thing being born, already born, or to be born—there is nothing that can be apprehended, nothing that can be clung to. All things are inherently like this—they have no intrinsic nature of their own: they are intrinsically incompatible with any characterization, neither one nor two, not many and not infinite, not small or large, not narrow or broad, not deep or shallow, not nullity and not concepts, not so and not not so, not truth and not not truth, not substantial and not insubstantial, not existent and not nonexistent. Enlightening beings thus see things as not things, while in terms of speech they follow convention in defining what are not things as things: they do not cut off the paths of action and do not give up enlightening practices; they seek omniscience without ever turning back. They know that all conditions of action are like dreams, that sounds and voices are like echoes, that sentient beings are like shadows, that all things are like phantoms—yet they do not deny the power of the action of causes and conditions; they know that the function of actions is far-reaching. They understand that all things do nothing, and traverse the path of nondoing without ever giving it up.
“These great enlightening beings abide in universal knowledge, dedicating all, whether positive or negative, to omniscience—they practice dedication in all places without ever retreating. In what senses, by what meanings, is it called dedication? It is called dedication because of having crossed over the world forever and arrived at the other shore. It is called dedication because of crossing over the path of speech and arriving at the other shore. It is called dedication because of leaving behind all sorts of concepts and reaching the other shore. It is called dedication because of having forever ended the idea of corporeality and arrived at the other shore. It is called dedication because of having left dependency behind forever and reached the other shore. It is called dedication because of having ended contrivance forever and reached the other shore. It is called dedication because of having left all states of existence forever and arrived at the other shore. It is called dedication because of having abandoned all grasping forever and arrived at the other shore. It is called dedication because of having left all worldly things forever and arrived at the other shore.
“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, then they are living in accord with the Buddha, in accord with the Truth, in accord with knowledge, in accord with enlightenment, in accord with its meaning, in accord with its sphere, in accord with its practice, in accord with reality, and in accord with purity. When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, then they comprehend all things; then they serve all Buddhas; there is not a single Buddha they do not attend, not a single thing they do not offer; there is not a single thing that can be destroyed, not a single thing that can be turned away from, not a single thing that can be clung to, not a single thing that can be avoided. They do not see anything at all, internal or external, that has any disintegration or violates causality. They are replete with the power of the teaching, and never cease.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba drug pa dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ste/ yongs su bsngo ba des yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni/ sangs rgyas tshad med pas byin gyis brlabs pa yin no/ / snying po thob pa yin no/ / chos nyid thob pa yin no/ / thams cad mkhyen pa la brtson pa yin no/ / don gyi chos dang ldan pa yin no/ / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su song ba yin no/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba dam pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba yin no/ / smon lam chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i rjes su song ba yin no/ / rdo rje ltar mi shigs pa'i snying po'i rjes su song ba yin no/ / chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug la dbang sgyur ba rab tu thob pa dam pa'i rjes su song ba yin no// //

“This is the sixth of the great enlightening beings’ dedications, following up and making permanent all roots of goodness, causing them to endure. When great enlightening beings abide in this dedication, they are always in the care of the Buddhas; they firmly endure, unregressing, and enter the profound essence of things, cultivating universal knowledge. They accord with the meaning of the Teaching, accord with the nature of things, accord with all enduring roots of goodness, accord with all completely fulfilled great vows, and fully embody the truth which accords with perdurance, which cannot be broken by even the adamant. In the midst of all things they attain independence.”
bam po bzhi bcu pa/

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te 'khor thams cad la bltas nas chos kyi dbyings la lta pa dang / don dang / yi ge dang / tshig la 'jug pa dang / sems mtha' dang dbus med par yangs pa yongs su sgom pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad snying rje chen pos rgyas par bya ba dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs kyi sems yang dag par 'brel bar bya ba dang / yon tan thams cad la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus su yang dag par shes par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rab tu dbye ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar bskyed pa thob pa yang dag par mthong ba dang / chos kyi lus kyi rjes su song ba'i gzugs kyi lus yongs su dag pa yang dag par ston pa dag byed cing / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Then the enlightening being Diamond Banner, surveying the ten directions, looking over the assembled masses, and viewing the cosmos, entered into the most profound meaning of verbal expression, cultivated an immeasurably broad mind, covered the whole world with the mind of great compassion, developed the mind of the family of Buddhas of past, future, and present, entered into the virtues of all Buddhas, perfected the body of independent powers of the Buddhas, observed the mental inclinations of sentient beings, and, according to their roots of goodness that could be developed and matured, manifested physical bodies to them based on the body of the essence of things. Imbued with spiritual power from the Buddha, he said in verse,

de dag rgyal po'i rigs dang ldan gyur cing / / 'gro ba kun na rgyal po gang yod pa/ / de dag zil gnon rgyal po 'gro ba'i mchog / phan pa'i don du rgyal po mthu chen 'gyur/ /
de dag dang ba'i yid du rab gyur cing / / 'gro ba kun la dbang sgyur rab thob ste/ / chos dang ldan par chos kyis rgyal srid skyong / / 'gro ba rnams kyi bde ba rab tu skyed/ /
de dag rgyal po'i rigs rgyud rnam dag pas/ / chos dang ldan par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor/ / de dag 'khrug med rgyal srid skyong ba byed/ / phyogs rnams kun nas 'khor lo phyir mi ldog /
de dag yon tan gzugs dang rab tu ldan/ / mkhas pa'i blo dang shes rab ye shes ldan/ / de dag zil gnon mthu la ldog pa med/ / bdud kyi dkrug ma thams cad rab tu 'joms/ /
de dag tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ste/ / bzod pa'i stobs la sdom pa'i sems kyis gnas/ / 'khon 'dzin khro ba rnam dag yid bsal bas; ; rgyal ba rnams kyi chos 'dir rtag tu brtson/ /
de dag zas dang skom dag sbyin byed cing / / bzhon dang phreng ba gos dang spos mang dang / / mal dang byug pa rgyab rten mar me dag / rnam pa mtha' yas ji snyed gtong byed cing / /
phan pa'i sems kyis de dag sbyin byed tshe/ / de la shin tu dad pa'i sems bsgyur cing / / bsam pa dag pas dga' ba yongs bskyed de/ / 'jig rten bla ma dag la sbyin pa byed/ /
de dag dngos po thams cad gtong byed cing / / phyi dang nang dang gang rnams ji snyed ba/ / kun kyang dang ba'i yid kyis rab tu gtong / / yid la zhum par byed pa gang yang med/ /
mgo yang gtong zhing mig kyang rab tu gtong / / lag pa gtong zhing de bzhin rkang pa gtong / / sha dag gtong zhing de bzhin rkang yang gtong / / thams cad lus kyang mi dga' med par gtong / /
de dag dbang phyug shin tu yangs gyur cing / / rigs dang dus ldan 'gro ba mi yi rje/ / kha nas lce yangs shin tu brkyangs byas shing / / slong ba rnams la ma dga' med par gtong / /
de dag dbang phyug shin tu yangs gyur cing / / slong ba rnams la lce sbyin byas nas kyang / / 'di na 'gro ba yod pa ma lus kun/ / rgyal ba'i ljags yangs ji bzhin thob 'gyur bsngo/ /
rab tu spro byas bu yang sbyin par byed/ / mi dga' med byas chung ma sbyin par byed/ / rab tu dga' byas rgyal srid sbyin par byed/ / bdag kyang gzhan gyi bran du sbyin par byed/ /
ci 'dod gtong zhing thams cad gtong ba byed/ / mi skyor gtong zhing dus su gtong bar byed/ / ci 'dra'i dngos po bslangs par gyur pa rnams/ / thams cad bsam pa bzhin du rab tu gtong / /
chos kyi don du bdag kyang gtong bar byed/ / byang chub don du dka' ba rab tu spyod/ / sems can don du thams cad bzod par byed/ / ye shes don du phyir ldog mi 'gyur ro/ /
rgyal ba rnams las chos rnams mnyan byas shing / / mngon par g.yog phyir 'bul bar byed pa'i tshe/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab sems kyis/ / rgyal ba rnams la dga' ba yangs pa skyed/ /
mi yi gtso bo 'dren pa mthong nas kyang / / byams ldan phan pa'i sems kyis rim gro byed/ / dga' bar byed pa'i yid dang ldan gyur cing / / snod du gyur te chos rnams len par byed/ /
ci nas 'jig rten 'di dag bder 'gyur zhing / / ci nas thams cad bskyabs par 'gyur ba dang / / ci nas 'gro ba thams cad 'grol 'gyur bar/ / de dag 'gro ba kun la yongs su bsngo/ /
gzugs mdzes bzhin sdug dag snyan ldan ba dag / me tog gdugs btags spos zhim bskus pa rnams/ / phreng ba lhab lhub rgyan dang ldan pa yi/ / 'khor dang ldan par de dag rab gyur cing / /
mkhas shing shes pa'i g.yog 'khor de dag kyang / / phan par sems pa'i yid kyis gtong ba'i tshe/ / ltos shing re ba'i sems kyang mi 'byung bar/ / sems can phan phyir byang chub rab tu tshol/ /
dge ba de la rjes su sems byed cing / / sna tshogs yangs shing rgya che snrel zhi la/ / 'gro ba kun la brtan pa yongs su bsngo/ / las la gnas su byed pa gang yang med/ /
de dag rgyal srid yangs pa sbyin par byed/ / yul dang mir bcas grong khyer dam pa dang / / rgyal po'i pho brang gnas su gyur pa dang / / khyim dang bza' shing rab sbyin par byed/ /
bskal pa brgyar yang sus kyang ma byin pa'i/ / sbyin pa 'jig rten mi yi gtso la dbul/ / 'jig rten rnams kyi pha rol byin byas shing / / 'gro ba kun la pha rol ston par byed/ /
de dag phyogs bcu'i slong ba mang po dag / rnam pa sna tshogs mthong bar gyur nas kyang / / slong ba thams cad shin tu mgur byas shing / / shin tu dgar 'gyur de bzhin spro bar byed/ /
dus gsum rgyal ba kun gyis cir bsngos pa/ / skyes bu 'dul ba de dag spyod yul la/ / rab tu bslab ste pha rol phyin byas shing / / de dag las de yongs su bsngo bar byed/ /
