chos rnams 'di las kye ma su zhig zhugs/ / gang la zhugs gyur ji ltar zhugs gyur ces/ / de dag chos dngos 'di la rnam lta yang / / sbyin pa'i sems la rnam par thogs pa med/ /
chos rnams gang la chos kyis chags med par/ / ye shes tshul shes de dag yongs su bsngo/ / chos kyi tshul la de dag yongs su bsngo/ / don gyi tshul shes de dag yongs su bsngo/ /
las la nam yang rnam par rtog pa med/ / rnam par smin la'ang gnas par mi byed de/ / byang chub rten par rab tu des shes kyang / / chos nyid dbyings las 'gal bar mi byed do/ /
lus la chags par de dag mi byed de/ / sems la'ang de dag gnas par mi byed do/ / las kyis de dag blo 'jug mi byed do/ / las kyis ye shes rten la'ang 'jug mi byed/ /
'das pa'i chos la rtog par mi byed de/ / ma 'ongs chos la'ang blo ni gtong mi byed/ / da ltar yod la'ang gnas par mi byed de/ / dus gsum kun las rnam par dpen par skyes/ /
de dag gzugs kyi pha rol phyin gyur cing / / tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed yid rnams dang / / 'jig rten kun gyi pha rol phyin gyur te/ / dag pa de dag dma' ba'i yid mi 'gyur/ /
phung po rnams dang khams la yongs btsal cing / / skye mched de bzhin lus kyi rnam pa dang / / sems kyi rnam pa ma lus rnam gzhigs kyang / / byang chub dngos su gang yang mi rnyed do/ /
rtag la nam yang chags par mi byed de/ / chad pa la yang de dag sems mi 'jug / chos nyid yod dang med pa ma yin te/ / gcig nas gcig brgyud las kyang ma lus shes/ /
sems kyi rgyu yis byang chub thob mi byed/ / chos nyid la yang de dag mi gnas te/ / zhing la'ang de dag gnas pa ma yin no/ / dus gsum chos rnams kun kyang yod pa min/ /
de ltar spyod pa chos 'di kun rtog cing / / ji ltar rgyal ba kun gyis brtag mdzad pa/ / de ltar des btsal nam yang rnyed pa med; ; spyod pa rnams la mi shes rmongs pa med/ /
bya ba'i lam dang 'gal bar mi byed cing / / las kyi lam rnams yongs su rjod byed pas/ / sems can lam rnams yongs su spyod byed cing / / rgyur bcas rkyen dang bcas par de la rtog /
ye shes mkhas pas gang rnams rjod mdzad pa'i/ / mkhas pa'i lam la de dag spyod byed cing / / don gyi tshul la rjes su sems byed pas; ; byang chub tshul ni mi yi gtso bos rtogs/ /
chos rnams skye med 'jig pa med pa ste/ / 'gro ba kun du gang yang 'pho ba med/ / chos rnams skye dang shi 'pho med par yang / / rgyal ba'i chos kyi tshul rnams rab tu rtogs/ /
chos rnams gang gi rang bzhin rnam shes pa/ / de ni rang bzhin dngos yod mi rtog ste/ / dngos med rtog med de dag rab tu shes/ / bde gshegs ye shes de dag rnam par mthong / /
'gro ba kun dang chos nyid thams cad dang / / sems can rnam pa zhing gi rnam pa dang / / chos kyi rnam pa dus rnams ma lus pa'i/ / chos rnams mkhas pas gang yang brjod pa med/ /
chos rnams ma lus gzung bar bya ba med/ / ji snyed sems can rgyal bas sangs rgyas pa/ / de yi chos la'ang chos kyi dngos med de/ / de yang dus dang chos su brjod pa yin/ /
chos nyid kun tu 'gro ba ci 'dra ba/ / de bzhin de dag yongs su bsngo ba byed/ / des kyang 'gro ba kun nas bsgyur byas te/ / de la kun tu dpa' bo yongs su bsngo/ /

Enlightening beings appear physically as monarchs In the highest worldly ranks, Their virtues and glory surpassing all, Providing benefit for all living creatures.
Their minds are pure, without attachment; They are masters of the world, respected by all. They promulgate true teaching to educate people, And cause sentient beings everywhere to attain peace.
Manifesting birth among the noble, rising to monarchy, They always carry on the teaching according to the truth. Benevolent by nature, free from cruelty, All in the ten directions look up to them and obey them.
Their knowledge and discernment always clear, Their capacities are fully complete. As rulers and leaders they are followed by all; They crush the armies of demons and annihilate them.
They hold fast to pure morality, without transgression; With firm determination they forbear, unshakably. They vow to forever clear away anger from the mind And always gladly practice the teachings of Buddha.
Food and drink, perfumes and garlands, as well as clothes, Vehicles, chairs, cushions, and lamps— Enlightening beings give these to people to help them, And give innumerable other kinds of things as well.
They practice giving to be of aid, Causing them to open their hearts. In regard to the Supreme as well as others Their minds are pure and full of joy.
Enlightening beings provide for all, Able to give up everything they have, internal and external, Unfailingly causing their minds to be forever pure And never to be narrow or mean.
They may give their heads or eyes Or give their hands or feet, Skin, flesh, bones, marrow, and so on— All they give up unbegrudgingly.
Enlightening beings, on the throne of royalty, Of the most noble of tribes, Open their mouths and put forth their tongues to give living beings, Their hearts joyful, without sorrow or attachment.
The virtues of giving their tongues They dedicate to all sentient beings, Praying that based on this excellent cause All may attain the universal tongue of the enlightened.
They may give their spouses and children, or their royal rank, Or give themselves to be servants; Their minds are pure and always joyful, Thus they have no remorse or regret.
They give whatever is required, Aiding according to the time, unwearied; All they have they can disburse So that all seekers be satisfied.
They give their bodies to hear the teaching And practice austerities seeking enlightenment; And for the sake of the living they give up all, Seeking unexcelled knowledge without turning back.
By the true teaching heard from the Buddhas They give up their bodies to be servants, Because they want to save all living beings; They develop a mind of infinite joy.
They see the World-Honored Guide Can bring widespread weal with kindness; Then they dance with joy And absorb the savor of the profound teaching of enlightenment.
Whatever roots of goodness enlightening beings have They dedicate all to sentient beings; They rescue all without exception, Forever liberating them, so they’re eternally at peace.
Enlightening beings’ retinues Are attractive, talented, eloquent and intelligent, Adorned with all manner of embellishments— Flower garlands, clothes, and perfumes:
These retinues, rare as they are, Enlightening beings are able to give away, Wholeheartedly seeking true enlightenment to liberate beings, Never for a moment giving up this determination.
Enlightening beings thus think clearly And fully carry out various great works, Dedicating all to conscious beings Without developing a grasping mind.
Enlightening beings give up their royal ranks As well as their land and cities, Palaces, bowers, gardens, and groves, Servants and attendants, all ungrudgingly.
Over countless millions of eons They travel everywhere giving, Whereby they teach and lead living beings, Causing them to ascend to the unexcelled shore.
Countless species, each different, Come and gather from all worlds; Seeing them, enlightening beings are joyful And satisfy them according to need.
Like the dedication of the Buddhas of all times Enlightening beings perform similar works; The course of the Human Taming Lords They emulate to reach the other shore.
Enlightening beings examine all things: Who can comprehend these things? What is comprehension, what is comprehended? Thus their giving dwells nowhere.
The adaptive knowledge of enlightening beings’ dedication, The expedient methods of enlightening beings’ dedication, The true meaning of enlightening beings’ dedication: They have no attachment to those things.
Their minds do not conceptualize actions arbitrarily, And they are not obsessed with results of action; They know the nature of enlightenment comes from conditions, And enter the profound realm of reality, without opposition.
They do not have action in their bodies, Nor does it dwell in the mind. By wisdom they realize there’s no essence to action, Yet due to causality action’s not lost.
Their minds do not wrongly grasp things of the past, Nor crave for things of the future, Nor dwell on aught in the present: They know the three times are all void.
Enlightening beings have already reached the other shore of form And of sensation, perception, patternings, and consciousness; They go beyond the flow of birth and death in the world, Their minds humble and always pure.
They clearly analyze the five clusters, eighteen elements, Twelve sense media, and their own bodies, Looking for enlightenment in each: Their essential nature cannot be grasped.
They do not cling to appearances of permanence in things, Nor cling to the appearance of annihilation: The nature of things is neither existent nor nonexistent, While the process of the principle of action ultimately never ends.
They do not dwell on anything at all, Do not see “sentient beings” or “enlightenment”: Throughout all lands in all times They ultimately find they cannot be found.
If one can see things in this way, One will accord with the understanding of the Buddhas; Though one seek their essence, it cannot be found, Yet enlightening beings’ practices are not in vain.
Enlightening beings understand things exist due to conditions, And they do not deviate from the paths they should travel. They clarify and explain the marks of all actions, Wanting to purify all sentient beings.
This is the path traversed by the wise, Taught by all the enlightened ones; Following it reflectively, entering the true meaning, One will naturally awaken and become enlightened.
Phenomena have no birth or extinction, And they have no coming or going; Not dying here and reborn there— Such people understand the Buddha teachings.
Comprehending the true nature of things, Yet not conceptualizing the nature of things, Knowing things have no essence and no discrimination— Such people can enter the Buddha’s knowledge.
The nature of things is in all places, All sentient beings and all lands, In all times, past, present, and future, Yet has no apprehensible form.
That which the Buddhas all realize Is all-inclusive, omitting naught. Though they explain all things in all times, All these things are not existent.
As the nature of things pervades everywhere, So does the dedication of enlightening beings: Thus dedicated to sentient beings, They never retreat from the world.
dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ste/ yongs su bsngo ba drug pa'o/ /

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba 'gro ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba bdun pa gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad gtong ba'i dmigs pa la brtson pa/ tshul khrims rnam par dag ba la rab tu brten pa/ lhag pa'i bsam pas byang chub sems dpa' yi dam phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa/ thams cad gtong ba'i bzod pa dang ldan zhing / rna la gzon pa'i dang tshul can; bsam gtan 'byams klas pa rnam pa tha dad pa la mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa/ shes rab kyi tshul dang sa rnam par dpyod pa la mkhas pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems kyis rnam par phye ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa/ yon tan mtha' yas pa yang dag par bsdu ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i las la rab tu brtson par yid la byed pa dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi phyogs mngon par skyob pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba yangs pa nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med par nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs mang po rdul tsam yan chad nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhal du med pa nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba grangs med pa nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba mu med pa nye bar gsog kyang rung / sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog kyang rung / chos la dmigs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog kyang rung / tshul de bzhin du dge 'dun la dmigs pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad la dmigs pa dang / thabs mkhas pa la dmigs pa dang / legs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems sgom pa la dmigs pa dang / nang la dmigs pa dang / phyi rol la dmigs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa tha dad pa mtha' yas pa'i tshogs la dmigs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog kyang rung / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la yongs su spyod pa dang / nye bar gnas pa dang / 'jug pa dang / yang dag par sgrub pa dang / nye bar gsog pa dang / tshogs su bya ba dang / mos par bya ba dang / rnam par sbyong ba dang / rnam par ston pa dang / rgya cher byed ba'i tshe bzod pa rab tu thob pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sems can dmyal ba'i sgo shin tu bcad pa/ dbang po rgyu ba shin tu bsdams pa/ bya ba'i tshul la rab tu zhugs pa/ phyin ci log med par 'gro ba/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snod du gyur pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi zhing du byung ba/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis shin tu gsos pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad las byung ba/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam gyi rjes su song ba/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su sbyang ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'phrin las kyi rjes su 'brang ba/ rang gi sems kyi go skabs rnyed pa/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba/ sangs rgyas kyi 'khor thams cad du yang dag par 'byung ba/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi phyag gi stobs kyis phyung ba/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyis yang dag par 'phags pa/ mtho ris la chags pa med pa; skyid pa la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa/ mngon par 'du byed pa la chags pa med pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dngos po thams cad yongs su bsngo bar byed pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi gter du gyur pa/ thams cad dang ldan pa'i nan tan la rab tu zhugs pa/ 'gro ba thams cad dgag pa'i gdugs su gyur pa/ 'gro ba thams cad rab tu rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par 'don pa/ sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba brtan par byed pa/ yul thams cad du yongs su bsngo ba/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub kyi sgo rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa/ ye shes kyi rgyal mtshan yang dag par gzugs par byed pa/ lam chen po rnam par sbyong ba la brtson pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyis blta na don yod pa la zhugs pa/ 'jig rten thams cad kyi dri ma sbyong ba/ rab tu sbyin pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su rigs dang ldan par byung ba/ sangs rgyas rigs rnam par dag par rab tu skyes pa/ yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor chen pos sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa/ 'jig rten thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa/ sems can thams cad rnam par dag pa la yang dag par gzhog pa/ dge ba yongs su bsdu ba la yang dag par brtson pa/ byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rdul med pas yongs su bzung ba de/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag spyod pa'i tshe sems 'di ltar bskyed de/ dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub tu sems bskyed pas yang dag par bzung ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pas bsam pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pas bstan pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i bsam pa las byung ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pas phan pa la zhugs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad ma lus pa la snying brtse bar byed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyod yul du yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / stobs bcu la dmigs par brtson pa dang / stobs bcu'i dbyings su yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbyings su mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de ltar yang dag par bsgrubs pa de dag las rnam par smin pa gang byung ba de/ phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyod pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la yongs su gtang bar bya ba yongs su gtong ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can gyi khams thams cad las sems can gcig kyang ma chud pa med par byas te/ sems can gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du sems can thams cad ma lus pa la yang yongs su bsngo bar byed de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rin po ches yongs su rgyas pa dang / rin po che thams cad kyis chal bar gang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa gos kyis rnam par dag cing gos kyis yongs su gang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa spos thams cad kyis yid du 'ong zhing dri zhim pos yongs su rgyas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par mdzes shing lhab lhub kyis yongs su rgyas pa yongs su rgyas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa me che mtha' yas pas khyad par du 'phags shing nor bu rin po ches yongs su rgyas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa me tog sna tshogs kyi kha dog du ma dang ldan par gyur cing me tog thams cad kyis yongs su rgyas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa kha zas zhim po sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang ldan zhing kha zas zhim po yongs su phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa gser dang dngul dang nor gyi dbyig gis dag cing nor gyi dbyig gis yongs su rgyas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rin po che'i ba dan sna tshogs kyis brgyan cing lha rdzas kyi gos thams cad kyis kun nas yog ste grangs pas yongs su rgyas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rin po che sna tshogs kyi cod pan gyis rnam pa sna tshogs su yongs su brgyan cing rin po che'i cod pan gyis yongs su rgyas pa dag slong ba re re la phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par sbyin pas ngoms par ma gyur cig / rgyun gcod par ma gyur cig / slong ba gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du slong ba thams cad ma lus pa la yongs su gtong zhing / slong ba re re la'ang phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal ba'i mur thug par shin tu tshim par byed kyang yongs su skyo bar ma gyur cig / phyir ldog par ma gyur cig / de yang 'di ltar sgyu med pa'i sems dang / 'dod cing sred pa med pa'i sems dang / grags pa 'dod pa med pa'i sems dang / 'gyod pa med pa'i sems dang / mya ngan med pa'i sems dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam la the tshom med pa'i sems dang / gtang ba shin tu gtong ba'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i sems dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rab tu dgod pa'i sems kyis yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa'i mthar gtong ba dang / 'dod pa'i sbyin pa gtang ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“What is great enlightening beings’ dedication equally adapting and according to all sentient beings? The enlightening beings accord with whatever roots of goodness they have accumulated—small roots of goodness, great roots of goodness, extensive roots of goodness, manifold roots of goodness, measureless roots of goodness, various roots of goodness, roots of goodness as numerous as atoms, incalculable roots of goodness, boundless roots of goodness, inconceivable roots of goodness, immeasurable roots of goodness, roots of goodness of the sphere of buddhahood, roots of goodness of the sphere of the teaching, roots of goodness of the sphere of the religious community, roots of goodness of the sphere of teachers, roots of goodness of the spheres of all sentient beings, roots of goodness of the sphere of skill in means, roots of goodness of the sphere of cultivation of good states of mind, internal roots of goodness, external roots of goodness, roots of goodness of the sphere of boundless aids to the fostering of enlightenment, roots of goodness of diligently cultivating universal relinquishment, roots of goodness of establishing supreme determination and ultimately keeping pure precepts, roots of goodness of equanimously enduring all, roots of goodness of constant, unregressing perseverence, roots of goodness of entering innumerable concentrations by great skill in means, roots of goodness of skillful analysis by knowledge and wisdom, roots of goodness of knowing the differences in mental patterns of all sentient beings, roots of goodness of universally protecting and nurturing all worlds.
“Great enlightening beings cultivate and live by these roots of goodness, entering into them, absorbing them, accumulating them, fully developing them; their awareness and understanding clear, they demonstrate and put them into action. Then they attain forbearance, close the doors of the courses of misery, skillfully embody roots of goodness, bear themselves with complete dignity, get rid of delusion, and fulfill correct action. They are capable of being vessels of the Buddha teaching, and can be fertile fields of blessings and virtue for sentient beings. In the care of the Buddhas, they develop the roots of goodness of buddhahood, live by the vows of Buddhas, and carry out the works of the Buddhas. Their minds attain freedom equal to the Buddhas of past, present, and future; they proceed to the site of Buddhas’ enlightenment, plunge into the power of the Enlightened, and are endowed with the marks of Buddhas. Transcending all worlds, they do not desire birth in a heaven, do not covet wealth and pleasure, and do not cling to activities. Dedicating all roots of goodness, they are mines of virtue for sentient beings. Abiding in the ultimate path, they envelop all. They remove sentient beings from the paths of delusion and cause them to live by all good principles. They reach all realms, uninterrupted and inexhaustible, opening the gates of omniscient enlightenment, setting up the banner of knowledge, clarifying the Great Path, able to show it to all worldlings, causing them to get rid of impurity. Their minds well trained, they are born in the house of the enlightened and purify their buddha-nature. Replete with virtuous qualities, they are great fields of blessings; a refuge for the world, they firmly stabilize sentient beings, purifying them all, diligently cultivating all roots of goodness.
“When great enlightening beings cultivate roots of goodness by the power of pure determination for enlightenment, they think in these terms: ‘These roots of goodness are accumulated by the aspiration for enlightenment, thought of by the aspiration for enlightenment, initiated by the aspiration for enlightenment, willed by the aspiration for enlightenment, caused to grow by the aspiration for enlightenment: they are all due to pity for all sentient beings; they are for the quest for knowledge of all ways of liberation; they are all for the sake of accomplishing the ten powers of the enlightened.’ While they thus reflect, their roots of goodness develop further, never regressing.
“Great enlightening beings also form this thought: ‘May I practice the deeds of enlightening beings forever by these roots of goodness, giving them all to sentient beings, dedicating them all to all sentient beings, including all, excepting none. May they cause countless worlds to be filled with treasures, countless worlds to be filled with raiment, countless worlds to be filled with fine fragrances, countless worlds to be filled with adornments, countless worlds to be filled with infinite jewels, countless worlds to be filled with exquisite flowers, countless worlds to be filled with fine flavorings, countless worlds to be filled with goods, countless worlds to be filled with chairs covered with jeweled screens and spread with fine fabrics, countless worlds to be filled with jeweled crowns variously adorned—even if one person should be forever coming seeking, I would give these things unceasingly; and as for one, so would I do for all sentient beings.’
“When great enlightening beings give in this way, they have no mind of falsehood or artifice, no mind of seeking or expectation, no desire for name and fame, no regret, no irritating afflictions in their minds; they only develop a mind solely intent on the path of universal knowledge, a mind to give away everything, a mind of pity for sentient beings, a mind to teach and perfect, a mind to cause all to abide in the mind of omniscient knowledge. Great enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness in this way, forever carrying out generous giving.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can gyi khams las sems can gcig kyang ma chud pa med par byas shing / sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa glang po can shes yan lag bdun shin tu gnas pa/ gser gyi rgyal mtshan dang / gser gyi rgyan dang / gser gyi dra bas g.yogs pa dang / rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pas yongs su gang ba'i sbyin par byed par gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rta'i rgyal po sprin ces bya ba dang 'dra ba rta'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i rgyan sdug gu sna tshogs dang / yan lag gi rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pas yongs su gang ba'i sbyin pa byed par gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa bud med dang / rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba yid du 'ong ba'i skad dbyangs dang ldan pa dang bcas pas yongs su gang ba'i sbyin pa byed par gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa bu dang bu mos gang ba byang chub kyi sems la gnas shing phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par slong ba re la yang yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rang gi lus kyis yongs su bkang ste byang chub kyi sems kyi stobs shin tu bde ba'i yid kyis yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rang gi mgos yongs su bkang ste bag yod pa'i sems kyis yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rang gi lus las byung ba'i mig gis yongs su bkang ste mig gi sbyin pa byed par gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa sha dang rkang gis yongs su bkang ste sdug bsngal gyis nyams pa med pa'i yid kyi dbang pos yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa bdag dbang ba'i rgyal po'i srid dang skyid pas yongs su bkang ste srid kyi sbyin pa byed par gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa bran dang las byed pa'i mis yongs su bkang ste gtang ba thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / ma 'dres par gtong ba chen po'i sems la gnas pas slong ba re re la yang yongs su gtong bar gyur cig / de bzhin du sems can gyi khams thams cad ma lus par yongs su bzung ste sems can gyi khams thams cad las gcig kyang ma chud pa med par slong ba gcig la ji lta bar slong ba thams cad la'ang de bzhin du sems can re re zhing yang phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par tshim par byed par gyur cig / 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa thams cad du yang snying rje chen po yangs pa yongs su rgyas pa'i sems dang / sems can thams cad la snying brtse bas sems can thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i tshe de'i rgyus bdag gi sems sbyin pa las phyir ldog par ma gyur cig / gtong ba'i sems kyis se gol gtogs pa tsam yang skyo bar ma gyur cig /

“Great enlightening beings also form this thought: ‘For the sake of even one sentient being I would like to cause countless worlds to be filled with prize tame elephants, with gold banners, covered with gold mesh, adorned with all kinds of jewels, to use as gifts; I would cause countless worlds to be filled with prize horses, adorned with all kinds of precious ornaments, to use as gifts; I would cause countless worlds to be filled with female musicians capable of playing all sorts of beautiful music, to use for giving; I would cause countless worlds to be filled with my own body, arousing the will for enlightenment, to use for giving; I would cause countless worlds to be filled with my own head, developing a nonindulgent mind, to use for giving; I would cause countless worlds to be filled with my own eyes to use for giving; I would cause countless worlds to be filled with my body’s blood, flesh, bones and marrow, without feeling any attachment, to use for giving; I would cause countless worlds to be filled with the rank of sovereign to use for giving; I would cause countless worlds to be filled with servants, to use for giving.’ Great enlightening beings give various such things to one sentient being, abiding in a magnanimous, totally generous state of mind; and as to one, so do they give to all sentient beings in the whole realm of sentient beings.
“Great enlightening beings perform the acts of enlightening beings throughout the future in one world, giving such things to one and all, satisfying everyone; and as they do in one world, so also do they do in all worlds in space throughout the cosmos. They cover all with great compassion, unremittingly, extending sympathy and mercy to all, providing them with what they need. They do not let conditions stop their practice of giving, and never grow weary of it, even for a moment.

de yang 'di ltar chags pa med pa'i sems dang / shin tu gtong ba'i sems dang / bdag nyid yangs pa'i sems dang / zab pa'i sems dang / legs par yongs su sdud pa'i sems dang / mngon par ma zhen pa'i sems dang / chos la srog med pa'i sems dang / yid shin tu thul ba'i sems dang / ma 'khrugs pa'i sems dang / g.yeng ba med pa'i sems dang / rin po che'i rigs sna tshogs thob pa'i sems dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa thams cad la re ba med pa'i sems dang / chos thams cad ma lus par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i sems dang / bsngo ba chen po'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems dang / don gyi chos shin tu rtogs pa'i sems dang / ye shes chen po'i sa rab tu thob pa'i sems dang / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dgod pa'i sems dang / chos kyi snang ba chen po yang dag par bskyed pa'i sems dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i sems kyis sbyin par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems kyi skad cig re re la nye bar bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can de dag longs spyod kyis phongs pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de dag gi bsod nams mi zad pa yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de dag gis bde bar gtogs pa'i bde ba thams cad rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i las kyi tshogs kyi phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de dag gis chos thams cad kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de dag theg pa thams cad las phyir mi ldog par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de dag gis sangs rgyas thams cad mthong zhing mchod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de dag sems can gyi khams thams cad du nyams pa med pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de dag sems can thams cad la sems nyams pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de dag sems can thams cad kyi mi khom ba rnam par spong zhing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rab tu dgod par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings give in this way, they give rise to these frames of mind: an unattached mind, an unfettered mind, a liberated mind, a mind of great strength, an extremely profound mind, a well-concentrated mind, a nonclinging mind, a nonsubjective mind, a well-controlled mind, an undistracted mind, a mind without arbitrary conceptions, a mind endowed with all kinds of precious essences, a mind not seeking reward, a mind comprehending all things, a mind abiding in great dedication, a mind skillfully determining meanings, a mind to cause all sentient beings to abide in unexcelled knowledge, a mind producing the great light of truth, a mind entering omniscient knowledge.
“In every moment of thought great enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness they have gathered in this way: ‘May all sentient beings have abundant wealth and lack nothing; may all sentient beings develop inexhaustible stores of great virtues; may all sentient beings fully experience all peace and happiness; may all sentient beings develop and extend the work of great enlightening beings; may all sentient beings fulfill infinite supreme qualities; may all sentient beings gain the vehicle of universal knowledge, which never rolls back; may all sentient beings see all the Buddhas of the ten directions; may all sentient beings be forever rid of the dust and dirt of confusions and delusions of the world; may all sentient beings attain pure, impartial minds; may all sentient beings be free from difficulties and attain omniscience.’

de ltar yongs su bsngo'o ba'i tshe yid bde zhing sems rab tu dga' bas yongs su bsngo ste/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la gtong ba'i sems las su rung ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la gtong ba yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad mngon par mgu bar gtang ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi dbul ba bzlog pa'i phyir gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad nor thams cad kyis bsdu ba'i phyir gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la nor grangs med par gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la gtong ba mtha' yas pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par rgyun chad pa med par gtong ba'i sems la rgyun 'chad pa med par gnas te yongs su bsngo'o; ; sems can thams cad la nor thams cad 'gyod pa med par sbyin pa dang / mdzod thams cad skyo ba med par gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la dngos po thams cad sbyin zhing gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la nor mang po rgya che ba yangs pa gtang ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad rgyan du mas rim gro bya ba'i phyir gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la thogs pa med par gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la tha ba med par gtang ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la stobs chen po shin tu bdo ba rdo rjes gtang ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la nyi ma ltar snyoms pa'i 'od zer gyis gtang ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bsgrub pa'i phyir gtong ba'i sems la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon du gyur pa la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad dang bsam pa tha dad pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they are inspired with joy: it is to cause all sentient beings to gain well-being and peace; to cause all sentient beings to attain impartial minds; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind capable of relinquishment; to cause all sentient beings to live with an all-giving mind; to cause all sentient beings to live with a joyfully giving mind; to cause all beings to live with a mind to give to bring eternal freedom from destitution; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind to give all goods and treasures; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind of universal giving, immeasurable giving, total giving; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind to unending giving; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind giving away all without regret or affliction; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind to give away all things to support life; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind to appropriate giving; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind to inclusive giving; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind of extensive, great giving; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind to give away unlimited adornments as offerings; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind of giving without attachment; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind of equanimous, impartial giving; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind of giving with extremely great adamantine strength; to cause all sentient beings to live with a mind giving like the light of the sun; to cause all sentient beings to live with a giving mind embracing the wisdom of the enlightened; to cause all sentient beings to be fully accompanied by roots of goodness; to cause all sentient beings to always be in the presence of roots of goodness, knowledge, and wisdom; to cause all sentient beings to attain the fullness of incorruptible pure minds; to cause all sentient beings to develop the most pure roots of goodness; to cause all sentient beings to wake up from the stupefaction of afflictions;

sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad bsal zhing dgag pa la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad ye shes dang yon tan mnyam pas rnam par dag par 'gyur bar bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba mi 'phrog pa la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyis mi g.yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tha dad pa med pa la yongs su bsngo bar bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / rnam par 'phrul ba mtha' yas pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnas med pa yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su dran pa rnam par dag pa bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba dam pa mngon par skyes pas rnam par dag par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi bdud kyi las dang / sgrib pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos thams cad bsal zhing dgag pa la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi yon tan gyi spyod pa mtha' yas pa mngon par skyes pa mnyam zhing rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o; ; sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs rlabs po che yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral bar bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par bya ba la brtson pa'i sems dang mi 'bral bar bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyis go skabs rnyed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba skyon med pa dang / chos dkar po thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi shin tu rgya che zhing mtha' yas pa'i sems dang bsam pa rlabs po che mnyam pa nyid kyis rnam par dag pa la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi gtong ba'i sems rnam par dag cing mnyam pa nyid du bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims dang / nan tan mnyam pa nyid kyis rnam par dag par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad brtson 'grus chen po'i phung po brtson 'grus thams cad mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i rgyud 'tshob par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chen po rab tu thob par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad bsam gtan mtha' yas pas rnam par phye ba'i ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyis chos kyi sku shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi mtha' yas pa rnam par dag cing mnyam pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi mngon par shes pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad spyod pa mthun pas yang dag par 'byung zhing chos yang dag par sgrub pa mnyam pa nyid kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas te yongs su bsngo'o/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi lus kyi las mnyam zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dag gi las mnyam zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi yid kyi las mnyam zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i las rnam par smin pa mnyam zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi chos khong du chud pa mnyam zhing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi don khong du chud pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa khong du chud pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam khong du chud pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi yon tan thams cad 'thob pa'i ye shes khong du chung pa rnam par dag pa 'gyur ba dang /

to cause all sentient beings to annihilate all doubt and confusion; to cause all sentient beings to attain the pure virtues of equanimous knowledge; to cause all sentient beings’ virtuous qualities to be fully developed and immune to deterioration or corruption; to cause all sentient beings to have pure, imperturbable concentration; to cause all sentient beings to abide in indestructible omniscience; to cause all sentient beings to fully accomplish the functions of innumerable enlightening beings’ pure spiritual powers; to cause all sentient beings to accumulate roots of goodness free from attachment; to cause all sentient beings to think of all Buddhas of past, present, and future with pure minds; to cause all sentient beings to produce superlative pure roots of goodness; to cause all sentient beings to eliminate all hindrances to enlightenment produced by the action of demons; to cause all sentient beings to be fully endowed with unobstructed, pure, equal virtuous qualities; to cause all sentient beings to open wide the doors of all roots of goodness and be able to fully develop pure virtues; to cause all sentient beings to always recollect the Buddhas with a broad mind, never slacking or giving up; to cause all sentient beings to always approach the Buddhas and diligently attend them; to cause all sentient beings to have immeasurable minds, broad and great minds, most excellent minds, thoroughly pure; to cause all sentient beings to develop minds of pure impartial generosity; to cause all sentient beings to keep the Buddhas’ precepts equally and purely; to cause all sentient beings to attain great transcendent forbearance; to cause all sentient beings to have transcendent energy, never becoming lazy; to cause all sentient beings to abide in immeasurable concentration and be able to awaken all kinds of spiritual knowledge; to cause all sentient beings to attain transcendent wisdom knowing all phenomena have no inherent nature; to cause all sentient beings to fulfill the infinite pure realm of truth; to cause all sentient beings to fully develop the pure roots of goodness of all mystic powers; to cause all sentient beings to abide in the practice of impartiality, build up good qualities, and perfect them all; to cause all sentient beings to be able to comprehensively enter the spheres of all Buddhas; to cause all sentient beings to be universally pure in thought, word, and deed; to cause the results of all sentient beings’ good works to be universally pure; to cause all sentient beings’ understanding of all things to be universally pure; to cause all sentient beings’ realization of true meaning to be universally pure; to cause all sentient beings’ cultivation of excellent practices to be universally pure; to cause all sentient beings to fulfill the great vows of all enlightening beings with universal purity;

sems can thams cad kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa las 'byung bar yongs su bsngo ba mnyam pa nyid kyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi zhing rnam par dag pa thams cad mthong ba dang / 'jug pa dang / nyams su myong ba mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa skyon med par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / bsod nams kyi rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i dbyangs kyi rkyen phun sum tshogs pa'i gsung yan lag brgyad stong phrag brgyad kyis brgyan pa dang / gsung gi tshul mtha' yas pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dbyangs yang dag par sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi stobs bcu'i rgyan chags pa med pa'i sems kyis mnyam par 'grub par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyan mi 'phrog pa thams cad dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i mi 'jigs pas khyu mchog dang / seng+ge'i nga ro mnyam pa nyid sgrog par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med cing phyir mi ldog pa rab tu bskor bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis chos thams cad mngon par sgrub pa la 'jug pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las thams cad rnam par dag pas dus mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis bla na med pa'i ded dpon yongs su grub cing rnam par dag pas mnyam pa nyid du bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis rgyan gcig dang / rgyan mtha' yas pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyan mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis dus thams cad mnyam pas dus gsum gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i yid mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'dod zhing chos bstan pa don du gnyer ba'i skye mched mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa la phan pa'i rim gro rtag tu byed par shes pa'i rjes su 'dod par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis chos thams cad rnam par mthong ba'i ye shes kyis thams cad mthong ba dang ldan pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi g.yo ba'i las kyi lam thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa sgrib pa med pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad dbang po thams cad la 'jug pa'i dbang po'i mngon par shes pa sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba thams cad kyi dbang po shes pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi rnam par dbye ba med pa'i ye shes mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid gcig cing rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mi mthun pa med cing mthun pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rnam par phye ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul chen po can gyi rdzu 'phrul khong du chud pa rab tu 'thob pa'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi yon tan zad mi shes pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i bsod nams gcig tu mnyam pa rab tu thob par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa dang mi 'bral zhing byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yongs su shes par bya ba dang /

to cause all sentient beings to fulfill all roots of goodness based on unity of being and to dedicate them to the production of the vehicle of universal knowledge, perfecting them in every way; to cause all sentient beings to realize all virtues and knowledge with universal purity; to cause all sentient beings to fully develop vision of all Buddhas without attachment; to cause all sentient beings to be endowed with Buddhas’ marks and embellishments, their adornments of virtue fully complete; to cause all sentient beings to fully develop clear speech, thoroughly trustworthy, adorned with a hundred thousand qualities, replete with the unhindered subtle voice of the Buddhas; to cause all sentient beings to attain unobstructed, equanimous minds adorned by the ten powers; to cause all sentient beings to attain the inexhaustible light of truth of all Buddhas, with all powers of elucidation fully developed; to cause all sentient beings to manage the Lion’s Roar of the unexcelled fearless hero among humans; to cause all sentient beings to attain universal knowledge and turn the wheel of teaching which never rolls back; to cause all sentient beings to have full comprehension of all the teachings and to reveal and expound them; to cause all sentient beings to cultivate pure ways appropriate to the times, fully developing them; to cause all sentient beings to equally and purely perfect the unexcelled treasures of teachings of the Guide; to cause all sentient beings to fully perfect individual adornments, innumerable adornments, great adornments, the adornments of all Buddhas; to cause all sentient beings to equally penetrate all objects in all times, reaching them all; to cause all sentient beings to be able to go to all buddha-fields, listen to and absorb the true teachings; to cause all sentient beings’ wisdom and altruism to be honored by the world, equal to the Buddhas’; to cause all sentient beings to know all things comprehensively by means of universal knowledge; to cause all sentient beings to carry out the practice of unshakability and realize the fruit of nonobstruction, consummating these in every way; to cause all sentient beings’ roots of goodness to evolve into spiritual powers, able to know the faculties of all living beings; to cause all sentient beings to attain nondiscriminatory, impartial knowledge, universally pure in regard to unity; to cause all sentient beings not to deviate from truth and to be endowed with all roots of goodness; to cause all sentient beings to clearly comprehend all the autonomous spiritual powers of enlightening beings; to cause all sentient beings to attain the inexhaustible virtues of all Buddhas, completely equal whether in terms of virtue or knowledge; to cause all sentient beings to arouse the determination for enlightenment and to understand perfectly the equality and unity of all things; to cause all sentient beings to comprehend the truth and become the highest fields of blessings for the world;

sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i gnas kyi dam par gyur te dam pa'i chos mthong ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis mthu chen pos sbyin pa rnam par dag cing snying rje chen po mnyam pa nyid rab tu 'thob par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi zil gyis ma non cing bzod par dka' ba'i gzi brjid mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi thub par dka' zhing blta na don yod pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi pham pa med pa'i sems dang / yid dang bsam pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi chos 'byams klas pa thams cad la dogs pa med par zhugs te khong du chud par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'od dang 'od zer gcig rab tu gtong ba mnyam pa nyid la 'jug par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad thogs pa med par byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa mthar phyin par bya ba mnyam pa nyid la nan tan byed par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa gcig pa dang / smon lam mthun pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi brjod pa gcig dang / 'byung ba mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad mthong zhing mgu bar bya ba mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang / sems can thams cad gdul ba rgyun mi 'chad pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi thogs pa med par chos bstan pa dbyangs kyi yan lag thams cad du grag pa mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems dang shes pa thams cad sems dang shes pa gcig tu yongs su bsngo ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /

to cause all sentient beings to develop impartial pure compassion and be fields of great power for all donors; to cause all sentient beings to be foremost in steadfastness, so that nothing can break them down; to cause all sentient beings to be beneficial to all who see them, and to be invincible; to cause all sentient beings to be well able to comprehend all true principles and attain fearlessness; to cause all sentient beings to radiate a single light which illumines all worlds in the ten directions; to cause all sentient beings to cultivate all the enlightening beings’ vigorous practices without shrinking back; to cause all sentient beings to fulfill all practical vows by means of one practical vow; to cause all sentient beings to make all hearers attain understanding by means of one sublime voice; to cause all sentient beings to be able to fully develop the pure mind of all enlightening beings; to cause all sentient beings to get the opportunity to meet good teachers and serve them all; to cause all sentient beings to unremittingly cultivate the practices of enlightening beings and harmonize and pacify living beings; to cause all sentient beings to teach according to potential, with inexhaustible powers of elucidation; to cause all sentient beings to be able to know all minds with one mind, and to impartially dedicate all roots of goodness;

sems can thams cad kyi rnam par bral ba med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsags pa mnyam pa nyid la sems can thams cad rab tu dgod par bya ba dang ldan pa'i ye shes rnam par dag par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i bsod nams kyi lhun mnyam pa nyid rnam par dag par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi rmongs pa med par sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsams shing yongs su bsngo ba shin tu grub par 'gyur ba'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba mnyam pa nyid yongs su 'grub cing yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'byung ba thams cad mi mnyam pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi 'byung ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad 'khor gcig rnam par dag pa 'khor thams cad rnam par dag par byed pa'i ye shes mnyam pa nyid kyis brgyan pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig dang mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba dang ldan par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi lhab lhub thams cad dang / lhab lhub brjod du med pa dang / lhab lhub mtha' yas pa dang / lhab lhub mu med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan par bya ba'i lhab lhub mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis chos thams cad rnam par rtogs shing mkhas pa dang / don dam par rtogs pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba/ rnam pa'i mchog / rnam pa dam pa/ rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis rnam pa tha dad pa med cing rnam pa tha dad pa dang bral ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / bsod nams dang yon tan mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis chos mi mnyam pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mnyam pa dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba gcig tu legs par dbang bskur ba mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad tshur zil gyis gnon cing phar zil gyis mi non pa'i sems can thams cad kyi ye shes dang / lus rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

to cause all sentient beings to always gladly accumulate all sorts of goodness and establish sentient beings in pure knowledge; to cause all sentient beings to attain the pure body of virtue and knowledge of omniscience; to cause all sentient beings to know the roots of goodness of all living beings, to practice dedication perceptively and perfect them all; to cause all sentient beings to attain universal knowledge and realize true enlightenment, complete in every way; to cause all sentient beings to attain full knowledge of spiritual powers, appearing in all places when appearing in one place; to cause all sentient beings to attain knowledge of universal adornment, all communities being adorned and purified when they adorn and purify one community; to cause all sentient beings to see all buddha-lands in one buddha-land; to cause all sentient beings to adorn all buddha-lands throughout with all adornments—unspeakably many adornments, innumerable adornments, infinite adornments; to cause all sentient beings to be able to understand with certainty the most profound meaning of all things; to cause all sentient beings to attain the foremost autonomous spiritual powers of the enlightened ones; to cause all sentient beings to attain autonomous spiritual powers which are not one, not different, and replete with all virtuous qualities; to cause all sentient beings to fulfill all equal roots of goodness and be crowned by the Buddhas; to cause all sentient beings to fully realize the body of pure knowledge, supreme in all realms of existence.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying brtse ba dang ldan pa/ phan par dga' ba/ snying rje chen po can/ sems can thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba la yang dag par zhugs pa/ phrag dog med pa/ ser sna med pa/ rigs dang ldan pa/ rab tu dge ba/ che ba nyid dang ldan pa/ yangs pa la mos pa/ 'khrug pa med pa/ khro ba med pa/ rnyog pa med pa/ rab rib med pa/ khams dang bsam pa shin tu gsal ba'i yid dang ldan pa/ drang po/ / drang ba/ g.yo med pa/ rmongs pa med pa/ mchog tu bya ba/ mi phyed pa/ 'da' ba med par spyod pa/ phyir mi ldog pa/ sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa/ chos dkar po'i stobs kyi shugs dang ldan pa/ mdud pa med pa/ nyams pa med pa/ chos dkar po thams cad yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la yang dag par brtson pa/ las ngan pa thams cad 'gag pa/ dka' thub dang brtul zhugs chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa/ brtul zhugs dang dka' thub kyis sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu sbyong ba/ sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po rang gi lus kyis len pa/ ye shes chen po'i mig gis yang dag par blta ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa/ ye shes kyi 'byung gnas dge ba'i rtsa ba rab tu nyan pa/ sems can thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba/ sems can thams cad yon tan rnam par dag pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba mnyam par yongs su bsngo ba/ sems can thams cad kyi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsdu ba la mkhas pa/ don gyi rjes su song ba'i khams kyi yon tan mngon par shes ba; sems can thams cad dang mnyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par byang ba yongs su bsngo ba/ sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi zhing gi rnam pa la chos dkar po'i sa bon lta bur gyur pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad 'gyod pa med par yongs su bsngo ba dang ldan pa/ sems can gyi khams thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i skal ba yongs su bsngo bas yongs su 'dzin pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi skal ba dang chos kyi char 'bebs pas dbyar gyi dus su gyur pa/ yongs su bsngo ba'i rigs dang ldan pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ ci nas kyang sems can thams cad shin tu bde zhing skyid pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad shin tu bde bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad shin tu grol bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad shin tu shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad chos dkar po la shin tu bkod par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad nyams pa med pa'i mig dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad shin tu dul ba'i yid dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad stobs bcu'i 'dul ba dang ldan par 'gyur bar yongs su bsngo ste; de ltar yongs su bsngo ba yang las kyi gnas su yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / rnam par smin pa'i gnas su ma yin no/ / lus kyi gnas su ma yin no/ / dngos po'i gnas su ma yin no/ / zhing gi gnas su ma yin no/ / phyogs kyi gnas su ma yin no/ / sems can thams cad kyi gnas su yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi gnas las gud du 'phags par yang yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / mngon par zhen pa thams cad las gud du 'phags par yang yongs su mi bsngo ste/ mngon par zhen pa'i chos yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo zhing stob pa/ 'jig rten thams cad nges par byed pa/ / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa/ bsam pa mnyam pas sems las su rung bar byas pa/ shin tu dag pa/ shin tu brtags pa/ shes rab dang ye shes dang ldan pa/ nang mnyam par gzhag pa dang ldan pa/ phyi rol gyi dmigs pa shin tu rtogs pa/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i mthar phyin pa/ sangs rgyas kyi rigs shin tu gsal ba dang ldan pa de yongs su bsngo ba

“Thus do great enlightening beings compassionately aid and comfort all sentient beings, causing them all to be purified, to give up envy and jealousy, to experience the most wonderful bliss, to be endowed with great charisma, to develop great resolute faith, to forever abandon anger and other blinding pollutants, so their hearts are pure, straightforward, and gentle, without deception or deviousness, confusion or folly, so they carry out emancipating practices, consolidating an incorruptible mind of impartiality, never regressing, their power of pure conduct fully developed, without affliction or loss. They practice dedication skillfully, always cultivating right practices, civilizing sentient beings, destroying all bad actions, cultivating the roots of goodness of all austerities. They also induce sentient beings to cultivate themselves, accepting suffering for the sake of all conscious creatures. Observing roots of goodness with the eye of great knowledge, knowing they all have knowledge and wisdom as their essence, they expediently dedicate them to all sentient beings. This is to cause all sentient beings to be able to abide in the realm of all pure virtues; to cause all sentient beings to be able to embody all roots of goodness, to know the natures and meanings of virtues; to cause all sentient beings to purify all roots of goodness; to cause all sentient beings to plant good qualities in fields of blessings, and have no regrets in their hearts; to cause all sentient beings to be able to embrace all living beings and cause everyone to head for universal knowledge; to cause all sentient beings to take in all roots of goodness, all in accord with impartial dedication.
“Also, they dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain ultimate peace; may all sentient beings attain ultimate understanding; may all sentient beings ultimately live in pure ways; may all sentient beings attain unhindered insight; may all sentient beings tune their minds well; may all sentient beings be fully endowed with the ten powers and tame living beings.’
“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they do not become attached to actions, to consequences, to the body, to objects, to lands, to places, to sentient beings, to the nonexistence of sentient beings, to all things, or to the nonexistence of all things. When great enlightening beings make dedication in this way, they distribute these roots of goodness throughout the world, that all sentient beings may fully develop buddha-knowledge, attain pure minds with clear, comprehensive wisdom, their inner minds silent and serene, unmoved by external objects, as they extend and develop the family of Buddhas of past, present, and future.

des de ltar yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe tshur zil gyis gnon la phar zil gyis mi gnon pa yin/ yon tan mi zad pa yin/ 'gro ba thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa la brtson pa yin/ zhing thams cad na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang tshegs chung dus mig lam du snang bar mthong ba yin; 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par snang ba yin te/ tshig rab tu phye ba thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i gzungs kyang rab tu thob cing khong du chud do/ / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par rgyun 'chad pa med pa'i chos bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis sems can thams cad dga' bar bya ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa yongs su sbyang ba'i don du sems kyi skad cig re re la mig yor snang ba'i tshul du skye ba yin/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa sems kyi skad cig re re la yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang bar rnam par dpyod pa'i ye shes kyis ngoms mi shes pa yin/ sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa mnyam pa nyid gang la bdag nyid gnas pa de la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin/ yongs su sgrub pa yin/ yongs su sbyong ba yin/ pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la rab tu brtson par byed cing sems can rnams yongs su sdud pa yin/ las ji ltar rnam par dag pa'i tshul bzhin du'ang yang dag par 'byung ba yin/ thogs pa med pa'i rna ba mngon par sgrub pa'ang rab tu 'thob pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te chos mtha' yas pa bstan cing brjod pa thos nas de dag thams cad 'dzin pa yin te/ chos bstan pa de la ring ba'i 'du shes nye bar mi gzhog go /sems skad cig gis byung ba/ dngos po med pa la rab tu gnas pa/ rten pa med cing mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul la gnas shing / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med par 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po rnam par phye ba thams cad du 'gro bar bya ba la se gol gtogs pa tsam yang dus gang du'ang thogs pa med pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe yang skal pa mnyam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba dang ldan pa yin te/

“When great enlightening beings cultivate and practice such dedications they transcend all, so none can surpass them; all the words of praise in the world would be insufficient to describe them. They cultivate all the practices of enlightening beings and are able to go to all buddha-lands and see all the Buddhas without hindrance. Also they can see the courses of action of the enlightening beings of all worlds. With expert skill in means they analyze the most profound statements and meanings of all the teachings; attaining total mental command, they endlessly expound the wondrous teaching. For the sake of sentient beings, from moment to moment they appear, like reflections, in untold worlds, attending the Buddhas; in every instant they adorn untold worlds, causing all to be completely adorned and purified throughout. They cultivate the knowledge to adorn buddha-lands tirelessly. Moment to moment they cause untold hundreds of thousands of billions of sentient beings to attain purity and complete impartiality. In those buddha-lands they diligently practice all ways of transcendence, save sentient beings, accomplish pure action, and attain unobstructed ears, hearing, absorbing, and retaining the teachings of each Buddha in untold worlds, energetically practicing them without even a thought of giving up. They abide in the spiritual powers of enlightening beings in which there is no acquisition, no dependence, no fabrication, and no attachment; in a single instant, in the time of a fingersnap, they can project themselves to untold buddha-worlds. They have the same insight as all enlightening beings.

yon tan 'di dag dang gzhan dag kyang rnam par dag cing / mtha' dang dbus med pa'i dkyil 'khor byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang mthun pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang / zad mi shes pa'i yon tan dang / legs pa 'thob par 'gyur na/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i tshe 'di lta ste/ zhing thams cad rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lus thams cad rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / dbang po thams cad rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa thams cad rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba thams cad rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi tshul la 'jug pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa yang dag par bstan pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid 'thob pa lta ci smos/

“When great enlightening beings cultivate the practice of enlightening beings in this way, they can fully develop infinite pure virtues, which could never be exhaustively recounted or extolled, and accomplish unexcelled enlightenment, realizing the equality and purity of all buddha-fields, equality and purity of all sentient beings, equality and purity of all bodies, equality and purity of all faculties, equality and purity of all fruits of action, equality and purity of all congregations and sites of enlightenment, equality and purity of all completely fulfilled practices, equality and purity of all knowledge of methods of the teaching, equality and purity of the vows and dedications of all Buddhas, and equality and purity of the realms of spiritual powers of all Buddhas.
bam po bzhi bcu gcig pa/

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su bsngo ba 'dis yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe yon tan gyi rgyud kyi tshul rnam par dag par bya ba dang / yon tan thams cad rab tu brgyan par bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa rab tu 'thob ste/ de de ltar yongs su bsngo ba 'dis yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe sems can rnams zhing dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / zhing rnams sems can dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / zhing rnams sems can gyi las dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / sems can gyi las rnams zhing dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / bsam pa sems dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / sems bsam pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / bsam pa dang sems dmigs pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / dmigs pa bsam pa dang sems dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / las kyi rnam par smin pa rten pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do; ; rten pa las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / las bya ba lam dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / lam las bya ba dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / chos nyid mtshan nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / mtshan nyid chos nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / chos rnams skye ba'i rang bzhin dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / skye ba'i rang bzhin chos rnams dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / zhing gi mnyam pa nyid sems can gyi mnyam pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / sems can gyi mnyam pa nyid zhing gi mnyam pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / sems can gyi mnyam pa nyid chos kyi mnyam pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha' mnyam pa nyid sems can thams cad kyi gnas mnyam pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / sems can thams cad kyi gnas mnyam pa nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha'i mnyam pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / 'das pa ma 'ongs pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / ma 'ongs pa 'das pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa dang ltar byung ba dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / da ltar byung ba ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / dus mnyam pa nyid sangs rgyas mnyam pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / sangs rgyas mnyam pa nyid dus mnyam pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ /

“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they attain the complete adornment of infinite virtues of gladdening teachings of which all qualities are pure. In this dedication, sentient beings are not at variance with all lands, lands are not at variance with all sentient beings; lands and sentient beings are not at variance with actions, actions are not at variance with lands and beings; thought is not at variance with mind, mind is not at variance with thought; thought and mind are not at variance with objects, objects are not at variance with thought and mind; actions are not at variance with consequences, consequences are not at variance with actions; practice is not at variance with the course of practice, the course of practice is not at variance with practice; the nature of things is not at variance with their characteristics, the characteristics of things are not at variance with their nature; the birth of things is not at variance with their nature, the nature of things is not at variance with their birth; the equality of lands is not at variance with the equality of living beings, the equality of living beings is not at variance with the equality of lands; the equality of all living beings is not at variance with the equality of all things; the equality of all things is not at variance with the equality of all living beings; the equality of the realm of dispassion is not at variance with the equality of stability of all living beings, the equality of stability of all living beings is not at variance with the equality of the realm of dispassion; the past is not at variance with the future, the future is not at variance with the past; the past and future are not at variance with the present, the present is not at variance with the past and future; the equality of worlds is not at variance with the equality of Buddhas, the equality of Buddhas is not at variance with the equality of worlds; the actions of enlightening beings are not at variance with universal knowledge, universal knowledge is not at variance with the actions of enlightening beings.

de de ltar yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe las mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin/ rnam par smin pa mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin; lus mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin/ tshul mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin/ smon lam mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin/ sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin; zhing thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin/ spyod pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin/ ye shes thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad mngon par mnyes par byed pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mngon par dga' bar byed pa yin/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin/ smon lam thams cad mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin/ las thams cad rab tu rtogs pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong zhing bsnyen bkur byed pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin/ rnam par dag pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin/ chos thams cad kyi tshul la 'jug pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin/ chos dkar po thams cad yongs su bsngo ba rnam par dag pa'i dkyil 'khor mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin te/

“When great enlightening beings dedicate in this way, they realize the equality of actions, the equality of consequences, the equality of bodies, the equality of expedients, the equality of vows, the equality of all sentient beings, the equality of all lands, the equality of all practices, the equality of all knowledge, the equality of the Buddhas of all times; they get to serve all Buddhas, attend and provide for all enlightening beings, and plant all roots of goodness; they are able to fulfill all great vows, teach and transform all sentient beings, and know all actions comprehensively; they get to serve and provide for all good teachers, and enter all enlightenment sites with pure congregations; they manage to comprehend and master all true teachings, and fully develop all pure qualities.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba 'gro ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ste/ bdun pa'o/ /
yongs su bsngo ba de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni/ 'dod pa thams cad kyi tsher ma dang bral zhing phyir rgol ba rab tu bcom pa yin/ rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pas ltos pa med par shin tu byung ba yin/ yon tan gyi rgyal srid dang dbang rab tu thob pas bsod nams kyis skyob pa'i mthu chen po dang ldan pa yin/ zhing thams cad du 'gro ba la zhugs pas chags pa med par spyod pa yin/ lus thams cad dang ldan pas shin tu rnam par phye ba yin/ spyod pa dang smon lam thams cad kyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas spyod pa chen pos byung ba yin/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rna ba'i shes pa thogs pa med par zhugs pas chos thams cad yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa yin/ shes rab kyi mig shin tu dag pa'i blo rab tu thob pas sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba dang ldan pa yin/ dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa thams cad mthar phyin par bya ba la rgyun mi 'chad ba yin te/ chos 'thob par bya ba thams cad thob pas rlom sems med pa yin no/ /

“This is the great enlightening beings’ seventh dedication, dedication equally adapting to all sentient beings, dedication in accord with all sentient beings. When great enlightening beings accomplish this dedication, then they can crush all demons; pulling out the thorns of craving, they attain the bliss of emancipation. Abiding in nonduality, they have great mystic powers; they rescue sentient beings and protect them, being monarchs of virtue. Their power of psychic travel is unhindered, and they go to all lands. They enter the realm of extinction, yet may assume any form. They accomplish the deeds of enlightening beings, and their minds attain autonomy in all practices and vows. They analyze and comprehend all things. They are able to be born in all buddha-fields. They attain unobstructed ears and can hear all sounds and voices in all lands. They attain the pure eye of wisdom and always see all Buddhas. In all realms they develop roots of goodness, their minds without pride or obsequiousness. They attain nonacquisitiveness in regard to all things. Great enlightening beings dedicate all roots of goodness equally in accord with all sentient beings.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being Diamond Banner, spiritually empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

de dag bsod nams rlabs chen byed pa dang / / rgya che zab mo phra dang rags byed cing / / sna tshogs chung ngu'i rnam pa byed kyang rung / / thams cad mtha' yas rnam par yongs su bsngo/ /
de dag dngos po ji snyed gang yod pa/ / rgya che yangs pa gang dang gang yang rung / / glang po'i shing rta rta yi shing rta dang / / gos dang dbyig dang gser dang dngul dag gis/ /
