chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par mngon par bsgrubs pa la zhugs shing khong du chud pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / rnam pa 'phrul pa dang / ye shes khong du chud pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rgyun mi 'chad pa kun tu bzang po sgyu ma lta bur mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa byang chub kyi sems kyis yang dag par bskyed pa dang / lus la chags pa med par brtson pa'i yang dag par lta ba dang; dge ba'i rtsa ba chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang ma bral ba dang / mngon par chags pa med pa'i chos nyid dang / sems kyi rgyud dmigs pa med pas yang dag par 'jug pa dang; mtshan ma la 'jug pa mtshan ma thams cad la gyen du 'phags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i mtshan ma yongs su sbyangs pa dang / 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rgyan dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par bkod pa khams thams cad shes pa dang ldan pas rab tu shes par gyur cig/ khong du chud par gyur cig/

with unattached, unbound, liberated mind to cultivate the practices of Universal Good in all worlds for the sake of all beings, attaining detailed knowledge of all worlds in the cosmos of space—detailed knowledge of small worlds, detailed knowledge of large worlds, detailed knowledge of polluted worlds, detailed knowledge of pure worlds, detailed knowledge of incomparable worlds, detailed knowledge of various worlds, detailed knowledge of broad worlds, detailed knowledge of narrow worlds, detailed knowledge of worlds with unobstructed adornments, detailed knowledge of Buddhas’ appearance throughout all worlds, detailed knowledge of explanation of truth throughout all worlds, detailed knowledge of bodily manifestation throughout all worlds, detailed knowledge of emanation of great light throughout all worlds, detailed knowledge of manifestation of the Buddhas’ autonomous spiritual powers throughout all worlds, detailed knowledge of entry into the congregations at enlightenment sites of buddha-fields in all worlds, detailed knowledge of demonstration of all tones with one voice throughout all worlds, detailed knowledge of making all buddha-fields in the cosmos into one buddha-field, detailed knowledge of making one buddha-field into all buddha-fields in the cosmos, detailed knowledge of awareness that all worlds are like dreams, detailed knowledge of awareness that all worlds are like reflections, detailed knowledge of awareness that all worlds are like illusions—knowing all this thoroughly, producing the path of all enlightening beings, enter the knowledge and spiritual powers practiced by Universal Good, fulfill the meditation of Universal Good, cultivate enlightening practices unceasingly, attain the free mystic metamorphoses of all Buddhas, acquire unobstructed bodies, abide in nonreliant knowledge, be without grasping or attachment to anything, being nonacquisitive in all mental actions, developing detachment in all situations, thinking of enlightening practice as purification, having no thought of grasping or clinging to universal knowledge, adorning themselves with concentrations, their knowledge in accord with all realms of reality;

dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis chags pa med pa dang / grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sems su chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa la 'jug pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings shin tu bstan pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings yangs pa la 'jug pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par dbye ba shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad rnam par dbye ba shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad sems gcig gis rgyas par dbang ba shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad dmigs su med pa'i spyod yul du shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad chags pa med par brtag pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad skye ba med par yongs su rig pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du byin gyi rlabs kyis rnam par 'phrul pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings 'byams klas pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / 'di dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis ye shes dang / chos la dbang ba sgyur ba rab tu thob pa/ 'gro ba thams cad tshim par byed pa la brtson pa/ don gyi lus yongs su mi gtong zhing lus blta ba la bsgrings pa med pa'i ye shes mnyam pa med pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i rnam pa rab tu thob pa/ chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin las ma g.yos pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nam mkha' ltar gos pa med pa'i tshig gi lam rnam par brjod pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa rnam par bkod pa'i don gyi rang bzhin shin tu rtogs pa/ rang bzhin gyis zhi ba yongs su rig pa'i ye shes kyis mi gnas ba'i yid kyi yang dag par rtogs pa dang ldan pa/ dmigs pa'i tshul la rten pa med par gnas pa/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi tshul yangs pa khong du chud pa/ 'jig rten thams cad du mi gnas pas yang dag par rgyu ba chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa/ gnas thams cad yang dag par bcom pas kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i sgo 'di dag la zhugs pa'i ye shes kyis yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par gyur cig/

with unattached, unbound, liberated mind to enter the door of practices of Universal Good and attain detailed knowledge of innumerable realms of reality, detailed knowledge of explanations of all realms of reality, detailed knowledge of entry into vast realms of reality, detailed knowledge of distinction of inconceivably many realms of reality, detailed knowledge of distinction of all realms of reality, detailed knowledge of one thought pervading all realms of reality, detailed knowledge of entry into all realms of reality, detailed knowledge of awareness that all realms of reality are ungraspable, detailed knowledge of observation of all realms of reality without obstruction, detailed knowledge of awareness that all realms of reality have no birth, detailed knowledge of manifestation of miracles in all realms of reality, with vast knowledge knowing such minute details of all realms of reality as they truly are, mastering the truth, demonstrating the practice of Universal Good, causing all sentient beings to be fully satisfied, not abandoning principle yet not clinging to doctrine, producing impartial, unobstructed knowledge, aware of the basis of nonobstruction, not dwelling on anything at all, not destroying the nature of things as it really is, pure and spacelike, while producing verbal explanation adapted to the world, opening up the true meaning, pointing out the silent, null essence, not relying or dwelling on any object, without vain discrimination, clearly seeing the universal structure of the realm of reality, comprehending that all worlds and all things are equal and nondual, divorcing all attachments;

dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis chags pa med pa dang / grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sems su bskal pa gang ji snyed pa thams cad shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ brjod du med pa'i bskal pa sems kyi skad cig gcig tu byin gyis rlob pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / sems kyi skad cig gcig la brjod du med pa'i bskal pa yang dag par bstan pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / grangs med pa'i bskal pa la yang dag par 'jug pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / bskal pa gcig grangs med pa'i bskal par yang dag par 'jug pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / bskal pa ring po bskal pa thung ngur yang dag par 'jug pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang; bskal pa thung ngu bskal pa ring por yang dag par 'jug pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i bskal pa sangs rgyas mi bzhugs par 'jug pa'i shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / bskal pa thams cad ma lus pa'i grangs shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / bskal pa thams cad ma lus par bskal pa ma yin par shin tu brtags pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i mu la yod pa'i bskal pa dang / dus gsum gyi bskal pa thams cad ma lus par sems kyi skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa shes pa shin tu phra ba dang / bskal pa shes pa shin tu phra ba 'di dag dang / bskal pa ma lus pa'i grangs de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis thugs su chud pa shes pa shin tu phra ba de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po rab tu thob pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad rab tu bsal ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ skyo ba med pa'i smon lam chen pos rtsom pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ mtha' dang dbus med pa'i 'jig rten mang por sangs rgyas mang po yang dag par bstan par yongs su rgyas par 'gengs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rigs yang dag par gzung ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad shin tu bag dro bar byed pa'i spyod pa'i rigs dang / rnam par 'dres pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ bskal pa'i grangs thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang dag par bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams re re nas phyi ma'i mtha'i mur mi g.yo bar spyod pa rgyun mi gcod pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i 'phrin las byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyis yongs su rgyas par 'gengs pa'i sems dang ldan pas/ sems kyi rgyu ba gcig gi gnas kyi sa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par gyur cig/ yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par gyur cig/

with unattached, unbound, liberated mind to cultivate the practices of Universal Good and develop detailed knowledge of all eons—detailed knowledge of making unspeakably many eons one moment, detailed knowledge of making one moment unspeakably many eons, detailed knowledge of fitting incalculable eons into one eon, detailed knowledge of one eon entering incalculable eons, detailed knowledge of long eons entering short eons, detailed knowledge of short eons entering long eons, detailed knowledge of entry into eons with Buddhas and eons without Buddhas, detailed knowledge of the number of all eons, detailed knowledge of how all eons are not eons, detailed knowledge of seeing all eons past, present, and future in a single moment—instantaneously knowing all such minute details of all eons as they truly are by means of enlightened knowledge, attaining to the mind mastering the completely fulfilled practices of enlightening beings, the mind entering the practice of Universal Good, the mind free from all inane speculation and erroneous conceptualization, the mind tirelessly making great vows, the mind perceiving the network of innumerable worlds filled with Buddhas, the mind able to learn and remember the roots of goodness of the Buddhas and the practices of the enlightening beings, the mind which, having heard, never forgets the great practices for comforting all sentient beings, the mind which can manifest the appearance of Buddha in the world in all ages, the mind which unceasingly practices unshakability and imperturbability in all worlds forever and ever, the mind which in all worlds fills the bodies of enlightening beings with the behavior of the enlightened;

dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis chags pa med pa dang / grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sems su chos shin tu phra ba shes pa 'di lta ste/ zab mo'i chos shin tu phra ba dang / yangs pa'i chos shin tu phra ba dang / sna tshogs kyi chos shin tu phra ba dang / rgyan rnam par dbye ba'i chos shin tu phra ba dang / mtha' dang dbus med pa'i bskal pa thams cad du bstan pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos thams cad chos gcig tu yang dag par 'jug pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos gcig chos thams cad du yang dag par 'jug pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos thams cad chos ma yin par 'jug pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos ma yin par shes pa chos rnam par dgod pa thams cad dang mi 'gal ba shin tu phra ba dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshul thams cad ma lus pa'i grangs la 'jug pa shes pa shin tu phra ba 'di dag dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos thams cad kyi grangs rnam par bkod pa dang / bstan pa shes pa shin tu phra ba de dag thams cad chags pa med par shes pa'i sems spyod pa gcig gi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung bas yang dag par bskyed pa dang / mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la zhugs pa'i sems dang / spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi chos rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad khong du chud pa'i bsam pa'i stobs dang / shugs chags pa med pas rab tu rtogs pa dang / dbang po thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu brten pa dang / dran pa dang / shes pa dang / chos la mkhas pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes kyi khongs su chud pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po chos kyi dbyings thams cad yongs su khyab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lus yang dag par bstan pa'i las dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi skur gtogs pa dang / tshig rnam par dgod cing shin tu bstan pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du grag pa dang / yid kyi las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yang dag par bzung ba dang / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i ye shes chos mtha' dang dbus med pa tha dad pa'i grangs dang / tshul thams cad ma lus pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par bsgrubs pas/ yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par gyur cig/ khong du chud par gyur cig / //

with unattached, unbound, liberated mind to cultivate the practice of Universal Good, accomplish nonregression, and attain extremely detailed knowledge of principles and phenomena—detailed knowledge of the principles and phenomena of mysticism, detailed knowledge of far-reaching principles and extensive phenomena, detailed knowledge of various principles and phenomena, detailed knowledge of principles and phenomena of adornment, detailed knowledge of the immeasurability of all principles and phenomena, detailed knowledge of all principles entering one principle, all phenomena entering one phenomena, all principles entering one phenomenon, all phenomena entering one principle, detailed knowledge of one principle entering all principles, one phenomenon entering all phenomena, one principle entering all phenomena, one phenomenon entering all principles, detailed knowledge of all principles and phenomena entering what is not principle or phenomenon, detailed knowledge of defining all principles and phenomena where there are none, without contradiction, detailed knowledge penetrating the techniques of all Buddha-teachings—knowing as they truly are all such things as defined by all speech in all worlds, with extremely detailed and subtle knowledge equal to all of them, that knowledge unobstructed, attaining the mind which enters the boundless realm of reality, abiding steadfastly with a profound mind in each sphere of reality, perfecting unobstructed practice, filling all faculties with universal knowledge, entering the knowledge of buddhahood, properly mindful of expedient means, accomplishing the great qualities of Buddhas, filling the entire cosmos, realizing all the bodies of the enlightened, manifesting all the physical actions of enlightening beings, expounding the teaching in the terms of expression of all worlds, attaining the mental activity of knowledge spiritually empowered by all Buddhas, producing omniscient knowledge skillfully distinguishing all things;
bam po bzhi bcu gsum pa/

dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis chags pa med pa dang / grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sems su zhing thams cad ma lus par mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang / sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa thams cad ma lus par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad ma lus pa'i sems shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang / dus thams cad ma lus par slebs par chos bstan pa shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang / chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad ma lus par rab tu rtogs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang / nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad ma lus pa'i mthar thug pa dang / dus gsum shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang / tshig dang ngag gi lam thams cad ma lus par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad ma lus par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa thams cad ma lus par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba dang; shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa 'di dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lam dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi lam shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra ba de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang ldan zhing kun tu bzang po'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par 'dzin pas chos ji lta ba bzhin dang / yi ge ji lta ba bzhin du mig yor dang 'dra ba'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sgra brnyan dang 'dra ba'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sprul pa dang 'dra ba'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / dben pa dang mnyam pa'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / zhi ba dang mnyam pa'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang mnyam pa'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / gnas med pa dang mnyam pa'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang mnyam pa'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa nye bar blang pa la gnas par brtson pa'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu phra bas rab tu shes par gyur cig/ khong du chud par gyur cig/ ces te/

with unattached, unbound, liberated mind to cultivate the practice of Universal Good and produce detailed knowledge of all kinds—that is, detailed knowledge of all lands and fields, detailed knowledge of all sentient beings, detailed knowledge of the fruits of all practices, detailed knowledge of the minds of all sentient beings, detailed knowledge of the proper timing of all expositions of the teaching, detailed knowledge of all realms of reality, detailed knowledge of all past, present, and future worlds throughout space, detailed knowledge of all manners of verbal expression, detailed knowledge of all worldly activities, detailed knowledge of all transmundane activities, and detailed knowledge of the paths of all Buddhas, the paths of all enlightening beings, and the paths of all sentient beings—cultivating enlightening practices, living by the path of Universal Good, knowing all expressions and meanings truly, bearing knowledge that all are like reflections, like dreams, like illusions, like echoes, like phantoms, like space, bearing knowledge of nullity, bearing knowledge of all realms of reality, bearing independent knowledge, bearing knowledge of all principles of Buddhahood.

de yang 'jig rten nam/ 'jig rten gyi chos la mi rtog pa dang / de yang byang chub bam/ byang chub sems dpa' la mi rtog pa dang / de yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'am/ 'byung ba'i lam la mi rtog pa dang / de yang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mi rtog pa dang / de yang sems can thams cad gdul ba dang / mi gdul ba la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de yang dge ba'i rtsa ba'am/ yongs su bsngo ba la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de yang bdag gam gzhan la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de yang dngos po dang / dmigs pa la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'am/ mngon par 'tshang rgya ba la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de yang chos nyid dam/ yongs su shes par bya ba la rnam par mi rtog pas/

“Enlightening beings dedicate their unattached, unbound, liberated minds, without forming arbitrary notions of worlds or worldly things, of enlightenment or enlightening beings, of the practices of enlightening beings or the paths of emancipation, of Buddhas or Buddha teachings, of taming or not taming sentient beings, of roots of goodness or dedication, of self or others, of gifts or recipients, of practices of enlightening beings or true enlightenment, of truth or knowledge.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sems dang / chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i lus dang / chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sgra dang / chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i las dang / chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i 'jig rten dang / chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i zhing dang / chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sems can dang / chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i chos dang / chags pa med pa dang grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bsngo ste/

“Great enlightening beings dedicate those roots of goodness in this way: that minds be unattached, unbound, liberated; that bodies be unattached, unbound, liberated; that speech be unattached, unbound, liberated; that actions be unattached, unbound, liberated; that rewards be unattached, unbound, liberated; that worlds be free from attachment and bondage and be liberated; that buddha-lands be free from attachment and bondage and be liberated; that sentient beings be free from attachments and bondage and be liberated; that laws be free from attachment and bondage and be liberated; that knowledge be free from attachment and bondage and be liberated.

de de ltar yongs su bsngo bas 'das pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba thob pa yin/ ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba thob pa yin/ da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba thob pa yin/ 'das pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba la slob pa yin/ ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba 'grub par 'gyur ba yin/ da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba la rab tu gnas pa yin/ 'das pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba'i lam la gnas pa yin; ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba'i lam mi gtong ba yin/ da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yongs su bsngo ba'i lam dang 'gal bar mi byed pa yin/ 'das pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gdams ngag la nan tan du byed pa yin/ ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gdams ngag la nan tan byed par 'gyur ba yin; da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gdams ngag khong du chud par byed pa yin/ 'das pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin/ ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid sgrub par 'gyur ba yin/ da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la nan tan byed pa yin/ 'das pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la yongs su spyod pa yin/ ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la rab tu gnas pa yin/ da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul dang mnyam par 'gyur ba yin/ 'das pa dang; ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mtshan nyid gcig pa yin/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa thob ba yin/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul dang tshul gyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pa yin/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can gyi gtso bo thams cad kyi yul dang mi 'gal ba thob pa yin te/

“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they do so as the Buddhas of past, present, and future during their enlightening: they study the dedication of Buddhas of the past, make the dedication of Buddhas of the future, and live by the dedication of Buddhas of the present; they remain on the path of dedication of the Buddhas of the past, do not give up the path of dedication of the Buddhas of the future, and follow the path of dedication of the Buddhas of the present; they diligently practice the teachings of the Buddhas of the past, accomplish the teachings of the Buddhas of the future, and know the teachings of the Buddhas of the present; they fulfill the equanimity of the Buddhas of the past, achieve the equanimity of the Buddhas of the future, and abide in the equanimity of the Buddhas of the present; they traverse the ranges of the Buddhas of the past, abide in the ranges of the Buddhas of the future, and equal the ranges of the Buddhas of the present; they attain the roots of goodness of the Buddhas of past, present, and future, are endowed with the essential nature of all Buddhas of past, present, and future, abide in the sphere of action of all Buddhas of past, present, and future, and accord with the realm of all Buddhas of past, present, and future.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba chags pa med pa dang / grol zhing bcings pa med pa'i sems zhes bya ba ste/ dgu pa'o/ /
yongs su bsngo ba de dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad de ltar yongs su bsngo ste; de de ltar yongs su bsngo bas/ khor yug rdo rje'i ri thams cad kyis mi choms pa'i stobs dang ldan pa yin/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi gzugs thams cad ma lus pa dang ldan zhing zil kyis mi non pa yin/ bdud kyi sde dang / bdud kyi dpung / bdud kyi las thams cad rab tu 'joms pa yin/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ma lus pa yang dag par bstan pa la brtson pa yin/ 'gro ba thams cad la go bar byed pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi tshig dbye ba la mkhas pa dang ldan pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rmongs pa med pa'i ye shes 'byams klas pa dang ldan pa yin/ gang dang gang du shi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gro ba dang; 'ong ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'dug pa thams cad du mi phyed pa'i g.yog 'khor dang ldan pa yin/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa dang / chos kyi 'byung gnas dran pa yang dag par 'dzin pa rnam par dag pa rab tu thob pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su gzung ba la mi skyo bas phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yin/ gnas thams cad yang dag par bcom pa yang rab tu thob pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang smon lam yang dag par bskyed pa yang thob pa yin/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa dang / byin gyi rlabs dang; byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa thob par bya ba yang rab tu thob pa yin no/ /

“This is great enlightening beings’ ninth dedication, dedication with unattached, unbound, liberated mind. When great enlightening beings live by this dedication, they cannot be broken down even by adamantine mountains; their physical characteristics are supreme among all sentient beings; they can destroy all the evildoing of demons; they appear in all worlds in the ten directions, cultivating the practices of enlightening beings; because they want to enlighten all sentient beings, they expound the Buddha-teachings to them in appropriate ways; attaining great knowledge and wisdom, they have no confusion in their minds about the teachings of the Buddhas; wherever they live, whether they go or stay, they always encounter incorruptible company; they are able to absorb and retain the teachings expounded by the Buddhas of all times by means of pure mindfulness; they cultivate the practice of enlightening beings forever and ever, never ceasing, developing and fulfilling the practical vows of Universal Good, attaining universal knowledge, disbursing it as buddha-work, perfecting the autonomous spiritual powers of enlightening beings.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being Diamond Banner, spiritually empowered by Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

de dag zil gyis mi non 'gyur byas shing; ; 'dra med de dag phyogs rnams thams cad du/ / las rnams ci 'drar yongs su bsags byas pa/ / de dag kun la brnyas par yong mi byed/ /
bdag gis byas pa'am gzhan gyis byas pa yi; ; dge ba gang la'ang brnyas par mi byed de/ / de la shin tu mos pa rab bskyed cing / / de dag sems can phan phyir yongs su bsngo/ /
de dag sems la mtho ba med byas shing / / yid la dma' ba'ang 'chang ba med byas te/ / rgyal ba rnams kyi sku yi 'phrin las dang / / gsol ba btab las las yangs gang 'byung dang / /
gang yang rnam pa mang po byed gyur cing; ; sems can kun la bde dang phan sems kyis/ / brtan pa'i mos dang bsam las byung ba dag / skyes bu dbang por ci nas 'gyur bar bsngo/ /
rnam pa sna tshogs ji snyed gang yod tshul/ / 'gro ba 'di na tha dad mi 'dra ba/ / rgya che yangs dang phra mo zab mo'i rnams/ / de dag bdag gis yongs bsags shes par bya/ /
ji snyed 'jig rten yangs pa'i 'gro ba yi/ / sna tshogs lus rnams lus su gzhol gzud pa/ / de dag shes byas spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ / ye shes sgo las phyir ldog ma gyur cig /
gang yang 'jig rten zhing gi sgo mnga' ba/ / phra dang rgya che spyi'u tshug snrel zhi dag / skra yi sbubs su kun kyang bsdu byas te/ / ye shes sgo nas thams cad shes gyur cig /
gang yang sems kyi tshul mang gcig min pa/ / de dag sems su yang dag bsdu byas te/ / ye shes sgo nas de dag shes byas nas/ / spyod lam ldog pa med par spyad par bya/ /
'gro ba kun gyi dbang po bsam pa dag / rgya che de bzhin shin tu phra ba dang / / zab mo sna tshogs ji snyed bsdu byas shing / / thams cad rang bzhin ji bzhin shes gyur cig /
gang yang las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa/ / rab dang 'bring dang de bzhin tha ma'i rnams/ / thams cad ye shes sgo nas shes byas te/ / bde gshegs stobs la rab tu 'jug gyur cig /
bdag gis las gtsang yongs su gang bsags pas/ / 'jig rten bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ / ji snyed de dag skad cig sems btud cing / / phyogs rnams kun tu de dag shes gyur cig /
dus rnams snrel zhir dus gsum gzud byas shing / / bskal pa mi mnyam tha dad mtshan shes nas/ / de dag mnyam nyid de dang 'gal med du/ / spyod cing kun tu rmongs par med gyur cig /
'gro ba'i spyod pa ji snyed gang yang rung / / 'jig rten dag na brkyang bskum mi g.yo ba/ / rnam pa tha dad thams cad shes gyur kyang / / mtshan med dngos kyi rlom sems med gyur cig /
phyogs rnams kun na skyes dbang ji snyed pa/ / su bzhugs de dag rnam par 'phrul mdzad pa; ; tshul gyis dkon zhing shin tu yangs pa rnams/ / de dag thams cad tshul bzhin shes gyur cig /
dga' ldan gnas na rang byung gang bzhugs pa/ / mi yi seng+ge 'dra med chen po dang / / phra dang yangs dang rnam par rgya che dag / rang bzhin bzhin du thams cad mthong gyur cig /
yum gyi phyal na dpe zla med pa rnams/ / rnam par 'phrul pa ji snyed mdzad pa dang / / 'tshang rgya mya ngan 'da' dang 'khor lo'i mchog / 'gro ba kun tu ldog pa med pa dang / /
mi yi seng+ge bltams par gyur pa'i tshe/ / lha yi mchog dang tshangs pa'i mchog rnams dang / / ye shes mchog dang shes la gnas rnams kyis/ / lag pa'i dam pas rim gror blangs pa dang / /
de bzhin chos dbyings ma lus ji snyed pa'i/ / phyogs na gang yod thams cad bsdu byas shing / / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul gzhi mtha' dbus med pa/ /
de dag thams cad mthong zhing shes gyur cig / skyes bu khyu mchog 'jig rten byung gyur cing / / gshegs thabs bdun por gshegs par gyur pa dang / / dpe zla med pas rnam par gzigs pa dag /
thams cad chags med sgo nas shes gyur cig ; gang yang skyes dbang bzhad mo bzhad pa dang / / skye dgu'i 'di dag 'dod byin gzigs gyur cing / / sems can 'di dag rab rib bsgribs ldongs pa/ / srid pa'i sdug bsngal kun las dgrol bya zhes/ /
seng+ge'i nga ro rnam par sgrog mdzad pa/ / bdag cag 'jig rten 'phags pa'i gtso yin gyi/ / ye shes sgron ma shin tu 'dir bstan cing / / 'gro ba kun gyi skye ba dgag par bya/ /
gang yang 'od zer brgya phrag mtha' yas pa/ / mi yi seng+ge skye tshe rab 'phro bas/ / ngan song thams cad zhi bar gyur pa dang / / 'gro ba kun gyi sdug bsngal zhir gyur dang / /
gang yang btsun mo'i 'khor gyi khrod bzhugs shing / / mi yi seng+ge rnam par 'phrul mdzad dang / / 'gro ba kun la phan dang bde thugs kyis; ; 'jig rten sgron ma mngon par byung ba dang / /
'gro rgyud 'di las shin tu byung gyur cing / / byang chub shing drung skyes dbang bzhugs gyur nas/ / sa rnams bskyod byas dpe zla med pa yi/ / 'od snang phyogs bcu kun tu bkye gyur cing / /
bdud kyi khyim rnams rab tu ldeg mdzad de/ / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten thams cad skul mdzad dang / / sngon spyod gang rnams yongs su smin mdzad cing / / gang don skyes dbang rnam par 'tshang rgya ba/ /
ma lus skra yi sbugs su bsdu byas shing / / phyogs rnams zhing rgyud de bzhin bsdu byas te/ / sems can mtha' yas rgyud kyang yongs bsdus shing / / rgyal ba rnams kyi rnam 'phrul grub gyur cig /
tshul rnams 'di dag ma lus shes bya ste/ / 'jig rten mkhyen pa'i yon tan brjod pa dang / / ye shes mkhyen pa'i yon tan ma brjod pa/ / thams cad spyod la gnas te shes gyur cig /
ji snyed bdud kyi dkrugs ma mang po dang / de dag dpung gis stong gsum khyab gyur cig / bdud rnams phyin ci log gtong mang po dag / thams cad chags med sgo nas thul gyur cig /
zhing na mi yi seng+ge gang bzhugs dang / / brgya byin gnas na skyes dbang gang bzhugs dang / / tshangs pa'i gnas na rang byung gang bzhugs pa/ / chags med thams cad ma lus mthong gyur cig /
gang rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / / mi yi gtso bo'i sku chul [*tshul?] mtha' yas pa/ / dus kyi dus gsum bskal pa ji snyed par/ / gang rnams rgyal bas mtha' ma ma brnyes dang / /
dpe zla med pa'i gdan du gyur pa rnams/ / mtha' yas phyogs rnams gang gis khyab gyur pa/ / mtshan nyid tha dad rgyan gyis dag pa rnams/ / kun du rgyal ba bsam yas bzhugs pa dag /
de dag rgyal sras mang pos yongs bskor cing; ; chos dbyings ma lus kun tu khyab mdzad nas/ / gang gis sangs rgyas ma lus byung gyur pa'i/ / byang chub spyod pa kun tu ston mdzad cing / /
ye shes mkhyen pa rnams kyi tshul gcig gis/ / sangs rgyas ma lus thams cad sdud mdzad cing / / rgyal ba'i rgyan tshul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis/ / gang gis chos kyi chos nyid yongs khyab pa/ /
dpe zla med pa'i rnam 'phrul ji snyed dang / / rgyal ba rnams kyi sku tshul ji snyed dang / / gang yang sku tshe bzung ste skyes gyur dang / / gang yang btsun mo'i 'khor gyis bskor ba dang / /
gang yang mngon par 'byung ba bstan pa dang / / mkhas pas dbang po shin tu phra mkhyen dang / / mya ngan 'das nas ring bsrel kun bsdus te/ / bgos shing rgyal ba'i mchod rten byas pa'i bar/ /
'jig rten dag na tshad med ma lus pa'i/ / spyod pa mtha' yas de dag rab spyod cing / / rgyal ba'i spyod pa yongs su gang brjod pa/ / de dag kun la spyod yangs 'jug gyur cig /
de ltar tshul rnams kun la yongs bsngo ste/ / dge ba de dag yongs su bsngo bas na/ / byang chub spyod pa de dag rab tu shes/ / spyod pas skyo bar nam yang mi 'gyur ro/ /
de dag rnam par 'phrul ba ji snyed pa/ / rgyal ba rnams kyis brjod pa gang yang rung / / 'gro ba 'di na 'jig rten mkhyen pa yi/ / gang yod thams cad ma lus rtogs par shes/ /
de ltar skyes dbang thams cad ma lus par/ / rab byung yul rnams rjes su thob gyur te/ / de dag skad cig gcig gis rtogs gyur kyang / / byang chub spyod las rnam par phyir mi ldog ;
gang yang rgyal ba'i spyod yul phra mo rnams/ / zhing dang chos kyi rgyud rnams thams cad kun/ / de dag spyod pa mchog gi shes gyur te/ / yongs su bsngo ba'i pha rol phyin pa thob; ;
bskal pa shin tu phra la 'jug pa gang / / skad cig gcig la grangs dang grangs med tshul/ / de dag byang chub shes pas rtogs gyur kyang / / spyod pa'i dam pa de las phyir mi ldog /
gang yang 'gro ba rnams kyi zhing chen dang / / kun nas nyon mongs de bzhin rnam dag rnams/ / kun kyang ye shes spyod pas shes byas shing / / de la yid gzhungs sems can dam pa 'khod/ /
dus kyi tshul rnams rjes su sems byed cing / / skad cig sems kyis bsam yas bskal pa dang / / de bzhin dus gsum ma lus thams cad kyang / / spyod pa'i mchog la gnas shing rab tu shes/ /
sems la yang dag gzhol zhing 'jug pa dang / / chos la yang dag 'jug pa'i tshul rnams dang / / zhing la yang dag 'jug pa mkhas 'di la/ / kun kyang spyod pa dam pas rab tu shes/ /
ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa gang yod dang / / sems can bsgrub dang de bzhin chos bsgrub dang / / rnam par 'phrul thob byang chub bsgrub pa rnams/ / mtha' dbus gzhi med thams cad ma lus pa/ /
'jug pa shin tu phra ba mtha' dag bsdu byas shing / / rnam par phye ba ji snyed yod pa rnams/ / bskal pa mi mthun tha dad mtshan ldan pa/ / de dag thams cad spyod pa yangs pas shes/ /
phyogs kyi rgyud na zhing rnams gcig min pa/ / 'gro ba rnams na sna tshogs gang yod dang / / sems can 'gro rgyud sna tshogs tha dad pa/ / spyod pa'i stobs la gnas shing shes par byed/ /
gang gis yongs su bsngo ba 'di shes pa/ / de ni ji snyed 'das pa'i sangs rgyas dang / / gang rnams ma byon gang dag bzhugs pa rnams/ / de dag spyod dang mnyam pa nyid 'thob bo/ /
rgyal ba kun gyis bsod nams 'thob par 'gyur/ / rgyal ba kun gyi ye shes 'thob par 'gyur/ / rgyal ba kun gyi spyod pa'i rjes bslabs shing / / yongs su bsngo ba 'di dag 'thob par 'gyur/ /
'gro ba kun gyis thub par dkar gyur cing / / 'jug pa kun tu bslab bya bslabs pa dag / rgyal ba kun gyi rjes su sems dpa' rnams/ / thams cad 'jig rten sgron ma mthong bar 'gyur/ /
de yi spyod la tshad gdab mi nus te/ / yon tan rnams la'ang tshad kyis gzhal mi nus/ / dpe med de dag spyod la gnas bcas shing / / rgyal ba kun gyi rnam 'phrul rab tu shes/ /

The peerless honored ones of the ten directions Have never had a thought of pride; Whatever virtuous works they perform, They are still respectful and reverent.
All the virtues they cultivate Are not for themselves or others; Always, with a mind of supreme resolve, They dedicate them to the benefit of all the living.
They have never developed pride or conceit, Yet they are not self-demeaning; The actions of the enlightened ones They inquire into and earnestly practice.
The various roots of goodness they cultivate Are all for the benefit of conscious creatures; They abide in profound will and broad understanding, Dedicated to the most honorable, virtuous human state.
The various skills and marvels There are in the world, beyond measure, Crude and fine, broad and deep, They practice and master all.
All the various bodies in the world They enter by equality of bodies; Cultivating this, they attain understanding And accomplish nonregression in the door of wisdom.
The lands in the worlds, innumerable kinds, Minute, immense, with different orientations, Enlightening beings can, via the door of knowledge, See all in a single pore.
Sentient beings’ mental activities, without measure, They can cause to equally enter one mind: Through the door of knowledge they understand all, And do not regress in their practice.
Sentient beings’ faculties and inclinations, Superior, middling, and inferior, are each unalike; All are profoundly hard to know: But enlightening beings can comprehend them in accord with their fundamental nature.
Sentient beings’ various actions, Superior, middling, and inferior, are each different: Enlightening beings, deeply entering enlightened power, Clearly see all through the door of knowledge.
Inconceivably innumerable eons They can cause to equally enter one instant; Thus having seen, throughout the ten directions They cultivate all pure actions.
Past, future, and present— They know their characteristics, each different, Yet without deviating from the principle of equality— This is the great mind’s practice of clear comprehension.
The actions of the sentient beings of the world are not the same— Sometimes apparent, sometimes hidden, there are innumerable kinds: Enlightening beings know all their different forms, And know too their forms are formless.
The autonomous spiritual power manifested By all Buddhas in the worlds in the ten directions, Vast, extensive, inconceivable, Enlightening beings are able to distinctly know.
The naturally enlightened Human Lions In the Tushita heavens of all worlds, Their virtues great, pure, beyond compare, All their features the enlightening can see.
Sometimes they manifest spiritual descent into the mother’s womb, Or innumerable autonomous miraculous displays— Attaining Buddhahood, teaching, showing extinction, Throughout the world, unceasingly.
When the Human Lions are first born, All those of superior knowledge serve them: The gods, such as Indra and Brahma, All respectfully attend to them.
In the infinite, boundless realms Throughout the ten directions, Without beginning or end, far or near, They manifest the powers of the enlightened.
After the Honored Human Leaders manifest birth, They walk seven steps in each direction: Wishing to enlighten the living by the wondrous truth, The Buddhas therefore observe all.
They see sentient beings sunk in the sea of cravings, Veiled by blindness and folly: The Free Humans show a smile And reflect that they should save beings from suffering.
The great Lion’s Roar emits a wondrous voice: “I am most honored in the world; I should light the lamp of clear pure knowledge And destroy the darkness of ignorance and folly in birth and death.”
When the Human Lion Kings appear in the world They radiate infinite great beams of light Causing an end to the courses of misery And extinguishing the sufferings of the world.
Sometimes they manifest life in a royal palace, Sometimes they manifest leaving home and cultivating enlightenment; Because they want to benefit sentient beings They demonstrate such powers of freedom.
When the Buddhas first sit on the enlightenment site, The whole earth trembles; All worlds in the ten directions are bathed in light, And beings in all states are relieved of pain.
Shaking the palaces of all demons, Awakening the minds of all sentient beings, Those who received the teaching and practiced it in the past They cause to know the true meaning.
All the lands in the ten directions Completely enter a pore; The lands in all pores are boundless: Therein they manifest spiritual powers.
Enlightening beings understand the innumerable methods Expounded by all the Buddhas; Even those the Buddhas have not explained They understand and diligently practice.
All the demon armies create conflicts Filling all worlds of the universe; The infinite varied ills they create Unhindered knowledge can all destroy.
The Enlightened may be in buddha-fields, Or may appear to be in celestial palaces. Sometimes they manifest their bodies in Brahma’s palace— Enlightening beings see all without obstruction.
Buddha manifests infinite, various bodies, Turning the wheel of the pure teaching; No bounds to this can ever be found, Even throughout all times.
Jeweled thrones, high and wide, without compare, Fill the infinite worlds of the ten directions, Adorned with various wondrous forms: Buddhas sit on them, inconceivable,
Surrounded by crowds of enlightening beings Filling the whole of the cosmos, Revealing infinite practices for enlightenment, The paths followed by all the Buddhas.
The appropriate acts of the Buddhas Are infinite, boundless as the cosmos; The wise are able, by one technique, To know them all entirely.
The Buddha’s spiritual powers Manifest all kinds of bodies: They may show infinite lives in all states of being, Or may appear surrounded by concubines,
Or else they may in countless worlds Manifest leaving home and attaining buddhahood, Add on the final demise, Distribution of relics and setting up of shrines.
By these boundless varied actions The guides explain the abode of buddhahood; The great virtues of the World Honored Enlightening beings vow to cultivate and achieve.
When they dedicate those roots of goodness They abide in such expedient means, Thus cultivating enlightening practice, Their minds never wearied or lazy.
The great spiritual powers of the Buddhas As well as their boundless supreme virtues And also wise acts in the mundane world: All they know exhaustively.
Thus all lordly humans In whatever realms they may be Understand all at once Yet don’t give up enlightenment practice.
The subtle, refined practices of the Buddhas And the various laws of all fields, They are able to know as they encounter them, Ultimately dedicating them to transcendence.
Finite or infinite, all ages Enlightening beings know are the same as one instant: Herein they enter enlightenment practice, Always cultivating it diligently, never regressing.
All the lands in the ten directions, Some polluted, some pure, And all the Buddhas there Enlightening beings can distinguish and know.
In every moment they clearly see Inconceivably many eons; Thus, throughout all times, They cultivate enlightening practice.
Into all minds they penetrate, And penetrate all things equally too, The same for all buddha-fields throughout space, Comprehending all their excellent practices.
They produce all kinds of knowledge Of sentient beings and phenomena As well as spiritual powers of enlightening beings: All of this inexhaustible.
Knowledge of all minute details, each distinct, Enlightening beings thoroughly absorb: Similar and different aspects they all know well, Thus cultivating far-reaching practice.
Innumerable are the sentient beings in each Of the innumerable buddha-lands in the ten directions: Their conditions and types are variously different— By the power of their practice enlightening beings can know them all.
All the guides there are In past, present, and future worlds— If one has knowledge and dedication like them, One’s practice is equal to those Buddhas.
If people can practice this dedication, This is learning the path of the Buddhas: They’ll attain the virtues of all Buddhas, And the knowledge and wisdom of Buddhas.
Invulnerable to all worldlings, Accomplishing all that is to be learned, They’ll always be able to recollect all Buddhas And see all the Lamps of the World.
Enlightening beings’ excellent practices are immeasurable, And so are their virtuous qualities: Once living by the unexcelled practice of the Enlightened, They know all the spiritual powers of the Buddhas.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa zhes bya ba bcu pa gang zhe na/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos smra ba chen por gyur pas dri ma med pa'i go 'phang thob pa/ chos kyi mdzod kyi sbyin pa rab tu byin zhing snying rje chen po dang ldan pas byams pa chen po thob cing / byang chub kyi sems la sems can rab tu dgod par brtson pa/ sems can gyi don la zhugs pas byang chub kyi sems rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog pa/ sems can thams cad kyi kha lo sgyur bas 'gro ba thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam yang dag par ston pa/ 'gro ba thams cad la chos kyi nyi ma dam par gyur pas/ dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pas 'jig rten thams cad snang bar byed pa/ 'gro ba thams cad la sems rab tu mnyam pas; sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa rgyun mi gcod pa ye shes la dbang sgyur zhing / sems rnam par dag pas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las thams cad nyams pa med par sgrub pa/ ye shes chen pos 'gro ba thams cad kyi ded dpon du gyur pas/ sems can thams cad la bde ba'i lam yang dag par ston pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos bskyed pa thams cad la sems thams cad kyis sngon 'dren pa/ sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dbyer mi phyed par gyur pas/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba spel ba la zhugs pa/ dam pa'i chos sbyin pa sngon du gtong bas chos dkar po thams cad la yang dag par brtson pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pas yongs su bzung ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas stobs dang shugs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa/ lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu brtan pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa yang dag par bsgrubs pas nye bar ston pa'i spyod pa mthu chen po'i sems dang ldan pas/ byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la mos shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa/ sgyu med par byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yang dag par bsgrubs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo'i dmigs pa mtha' dang dbus med pa la sems pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba la dmigs shing yongs su bsngo ba rgya chen pos bsgribs pa med pa'i yul thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba la zhugs shing rab tu bsgrub pa de/ chung ngu na sangs rgyas kyi gsung las tshig dang yi ge gcig thos sam/ ston tam/ yang dag par 'dzin kyang rung ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa de dag na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag dran pas dmigs te; 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang yid la byed/ ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang yid la byed/ da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang yid la byed/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyang yid la byed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/

“What is great enlightening beings’ boundless dedication equal to the cosmos? Here they wrap their heads with the turban of nondefilement, dwell in the position of a teacher of truth, and extensively carry out the giving of teaching, with great kindness and compassion establishing sentient beings in the aspiration for enlightenment. Always practicing charity, by the determination for enlightenment they nurture roots of goodness. Being directors for sentient beings, they point out to them the path of universal knowledge. Being suns of truth for sentient beings, the light of their roots of goodness illumines all. Their minds are impartial toward all sentient beings. They practice good works without rest. Their hearts are pure, free from stain, and their knowledge and wisdom are free. They never give up good works, and, acting as wise caravan leaders for sentient beings, they bring them all into the right path of peace. Being leaders and guides for sentient beings, they have them cultivate the practices of all roots of goodness. Being incorruptible, steadfast, good friends to sentient beings, they cause their roots of goodness to develop and mature.
“These great enlightening beings make giving of teaching principal; developing all pure, good qualities, they embody the mind directed toward universal knowledge, their supreme will power ultimately enduring, developing, and growing. They are endowed with great powers and virtues. They trust good spiritual friends, their minds have no deceitfulness. They contemplate and examine the boundless realms of the way into universal knowledge.

“These roots of goodness they dedicate in this way: they vow to become able to cultivate, perfect, and increase all perspectives of universal nonobstruction; they vow to become able to absorb retain, and expound whatever they hear of the true teaching of the Buddhas, even a single line or verse; they vow to become able to recollect all the Buddhas, past, future, and present, of all worlds, innumerable, boundless, equal to the cosmos, and, having remembered them, to cultivate enlightening practices; they also vow to cultivate enlightening practice for one being in one world forever by this root of goodness of remembrance of Buddhas, and as in one world, so in all worlds, throughout the space of the cosmos, and as for one being so for all sentient beings, in each case being eternally adorned with great vows for their sake, eradicating any thought of separation from the Buddhas and spiritual friends, always seeing the Buddhas before them, able to draw near to every Buddha that appears in the world. The pure religious practices extolled and expounded by all Buddhas and enlightening beings they vow to cultivate and completely fulfill—religious practice of unbroken morality, flawless morality, unalloyed morality, spotless morality, impeccable morality; religious practice that cannot be shrouded, religious practice lauded by Buddhas, religious practice of nonreliance, religious practice of nonacquisitveness, religious practice of increasing the purity of the enlightening being, religious practice as carried out by the Buddhas of all times, religious practice of nonobstruction, religious practice of nonattachment, religious practice of noncontention, religious practice without extinction, religious practice of stabilization of good will, religious practice of incomparable compassion, religious practice of immutable joy, religious practice of undisturbed equanimity, religious practice of freedom from anger.
“If great enlightening beings are able to cultivate such pure religious practices for their own sake, then they will be able to do so for the sake of all sentient beings, enabling all sentient beings to attain stability, enabling all sentient beings to attain open understanding, enabling all sentient beings to attain completion, enabling all sentient beings to attain purity, enabling all sentient beings to attain nondefilement, enabling all sentient beings to attain illumination, enabling all sentient beings to be unstained by sense objects, enabling all sentient beings to be free from blinding hindrances, enabling all sentient beings to be freed from inflaming afflictions, enabling all sentient beings to be freed from all bonds, enabling all sentient beings to forever depart from all evils, enabling all sentient beings to be harmless and ultimately pure.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pa rnam par ma dag pas gzhan gyi tshangs par spyod pa rnam par dag par bya ba mi nus so/ / byang chub sems dpa' tshangs par spyod pa las phyir log pas/ pha rol byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pa la bsgrub par mi nus so/ / byang chub sems dpa' tshangs par spyod pa rgyun chad pas / gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pa la rnam par dag par bya bar mi nus so/ / byang chub sems dpa' tshangs par spyod pa dang bral bas/ gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pa la nan tan du byed du gzhug par mi nus so/ / byang chub sems dpa' tshangs par spyod pa las nyams pas/ gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pa la sbyar bar mi nus so/ / byang chub sems dpa' tshangs par spyod pa la mos pa med pas/ gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pa la mos par bya bar mi nus so/ / byang chub sems dpa' tshangs par spyod pa la rnam par mi gnas pas/ gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par gzhag par mi nus so/ / byang chub sems dpa' tshangs par spyod pa la ma zhugs pas/ gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pa la gzhug par mi nus so/ / byang chub sems dpa' tshangs par spyod pa las g.yos pas/ gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pa mi g.yo ba la gzhag par mi nus so/ / byang chub sems dpa' tshangs par spyod pa ma spyad pas/ gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i tshangs par spyod pas yang dag par gzung bar mi nus so/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' ni ji skad smra ba de ltar byed pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' ni ma nor ba la gnas shing ma nor bar smra ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa' ni bden par smra zhing de bzhin du byed pa la gnas pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' ni lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag cing nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa' ni bsgribs pa thams cad rnam par 'thor zhing bsgribs pa med pa'i spyod yul la zhugs pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan zhing gzhan la lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas chos ston pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' ni drang ba'i tshul gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan zhing gzhan drang po la gzhog pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' ni 'gyod pa dang bral bar byas shing gzhan 'gyod pa las rnam par slong ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa' ni yid dang bar gyur cing gzhan sems dang bar dbyer med pa la yang dag par bsgrub pa yin / byang chub sems dpa' ni chos yang dag par brjod par gyur cing gzhan chos la nye bar stobs pa yin te/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ /

Why? If great enlightening beings cannot themselves be pure in religious practice, they cannot cause others to attain purity; if they themselves regress from religious practice, they cannot cause others not to regress; if they themselves are corrupt in religious practice, they cannot cause others to be free from corruption; if they themselves stray from religious practice, they cannot cause others not to stray; if they themselves are lazy in religious practice, they cannot cause others not to slack off; if they themselves have no faith in religious practice, they cannot cause others to have faith; if they themselves do not live steadily by religious practice, they cannot cause others to live steadily; if they themselves have no realization of religious practice, they cannot cause others’ minds to attain realization; if they themselves give up religious practices, they cannot cause others to persevere; if they themselves waver in religious practice, they cannot cause others not to waver. Great enlightening beings act without delusion and teach doctrine that is free from delusion; what they say is truthful, and they practice what they preach. They purify their deeds, words, and thoughts, eliminating all dross and defilements. They abide in unobstructed action and annihilate all hindrances. Great enlightening beings themselves attain pure minds and explain to others ways to purify the mind; they themselves cultivate harmony and tolerance, taming their minds with roots of goodness, and cause others to be harmonious and tolerant, taming their minds with roots of goodness. They themselves get rid of doubt and regret, and also cause others to be forever rid of doubt and regret. They themselves attain pure faith and also cause others to attain indestructible pure faith. They themselves abide by the truth, and also cause others to live by the truth.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos sbyin pa la brtson pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis chos thams cad kyi sgo mi zad pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /chos thams cad shin tu bstan pa'i sgo 'gro ba thams cad tshim par byed pa/ gzhan gyis brgal ba thams cad la rnam par 'das pa dor ba dang gzhag pa rab tu 'gags pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rgya mtsho shin tu ston par gyur cig /chos kyi gnas re re dang / chos kyi tshul re re dang / chos rnam par brjod pa re re dang / chos su gdags pa re re dang / chos su smos pa re re dang / chos brjod pa re re dang / chos kyi sgo re re dang / chos la 'jug pa re re dang / chos bskyed pa re re dang / chos rnam par dgod pa re re las chos mi zad pa/ mtha' dang dbus med pa'i mi 'jigs pa la rab tu brtson pa thob ste/ tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa la zhugs pas ston cing 'gro ba thams cad kyis phyi ma'i mthar thug pa mi zad pa dang ldan pa dang / sems can thams cad la lhag pa'i bsam pas bstan pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i tshig chags pa med pas byung ba dang / 'khrul ba med pa'i spobs pas 'gro ba thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i chos shin tu ston pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad du rjes su bsgrags pa'i chos kyi tshig gi tshul dang ldan pa dang / chos thams cad kyi snang ba mtha' yas pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dga' ba'i shugs yang dag par skyed pa dang / sems can thams cad dga' ba dang / mos pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu bzhag par rmongs pa med pa dang / chos snang ba'i spobs pa dang ldan pa dang / tshig thams cad yang dag par gzung ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rab tu brtson pa dang / chos kyi dbyings su lus tshad med pas byin gyis rlob pa dang / chos kyi dbyings sems yangs pa tshad med pas rgyas par 'gengs pa dang; chos kyi dbyings su dbyangs thams cad rnam par dag pa tshad med pas grags par byed pa dang / chos kyi dbyings su tshad med pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yang dag par ston pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi byang chub sems dpa'i las tshad med pa la brtson pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa tshad med pa rab tu thob pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la yang dag par 'jug pa tshad med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings su chos tshad med pa mngon par bsgrubs pa la bslab pa dang / chos kyi dbyings su byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa tshad med pa yang dag par spyod pa la gnas pa dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i khong du chud pas sems can thams cad kyi gtso bos yang dag par bstan pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /ces de ltar sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rab tu dgod pa shin tu bsgrub pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate the roots of goodness arising from giving of teaching in this way: ‘May I attain the infinite means of teaching of all Buddhas and analyze and explain them for all sentient beings, causing them all to rejoice and be satisfied in mind, shattering all false philosophies; may I be able to expound the ocean of teachings of the Buddhas of past, present, and future for all sentient beings, in terms of the upshot of each teaching, the meanings and principles of each teaching, the interpretation of each teaching, the revelation of each teaching, the ways of access to each teaching, the awakening to each teaching, the contemplation and investigation of each teaching, and the field and position of each teaching, attain infinite treasuries of truths, acquiring fearlessness, endowed with all powers of analysis and elucidation, extensively analyzing and explaining for sentient beings, throughout the future, inexhaustibly.’ Because they want to enable all sentient beings to establish transcendent will and develop unhindered, impeccable discernment; because they want to cause all sentient beings to be joyful; because they want to enable all sentient beings to develop the light of all pure principles, unceasingly expounding them in expressions adapted to the type of audience; because they want to cause all sentient beings to be profoundly faithful and joyful, they abide in universal knowledge, discern and comprehend all things, and cause them to be without confusion, thinking in these terms: ‘I should earnestly cultivate practice in all worlds for the sake of sentient beings, attain an infinite free body pervading the cosmos, attain an infinite great mind pervading the cosmos, become endowed with infinite pure speech equal to the realms of the cosmos, appear in sites of enlightenment of infinite congregations throughout the extent of the cosmos, cultivate enlightening practices as infinite as the cosmos, attain stations of enlightening beings as infinite as the cosmos, realize equanimity of enlightening beings as infinite as the cosmos, learn principles of enlightening beings as infinite as the cosmos, live by practices of enlightening beings as infinite as the cosmos, and enter into dedications of enlightening beings as infinite as the cosmos.’ This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness, to cause all sentient beings to be able to attain universal knowledge.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i sems can gdul ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing byin gyis brlab pa dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i mi 'jigs pa rab tu thob par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa rab tu thob par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs rab tu thob par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu thob par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i bsod nams bsags pa yongs su grub par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i sems can gyi don gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba thob par gyur cig /dge ba'i rtsa ba des chos 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig/ ji ltar bdag gis thob par gyur ba de bzhin du/ sems can thams cad kyis kyang thob par gyur cig /thob pa 'di dang / mnyam pa nyid 'di dang / yongs su rdzogs pa 'dis sems can thams cad bdag dang spyod pa mnyam par gyur cig /bsod nams mnyam pa dang / ye shes mnyam pa dang / stobs mnyam pa dang / mi 'jigs pa mnyam pa dang / rnam par dag pa mnyam pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa mnyam pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa mnyam pa dang / chos bstan pa mnyam pa dang / don mnyam pa dang / rnam par nges pa mnyam pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad mnyam pas mnyam par gyur cig /ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate roots of goodness to their aspiration to see Buddhas infinite as the cosmos, to tame sentient beings infinite as the cosmos, to maintain buddha-lands infinite as the cosmos, to realize enlightening knowledge infinite as the cosmos, to attain fearlessness infinite as the cosmos, to attain enlightening beings’ inconceivable abodes infinite as the cosmos, to be endowed with virtues infinite as the cosmos, and to fulfill roots of goodness beneficial to sentient beings as infinite as the cosmos. They also pray that by these roots of goodness they will be enabled to attain impartiality of virtue, impartiality of knowledge, impartiality of power, impartiality of fearlessness, impartiality of purity, impartiality of freedom, impartiality of true awakening, impartiality of teaching, impartiality of doctrine, impartiality of certitude, and impartiality of all spiritual powers, fully developing all these qualities and also vowing that all sentient beings should attain them just as they have.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ ji ltar chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag tshad med pa'i ye shes yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sangs rgyas mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad mthong ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar chos kyi dbyings la mus gcad pa med pa de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing mus gcad pa med pa thams cad du 'gro bar yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar chos kyi dbyings sa mtshams med pa de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'jig rten gyi khams sa mtshams med pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar chos kyi dbyings la ris su chad pa med pa de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ris su chad pa med par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar chos kyi dbyings rgyud kyi tshul gcig par gyur pa de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad ye shes kyi rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin yongs su dag pa de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'gro ba thams cad shin tu rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar chos kyi dbyings 'gro ba thams cad kyi rjes su song ba de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar chos kyi dbyings 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyan du gyur pa de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i rgyan rnam par dag par yongs su bsngo'o/ / ji ltar chos kyi dbyings la 'jig pa med pa de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate roots of goodness in this way: that is, as the cosmos is infinite, so is the dedication of roots of goodness—the wisdom attained is ultimately infinite; as the cosmos is boundless, so is the dedication of roots of goodness, seeing all Buddhas without any bounds; as the cosmos is unlimited, so is the dedication of roots of goodness, going to buddha-fields without limit; as the cosmos has no boundaries, so also is the dedication of roots of goodness, cultivating enlightening practices in all worlds, without boundaries; as the cosmos has no end, so too is the dedication of roots of goodness, abiding in universal knowledge forever without end; as the cosmos is of one nature, so too is the dedication of roots of goodness of the same nature of knowledge as all beings; as the cosmos is inherently pure, so too is the dedication of roots of goodness, causing all sentient beings to ultimately be pure; as the cosmos is adaptive, so too is the dedication of roots of goodness, causing all sentient beings to accord with the practical vows of Universal Good; as the cosmos is adorned, so too is the dedication of roots of goodness, causing all sentient beings to be adorned with the practices of Universal Good; as the cosmos cannot be lost or destroyed, so too is the dedication of roots of goodness, causing all enlightening beings never to lose or destroy pure practices.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba der dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni thams cad du 'gro bas na thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang 'gro ba thams cad du shin tu snang bar 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yongs su 'thob pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thogs pa med par 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong ba sems can thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba las phyir mi ldog pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong ba yongs su shes shing rab tu 'phel bar byed pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong ba gnas su mi 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong ba chags pa med par khong du chud par 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong zhing kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong zhing mngon sum du blta ba rgyun mi 'chad pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i stobs dang shugs skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / ci nas kyang sangs rgyas mthong zhing dngos po nyams par 'gyur ba thams cad las 'phags par 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar yang chos kyi dbyings byed pa med pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings gnas med pa dang / chos kyi dbyings nyams pa med pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dben pa dang / chos kyi dbyings zhi ba dang / chos kyi dbyings gnas pa dang / chos kyi dbyings mi 'pho ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tha dad pa med pa bzhin du 'gyur bar yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate roots of goodness in this way: ‘By these roots of goodness may we serve all Buddhas and enlightening beings and gladden them all; by these roots of goodness may we quickly attain entry into the essence of universal knowledge; by these roots of goodness may we cultivate omniscience in all places; by these roots of goodness may we cause all sentient beings to always get to go see all the Buddhas; by these roots of goodness may we cause all sentient beings to always see the Buddhas and be able to do buddha-work; by these roots of goodness may we enable all sentient beings to always see the Buddhas and never be lazy about buddha-work; by these roots of goodness may we enable all sentient beings to always see the Buddhas and be joyful and pure in mind and never regress; by these roots of goodness may we enable all sentient beings to always get to see the Buddhas and attain good understanding; by these roots of goodness may we cause all sentient beings to always see the Buddhas and not give rise to clinging attachments; by these roots of goodness may we cause all sentient beings to always see the Buddhas and comprehend without obstruction; by these roots of goodness may we enable sentient beings to always see the Buddhas and accomplish the practices of Universal Good; by these roots of goodness may we cause all sentient beings to always see the Buddhas appearing before them, never leaving them for moment; by these roots of goodness may we cause all sentient beings to always see the Buddhas and produce the infinite powers of enlightening beings; by these roots of goodness may we enable all sentient beings always to see the Buddhas and never forget their teachings.’

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba chos bstan cing brjod pas yang dag par bzung ba dang / chos bstan par bskul ba dang / de la dmigs pa la brtson par byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / de dag la sogs pa dge ba brtsams pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs shing byang chub sems dpar gyur te chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sems can thams cad 'god pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad 'jig rten kun gyis chos yongs su dris pas zad par mi 'gyur bas mi 'phrogs pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad chos kyi snang bas bsgribs pa med pa thob pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi tshig dang yi ge brjod pa la mkhas shing ye shes kyi snying po'i chos smra bar gyur cig/ sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes ston pa la mkhas shing sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston pas mig dang 'dra ba'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad rigs pas gzung ba'i tshig dang / yi ge chud ma zos par shin tu ston pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dran pas yang dag par 'dzin pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad mtshan gyis shin tu brgyan pa'i lus dang ldan zhing / 'od mtha' yas par 'phro ba'i chos yang dag par dpyad pa la mkhas pas nye bar mi dmigs pa'i lam du zhugs pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad chos mi 'chad pa la gnas shing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi char bsam pa thag pas dbab pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis chos kyi sprin rab tu ston cig /sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad gzhan gyis pham par mi nus pa'i rgyal mtshan dang ldan pa'i chos smra ba'i mdzod bdog pas chos rgya mtsho thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos chud mi gzon pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig; sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi spobs pa la brtson zhing chos thams cad yang dag par brjod pa la mkhas pas chos thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi nyi ma'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa shin tu bstan pa'i chos kyi 'byung gnas dang mdzod rab tu thob cing / chos kyi 'byung gnas dang / rigs kyi tshul dang ldan pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad chos kyi mdzod rnam par phye ba'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing chos kyi spyod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas shin tu bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing dbye ba med pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i chos la gnas pa rab tu thob pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad yon tan dang bsngags pa mu med cing zad mi shes pa dang ldan te/ chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad bden pa'i mtha'i tshul gyis rjes su zhugs pas 'gro ba thams cad la mi slu ba'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad bdud kyi las thams cad khong du chud pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing bdud thams cad rnam par 'thor ba'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad bdag gi med pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sems dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba'i chos smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi stobs kyis smon lam rab tu thob cing / 'gro ba thams cad bde bar byed pa'i chos smra bar gyur cig /de yang 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ nyams pa med pa'i las kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyams pa med pa'i rnam par smin pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyams pa med pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyams pa med pa'i chos la yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyams pa med pa'i dngos po la yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyams pa med pa'i rgyu rnams kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyams pa med pa'i chos kyi lam gyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyams pa med pa'i ming mang po dang / tshig mang po dang / yi ge mang po'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyams pa med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyams pa med pa'i sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo yang gzugs kyi tshul la chags shing yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / 'dod pa la gnas pa'i sgra'i don du yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / dri'i phyir yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / ro'i phyir yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / reg bya'i phyir yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / 'dod pa la gnas pa'i chos rnams kyi phyir yang yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / mtho ris su skye ba'i phyir yang yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / 'dod pa la spyod pa'i phyir yang yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / 'dod pa'i yul la chags pas kyang yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / g.yog 'khor gyi phyir yang yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / dbang phyug don du gnyer bas yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / 'khor ba'i dga' ba'i don du yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba la gnas shing yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / dngos po la mngon par mos shing yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / 'dod pa dang ldan par bya ba'i bsam pas yongs su mi bsngo'o// kun gzhi la mos pas yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / bsten pa'i sems kyis yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhig pa'i don du yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / khams gsum pa la gnas pas kyang yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rol chags pas kyang yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la gnas shing yongs su mi bsngo'o/ / 'di ltar 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i don du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chags pa med pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / bsgribs pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'gro ba thams cad 'khor ba nas rab tu gdon pa'i ye shes chen po khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rdo rje lta bu dang / bsam pa bsten pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / yun du 'chi ba med pa'i chos bsgrub pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyis brgyan pa'i rgyan du ma dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyod pas rnam par 'phrul ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos snang ba thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa grub par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i zhing thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i gzhi yongs su rdzogs pa thob cing phyir mi ldog pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i go cha don yod pas sems can thams cad kun tu bzang po'i sa la rab tu dgod pa la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par sems can thams cad rab tu dgrol bar bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis bsgribs pa med pa thams cad 'jig rten du yang dag par bstan pa'i spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa la rab tu gnas par bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas
