shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / de de ltar yongs su bsngo ba yang rang bzhin dang mnyam pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos nyid dang mnyam pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'gro ba tshad med pa thams cad dang mnyam pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / nyon mongs pa med pa dang mnyam pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / byed pa med pa'i rang bzhin dang mnyam pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos 'khrugs pa med pa yongs su shes pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du zhugs pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o// 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / mngon par shes pa ma nyams pa thob pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyod pa la grub pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad sems can dmyal ba nas phyir bzlog pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad byol song gi skye gnas su mi dgod pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad gshin rje'i 'jig rten na gnas pa dgag pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi sgrib pa'i chos thams cad spang ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems dge ba'i rtsa bas shin tu tshim par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o// chos kyi 'khor lo dus la bab par bskor bas dga' bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / stobs bcu'i 'khor lo la sems can thams cad gzud pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / smon lam mtha' dang dbus med pa thob par bya ba'am/ rnam par dag pa'i chos can du bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub kyi sems cang shes bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen grangs med pa thams cad dga' bar bya ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la gnas par bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par gzung zhing / ye shes kyi snang ba shin tu 'phags par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o// byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bsgribs pa med par mngon sum du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad mngon du lta bar mngon par mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos snang ba thams cad la mngon par mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / dog pa med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis 'jigs pa med pa la mngon par mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes la mngon par mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad snying rje chen po rnam par dag pas yongs su bskyab pa la mngon par mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' dag ma lus pa lhag ma med pa thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba dang / brjod du med pa'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis thams cad brgyan par mngon par mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / bdud kyi las dang / bdud kyi zhags pa dang / bdud kyi dkrugs ma thams cad rnam par gtor ba dang; rab tu gzhom par mngon par mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gnas med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas par mngon par mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems rgya chen pos sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi rgyud la 'jug par mngon par mos pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / dran pa rnam par sbyangs pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / blo gros rnam par nges pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rig pas shin tu 'dzin pa'i mngon par shes pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / blo mtha' dang dbus med cing chags pa med pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'gro ba thams cad la byams pa chen po spyod pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / snying rje chen po la rab tu brtson pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / dga' ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / btang snyoms kyis gnyis la chags pa dang bral ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la dbang bsgyur bar gnas pas yongs su bsngo'o/ / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos bsngags pa'i lam rab tu dbye bas chos rnam par dbye ba la zhugs pa dang / chos nyid la nges par gzhog pa'i yid dang sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / dpa' ba'i rgyal mtshan gyi sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan dang ldan pa'i mdzod kyi sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par gtor ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / rnam par dag pa dang / chags pa med pa thams cad rab tu 'thob par bya ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad spyad pa las phyir mi ldog par bya ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos dam pa dang rab dang phul la mngon par mos pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / yon tan gyi chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i ye shes kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa la mos shing dang ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / bdud kyi dkrugs ma thams cad rab tu gzhig pa dang / chags pa med cing dri ma med pa'i chos kyi go 'phang 'thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdas 'gro ba thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba las phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi ye shes kyi nyi ma rab dang phul khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'od zer brgya stong gis brgyan pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes chen po'i snang ba 'gro ba thams cad du rab tu dgye ba'i sems kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya zhing gdul ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi rgyud shin tu tshim par bya ba dang; sngon gyi smon lam chen po nub pa med pas phyi ma'i mtha'i mur spyod pa chen po'i rgyud rgyun mi 'chad cing rnam par dag pa dang / snang ba dri ma med pas rgyags pa dang / dregs pa dang; nga rgyal shin tu gcad pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa rnam par gtor ba dang / sred pa'i dra ba yang dag par gtub pa dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa thibs po bsal ba dang; bsgribs pa med cing dri ma dang bral la chags pa med pa'i chos kyi lo shin tu legs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad du bskal pa'i grangs rnam par 'chad pa med pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / spyod pa'i rgyud las phyir mi ldog pas sems can gyi tshogs so sor chags pa med pa'i ye shes rab dam pa mchog rnam par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang; sems can re re las sangs rgyas kyi sku shin tu bstan pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa las phyir mi ldog par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo yang 'dod pa'i yul dang / khams gsum pa la gnas shing yongs su mi bsngo ste/

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate the roots of goodness in these ways: they dedicate them in conformity with the nonoriginated nature of the cosmos; they dedicate them in conformity with the fundamental nature of the cosmos; they dedicate them in conformity with the inherent essential nature of the cosmos; they dedicate them in conformity with the nonreliant nature of the cosmos; they dedicate them in conformity with the unforgetting nature of the cosmos; they dedicate them in conformity with the empty nature of the cosmos; they dedicate them in conformity with the placeless nature of the cosmos; they dedicate them in conformity with the tranquil nature of the cosmos; they dedicate them in conformity with the immutable nature of the cosmos; they dedicate them in conformity with the undifferentiated nature of the cosmos.
“Great enlightening beings also dedicate the revelations and enlightenment of the giving of teaching, as well as the roots of goodness arising therefrom, in this way: ‘May all sentient beings become enlightening teachers, always in the care of the Buddhas; may all sentient beings become unsurpassed teachers, skillfully establishing all sentient beings in universal knowledge; may all sentient beings become indefatigable teachers, never stymied by challenging questions; may all sentient beings be unobstructed teachers, attaining the unobstructed light of all truths, may all sentient beings be teachers with a treasury of knowledge, able to skillfully explain all Buddha teachings; may all sentient beings become teachers with the freedom of the enlightened ones and be able to skillfully analyze the knowledge of the enlightened; may all sentient beings be teachers with the eye of thusness, explaining the truth without depending on the instruction of another; may all sentient beings become teachers who remember all the teachings of Buddhas, expounding them in accord with their principles, not deviating from the meaning of their expressions; may all sentient beings become teachers practicing the signless path, adorning themselves with subtle characteristics, emanating immeasurable light, skillfully entering into all truths; may all sentient beings become great-bodied teachers, their bodies pervading all lands, creating great clouds of teaching, showering the Buddha-teachings; may all sentient beings become teachers preserving the treasury of the teachings, setting up the banner of invincibility, preserving the Buddha-teachings, causing the ocean of true teaching not to diminish; may all sentient beings become teachers who are suns of all truths, attain the powers of analysis and elucidation of Buddhas, and skillfully explain all truths; may all sentient beings become teachers with skill in means of vocal expression, skillfully explaining the boundless treasury of the realm of truth; may all sentient beings become teachers who have arrived at the other shore of the doctrine, opening up the treasury of teaching with the spiritual powers of knowledge; may all sentient beings become teachers stably abiding by the true teaching, and expound the ultimate knowledge of the enlightened; may all sentient beings become teachers who have thoroughly comprehended all the teachings, able to explain infinite, inexhaustible virtues; may all sentient beings become teachers who don’t deceive the world, able with skill in means to enter reality; may all sentient beings become teachers destroying the throngs of demons, able to be well aware of all workings of demons; may all sentient beings become teachers accepted by the Buddhas and get rid of the mind taken in by ego and possessiveness; may all sentient beings become teachers pacifying all worlds, accomplishing the will power of teaching of truth of enlightening beings.’
“Great enlightening beings also dedicate roots of goodness in this way: they do not dedicate them because of attachment to deeds, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to rewards, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to mind, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to things, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to events, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to cause, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to words and speech, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to names, phrases, and statements, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to dedication, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to benefiting sentient beings.
“Great enlightening beings also dedicate roots of goodness in this way: they do not dedicate them because of involvement in forms, they do not dedicate them because of involvement in sounds, smells, tastes, feelings, or things, they do not dedicate them to seek birth in heaven, they do not dedicate them to seek pleasure, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to objects of desire, they do not dedicate them in hopes of getting followers, they do not dedicate them in quest of rulership, they do not dedicate them for the sake of mundane happiness, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to life, they do not dedicate them because of enjoyment of existences, they do not dedicate them in search of the pleasures of union, they do not dedicate them because of seeking that which one may be fondly attached to, they do not dedicate them because of maliciousness, they do not dedicate them for that which would destroy roots of goodness, they do not dedicate them because of dependence on the world, they do not dedicate them because of attachment to stages of meditation, liberation, or concentration, they do not dedicate them because of dwelling in the vehicles of Buddhas’ disciples and self-enlightened people—they only dedicate them to edify and pacify all sentient beings, to fulfill all-knowledge, to attain unobstructed knowledge, to attain unhindered pure roots of goodness, to cause all sentient beings to transcend birth and death and realize great knowledge, to cause the great determination for enlightenment to be adamant and unbreakable, to accomplish the method of ultimate immortality, to adorn the lineage of Buddhas with infinite adornments, to reveal the freedom of universal knowledge, to seek enlightening beings’ great spiritual superknowledge clarifying all things, to carry out the practice of Universal Good in all buddha-fields throughout the space of the cosmos, completely fulfilling it without regressing, don the strong, durable armor of great vows and cause all sentient beings to abide in the realm of Universal Good, to liberate sentient beings throughout the future without resting, and show the unobstructed light of the stage of universal knowledge, forever uninterrupted.
“When great enlightening beings dedicate these roots of goodness, they dedicate them in these frames of mind: they dedicate roots of goodness with mindfulness of the equality of fundamental nature, with mindfulness of the equality of the essence of things, with mindfulness of the equality of the infinity of all sentient beings, with mindfulness of the equality of noncontradiction, with mindfulness of the equality of nonproduction of inherent nature, with a mind knowing all things without disturbance, with a mind entering into the equality of past, present, and future, with a mind producing the seed nature of Buddhas of all times, with a mind that has attained undiminishing spiritual powers, with a mind producing and maturing practical applications of universal knowledge.
“Also, they dedicate the roots of goodness to cause all sentient beings to forever leave behind all hells, to cause all sentient beings not to enter into animalistic dispositions, to cause sentient beings not to go to the realm of ghosts, to cause all sentient beings to get rid of all factors hindering enlightenment, to cause all sentient beings to fulfill all roots of goodness, to cause all sentient beings to be able to expound the teaching in accord with the time and bring joy to all, to cause all sentient beings to enter the sphere of the ten powers, to cause all sentient beings to fulfill the boundless pure ways and vows of enlightening beings, to cause all sentient beings to follow the instructions of all good spiritual teachers so the vessel of the determination for enlightenment may be fulfilled, to cause all sentient beings to absorb, retain, and apply the most profound Buddha teachings and attain the light of knowledge of all Buddhas, to cause all sentient beings to cultivate the unobstructed practices of enlightening beings and always be in their presence, to cause all sentient beings to always see the Buddhas appearing before them, to cause all sentient beings to always be in the presence of the pure light of the truth, to cause the fearless great determination for enlightenment to always be present in all sentient beings, to cause the inconceivable knowledge of enlightening beings to always occur to all sentient beings, to cause all sentient beings to everywhere rescue and safeguard living beings and cause the pure mind of great compassion to always be present, to cause all sentient beings to adorn all buddha-fields with unspeakably many superb ornaments to cause all sentient beings to obliterate all ensnaring doings of conflict provoked by all demons, to cause all sentient beings to cultivate enlightening practices in all buddha-fields without relying on anything, to cause all sentient beings to develop knowledge of all means of liberation and enter the wide doors of all Buddha teachings.
“Great enlightening beings also dedicate these roots of goodness with purity of right mindfulness; with certainty of knowledge; knowing all the methods and expedients of the Buddhas’ teachings; in order to accomplish immeasurable unobstructed knowledge; desiring to fulfill pure transcendent aspirations; by virtue of abiding kindness toward all sentient beings; by virtue of abiding compassion for all sentient beings; by virtue of abiding joy for all sentient beings; by virtue of abiding equanimity toward all sentient beings; in order to forever abandon attachment to duality and to live by supreme roots of goodness; in order to ponder, investigate, distinguish, and explain all aspects of interdependent origination; in order to establish the mind marked by great courage; in order to establish the treasury of invincibility; in order to demolish the hordes of demons; in order to attain unobstructed mindfulness of the purity of all things; in order to cultivate all enlightening practices without regressing; in order to attain the mind that happily seeks the supreme truth; in order to attain the free pure omniscient mind happily seeking all virtuous qualities; in order to fulfill all wishes and remove all conflict, attain free, pure, unobstructed buddhahood and expound the nonregressive teaching for all sentient beings; in order to become adorned by the hundreds of thousands of light beams of the sun of knowledge of the supreme truth of the enlightened ones and illumine the sentient beings of all realms; in order to tame all sentient beings, always satisfying them according to their pleasures, not giving up their original vows throughout all time, listening to the true teaching, cultivating its great practice, attaining the undefiled light of pure wisdom, getting rid of all conceit, dissolving all afflictions, breaking the net of craving, destroying the darkness of delusion, and fulfilling the undefiled unobstructed teaching; in order to always cultivate the practice of universal knowledge through incalculable eons for the sake of all beings, without regressing, causing each to attain unobstructed wisdom, and manifest the autonomous spiritual powers of the Buddhas without cease.
“When great enlightening beings dedicate roots of goodness in this way, they should not greedily cling to objects of desire.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'dod ma chags pas yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams zhe mi sdang bas yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams gti mug med pas yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams gnod pa med pas yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nga rgyal med pas yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams g.yo med pas yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams drang pos yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rig pas yongs su bsngo bar bya'o/ /

Why? Great enlightening beings should dedicate roots of goodness free from greed, should dedicate roots of goodness free from anger, should dedicate roots of goodness free from delusion, should dedicate roots of goodness free from malevolence, should dedicate roots of goodness free from pride, should dedicate roots of goodness free from deceitfulness, should dedicate roots of goodness of honesty, should dedicate roots of goodness of diligence, should dedicate roots of goodness of cultivation and practice.

byang chub sems dpas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mngon par brtson pas yongs su bsngo bar bya ste/ de de ltar yongs su bsngo bas sems rab tu dang ba 'thob bo/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la go skabs dbye ba 'thob bo/ / byang chub sems dpa'i lam rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su 'jug par 'gyur ro/ / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro/ / 'jig rten gyi nyes pa thams cad rab tu spong ngo/ / bdud kyi las thams cad rab tu spong ngo/ / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad rab tu dga' bar byed do/ / bdag gi smon lam chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / sems can thams cad gnyer ba chen pos shin tu 'bod pa yin no/ /

“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they attain minds of pure faith, joyfully accepting the practices of enlightening beings, cultivating the pure great path of enlightening beings, endowed with the essence of buddhahood, attaining enlightened knowledge and wisdom, abandoning all evil, getting rid of all manias, associating with good spiritual friends, and, fulfilling their own great vows. they invite all sentient beings to partake of their charity.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos sbyin pas 'byung ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyis chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa thob par gyur cig/ sems can thams cad kyis dbyangs snyan pa dang / ye shes kyi rnga'i dbyangs dang / thams cad du bsam gyis khyab cing 'phags pa'i dbyangs dang / yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs dang / dag pa'i dbyangs dang / zhing thams cad du sgras rgyas par 'gengs pa'i dbyangs dang / yon tan bye ba brgya stong brjod du med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i dbyangs dang / sgra mtho ba dang / sgra che bas rnam par 'khrug pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i dbyangs dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad sgras rgyas par 'gengs pa'i dbyangs dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyis ngag mnyan pa'i dbyangs rab tu thob par gyur cig /sems can thams cad kyis sgra dang dbyangs mtha' yas pa'i ye shes rab tu thob bar gyur cig/ sgra dang dbyangs thams cad rnam par dag pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /dbyangs tshad med pa dang / tshig gi lam thams cad shes pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /dbyangs la dbang bsgyur ba zil gyis mi non pa'i dbyangs thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa'i ye shes rab tu thob par gyur cig/ dbyangs thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa'i dbyangs rab tu thob par gyur cig /sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad kyis mnyan na mi ngoms pa'i dbyangs rab tu thob par gyur cig/ sems can thams cad kyis 'gro ba kun mos par nyan pa'i dbyangs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa thob par gyur cig/ sems can thams cad dad par byed pa'i dbyangs dang ldan par gyur cig/ sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dbyangs su brjod pas smra ba'i sems rnam par dag pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par sgrog pa'i sgra rab rib med pa'i dbyangs kyis smra bar gyur cig /sems can thams cad chos thams cad kyi gzungs kyi rgyan gyis chos thams cad rnam pa du mar ston pa dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thob pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos rdo rje'i tshig gis yang dag par gzung ba dang / chos nyid thams cad brjod pa rab tu dbye ba ye shes dang ldan pa dang / tshig dang yi ge brjod du med pa'i mdzod dang ldan pa dang / chos rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad shin tu bstan pa la gzhag pa dang / gnas par bya ba dang / rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba dang / chos snang ba thams cad kyis 'od rab tu thob pa la 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug par byed pa dang / chos thams cad kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i don dang; tshig dang / yi ge rnam par 'phrul pa'i dbyangs kyi byin gyi rlabs dang ldan pa dang / chags pa med pa'i dbyangs la dbang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi shes pa'i dbyangs dang ldan par gyur cig /

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate the roots of goodness produced by this giving of teaching in this way: they cause all sentient beings to acquire clear beautiful voices, gentle voices, voices like celestial drums, voices capable of articulating innumerable sounds, pleasant voices, pure voices, voices pervading all buddha-fields, voices adorned by countless qualities, far-ranging voices, sonorous voices eliminating all distraction, voices filling the cosmos, voices able to pick up the languages of all sentient beings; and to acquire knowledge of the boundless sounds of all sentient beings, knowledge of all pure sounds of speech, knowledge of infinite sounds of speech, knowledge of the supremely free sound that enters all sounds; and to acquire all pure adorning speech tones, tones which all beings never tire of hearing, speech ultimately not bound to any world, joyful tones, pure tones of the speech of Buddhas, tones of speech expressing all Buddha teachings, unmuffled by delusion, famed everywhere, tones that cause all sentient beings to acquire the adornment of concentration formulations of all the teachings, tones of speech expressing innumerable kinds of teachings, sounds of speech reaching the infinite congregations at enlightenment sites throughout the cosmos, tones of speech containing indestructible expressions of inconceivable truths, speech revealing all facts, speech able to expound the treasury of knowledge of differences in unspeakably many words and phrases, speech that explains all things without attachment or interruption, speech shining with the light of all truths, speech able to cause all worldlings to be purified and ultimately reach universal knowledge, speech that contains the expressions and meanings of all the teachings, free uninhibited speech maintained by spiritual powers, speech of the knowledge which reaches the other shore of all worlds.

dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad mi dma' ba'i dbyangs dang / bag tsha ba med pa'i dbyangs dang / 'dod chags med pa'i tshig gi dbyangs dang / ngag snyan pa'i dbyangs dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad mngon par dga' bar byed pa'i dbyangs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad brjod pa'i dbyangs dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi the tshom gcod cing khong du chud par byed pa'i dbyangs dang / spobs pas legs par sbyar ba'i dbyangs dang / sems can gnyid kyis log pa thams cad sad par byed pa'i dbyangs dam pa yangs pa dang ldan par gyur cig/ ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o// //

“Also by these roots of goodness, they enable all sentient beings to acquire nongroveling speech, fearless speech, unobsessed speech, speech gladdening all congregations at sites of enlightenment, harmonious, beautiful speech, speech able to explain all the principles of buddhahood, speech cutting off the doubts of all sentient beings and causing them to awaken, speech endowed with all powers of analysis and elucidation, speech awakening all sentient beings from their slumber in the long night of ignorance.
bam po bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa/

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sems can thams cad kyi lus rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mtshan rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi las dang rnam par smin pa rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa dang; sems can thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi byang chub kyi sems tshad med pa rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po'i tshul rab tu shes pa rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mos pa rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa chags pa med pa la brtson pa'i smon lam rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rig pa dang / blo dang / ye shes dam pa dang / spobs pa rnam par dag cing kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ste/
sems can thams cad kyi lus rnam pa de ltar yongs su dag cing lus yongs su dag pa shin tu gsal ba rnyog pa med pa/ rnam par dang ba/ rnam par dag pa/ rdul med pa/ dri ma dang bral ba 'od gsal zhing dang ba yid du 'ong ba/ bsgribs pa med pa de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du snang bar gyur cig/ mig yor gyi rnam par dmigs pas 'gro ba thams cad snang bar gyur cig /mig yor gyi gnas kyi rnam pa thams cad snang bar gyur cig /'di lta ste/ dper na/ me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu dag pa la tshigs su mi 'gyur bar gdong du dmigs pa rnam par snang ba de lta bu'i lus yongs su dag pa/ sems can thams cad kyis rab tu thob par gyur cig /sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang dag par ston pa dang / chos yang dag par ston pa dang / yon tan yang dag par ston pa dang / nan tan yang dag par ston pa dang / 'grub pa yang dag par ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul dang / smon lam yang dag par ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad yang dag par ston pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul yang dag par ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas thams cad mkhyen pa yang dag par ston par gyur cig /de ltar yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi rnam pas sems can thams cad ma lus par yongs su bzung ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i bsod nams kyi sku yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur cig /

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate the roots of goodness in this way: ‘May all sentient beings attain the pure reality body free from all faults and ills; may all sentient beings attain pure sublime virtues free from all faults and ills; may all sentient beings attain pure sublime characteristics free from all faults and ills; may all sentient beings attain the pure results of action free from all faults and ills; may all sentient beings attain the pure mind of universal knowledge free from all faults and ills; may all sentient beings attain the infinite pure will for enlightenment free from all faults and ills; may all sentient beings attain impeccable skill in means of comprehending all faculties; may all sentient beings attain impeccable pure faith, may all sentient beings attain impeccable pure diligence in carrying out commitments unimpeded; may all sentient beings attain impeccable pure right mindfulness, knowledge, and powers of analysis and elucidation.’
“Great enlightening beings also dedicate roots of goodness for the sake of all sentient beings to the attainment of various pure subtle bodies—the body of light, the body of freedom from pollution, the body of nonobsession, the body of purity, the body of extreme purity, the body of detachment from objects of sense, the body of ultimate detachment from objects of sense, the body of freedom from defilement, the body of beauty, the body of nonobstruction—manifesting images of action in all worlds, manifesting images of speech in all worlds, manifesting images of construction in all abodes, like a clear mirror in which all kinds of images of forms spontaneously appear, showing sentient beings the practices of enlightenment, showing sentient beings the most profound truths, showing sentient beings all kinds of virtuous qualities, showing sentient beings the path of practice, showing sentient beings developmental practices, showing sentient beings the undertakings of enlightening beings, showing sentient beings in all worlds the appearance in the world of the Buddhas of all worlds, showing sentient beings the spiritual powers and mystical transfigurations of all Buddhas, showing sentient beings the awesome power of the inconceivable liberation of all enlightening beings, showing sentient beings the essence of omniscience fulfilling the practical vows of the enlightening being Universally Good. Great enlightening beings skillfully take care of all sentient beings with such subtle pure bodies and enable them to attain the body of all-knowledge with pure qualities.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi sbyin pas 'byung ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rjes su song ba'i lus kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par gyur cig /'gro ba thams cad kyis blta na don yod cing byang chub kyi sems las phyir mi ldog pa dang / sems can thams cad la mthun par gyur pas bsam pa mi 'khrugs pa dang / bskal pa thams cad du skyo ba med par byang bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par gnas pa dang / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par snying rje chen po rgyun mi gcod pas/ sems can thams cad la dus la bab par chos ston pa mi gtong bas dbang po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dran pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i sems dang ldan pas sems bskyed pa gcig dang yang mi 'bral ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad 'dod cing zhal blta ba'i sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byed pa mi gtong ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa thams cad rjes su med par mi byed cing / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la rab tu dgod pa'i sems kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo thob par bya ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba thams cad kyis chos thams cad la lta zhing sems pa yang dag par len pas chos kyi sprin yang dag par 'dzin pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par gyur cig /sems can thams cad 'jug pa dang / zhing thams cad la 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten dang dus thams cad la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi las dang rnam par smin pa shes pa la 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi thabs mkhas pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mngon par bsgrub pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi ye shes la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / khyu mchog gi mthu la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad la 'jug pa rab tu thob pa la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod par gyur cig /ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate the roots of goodness generated by giving of the teaching to the aspiration to live in all worlds cultivating enlightening practices, so that sentient beings who see them do not do so in vain, but develop the determination for enlightenment without ever regressing, follow the truth unshakably, and in all worlds, throughout all time, live undefatigably by the path of enlightening beings, with great compassion, impartial and universal, as vast as the cosmos, knowing the faculties of sentient beings and ever explaining the truth to them according to the time, always rightly mindful of spiritual friends, never forgetting for an instant, all the Buddhas always appearing before them, their minds always truly aware, never flagging, cultivating roots of goodness without any falsehood, placing all sentient beings in universal knowledge, causing them not to regress, imbued with the light of all the Buddha teachings, holding the clouds of the great teaching, receiving the rain of the great teaching, cultivating the practices of enlightening beings, entering in among all sentient beings, entering all buddha-fields, penetrating all phenomena and principles, penetrating all times, penetrating the knowledge of consequences of all sentient beings, penetrating the knowledge of skillful methods of all enlightening beings, penetrating the knowledge of production of all enlightening beings, penetrating the knowledge of the pure realm of all sentient beings, penetrating the autonomous spiritual powers of all Buddhas, penetrating all the boundless realms of reality, and herein cultivating enlightening practice.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i las dang / chos la brtson pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig kyang rgyan dang lhab lhub brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang ldan zhing chos kyi dbyings tshad med par shin tu yangs par gyur te/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis mngon par sangs rgyas pa thams cad ma lus par de ltar rnam par dag cing 'od gsal ba dang / bzang zhing bsgribs pa med par gyur cig /sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu dmigs pa rnam par dag pa rnams ji ltar gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis yongs su snang ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad du'ang yongs su snang bar gyur cig /sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyang gcig bzung bas yongs su bzung ste/ chos kyi dbyings tshad med par rtogs pa'i rnam par dag pas rnam par dag par gyur cig / 'di lta ste/ rin po che'i rgyan grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /gos rin po che thams cad bting zhing / rin po che sna tshogs grangs med pa thams cad kyi rin po che rnam par dag pa'i gdan kun nas gnas par gyur cig / rin po che thams cad kyi dril bu'i dra ba dang ldan zhing / rin po che'i bla re grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ rin po che thams cad gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas yongs su bzung zhing; rin po che'i gdugs grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /nor gyi dbyig thams cad kyi char rab tu 'bab pa'i rin po che'i sprin grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig; blta na yid du 'ong ba rnam par dag pa'i rin po che'i me tog grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ rin po che sna tshogs kyis skar khung shin tu brgyan cing / rin po che thams cad kyi stegs bu grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /sangs rgyas kyi dbyangs yid du 'ong ba sems can thams cad kyi khams su sgrog cing / rin po che'i dril bu grangs med pa kun nas gnas med par gyur cig /sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi yon tan gyis sems rgyas shing gsal bas rin po che'i pad+mo grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad kyi me tog dang ldan pa'i rin po che'i shing grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /byang chub sems dpa' mang po'i gnas rin po che'i gtsug lag khang grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing thams cad du yid du 'ong bar rgyu ba'i rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ rin po che'i rgyan chen pos spras pa'i rin po che'i ba gam grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i rin po che'i rta babs grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad kyi se mo do las rab tu bkye ba'i rin po che'i 'od zer gyi sgo grangs med pa rnams kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i shing ta la rin po che'i zla gam grangs med pas brgyan pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po ches rnam par dag pa'i rin po che'i skar khung rnam pa sna tshogs grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rab tu grub pas rin po che'i rgyan dang / lhab lhub grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan dang ldan pa'i rin po che'i snying po rab tu brgyan pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /yid du 'ong ba'i rin po ches shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rin po che'i rgyan dang lhab lhub sna tshogs grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /

“Great enlightening beings also dedicate the roots of goodness cultivated by giving of teaching to the aspiration to purify all buddha-lands and adorn them with inexpressibly many embellishments, each buddha-land as vast as the cosmos, purely good, without obstructions, with pure light, the Buddhas manifesting the attainment of true awakening therein, the pure realms in one buddha-land able to reveal all buddha-lands, and as of one buddha-land, so of all buddha-lands, each of those lands adorned with arrays of pure exquisite treasures, as measureless as the cosmos—countless thrones of pure jewels spread with precious robes, countless jeweled curtains and jeweled nets draping, countless precious canopies with all kinds of jewels reflecting each other, countless jewel clouds raining jewels, countless jewel flowers all around, completely pure, countless pure arrays of balustrades made of jewels, countless jewel chimes always emitting the subtle tones of the Buddhas circulating throughout the cosmos, countless jewel lotuses of various jewel colors blooming with glorious radiance, countless jewel trees arrayed in rows all around, with flowers and fruits of innumerable jewels, countless jewel palaces with innumerable enlightening beings living in them, countless jewel mansions, spacious, magnificent, long and wide, far and near, countless jewel ramparts with exquisite jewel ornaments, countless jewel gates hung all around with strings of beautiful jewels, countless jewel windows with pure arrays of inconceivable numbers of jewels, and countless jewel palms, shaped like crescent moons, made of clusters of jewels—all of these embellished with myriad jewels, spotlessly pure, inconceivable, all produced by the roots of goodness of the enlightened, replete with adornments of countless treasuries of jewels.

chos thams cad kyi rgyun shin tu rig par 'bab pa'i rin po che'i chu klung grangs med pa rnams kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ chos rgya mtsho thams cad dang ldan pa'i rin po che'i rgya mtsho grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /chos thams cad kyi me tog puN+Da ri ka rjes su sgrogs pa'i rin po che'i me tog puN+Da ri ka grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ ye shes kyi ri bo shin tu 'phags shing rnam par dag pa'i rin po che'i ri bo grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad kyi srad bu bres pa'i rin po ches mig mangs ris su rnam par phye ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ye shes chen po'i 'od zer gyis chos kyi dbyings thams cad du snang bar byed pa'i rin po che'i 'od thogs pa med par gsal ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ yid du 'ong ba'i sgra snyan par sgrogs pa'i rin po che'i dril bu rab tu dkrol ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig; byang chub kyi sems rin po che dang ldan pas rin po che rnam par dag pas rnam par dpyang ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ rin po che'i kha dog bsam gyis mi khyab cing rnam par dag pa'i snam bu rin po che rab tu dpyang pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che'i zla gam gyi rgyal mtshan gyis rnam par mdzes pa'i rin po che'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad kyi ba dan gyi sprin gyi char mngon par 'bab pa'i rin po che'i ba dan grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /bar snang gi rgyan sna tshogs kyi snam bu rin po che'i lda ldi mngon par bres pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ rin po che sna tshogs reg na bde ba'i rin po che'i gding ba yongs su bting ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yang dag par ston cing / thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyan rnam par sbyong ba'i rin po che'i klong grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs brgya stong thams cad kyis mdzes par gyur pa'i rin po che'i sen mo do rab tu dpyang pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /gnas pa dang mi gnas pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pas rin po che'i khang pa dang / gnas grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ rdo rje rin po ches mdzes par gyur cig/ rin po che'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ grangs med par mthong ba thams cad rnam par dag cing rin po che sna tshogs kyis shin tu brgyan pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad dang ldan zhing / rin po che rnam par dag pas rnam par dpyang pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /chags pa med pa'i lus kyi tshul rnam par dag pas rin po che'i khor yug gis kun nas bskor ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du dri zhim po rjes su song zhing / rin po che'i spos grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ sprul pa re re zhing chos kyi dbyings kyi tshad dang mnyam pas rin po che'i 'phrul ba shin tu sprul pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /snang ba re re las snang ba thams cad ston cing /

There are also countless jewel rivers from which flow all pure good principles; countless jewel seas filled with the water of the teaching; countless jewel lotuses always emitting the sound of the lotus of the sublime teaching; countless jewel polar mountains, monarchs of the mountains of wisdom, standing out completely pure; countless eight-faced jewels, strung on precious threads, incomparably beautiful and clear; countless jewels of pure light always emanating the unimpeded light of great knowledge illumining the entire cosmos; countless jewel chimes striking one another and producing wonderful tones; countless pure jewels filled with jewels of enlightening beings; countless jeweled streamers of many colors hung all around, with radiant, clear colors; countless jeweled banners adorned with jewel crescents; countless jeweled pennants, each one able to shower innumerable jeweled pennants; countless jeweled sashes hanging in the sky, beautifully adorned; countless precious mats able to produce various kinds of subtle pleasant feelings; countless jewel wreaths showing the enlightening beings’ eye of universal knowledge; countless jewel garlands, each garland the superb adornment of a hundred thousand enlightening beings; countless jewel palaces, absolutely peerless; countless jewel ornaments embellished with diamonds; countless ornaments of all kinds of jewels always displaying all pure wonderful colors; countless jewels with different shapes and colors, their lights reflecting with thorough clarity; countless jewel mountains surrounding like a fence all around, with unhindered purity; countless precious scents perfuming all worlds; countless precious magical events, each one pervading the cosmos; countless jewel light beams, each beam manifesting all lights;

rin po che'i snang ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ chos kyi ye shes kyi 'od rnam par dag pa'i rin po che'i 'od grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ 'od zer re res kyang chos kyi dbyings thams cad du khyab par 'gyur ba'i rin po che'i 'od zer nyams pa med pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che'i 'byung gnas thams cad dang ldan pa'i rin po che'i 'byung ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig / chos rin po che'i dbyig thams cad sbyin pa'i rin po che'i mdzod grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyal mtshan shin tu 'phags pa'i rin po che'i dpal grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig / ye shes bzang po chen po rnam par dag pa'i rin po che bzang po grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin la dga' zhing rtse ba'i rin po che'i bza' shing gi ra ba shin tu brgyan pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs kyis 'gro ba thams cad rnam par bstan pa'i rin po che'i dbyangs grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ rin po che thams cad kyi 'bru las chos kyi 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa'i rin po che'i gzugs grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /mtshan thams cad mtshan ma yin pas brgyan pa'i rin po che 'dra ba med pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad kyi rim gro; byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba bskyed pa'i rin po che'i rim gro grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ rin po che thams cad kyis lhun legs par brtsigs pa'i rin po che las bsgrubs pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad kyis shin tu brtan par brgyan pa'i rin po che'i gnas grangs med pa rnams kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gzhal du med pa'i gos bde bar bgo ba rab tu thob pa'i rin po che'i gos dang ldan pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /sems bskyed ma thag tu shin tu mthong ba'i gzungs rab tu thob cing chos gos dang ldan pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /lus rin po che thams cad rnam par smin pa nges par rtogs shing rnam par dag pa'i rin po ches bsgos pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig; mthong ma thag tu chos thams cad kyi tshul shes pa'i mig rnam par dag cing nyams pa med par blta ba'i rin po che grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ ye shes kyi phung pos grub pa'i rin po che'i 'od kyi phung po grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /de bzhin gshegs pa'i seng ge'i gzims kyi nga ros rnam par dag pa'i rin po che'i mal grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ye shes kyi mar me yongs su grub pa'i rin po che'i mar me grangs med pa mang po kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ shing ta la gcig dang gnyis la rin po che'i srad bus mig mangs ris su bris pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rin po che'i shing ta la grangs med pa mang po kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ rin po che'i yal gas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rin po che'i sdong po grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che sna tshogs kyi yal ga dang ldan pa'i rin po che'i shing lo grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bya mang po chos kyi rgyun sgrog pas brgyan pa'i rin po che'i nags tshal grangs med pa kun nas gnas bar gyur cig /ye shes kyi snang ba kun tu gtong ba'i rin po che'i lo ma dang ldan pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa me tog gcig la gnas shing / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rgyu ba'i rin po che'i me tog dang ldan pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes chen po las phyir mi ldog pa'i 'bras bu rab tu thob pa'i rin po che'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /

there are also countless jewel lights, the lights of pure knowledge, comprehensively illumining all things, and countless unimpeded jewel lights, each pervading the cosmos; there are countless jewel places where there are all kinds of precious substances, and countless jewel treasuries revealing all the treasuries of the true teaching; countless jewel banners emblematic of the enlightened standing out on high; countless precious saints, images of saints of great knowledge, thoroughly pure; countless gardens of jewels producing the bliss of meditation of enlightening beings; countless precious sounds, the wondrous voice of the enlightened teaching all the world; countless jewel forms, each one emanating countless lights of sublime doctrines; countless precious marks, each one transcending common characteristics; countless precious modes of bearing, all who see which develop the joy and rapture of enlightening beings; countless collections of jewels, all who see which develop a collection of jewels of wisdom; countless precious peaceful abodes, all who see which develop a precious well-stabilized mind; countless precious garments, those who wear which develop the peerless concentration of enlightening beings; countless precious vestments, those who wear which attain the spell of good vision as soon as they wish; countless jewel practices, those who see which know that all ‘jewels’ are results of action, definitively pure; countless precious unhindered insights, those who perceive which can realize all pure objective vision; countless treasuries of jewel lights, those who see which immediately can attain the treasury of great knowledge; countless jewel thrones with Buddhas sitting on them like great lions roaring; countless jewel lamps always radiating the light of pure knowledge; countless jewel trees arrayed in rows, wound with jewel ropes, their adornments thoroughly pure, also having countless jewel trunks, standing high, straight, round, and clean, countless jewel boughs, thick with adornments, with inconceivable numbers of birds flying around and gathering there, always warbling beautiful songs expressing the true teachings, countless jewel leaves emitting the light of great knowledge pervading everywhere, countless jewel flowers, with innumerable enlightening beings sitting on each blossom, traveling throughout the cosmos, and countless jewel fruits, those who see which will attain the fruit of nonregression from all-knowledge;

grong gi chos thams cad yongs su spangs par gnas pa'i rin po che'i grong grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad kyis yog pa'i sems can gyis gang zhing rin po che'i 'byung gnas grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /mthu bo che dpa' bo chos kyi go cha brtan pa bgos pas byang chub sems dpa'i sems phyir mi ldog pa dang ldan pa'i rgyal po'i gnas rin po che grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /sems kyi gnas thams cad las rnam par 'das pas rab tu gang ba'i rin po che'i gnas grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig ;yongs su shes pa'i gos thams cad rab tu bgo ba'i gos rin po che grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /khyim med par rab tu byung ba'i byang chub sems dpas yongs su gang zhing rin po che'i 'byung gnas kyi gnas grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ blta na yid du 'ong ba rin po che dang ldan pa'i mthun pa'i rin po che grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes kyi 'od 'phro ba rab tu gtong ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu sprul pa rab tu bskor ba'i rin po che'i 'khor lo grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rin po che thams cad kyi shing rnam par dag pa mig 'phrul gyi rnam pa shin tu dag pa'i rin po che'i shing grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /blta na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che shin tu rnam par bkram pa'i rin po che'i sa rnam par dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs chos kyi dbyings thams cad du sgrog pa'i rin po che'i rol mo brdung ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur byin gyi rlabs rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rin po che'i rol mo dkrol ba grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /chos rin po che rnams yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems can rin po che grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /bsod nams rin po che dang ldan pa'i lus rin po che rnam par dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /chos rin po che rab tu brjod pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngag rin po che grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /thams cad mkhyen par smon pa'i bsam pa rin po che rab tu thob pa'i sems yongs su byang ba rin po che grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rin po che'i stobs rmongs pa med pa la rten pa'i dran pa rin po che yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rin po che bzung ba dang / yang dag par bcang ba'i byin gyi rlabs yod pa'i rig pa rin po che rnam par dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi mdzod nges par rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i blo gros rin po che yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /thams cad mkhyen pa'i rin po che shin tu yangs pas rgyas par 'gengs pa'i blo rin po che tshad med pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig / stobs bcu rin po che thams cad nyams pa med pa'i mig rin po che yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad du mnyan pa rnam par dag pa'i rna ba rin po che yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /mthun pa'i dri rin po che rnam par dag pa'i sna rin po che yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /mtha' dang dbus med pa'i tshig gi tshul thams cad rnam par ston pa'i lce yangs pa rin po che grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med par 'gro ba'i lus rin po che yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam la brtson pa'i yid rin po che yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /dbyangs rin po che rnam par dag pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyas par 'gengs pa'i dbyangs rin po che yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ye shes rin po che sngon du 'gro ba'i lus kyi las rin po che grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ ye shes rin po che bsgribs pa med pa la brtson pas ngag gi las rin po che yang dag par yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig / chags pa med pa'i ye shes rin po che'i mthar thug pa'i yid kyi las rin po che yangs shing yongs su dag pa grangs med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/

also there are countless jewel villages, those who see which give up the ways of worldly habitats; countless jewel cities filled with free beings, countless palaces with monarchs in them who are endowed with the godlike body of enlightening beings, courageous and steadfast, wearing the armor of the truth, their minds unshrinking; countless jewel houses, those who enter which can eliminate the mind of attachment to house and home; countless jewel garments, those who wear which can foster the understanding of nonattachment; countless jewel palaces filled with enlightening beings who have left home; countless jewel curios which bring immeasurable joy to those who see them; countless jewel wheels emanating inconceivable lights of knowledge, turning the wheel that never turns back; countless jewel trees adorned with Indra nets, all pure; countless jeweled grounds, inlaid with inconceivably many jewels; countless jewel pipes, their clear sounds filling the cosmos; countless jewel drums, their wondrous sounds beating in harmony unbroken throughout the eons; countless jewel sentient beings, all able to bear the jewel of the unexcelled teaching, with countless jewel bodies replete with innumerable jewels of virtuous qualities, countless jewel mouths always uttering the voice of the jewels of all the sublime teachings, countless jewel minds endowed with the jewel of pure intention set on great knowledge, jewel mindfulness cutting off all folly and ultimately solidifying the jewel of universal knowledge, jewel superknowledges reciting and retaining the jewels of all Buddha teachings, jewel intellects understanding with certainty the treasure of all Buddha teachings, jewel knowledges attaining the jewel of great complete omniscience, jewel eyes mirroring the treasure of the ten powers without obstruction, jewel ears hearing the infinite sounds of the whole realm of reality clearly and without obstruction, jewel noses always smelling the pure jewel fragrance of harmony, jewel tongues able to enunciate countless rules of speech, jewel bodies traveling unhindered throughout the ten directions, jewel minds always diligently cultivating the practical vows of Universal Good, jewel voices, clear and beautiful, pervading the worlds in the ten directions, jewel acts guided by knowledge, jewel speech always explaining the cultivation of the jewel of unobstructed knowledge, and jewel thought attaining the treasure of unimpeded great knowledge, which is ultimately complete.

sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig dang / yul gcig dang / phyogs gcig dang / skra'i mchog ma'i rtse mo re re zhing yang de ltar skye mched kyi ye shes rnam par dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa nas/ byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa grangs dang / bgrang ba las 'das pas kun tu gang bar gyur cig /phyogs gcig tu ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad kyang yongs su gang bar gyur cig /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag rin po che'i dmigs pas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig bzung bas bsdus te/ spos rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyi spos kyi rgyan tshad med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /gzhung de ltar rin po che ji lta ba de bzhin du spos su bsngo ba yang khong du chud par byas te/ ye shes kyi spos chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i spos kyi yid kyi las rgya chen po yongs su dag pa/ tshad med pa'i bar du kun nas gnas par gyur cig /de bzhin du me tog sna tshogs thams cad kyi me tog gi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ces bya ba nas ye shes kyi me tog chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i yid kyi las me tog rgya che zhing yongs su dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /phreng ba dang / byug pa sna tshogs thams cad kyi phreng ba dang / byug pa'i rgyan mtshungs pa med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ces bya ba nas ye shes kyi phreng ba dang / byug pa chags pa med pa'i mtha' thug pa'i yid kyi las kyi phreng ba dang / byug pa'i rgyan rnam par dag pa mtshungs pa med pa'i bar du kun nas gnas par gyur cig /phye ma dang / bdug pa sna tshogs thams cad kyi phye ma dang bdug pa'i rgyan sa mtshams med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ces bya ba nas ye shes kyi phye ma dang / bdug pa chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i yid kyi las kyi phye ma dang / bdug pa yongs su dag pa sa mtshams med pa'i bar du kun nas gnas par gyur cig /gos dang / chos gos sna tshogs thams cad kyi gos dang / chos gos kyi rgyan mu med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ces bya ba nas ye shes kyi gos dang / chos gos kyi rgyan chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i yid kyi las khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i gos dang / chos gos yongs su dag pa mu med pa'i bar du kun nas gnas par gyur cig /zhing thams cad du gdugs sna tshogs yang dag par btsugs pa'i gdugs kyi rgyan sa mtshams med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ces bya ba nas ye shes kyi gdugs kyi rgyan chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i yid kyi las ye shes kyis yang dag par khyab pa yongs su dag pa sa mtshams med pa'i bar du kun nas gnas par gyur cig /rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sna tshogs thams cad kyi rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyi rgyan tshad med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ces bya ba nas ye shes kyi rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i yid kyi las kyi ye shes kyi rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyi rgyan yongs su dag pa tshad med pa'i bar du kun nas gnas par gyur cig /lhab lhub sna tshogs thams cad kyi lhab lhub kyi rgyan brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /ces bya ba nas ye shes kyi lhab lhub kyi rgyan gyi mthar thug pa'i yid kyi las kyi ye shes kyi lhab lhub kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa rnam par dag pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar du kun nas gnas par gyur cig /de ltar tshul de bzhin du thams cad du yang shes par bya ste/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag las sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig bzung bas bsdus te/ nor bu rin po che sna tshogs thams cad kyi nor bu rin po che'i rgyan brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig/ ces bya ba nas nor bu rin po che thams cad kyi shing kun tu bres pa'i nor bu rin po che'i gdan rnam par dag pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa kun nas gnas par gyur cig /de ltar tshul de bzhin du kun tu byas te dmigs pa re re zhing lan brgyar bzlas par bya'o/ / ye shes kyi nor bu rin po che chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i yid kyi las kyi ye shes kyi nor bu rin po che rnam par dag pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar du gnas par gyur cig /ces

“The great enlightening beings vow that in all those buddha-lands, in each direction of each buddha-land, in each and every place, even so minute as a hairtip, there be incalculable, boundless, unspeakable numbers of great enlightening beings, all accomplished in pure clear knowledge, filling everywhere, in every point of space in every place in every direction of every buddha-land throughout the cosmos. This is great enlightening beings’ dedication of roots of goodness vowing that all the buddha-lands should be replete with all kinds of precious adornments, as extensively told of the jewel ornaments, that they should have such adornments of fragrances, flowers, garlands, perfumes, incenses, aromatic powders, robes, parasols and canopies, banners, pennants, crystals, and so on, a hundredfold more, all like the ‘jewel’ ornaments.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis bsgrubs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad yongs su dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid mi 'khrugs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ bsod nams kyi stobs thub pa med pa rnam par dag pa dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ bsod nams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa zil gyis ma non pa bstan pa dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ mi zad pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos la gzud pa dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ tshig gi rnam pa grangs med pa shin tu dag pa'i dbyangs dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ thogs pa med pa'i mig gis chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa shes par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad rjes su dran pa rnam par dag pa dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ bsgribs pa med pa'i blo gros chen pos chos nges par rtogs pa'i mdzod dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ byang chub mtha' dang dbus med pas chos kyi dbyings rgyas par dgang ba la chags pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pas rnam par dbye ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las yon tan thams cad kyi rgyan dang ldan pa rnam par dag pa dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pas 'byung ba dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rgyud kyi tshul gcig cing rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa dang / goms par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ shes pa thams cad rnam par dpyad pa la 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ mi mnyam pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su bsngo ba dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ lhag pa'i bsam pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnam pa tha dad pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ dkar po'i phyogs thams cad bsgrub cing brtan par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ skad cig gcig gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i mthar thug par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir/ nan tan gyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/

“Great enlightening beings dedicate the roots of goodness amassed by such practices as the giving of teaching to nurturing all roots of goodness; to purifying all buddha-lands; to fully developing all sentient beings; to causing all sentient beings’ minds to be pure and imperturbable; to causing all sentient beings to enter the most profound Buddha teaching; to causing all sentient beings to attain unsurpassable pure qualities; to causing all sentient beings to attain indestructible power of pure virtue; to causing all sentient beings to attain inexhaustible power of knowledge, liberate all living beings, and enable them to enter buddhahood; to causing all sentient beings to attain impartial, inexhaustible, pure speech; to causing all sentient beings to attain the equanimous unobstructed eye and achieve knowledge equal to the entire cosmos throughout space; to causing sentient beings to attain pure recollection and know all worlds of past ages; to causing all sentient beings to attain unobstructed great knowledge and be able to comprehend with certainty all treasuries of truths; to causing all sentient beings to attain unlimited, immeasurable great enlightenment, pervading the cosmos without any hindrance; to causing all sentient beings to attain impartial, nondiscriminatory, homogeneous roots of goodness; to causing all sentient beings to attain pure physical, verbal, and mental action adorned with all virtues; to causing all sentient beings to accomplish action the same as Universally Good; to causing all sentient beings to be able to enter all homogeneously pure buddha-fields; to causing all sentient beings to examine universal knowledge, penetrate it, and fulfill it; to causing all sentient beings to be able to avoid partial roots of goodness; to causing all sentient beings to attain equanimous, unvarying will, gradually fulfilling all-knowledge; to causing all sentient beings to be able to live steadily by all good principles; to causing all sentient beings to instantly realize universal knowledge and reach the ultimate; to causing all sentient beings to be able to fulfill the pure path of omniscience—this is wherein they dedicate their roots of goodness.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsngos nas/ chos thams cad yongs su dag par chos bstan pa'i tshul gyis chos nyid kyi stobs mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis chos rgya mtsho brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa thob pa rnam par dag pa'i spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang ldan par gyur cig /ces yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos rgya mtsho de dag las chos rgya mtsho re re zhing yang chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / tshig thams cad rab tu dbye bas shin tu bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos 'byams klas pa mtha' dbus med pa thams cad dang / chos kyi snang ba thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dus gsum dang mi 'gal ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spobs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de sangs rgyas la dga' ba dang / chos la dga' ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir/ snying rje chen po la dga' ba las phyir mi ldog pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de las kyi rnam pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa thams cad kyi sems dang dbang po dang bar bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de zhing gi rgyud snrel zhi dang / spyi'u tshugs su rgyu ba thams cad shin tu bstan pa dang / phra ba dang / rgya che ba dang / yangs pa dang / dog pa dang / tha gru che ba sna tshogs dang / rnam par dag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo rgyun mi 'chad par mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par bskor ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de sems bskyed pa'i skad cig re re dang / mi 'jigs pa gzhan dang gzhan tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pas chos snang ba gsar pa/ gsar ba rab tu thob cing bstan pa dang bshad pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad tshol ba la lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / dbang po ma 'khrugs shing mi dma' bas/ chos 'byams klas pa thams cad ma lus par mngon par shes pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi rdzu 'phrul thob pas sems can gyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'byams klas pa thams cad mngon par dga' ba dang / tshim par chos thams cad rab tu bstan pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa thams cad du song ba'i yongs su bsngo ba la gnas shing 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste/ chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i lus kyi las kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i ngag gi las kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i yid kyi las kyis yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i gzugs mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i phung po mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i khams mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i skye mched mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i nang mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i phyi rol mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i brtsams pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i sbyor ba mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i mos pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i dbang po mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i zhing thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o// chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i 'gro ba thams cad du snang ba mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o// chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dul ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i chos thams cad mi gnyis pa'i dbyings mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med par song ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Once great enlightening beings have dedicated their roots of goodness in this way for the sake of all living beings, they also dedicate these roots of goodness because they want to fulfill and expound the power of all pure practical methods; because they want to achieve the spiritual power of pure practice and comprehend unspeakably many oceans of truths; because they want to be imbued with infinite lights of pure knowledge, equal to the cosmos, in each ocean of truths; because they want to analyze and explain the different expressions and meanings of all teachings; because they want to accomplish the boundless vast concentration of the lights of all teachings; because they want to follow the powers of elucidation of the Buddhas of past, present, and future; because they want to develop the free body of all Buddhas of past, present, and future; because they respect the admirable unhindered state of all Buddhas; in order to fulfill the heart of great compassion and rescue all sentient beings without ever retreating; because they want to achieve the mind of unobstructed knowledge of infinite differentiations, untainted purity of senses, and enter all congregations in all sites of enlightenment; because they want to always turn the wheel of the impartial, nonregressive teaching in all buddha-lands, whether inverted or upright, coarse or subtle, broad or narrow, small or large, tainted or pure; because they want to attain fearlessness in every moment, without end, all kinds of analytic and expository skills, and the light of the sublime teaching, to reveal and explain the truth; in order to happily seek all goodness, to learn and practice with determination, all faculties growing better, to attain the great spiritual knowledge of all truths; because they want to draw near to and provide offerings at all congregations’ enlightenment sites, and expound the teachings to all sentient beings to make them joyful.
“Great enlightening beings also dedicate these roots of goodness in this way: they dedicate them by abiding in abodes infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in physical action infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in verbal action infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in mental action infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of matter infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of sensation, perception, patterning, and consciousness infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of aggregates infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of elements infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of sense media infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in internal equality infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in external equality infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of impulses infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of wills infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of means of liberation infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in equality of inclinations infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of faculties infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in equality of beginnings, middles, and ends infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of acts and consequences infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of defilement and purity infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of living beings infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of buddha-fields infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of phenomena infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of mundane lights infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of Buddhas and enlightening beings infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of practices and vows infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of emancipations of enlightening beings infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of teaching and training of enlightening beings infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of nonduality of realms of reality infinite as the cosmos, by abiding in the equality of sites of enlightenment and congregations of Buddhas, infinite as the cosmos.
