de de ltar yongs su bsngo bas/ chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dang mnyam pa'i lus yongs su dag pa kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dang mnyam pa'i dgra yongs su dag pa kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dang mnyam pa'i sems yongs su dag par kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dang mnyam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam yongs su dag pa kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dang mnyam ba'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dang mnyam pa'i chos thams cad bstan pa dang brjod pas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad go bar bya ba yongs su dag pa kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par chos kyi dbyings la yang dag par gzhol ba'i tshul gyis lus 'byams klas pa rjes su 'gro bar kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ / chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dang mnyam pa'i chos snang ba mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad dang / mi 'jigs pa rnam par dag pa'i tshig gcig brjod pas sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi the tshom gcod cing / sems dang / dbang po dang / bsam pa khong du chud par byed pas tshim par byed pa dang / bla na med pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi che ba nyid dang / ye shes la 'jug pa shin tu 'phags pa dang / chos mngon par shes pa la gnas par bya ba kun nas gnas par 'gyur te/

“When great enlightening beings practice dedication in this way, they abide in equal pure embodiments infinite as the cosmos, they abide in equal pure speech infinite as the cosmos, they abide in equal pure minds infinite as the cosmos, they abide in equal pure commitments of enlightening beings infinite as the cosmos, they abide in equal pure sites of enlightenment of congregations infinite as the cosmos, they abide in pure knowledge infinite as the cosmos equally explaining things for all enlightening beings, they abide in bodies infinite as the cosmos equally able to enter into all worlds in the cosmos, they abide in equal pure fearlessness of the light of all truths able to cut away the nets of doubts of all sentient beings with one voice, gladdening them in accord with their faculties and inclinations, abiding in the ways of emancipation, the great virtues and spiritual powers and fearlessness of knowledge of all sciences of liberation.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bsngo ba chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa zhes bya ba bcu pa ste/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsngo ba des yongs su bsngos na/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su rdzogs pa thob par 'gyur ro/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mtha' gtugs pa thams cad yongs su dag pa thob par 'gyur ro/ / sems can thams cad kyis kyang rab tu thob par bya ba la brtson par byed par 'gyur ro/ / chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i ye shes mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro/ / sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad kyi skad cig re re la sangs rgyas bskyed pa thams cad mthong ba rab tu thob cing khong du chud par 'gyur ro/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rgya chen po'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / bsgribs pa med pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad rnam par dag par byed pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad byin gyis brlab cing brtan par byed pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / shin tu bstan pa brjod du med pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / dus thams cad du rnam par 'phrul pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes dang phyir mi ldog pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad ma lus par rgyas par 'gengs pa la 'jug cing khong du chud par 'gyur ro/ / kun tu bzang po'i mig mtha' dang dbus med pa mngon par bsgrubs pa yongs su rdzogs pa thob par 'gyur ro/ / de mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos bstan pa chags pa med pa'i rna ba'i ye shes khong du chud pa yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ro/ / chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad lus kyi skyil mo krung gcig gis yongs su rgyas par byin gyis rlob kyang sems can thams cad la gnod pa med par byed par 'gyur ro/ / dus gsum mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad la 'jug pa'i ye shes 'byams klas pa yongs su rdzogs pa thob cing khong du chud par 'gyur ro/ / blo mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / sems can thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / skye mched yongs su shes pa'i ye shes thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad la 'jug cing rgyas par 'gengs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / sems can gyi ris dang / skye gnas rnam pa sna tshogs su gyur pa thams cad nas byung ba'i sgra dang / smra ba dang / skad thams cad ma lus pa la mngon sum gyi ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par rnam pa mtha' yas pa'i 'od zer dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu gtong zhing mtha' dang dbus med pa snang bar byed pa rnam par dag pa dang / dus gsum thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ma lus par mngon par bsgrub pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dang dbus med pa ma lus pa thams cad la skad cig gcig tu 'jug pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad ma lus pa la 'jug pas 'gro ba mtha' dang dbus med pa rnam par dag par bya ba rab tu thob par 'gyur ro/ / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o/ / rab tu sgrub bo/ / rnam par dag par byed do/ / mnyam par byed do; ; mngon sum du byed do/ / rab tu rtogs par byed do/ / khong du chud par byed do/ / yang dag par sems par byed do/ / rnam par dag pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par bya ba rjes su thob par byed do/ / de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g.yos te/ g.yos so/ / rab tu g.yos so/ / kun tu g.yos so/ / 'gul to/ / rab tu 'gul to/ / kun tu 'gul to/ / ldeg go /rab tu ldeg go/ kun tu ldeg go /chem chem/ rab tu chem chem/ kun tu chem chem mo/ / 'ur 'ur/ rab tu 'ur 'ur/ kun tu 'ur 'ur ro/ / shig shig /rab tu shig shig /kun tu shig shig go /sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / chos nyid rab tu thob pas lha rdzas kyi me tog gi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi phreng ba'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi phye ma'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi gos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi lhab lhub kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi spos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi dus dang mthun pa'i tsan+dan gyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi sbrul gyi snying po'i tsan+dan mchog gi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi lha'i lus grangs med pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi dbyangs kyi yan lag brgya stong brjod du med pa'i tshig dang / brjod pa la rtog pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa yid du 'ong bar spyod pa'i chos chen po'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi de bzhin gshegs pas bstod pa'i sangs rgyas bsngags pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi legs so/ / zhes bya ba dang / lhung lhung ldegs kyi sgra 'byin pa dang / dga' bar byed pa'i dbyangs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi lha'i lus bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med cing brjod du med pas rab tu btud do/ / lha yul gyi lha grangs med pa sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la brtson par yid la byed cing de bzhin gshegs pa la shin tu dad pa'i sems kyi rgyud dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang mi 'bral ba'i sems kyis mngon par gnas so/ / lha rdzas kyi rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba'i sgra lha'i glu'i dbyangs kyi tshul grangs med par grag pa de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing yid la bya ba la brtson pa rnams kyang rab tu bsgrags so/ / lha rdzas las shin tu 'das pa'i 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi tha gru thams cad rab tu snang bas khyab par byas so/ / lha rdzas las 'das pa'i sprul pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul grangs med pa bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i cho 'phrul rnams kyang yang dag par bstan par gyur to/ / gling bzhi pa 'di dga' ldan gyi gnas su lha'i dbang po rab dga' ldan gyi khang pa na ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang phyogs bcu rgyas par bkang zhing chos bstan pa 'di nyid kun tu byung ngo/ /

This is great enlightening beings’ tenth dedication, dedication as infinite as the cosmos.
“When great enlightening beings dedicate all roots of goodness, such as giving of teaching, in this way, they fulfill the infinite, boundless commitment of Universal Good, are able to purify all buddha-fields throughout the cosmos, equal to space, and cause all sentient beings to also attain such fully developed boundless knowledge, understand all truths, in every moment see all Buddhas appearing in the world, and in every moment see all Buddhas’ infinite boundless powers—vast powers, powers of nonattachment, powers of unimpeded freedom, powers to purify all sentient beings, powers to structure all worlds, powers to manifest all languages, powers to appear appropriately in accord with the time, powers dwelling in irreversible spiritual knowledge, powers to explain all realms of reality exhaustively, powers producing the boundless eye of the enlightening being Universally Good, powers of hearing the true teachings of infinite Buddhas with unobstructed ear consciousness, powers to pervade the infinite cosmos with one body while sitting still without crowding the sentient beings, powers of penetration of all the infinite phenomena of past, present, and future by means of complete knowledge. They also realize infinite purities — purity of all sentient beings; purity of all buddha-fields; purity of all things; purity of comprehensive knowledge of all realms; purity of boundless knowledge pervading the realm of space; purity of knowledge of all different vocal sounds, using various kinds of verbal expression adapted to all sentient beings; purity of radiance of infinite spheres of light illuminating all the boundless worlds; purity of knowledge producing the practices of all enlightening beings of past, present, and future; purity of knowledge instantly entering the sites of enlightenment of congregations of all Buddhas of past, present, and future; purity of entering into all worlds, boundless though they be, and causing all sentient beings to do what they should do — in all these they attain fulfillment, completion, accomplishment, equanimity, actualization, direct knowledge, and true realization, having seen into all of them, attained purity in all respects, and reached the other shore.”
At that point, by the spiritual power of the Buddha, in each of the ten directions as many worlds as atoms in a million buddha-lands quaked in six ways — trembling, trembling all over, trembling equally all over; rising, rising all over, rising equally all over; surging, surging all over, surging equally all over; shaking, shaking all over, shaking equally all over; roaring, roaring all over, roaring equally all over; crashing, crashing all over, crashing equally all over. Because of the Buddha’s spiritual power, and by natural law, it rained celestial flowers, celestial garlands, celestial incense powders, celestial mixed perfumes, celestial raiment, celestial gems, celestial ornaments, celestial crystals, celestial aloe wood, celestial sandalwood incense, celestial parasols of surpassing beauty, all kinds of celestial banners, multicolored celestial pennants, countless celestial bodies, innumerable billions of unspeakable numbers of celestial sounds of the wonderful teaching, inconceivably many celestial voices praising Buddha, countless celestial sounds of joyful eulogy. Innumerable celestials bowed in respect, countless celestial children constantly remembranced the Buddhas and the immeasurable rare virtues of the Enlightened Ones, countless celestial children made music and sang hymns of praise to offer the Enlightened, countless billions of celestials emanated great lights illuminating all buddha-fields in the entire cosmos throughout space, revealing countless realms of Buddhas and disguised bodies of the Enlightened, surpassing all celestial beings.
As such a teaching was expounded in the palace of the Tushita heaven of happiness and satisfaction in this world, so it was in the celestial palaces of the Tushita heavens in all worlds throughout the ten directions.

sangs rgyas kyi mthus phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi pha rol dag nas kyang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' lhags nas phyogs bcu bkang ste 'di skad zer ro/ /
kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar khyod kyis yongs su bsngo ba'i chos nyid 'di bshad pa legs so; ; legs so/ /
kye/ rgyal ba'i sras/ bdag cag kun kyang ming rdo rje rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba sha stag ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ming rdo rje'i 'od ces bya ba dag na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan rdo rje dpal zhes bya ba bzhugs pa dag gis drung nas 'dir phyin te/ kun na yang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'khor gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag na/ tshig 'di dag dang / yi ge 'di dag dang / go bar bya ba 'di dag gis don 'di nyid lhag pa med cing chad pa med par brjod de/ chos 'di nyid ston to/ / kye/ rgyal ba'i sras/ bdag cag kyang de ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams re re'i gling bzhi pa dag gi dga' ldan gyi gnas kyi lha'i rgyal po rab dga' ldan gyi khang pa rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan ces bya ba dag tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams phyin pa mngon du mthong ba sha stag sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'khor 'dir phyin to/ /

Then, again by the spiritual power of Buddha, there assembled as many enlightening beings as atoms in a million buddha-fields from beyond as many worlds as atoms in a million buddha-fields in each of the ten directions, filling all quarters, all saying “Good, good! Child of Buddha, you have ably explained these great dedications. We all have the same name—Diamond Banner—and all have come here from the presence of Diamond Banner Buddhas in worlds in Diamond Light. In those worlds we expound this teaching by the spiritual power of Buddha, and the congregations, the followings, the expressions and doctrines are all like this, no more and no less: we have all come from those lands, empowered by the Buddhas, to stand as witnesses for you. And we have come to this assembly to be your witnesses, so also do the hosts of enlightening beings come to all the jewel-adorned halls of the palaces of the Tushita heavens in all worlds in the ten directions to be witnesses in the same way.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan gyis phyogs bcur bltas te/ 'khor thams cad la bltas nas chos kyi dbyings la rnam par blta ba dang / don dang tshig dang yi ge la rab tu 'jug pa dang / sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med par yangs pa yongs su sgom pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la snying rje chen pos khyab par bya ba dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs su sems yang dag par 'brel bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus yang dag par bskyed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yang dag par shes par bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar bskyed pa'ang ji ltar dus la bab pa la yang dag par blta ba dang / chos kyi lus kyi rjes su song ba'i gzugs kyi lus yang dag par bstan par byed cing / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Then the enlightening being Diamond Banner, spiritually empowered by Buddha, looked over all the congregations in the ten directions, reaching throughout the cosmos; knowing expression and meaning well, he expanded his great mind, with great compassion covering all beings, fixing his mind on the lineage of the Buddhas of past, present, and future and dwelling steadily thereon, he entered into the ways to the qualities of all Buddhas, and attained the body of freedom of the Buddhas. He observed the inclinations of the minds of sentient beings as well as all the roots of goodness they had planted, knowing them all distinctly, and in accord with the body of reality he manifested for them bodies of pure sublime forms. Then at this time he uttered verses saying,

de dag chos la rab tu mkhas gyur cing / / chos rgyud mtha' yas rnam par dag byas nas; ; chos kyi 'od byed chos la kha lo sgyur/ / chos rnams rab rtogs chags pa med pa thob/ /
de dag chos kyi kha lo sgyur gyur te/ / shin tu dkon pa'i chos rnams ston byed cing; / chos kyi sgo la rab tu gzhag bya bar/ / sems can mtha' yas phyogs su go bar byed/ /
de dag chos kyi gangs chen mtsho 'thung zhing / / chos nyid sprin char phyogs su rab tu 'bebs/ / 'jig rten khams su chos nyid nyi shar cing / / sems can phan phyir chos rnams ston par byed/ /
de dag shin tu dkon pa'i sbyin bdag ste/ / chos kyi rnam tshul shes pa rjes su thob/ / chos kyi snang bas rab tu sems gsal ba/ / 'jigs med 'jig rten dag tu chos rab ston/ /
shin tu dri med chos kyi sems dang ldan/ / chos kyi sgo la de dag rab tu gnas/ / chos rnams rgya mtsho de dag shin tu 'phags/ / 'jig rten dag tu chos nyid rnga yang brdung / /
de dag shin tu dkon pa'i chos brjod cing / / chos nyid bsod nams yang dag gsog par byed/ / chos nyid bsam pa yongs su dag byed cing / / chos kyi gter rnams 'gro ba kun la ston/ /
chos kyi khang bar rgyal bas dbang bskur ba/ / chos nyid ye shes snying po'i lus dang ldan/ / chos kyi mtshan gzhi rtogs pa'i ye shes can/ / de dag chos nyid bzang po'i chos la gnas/ /
rgyal ba kun gyis gang la bstod mdzad dang / / rab kyi phul gyis gang zhig gnang gyur cing / / skyes dbang thams cad gang gis bskyed gyur pa'i; ; sbyin pa dam pa de dag sbyin par byed/ /
de dag chos kyi lus ldan shes dang ldan/ / 'jig rten mkhas pas chos nyid sprul mdzad pas/ / chos kyi sgron ma 'gro la phan pa'i phyir/ / dma' ba med par mtha' yas chos ston te/ /
de dag chos bzang dam pa sbyin byas nas/ / dge rtsa de dag rjes su sems byed cing / / 'jig rten dag tu dge ba gang byas pa/ / de dag yongs bsngo'i shes dang ldan pa yin/ /
rang byung thams cad gang gis bskyed gyur pa'i/ / dge rtsa de dag 'gro ba'i don du shes/ / thams cad rnam phye rnam par dag gyur cig / sangs rgyas rgyan gyi pha rol phyin par byed/ /
zhing gi rgyan mang shin tu rgya che zhing / / phyogs rnams kun tu de la tshad med pas/ / 'jig rten kun tu bsam yas rgyan ldan pa/ / de 'drar zhing rnams ma lus kun gyur cig /
skyes bu 'dul ba'i ye shes ji tsam pa/ / de 'drar sems can rnam dag ldan gyur te/ / rgyal ba'i sras po bzang po ji bzhin du/ / yon tan kun gyis sems brgyan ldan gyur cig /
de dag rnam 'phrul shin tu rnam yangs pa/ / gang gis 'jig rten ma lus rgyas gang ba/ / de yi spyod la shes rab bzang gnas par/ / sems can thams cad ma lus 'gyur bar shog /
ji snyed 'jig rten ma lus gang yang rung / / phyogs su rgyal ba kun gyis sangs rgyas pa/ / kun kyang kun tu bzang po ji bzhin du/ / legs spyod dam pa mchog dang ldan gyur cig /
yon tan rgyud rnams ji snyed gang yang rung / / rgyal sras rnams dang rgyal bas thugs chud pa'i/ / yon tan gang la mtha' dang dbus med pa/ / yon tan de 'drar sems can kun gyur cig /
gang yang rdzu 'phrul stobs dang ldan pa rnams/ / 'jug pa kun la bslab pa kun bslabs pa/ / rnam 'phrul thams cad yang dag ston pa rnams/ / phyogs rnams thams cad rgyas par 'dod gyur cig /
sems kyi skad cig gcig gis rang byung rnams/ / 'dren pa sems can kun dang mnyam mthong ste/ / chos rnams thams cad ma lus bsdu byas shing / / skra rtse gcig tu mi mgon sdud gyur cig /
'jig rten 'di na 'gro ba gang rgyu ba/ / gang rnams mi yi dam pas mkhyen gyur pa/ / de dang mnyam pa thams cad ma lus pa'i/ / 'jig rten mkhyen la mchod pa byed gyur cig /
spos kyi rgyud dang de bzhin me tog dang / / gos kyi rgyud dang de bzhin gdugs rnams kyis/ / chos dbyings ma lus rgyas par gang byas shing / / 'jig rten kun tu yid kyis 'gengs gyur cig /
sangs rgyas mtshan gyi rnam pa bsam yas pa/ / skra rtse gcig tu thams cad bsdu ba yis/ / lhag ma med par lam rnams kun bsdus shing / / 'jig rten sgron la phyag 'tshal gyur par shog /
rgyal ba de dag kun la phyag 'tshal te/ / thams cad lus kyis tshul gyis 'dud byed cing / / phyogs rnams kun tu rgyal ba kun ston pas/ / phyi ma'i bskal kun zad par byed gyur cig /
sems can snyed kyi yid kyi rnam pa yis/ / rgyal ba gcig la'ang mchod pa byed gyur cig / ji ltar rgyal ba gcig mchod de bzhin du/ / skyes dbang ma lus kun la'ang mchod gyur cig /
de dag mchod pa'i yon tan brjod byed pas/ / 'gro ba kun du bskal ba zad gyur kyang / / skyes bu 'dul ba dpe zla med pa yi/ / rgyal ba mchod pa'i mthar thug med gyur cig /
'gro ba kun na bskal mang ji snyed pa/ / de snyed bskal pa spyad pa spyod byed cing / / rgyal ba gcig la rim gro bya bas kyang / / bskal pa thams cad ma lus zad gyur cig /
rgyal ba gcig la ji tsam brjod gyur pa/ / rgyal ba kun la'ang bskal pa de snyed de/ / bskal pa'i grangs kyi mthar thug ma gyur cig / rgyal ba'i spyod pas skyo ba med gyur cig /
ji ltar chos dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / / ji tsam rgya chen yongs su mtha' yas pa/ / de snyed rgya chen me tog bzang po rnams/ / thub mang sems can snyed la 'bul gyur cig /
dri zhim ldan pa'i de bzhin phye ma dag / gtsang zhing rnam dag rnam pa sna tshogs la/ / 'gro ba kun na dpe zla dmigs med pa/ / de 'dras rgyal ba mchod pa byed gyur cig /
zhing rnams du ma sems can mnyam pa yi/ / rgyal ba gcig la gdugs rnams 'bul byed cing / / rgyal ba kun la'ang de bzhin dgab bya bas/ / rgyal ba rnams la gdugs mchod byed gyur cig /
byug pa dam pa mchog tu gyur pa rnams/ / 'gro ba 'di na gang la dpe med pa/ / de yis sangs rgyas mchod byed spyod pa yis/ / bskal mang sems can mnyam pa zad gyur cig /
de bzhin byung dang spos kyi phye ma dang / / me tog bdug pa na bza' spos rnams dang / / rin chen lhab lhub mchod pa mtha' yas pa'i/ / rim gro skye ba med par byed gyur cig /
'jig rten sgron ma sems can mnyam pa dag / skad cig re rer byang chub 'tshang rgya ba/ / de dag yon tan mtha' yas rjod byed cing / / skyes bu 'dul la mchod pa byed gyur cig /
sems can mnyam pa'i 'jig rten mkhyen pa la/ / sems can mnyam pa'i bskal pa bgrang byas shing / / blo mchog ldan pa mchod pa byed pa ni/ / rgyal bas bshad kyang zad par ma gyur cig ;
rgyal ba rnams la 'di 'dra'i mchod byed cing / / sangs rgyas rnams 'phrul kun tu 'gengs byed pas/ / bzang dang ldan pa'i spyod la gnas bcas shing / / sangs rgyas ma lus thams cad mthong gyur cig /
'gro kun dge ba ji snyed yod pa dang / / byas dang byed gyur de bzhin byed pa dag / bzang po ci bzhin de 'dra'i sa dag la/ / kun kyang kun nas bzang por red gyur cig /
'jig rten thams cad ma lus sems can rnams/ / ji snyed rgyal ba kun gyis thugs chud pa/ / kun kyang mkhas pa kun gyis bsngags pa yi/ / kun tu bzang po de bzhin 'gyur bar shog /
phyogs rnams ma lus kun tu ci byas pa/ / skyes bu dam pa de ltar yongs su bsngo/ / rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan rgyal bas gang gsungs pa/ / yongs bsngo dam pa mchog dang phul yang yin/ /
de bzhin zhing rnams thams cad ma lus par/ / rgyun bzhin kun kyang khong du chud bya ste/ / sems can ji snyed thams cad ma lus pa/ / de dag kun kyang kun tu bzang gyur cig /
sbyin pas yongs bsngo ji bzhin red gyur cig / tshul khrims kyis kyang bsngo bzhin red gyur cig / brtson 'grus stobs kyis bskal par mi ldog cing / / bzod pas 'khrugs pa med pa'i yid gyur cig /
bsam gtan gyis kyang rtse gcig yid ldan zhing / / ting 'dzin kun gyi spyod yul shes gyur cig / shes rab dus rnams gsum po thams cad du/ / 'jig rten dag tu mthar dmigs med gyur cig /
lus dang ngag dang yid rnams thams cad kyang / / rnam pa kun tu rnam dag mkhas gyur cig / spyod pa de dag thams cad ma lus par/ / kun kyang kun tu bzang por red gyur cig /
ji ltar chos dbyings rlom pa'i sems med cing / / de la spros dang chags pa med pa dang / / mya ngan 'da' dang bsgribs pa med pa ltar/ / de bzhin sems la rlom sems med gyur cig /
chos mkhas yongs su bsngo ba gang brjod pa/ / de ni rgyal bas gsungs pa'i bsngo ba ste/ / mkhas pa'i spyod pa ci nas 'grub 'gyur bar/ / dge ba yongs pa de yis yongs su bsngo/ /
rgyal ba'i sras kyis 'di la bslabs byas te/ / ji snyed gang yod thams cad ma lus par/ / khams rnams kun kyang yongs su bsdu byas te/ / ci nas bde gshegs stobs la 'jug par bsngo/ /
yangs pa ji snyed rgyal bas gsungs pa dang / / kun tu bzang zhes gang la gdags pa yi/ / rgyal ba'i sras rnams gang la gnas gyur pa'i/ / spyod pa dam pa de dag su 'dod pas/ /
sems can ma lus thams cad bgrang bar nus/ / dus gsum sems kyang ma lus kun bgrang nus/ / gang la kun tu bzang por ming gdags pa/ / rgyal sras de yi yon tan mtha' med do/ /
nam mkha' spu rtses bgrang bar nus kyang srid/ / zhing rnams kun gyi rdul kyang bgrang bar nus/ / gang la rgyal sras drang srong che gnas pa'i/ / spyod pa de dag bgrang bar mi nus so/ /

Enlightening beings accomplish knowledge of truth, Understanding boundless ways of right teaching: Becoming teachers with the light of truth, They know the unobstructed genuine verity.
Enlightening beings are great guides to truth; They reveal the most profound teaching, hard to attain: Leading the measureless masses of the ten directions, They cause them to abide securely in truth.
Enlightening beings have drunk the ocean of Buddha teachings; Their clouds of truth shower the worlds of the ten directions. The sun of truth appears in the world, Revealing the sublime teaching for the benefit of the living.
They are always rarely-met donors of teaching, Understand convenient means to enter truth. The light of truth, pure, illumines their minds, And they teach in the world without fear.
They have cultivated a mind in command of the teachings, Able to understand all aspects thereof; Developing the deep deep ocean of wondrous teaching, They beat the drum of truth for all sentient beings.
They proclaim the most profound, rare teaching, With which are nurtured all virtues; Endowed with the mind of pure joy in truth, They show the world the treasury of Buddhahood.
Anointed and crowned by the Buddhas, kings of truth, Having developed the body of knowledge of the nature of things, They are able to understand the true character of all things, And abide by all good ways.
Enlightening beings practice the foremost giving Praised by all the enlightened ones— All their acts are approved by Buddhas, Thereby they perfect the most honorable humans.
Enlightening beings have attained the subtle truth body Personally born by transformation of the Buddha teachings. To benefit the living they are lamps of truth, Expounding countless supreme principles.
According to the giving of the wonderful teaching they practice, They also examine their roots of goodness; The good deeds they do for sentient beings They dedicate all with knowledge.
The virtuous ways to attain buddhahood They pass on to living beings, Wishing that all may be pure And reach the Buddhas’ magnificent other shore.
The buddha-lands of the ten directions are infinite, And all have infinite great adornments: Such adornments, inconceivable, Are all used to adorn one land.
The pure knowledge of the enlightened They vow to enable all beings to have, Like Universally Good, the true offspring of Buddha, Adorning themselves with all virtues.
Accomplishing vast spiritual power, They travel throughout all worlds, Causing all beings without exception To practice the enlightening path.
The countless sentient beings of the ten directions Awakened by the Buddhas They cause to be like Universally Good, Fully carrying out the highest practice.
The various different virtues Achieved by the Buddhas and enlightening beings They vow to have everyone fulfill, Boundless though they be.
Enlightening beings are endowed with the power of freedom And go to study wherever they should learn; Manifesting all great psychic powers, They go to the infinite lands of the ten directions.
Enlightening beings are able in one instant To see countless Buddhas, many as beings, And also in a single hairtip Concentrate all things, seeing all clearly.
The sentient beings of the worlds, without measure, Enlightening beings can distinguish and know. The Buddhas are as infinite as living beings; They generously present offerings to them all.
All kinds of wonderfully scented flowers, Jewels, clothes, pennants, and parasols, They distribute throughout the cosmos, Determined to offer them to all Buddhas.
In a single pore they clearly see All the inconceivably many Buddhas— And so it is in every pore: They bow to all the lamps of the worlds.
With their whole bodies they successively bow In respect for those boundless Victors; They also praise them with their words Forever and ever more.
Their offerings to one Buddha Are as numberless as sentient beings; Thus do they make offerings to one Buddha And to all Buddhas in the same way.
They provide for and laud the Buddhas Throughout all ages of the world; The ages of the world may come to an end, But enlightening beings’ offerings never cease.
In the various ages of all worlds They cultivate practices there, Honoring and attending one Buddha Tirelessly throughout all ages.
As they provide for one Buddha for immeasurable eons, So do they also for all Buddhas; Yet they do not think of the number of eons, Or ever tire of making offerings.
The cosmos is boundlessly vast: Enlightening beings observe it with clear comprehension, Spreading great lotus blossoms throughout As presents to Buddhas infinite as beings.
Jewel flowers of perfect color and scent, Pure ornaments, most delicate, Beyond compare in any world, They bring to offer the most noble of humans.
Infinite lands, many as sentient beings, They fill with precious canopies, Which they offer to one Buddha And do the same for all Buddhas.
Perfumes, incomparable, most excellent, Never before found in any world, They offer to the Guide of humans and divines Throughout eons as many as beings.
Powder and burning incense, exquisite flowers, Jewels, raiment, and ornaments, They present to the Supreme Victors Joyfully serving them tirelessly.
World-Illumining Lamps, as many as beings, Attain great enlightenment every moment, And boundless verses of eulogy and exposition They present to the Human Tamers.
To Buddhas numerous as living beings They make most excellent offerings; For eons countless as living beings, They praise them without end.
When they make offerings to the Buddhas this way, By Buddhas’ spiritual power they extend everywhere, Seeing all the infinite Buddhas of the ten directions, Abiding in the practice of the Universally Good enlightening being.
All the roots of goodness Of past, future, and present, Enable us to always carry out Universal Good practice And quickly gain the station of the realm of Universal Good.
May the infinite sentient beings of the worlds Seen by all the Buddhas Become like Universally Good, Praised by the intelligent.
This is the practice of dedication Cultivated in common by all great beings; All the Buddhas explain for us This unexcelled practice of dedication,
To enable all living beings In all worlds in the ten directions To attain awakening and enlightenment And to always act as Universally Good does.
Practicing giving in accord with their dedication And also strictly maintaining the precepts, Persevering over the long run, unshrinking, Tolerant, gentle, minds unstirred,
In meditation keeping the mind on one point, By wisdom comprehending objects, same as concentration, Penetrating past, future, and present, To which none in the world can find any bounds—
Enlightening beings’ physical, verbal, and mental actions, Like this practice, are all pure; All they cultivate, omitting none, All on a par with the enlightening being Universally Good.
Like the cosmos, free from false discrimination, The stain of inanity is forever gone; And as nirvana has no obstructions, Their minds likewise are free from all grasping.
The principles of dedication of the wise The Buddhas have revealed; All kinds of roots of goodness they dedicate, Therefore they can accomplish the enlightening path.
Offspring of Buddha learn this dedication well, Fulfilling innumerable undertakings, Taking in the cosmos comprehensively; Therefore they can attain the power of the Blissful Ones.
If you want to accomplish, as the Buddha explains, The great, superlative practices of enlightening beings, You should live by this dedication— Such offspring of Buddha are called Universally Good.
All living beings may be counted, And the experience of past, present, and future minds may be known, But the virtues of such Universally Good Offspring of Buddha cannot be measured.
The bounds of space may be measured with a hair, The number of atoms in all lands may be known, But the practical vows by which these sages live Cannot be measured by anyone.
